[Gray]113-mr. gray , [I]336-my lady respect [your]113-mr. gray plain - speaking , although [I]336-my lady may wonder whether [a young man of]3117-a young man of [your]113-mr. gray age and position has any right to assume that [he]3117-a young man of is [a better judge]3118-a better judge than one with the experience which [I]336-my lady have naturally gained at [my]336-my lady time of life , and in the station [I]336-my lady hold . ”[336-my lady] “ If [I]113-mr. gray , [madam]3119-madam , as [the clergyman of [this parish]3121-this parish]3120-the clergyman of this parish , am not to shrink from telling what [I]113-mr. gray believe to be the truth to [the poor and lowly]3122-the poor and lowly , no more am [I]113-mr. gray to hold [my]113-mr. gray peace in the presence of [the rich and titled]3123-the rich and titled . ”[113-mr. gray] [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s face showed that [he]113-mr. gray was in that state of excitement which in [a child]773-a child would have ended in a good fit of crying . [He]113-mr. gray looked as if [he]113-mr. gray had nerved [himself]113-mr. gray up to doing and saying things , which [he]113-mr. gray disliked above everything , and which nothing short of serious duty could have compelled [him]113-mr. gray to do and say . And at such times every minute circumstance which could add to pain comes vividly before one . [I]0-i saw that [he]113-mr. gray became aware of [our]774-our presence , and that it added to [his]113-mr. gray discomfiture . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady flushed up . “ Are [you]113-mr. gray aware , [sir]3124-sir , ”[336-my lady] asked [she]336-my lady , “ that [you]113-mr. gray have gone far astray from the original subject of conversation ? But as [you]113-mr. gray talk of [[your]113-mr. gray parish]3125-your parish , allow [me]336-my lady to remind [you]113-mr. gray that [Hareman ’s Common]21-hareman ’s common is beyond the bounds , and that [you]113-mr. gray are really not responsible for the characters and lives of [the squatters]3126-the squatters on [that unlucky piece of ground]3127-that unlucky piece of ground . ”[336-my lady] “ [Madam]3119-madam , [I]776-he see [I]776-he have only done harm in speaking to [you]3119-madam about the affair at all . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow caught the expression of [his]776-he face . “ Good morning ! ”[92-lady ludlow] [she]92-lady ludlow cried , in rather a louder and quicker way than that in which [she]92-lady ludlow had been speaking . “ Remember , [Job Gregson]132-job gregson is [a notorious poacher and evildoer]3129-a notorious poacher and evildoer , and [you]776-he really are not responsible for what goes on at [Hareman ’s Common]21-hareman ’s common . ”[92-lady ludlow] [He]776-he was near [the hall]501-the hall door , and said something — half to [himself]776-he , which [we]778-we heard ( being nearer to [him]776-he ) , but [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady did not ; although [she]336-my lady saw that [he]776-he spoke . “ What did [he]776-he say ? ”[336-my lady] [she]336-my lady asked in a somewhat hurried manner , as soon as the door was closed—“I did not hear . ”[336-my lady] [We]778-we looked at [each other]780-each other , and then [I]0-i spoke : “ [He]776-he said , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , that ‘ [God]133-god help [him]776-he ! [he]776-he was responsible for all the evil [he]776-he did not strive to overcome . ’ ”[0-i] [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady turned sharp round away from [us]778-we , and [Mary Mason]127-mary mason said afterwards [she]127-mary mason thought [[her]127-mary mason ladyship]3041-her ladyship was much vexed with [both of [us]778-we]783-both of us , for having been present , and with [me]0-i for having repeated what [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had said . But it was not [our]778-we fault that [we]778-we were in [the hall]501-the hall , and when [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady asked what [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had said , [I]0-i thought it right to tell [her]336-my lady . In a few minutes [she]336-my lady bade [us]778-we accompany [her]336-my lady in [her]336-my lady ride in [the coach]389-the coach . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow always sat forwards by [herself]92-lady ludlow , and [[we]778-we girls]787-we girls backwards . Somehow this was a rule , which [we]778-we never thought of questioning . It was true that riding backwards made some of [us]778-we feel very uncomfortable and faint ; and to remedy this [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady always drove with both windows open , which occasionally gave [her]336-my lady the rheumatism ; but [we]778-we always went on in the old way . This day [she]336-my lady did not pay any great attention to [the road by which [we]778-we were going]789-the road by which we were going , and [Coachman]790-coachman took [his]790-coachman own way . [We]778-we were very silent , as [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady did not speak , and looked very serious . Or else , in general , [she]336-my lady made these rides very pleasant ( to [those who were not qualmish with riding backwards )]792-those who were not qualmish with riding backwards ) , by talking to [us]778-we in a very agreeable manner , and telling [us]778-we of the different things which had happened to [her]336-my lady at various places,—at [Paris]22-paris and [Versailles]23-versailles , where [she]336-my lady had been in [her]336-my lady [youth,—at [Windsor]25-windsor and [Kew]26-kew and [Weymouth]14-weymouth]24-youth,—at windsor and kew and weymouth , where [she]336-my lady had been with [the Queen]793-the queen , when [maid - of - honour]794-maid - of - honour — and so on . But this day [she]336-my lady did not talk at all . All at once [she]336-my lady put [her]336-my lady head out of the window . “ [John Footman]134-john footman , ”[336-my lady] said [she]336-my lady , “ where are [we]796-we ? Surely this is [[Hareman]135-hareman ’s Common]3105-hareman ’s common . ”[336-my lady] “ Yes , an’t please [[my]134-john footman lady]336-my lady , ”[134-john footman] said [John Footman]134-john footman , and waited for further speech or orders . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady thought a while , and then said [she]336-my lady would have the steps put down and get out . As soon as [she]336-my lady was gone , [we]796-we looked at [each other]780-each other , and then without a word began to gaze after [her]336-my lady . [We]796-we saw [her]336-my lady pick [her]336-my lady dainty way in the little high - heeled shoes [she]336-my lady always wore ( because they had been in fashion in [her]336-my lady youth ) , among the yellow pools of stagnant water that had gathered in [the clayey soil]798-the clayey soil . [John Footman]134-john footman followed , stately , after ; afraid too , for all [his]134-john footman stateliness , of splashing [his]134-john footman pure white stockings . Suddenly [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady turned round and said something to [him]134-john footman , and [he]134-john footman returned to [the carriage]800-the carriage with a half - pleased , half - puzzled air . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady went on to [a cluster of rude mud houses at [the higher end of [the Common]804-the common]803-the higher end of the common]802-a cluster of rude mud houses at the higher end of the common ; [[cottages]805-cottages built , as [they]805-cottages were occasionally at that day , of wattles and clay , and thatched with sods]806-cottages built , as they were occasionally at that day , of wattles and clay , and thatched with sods . As far as [we]807-we could make out from dumb show , [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow saw enough of [the interiors of [these places]809-these places]808-the interiors of these places to make [her]92-lady ludlow hesitate before entering , or even speaking to [any of [the children who were playing about in the puddles]811-the children who were playing about in the puddles]810-any of the children who were playing about in the puddles . It seemed to [us]807-we a long time before [she]92-lady ludlow came out ; but [I]0-i dare say it was not more than eight or ten minutes . [She]92-lady ludlow came back with [her]92-lady ludlow head hanging down , as if to choose [her]92-lady ludlow way,—but [we]807-we saw it was more in thought and bewilderment than for any such purpose . [She]92-lady ludlow had not made up [her]92-lady ludlow mind where [we]807-we should drive to when [she]92-lady ludlow got into [the carriage]800-the carriage again . [John Footman]134-john footman stood , bare - headed , waiting for orders . “ To [Hathaway]19-hathaway . [[My]134-john footman dears]3066-my dears , if [you]3066-my dears are tired , or if [you]3066-my dears have anything to do for [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott , [I]134-john footman can drop [you]3066-my dears at [Barford Corner]27-barford corner , and it is but a quarter of an hour ’s brisk walk [home]586-home . ”[134-john footman] But luckily [we]807-we could safely say that [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott did not want [us]807-we ; and as [we]807-we had whispered to [each other]780-each other , as [we]807-we sat alone in [the coach]389-the coach , that surely [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady must have gone to [[Job Gregson]132-job gregson ’s]818-job gregson ’s , [we]807-we were far too anxious to know the end of it all to say that [we]807-we were tired . So [we]807-we all set off to [Hathaway]19-hathaway . [Mr. Harry Lathom]128-mr. lathom was [a bachelor squire]819-a bachelor squire , thirty or thirty - five years of age , more at [home]586-home in [the field]821-the field than in [the drawing - room]822-the drawing - room , and with [sporting men]823-sporting men than with [ladies]824-ladies . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady did not alight , of course ; it was [[Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom ’s place]826-mr. lathom ’s place to wait upon [her]336-my lady , and [she]336-my lady bade [the butler,—who]827-the butler,—who had a smack of [the gamekeeper]828-the gamekeeper in [him]827-the butler,—who , very unlike [[our]807-we own powdered venerable fine gentleman at Hanbury,—tell [[his]827-the butler,—who master]830-his master]829-our own powdered venerable fine gentleman at hanbury,—tell his master , with [her]336-my lady compliments , that [she]336-my lady wished to speak to [him]827-the butler,—who . [You]831-you may think how pleased [we]807-we were to find that [we]807-we should hear all that was said ; though , [I]0-i think , afterwards [we]807-we were half sorry when [we]807-we saw how [our]807-we presence confused [the squire]832-the squire , who would have found it bad enough to answer [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s questions , even without [two eager girls]834-two eager girls for audience . “ Pray , [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom , ”[336-my lady] began [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , something abruptly for her,—but [she]336-my lady was very full of [her]336-my lady subject,—“what is this [I]336-my lady hear about [Job Gregson]132-job gregson ? ”[336-my lady] [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom looked annoyed and vexed , but dared not show it in [his]128-mr. lathom words . “ [I]128-mr. lathom gave out a warrant against [him]132-job gregson , [[my]128-mr. lathom lady]336-my lady , for theft,—that is all . [You]336-my lady are doubtless aware of [his]132-job gregson character ; [a man who sets nets and springes in long cover , and fishes]3136-a man who sets nets and springes in long cover , and fishes wherever [he]132-job gregson takes a fancy . It is but a short step from poaching to thieving . ”[128-mr. lathom] “ That is quite true , ”[92-lady ludlow] replied [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow ( who had a horror of poaching for this very reason ): “ but [I]92-lady ludlow imagine [you]128-mr. lathom do not send [a man]725-a man to [gaol]3093-gaol on account of [his]132-job gregson bad character . ”[92-lady ludlow] “ [Rogues]3139-rogues and [vagabonds]3140-vagabonds , ”[128-mr. lathom] said [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom . “ [A man]725-a man may be sent to prison for being [a vagabond]3142-a vagabond ; for no specific act , but for [his]132-job gregson general mode of life . ”[128-mr. lathom] [He]128-mr. lathom had the better of [her]92-lady ludlow ladyship for one moment ; but then [she]92-lady ludlow answered — “ But in this case , the charge on which [you]128-mr. lathom committed [him]132-job gregson is for theft ; now [[his]132-job gregson wife]3072-his wife tells [me]92-lady ludlow [he]132-job gregson can prove [he]132-job gregson was [some miles distant from [Holmwood]28-holmwood]3144-some miles distant from holmwood , where the robbery took place , all that afternoon ; [she]3072-his wife says [you]128-mr. lathom had the evidence before [you]128-mr. lathom . ”[92-lady ludlow] [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom here interrupted [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , by saying , in a somewhat sulky manner—“No such evidence was brought before [me]128-mr. lathom when [I]128-mr. lathom gave the warrant . [I]128-mr. lathom am not answerable for [the other magistrates]3145-the other magistrates ’ decision , when [they]3145-the other magistrates had more evidence before [them]3145-the other magistrates . It was [they]3145-the other magistrates who committed [him]113-mr. gray to [gaol]3093-gaol . [I]128-mr. lathom am not responsible for that . ”[128-mr. lathom] [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady did not often show signs of impatience ; but [we]838-we knew [she]336-my lady was feeling irritated , by the little perpetual tapping of [her]336-my lady high - heeled shoe against the bottom of [the carriage]800-the carriage . About the same time [we]838-we , sitting backwards , caught a glimpse of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray through the open door , standing in the shadow of [the hall]501-the hall . Doubtless [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow ’s arrival had interrupted a conversation between [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom and [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray . [The latter]841-the latter must have heard every word of what [she]336-my lady was saying ; but of this [she]336-my lady was not aware , and caught at [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom ’s disclaimer of responsibility with pretty much the same argument which [she]336-my lady had heard ( through [our]838-we repetition ) that [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had used not two hours before . “ And do [you]128-mr. lathom mean to say , [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom , that [you]128-mr. lathom do n’t consider [yourself]128-mr. lathom responsible for all injustice or wrong - doing that [you]128-mr. lathom might have prevented , and have not ? Nay , in this case the first germ of injustice was [your]128-mr. lathom own mistake . [I]336-my lady wish [you]128-mr. lathom had been with [me]336-my lady a little while ago , and seen the misery in [[that poor fellow]3147-that poor fellow ’s cottage]3148-that poor fellow ’s cottage . ”[336-my lady] [She]336-my lady spoke lower , and [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray drew near , in a sort of involuntary manner ; as if to hear all [she]336-my lady was saying . [We]838-we saw [him]113-mr. gray , and doubtless [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom heard [his]113-mr. gray footstep , and knew who it was that was listening behind [him]113-mr. gray , and approving of every word that was said . [He]113-mr. gray grew yet more sullen in manner ; but still [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady was [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , and [he]113-mr. gray dared not speak out before [her]336-my lady , as [he]113-mr. gray would have done to [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow , however , caught the look of stubborness in [his]113-mr. gray face , and it roused [her]92-lady ludlow as [I]0-i had never seen [her]92-lady ludlow roused . “ [I]92-lady ludlow am sure [you]113-mr. gray will not refuse , [sir]3124-sir , to accept [my]92-lady ludlow bail . [I]92-lady ludlow offer to bail [the fellow]3150-the fellow out , and to be responsible for [his]3150-the fellow appearance at the sessions . What say [you]113-mr. gray to that , [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom ? ”[92-lady ludlow] “ The offence of theft is not bailable , [[my]113-mr. gray lady]336-my lady . ”[113-mr. gray] “ Not in ordinary cases , [I]113-mr. gray dare say . But [I]113-mr. gray imagine this is an extraordinary case . [The man]413-the man is sent to [prison]3153-prison out of compliment to [you]113-mr. gray , and against all evidence , as far as [I]113-mr. gray can learn . [He]3150-the fellow will have to rot in [gaol]3093-gaol for two months , and [[his]3150-the fellow wife]3072-his wife and [children]324-children to starve . [I]113-mr. gray , [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow , offer to bail [him]3150-the fellow out , and pledge [myself]113-mr. gray for [his]3150-the fellow appearance at next quarter - sessions . ”[113-mr. gray] “ It is against the law , [[my]92-lady ludlow lady]336-my lady . ”[92-lady ludlow] “ Bah ! Bah ! Bah ! Who makes laws ? Such as [I]113-mr. gray , in [the House of Lords]3158-the house of lords — such as [you]113-mr. gray , in [the House of Commons]3159-the house of commons . [We]3160-our , who make the laws in [St. Stephen]29-st. stephen ’s , may break the mere forms of them , when [we]3160-our have right on [our]3160-our sides , on [[our]3160-our own land]3161-our own land , and amongst [[our]3160-our own people]3162-our own people . ”[113-mr. gray] “ [The lord - lieutenant]3163-the lord - lieutenant may take away [my]113-mr. gray commission , if [he]3163-the lord - lieutenant heard of it . ”[113-mr. gray] “ And a very good thing for [the county]3101-the county , [Harry Lathom]128-mr. lathom ; and for [you]113-mr. gray too , if [he]128-mr. lathom did,—if [you]113-mr. gray do n’t go on more wisely than [you]113-mr. gray have begun . A pretty set [you]113-mr. gray and [[your]113-mr. gray brother]3165-your brother magistrates are to administer justice through [the land]3166-the land ! [I]113-mr. gray always said a good despotism was the best form of government ; and [I]113-mr. gray am twice as much in favour of it now [I]113-mr. gray see what a quorum is ! [[My]113-mr. gray dears]3066-my dears ! ”[113-mr. gray] suddenly turning round to [us]844-us , “ if it would not tire [you]3066-my dears to walk [home]586-home , [I]113-mr. gray would beg [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom to take a seat in [[my]113-mr. gray coach]3169-my coach , and [we]844-us would drive to [Henley Gaol]30-henley gaol , and have [the poor man]3170-the poor man out at once . ”[113-mr. gray] “ A walk over [the fields]3171-the fields at this time of day is hardly fitting for [young ladies]3088-young ladies to take alone , ”[128-mr. lathom] said [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom , anxious no doubt to escape from [his]128-mr. lathom tete - a - tete drive with [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , and possibly not quite prepared to go to the illegal length of prompt measures , which [she]336-my lady had in contemplation . But [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray now stepped forward , too anxious for the release of [the prisoner]846-the prisoner to allow any obstacle to intervene which [he]113-mr. gray could do away with . To see [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow ’s face when [she]336-my lady first perceived whom [she]336-my lady had had for auditor and spectator of [her]336-my lady interview with [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom , was as good as a play . [She]336-my lady had been doing and saying the very things [she]336-my lady had been so much annoyed at [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s saying and proposing only an hour or two ago . [She]336-my lady had been setting down [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom pretty smartly , in the presence of [the very man to whom [she]336-my lady had spoken of [that gentleman]848-that gentleman as so sensible , and of such a standing in [the county]3101-the county]847-the very man to whom she had spoken of that gentleman as so sensible , and of such a standing in the county , that it was presumption to question [his]128-mr. lathom doings . But before [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had finished [his]113-mr. gray offer of escorting [us]850-us back to [Hanbury Court]7-hanbury court , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady had recovered [herself]336-my lady . There was neither surprise nor displeasure in [her]336-my lady manner , as [she]336-my lady answered—“I thank [you]113-mr. gray , [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray . [I]852-i was not aware that [you]113-mr. gray were [here]3173-here , but [I]852-i think [I]852-i can understand on what errand [you]113-mr. gray came . And seeing [you]113-mr. gray here , recalls [me]852-i to a duty [I]852-i owe [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom . [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom , [I]852-i have spoken to [you]113-mr. gray pretty plainly,—forgetting , until [I]852-i saw [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , that only this very afternoon [I]852-i differed from [him]113-mr. gray on this very question ; taking completely , at that time , the same view of the whole subject which [you]113-mr. gray have done ; thinking that [the county]3101-the county would be well rid of [such a man as [Job Gregson]132-job gregson]3175-such a man as job gregson , whether [he]113-mr. gray had committed this theft or not . [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray and [I]852-i did not part quite [friends]3176-friends , ”[852-i] [she]852-i continued , bowing towards [him]853-he ; “ but it so happened that [I]852-i saw [[Job Gregson]132-job gregson ’s wife]3177-job gregson ’s wife and home,—I felt that [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had been right and [I]852-i had been wrong , so , with the famous inconsistency of [my]852-i sex , [I]852-i came hither to scold [you]853-he , ”[852-i] smiling towards [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom , who looked half - sulky yet , and did not relax a bit of [his]128-mr. lathom gravity at [her]852-i smile , “ for holding the same opinions that [I]128-mr. lathom had done an hour before . [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , ”[128-mr. lathom] ( again bowing towards [him]853-he ) “ [these young ladies]3178-these young ladies will be very much obliged to [you]113-mr. gray for [your]113-mr. gray escort , and so shall [I.]128-mr. lathom [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom , may [I]128-mr. lathom beg of [you]128-mr. lathom to accompany [me]128-mr. lathom to [Henley]31-henley ? ”[128-mr. lathom] [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray bowed very low , and went very red ; [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom said something which [we]854-we none of [us]854-we heard , but which was , [I]0-i think , some remonstrance against the course [he]853-he was , as it were , compelled to take . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow , however , took no notice of [his]853-he murmur , but sat in an attitude of polite expectancy ; and as [we]854-we turned off on [our]854-we walk , [I]0-i saw [Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom getting into [the coach]389-the coach with the air of a whipped hound . [I]0-i must say , considering [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s feeling , [I]0-i did not envy [him]128-mr. lathom [his]128-mr. lathom ride — though , [I]0-i believe , [he]128-mr. lathom was quite in the right as to the object of the ride being illegal . [Our]854-we walk [home]586-home was very dull . [We]854-we had no fears ; and would far rather have been without [the awkward , blushing young man]858-the awkward , blushing young man , into which [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had sunk . At every stile [he]853-he hesitated,—sometimes [he]853-he half got over it , thinking that [he]853-he could assist [us]854-we better in that way ; then [he]853-he would turn back unwilling to go before [ladies]824-ladies . [He]853-he had no ease of manner , as [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady once said of [him]853-he , though on any occasion of duty , [he]853-he had an immense deal of dignity . CHAPTER III . As far as [I]0-i can remember , it was very soon after this that [I]0-i first began to have the pain in [my]0-i hip , which has ended in making [me]0-i a cripple for life . [I]0-i hardly recollect more than one walk after [our]854-we return under [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s escort from [[Mr. Lathom]128-mr. lathom ’s]861-mr. lathom ’s . Indeed , at the time , [I]0-i was not without suspicions ( which [I]0-i never named ) that the beginning of all the mischief was a great jump [I]0-i had taken from the top of one of the stiles on that very occasion . Well , it is a long while ago , and [God]133-god disposes of [us]854-we all , and [I]0-i am not going to tire [you]862-you out with telling [you]862-you how [I]0-i thought and felt , and how , when [I]0-i saw what [my]0-i life was to be , [I]0-i could hardly bring [myself]0-i to be patient , but rather wished to die at once . [You]862-you can [every one of [you]862-you]863-every one of you think for [yourselves]862-you what becoming all at once useless and unable to move , and by - and - by growing hopeless of cure , and feeling that one must be a burden to [some one all one]864-some one all one ’s life long , would be to [an active , wilful , strong girl of seventeen , anxious to get on in [the world]866-the world , so as , if possible , to help [[her]865-an active , wilful , strong girl of seventeen , anxious to get on in the world , so as , if possible , to help her brothers and sisters brothers and [sisters]868-sisters]867-her brothers and sisters]865-an active , wilful , strong girl of seventeen , anxious to get on in the world , so as , if possible , to help her brothers and sisters . So [I]0-i shall only say , that one among the blessings which arose out of what seemed at the time a great , black sorrow was , that [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow for many years took [me]0-i , as it were , into [her]92-lady ludlow own especial charge ; and now , as [I]0-i lie still and alone in [my]0-i old age , it is such a pleasure to think of [her]92-lady ludlow ! [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott was great as [a nurse]869-a nurse , and [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i can never be grateful enough to [her]103-mrs. medlicott memory for all [her]103-mrs. medlicott kindness . But [she]103-mrs. medlicott was puzzled to know how to manage [me]0-i in other ways . [I]0-i used to have long , hard fits of crying ; and , thinking that [I]0-i ought to go [home]586-home — and yet what could [they]871-they do with [me]0-i there?—and a hundred and fifty other anxious thoughts , some of which [I]0-i could tell to [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott , and others [I]0-i could not . [Her]103-mrs. medlicott way of comforting [me]0-i was hurrying away for some kind of tempting or strengthening food — a basin of melted calves - foot jelly was , [I]0-i am sure [she]103-mrs. medlicott thought , a cure for every woe . “ There take it , [dear]3179-dear , take it ! ”[103-mrs. medlicott] [she]103-mrs. medlicott would say ; “ and do n’t go on fretting for what ca n’t be helped . ”[103-mrs. medlicott] But , [I]0-i think , [she]103-mrs. medlicott got puzzled at length at the non - efficacy of good things to eat ; and one day , after [I]0-i had limped down to see [the doctor]3071-the doctor , in [[Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott ’s sitting - room]873-mrs. medlicott ’s sitting - room — [a room lined with cupboards , containing preserves and dainties of all kinds]874-a room lined with cupboards , containing preserves and dainties of all kinds , which [she]103-mrs. medlicott perpetually made , and never touched [herself]103-mrs. medlicott — when [I]0-i was returning to [[my]0-i bed - room]875-my bed - room to cry away the afternoon , under pretence of arranging [my]0-i clothes , [John Footman]134-john footman brought [me]0-i a message from [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ( with whom [the doctor]3071-the doctor had been having a conversation ) to bid [me]0-i go to [her]336-my lady in [that private sitting - room at the end of [the suite of apartments]879-the suite of apartments , about which [I]0-i spoke in describing the day of [my]0-i first arrival at [Hanbury]13-hanbury]878-that private sitting - room at the end of the suite of apartments , about which i spoke in describing the day of my first arrival at hanbury . [I]0-i had hardly been in [it]880-it since ; as , when [we]881-we read to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , [she]336-my lady generally sat in [the small withdrawing - room out of which [this private room of hers]884-this private room of hers opened]883-the small withdrawing - room out of which this private room of hers opened . [I]0-i suppose [great people]885-great people do not require what [[we]881-we smaller [people]302-people]886-we smaller people value so much,—I mean privacy . [I]0-i do not think that there was [a room which [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady occupied]888-a room which my lady occupied that had not two doors , and some of [them]888-a room which my lady occupied had three or four . Then [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady had always [Adams]104-adams waiting upon [her]336-my lady in [[her]336-my lady bed - chamber]891-her bed - chamber ; and it was [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott ’s duty to sit within call , as it were , in a sort of anteroom that led out of [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s own sitting - room]893-my lady ’s own sitting - room , on the opposite side to [the drawing - room]822-the drawing - room door . To fancy [the house]3047-the house , [you]896-you must take [a great square]897-a great square and halve [it]897-a great square by a line : at one end of this line was [the hall]501-the hall door , or public entrance ; at the opposite the private entrance from [a terrace]899-a terrace , which was terminated at one end by a sort of postern door in an old gray stone wall , beyond which lay [the farm buildings]900-the farm buildings and [offices]901-offices ; so that [people]302-people could come in this way to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady on business , while , if [she]336-my lady were going into [the garden]904-the garden from [[her]336-my lady own room]905-her own room , [she]336-my lady had nothing to do but to pass through [[Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott ’s apartment]906-mrs. medlicott ’s apartment , out into [the lesser hall]907-the lesser hall , and then turning to the right as [she]336-my lady passed on to [the terrace]908-the terrace , [she]336-my lady could go down the flight of broad , shallow steps at the corner of [the house]3047-the house into [the lovely garden]910-the lovely garden , with stretching , sweeping lawns , and gay flower - beds , and beautiful , bossy laurels , and other blooming or massy shrubs , with full - grown beeches , or larches feathering down to the ground a little farther off . The whole was set in a frame , as it were , by [the more distant woodlands]911-the more distant woodlands . [The house]3047-the house had been modernized in the days of [Queen Anne]136-queen anne , [I]0-i think ; but the money had fallen short that was requisite to carry out all the improvements , so it was only [the suite of [withdrawing - rooms]914-withdrawing - rooms]913-the suite of withdrawing - rooms and [the terrace - rooms]915-the terrace - rooms , as far as the private entrance , that had the new , long , high windows put in , and these were old enough by this time to be draped with roses , and honeysuckles , and pyracanthus , winter and summer long . Well , to go back to that day when [I]0-i limped into [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s sitting - room]917-my lady ’s sitting - room , trying hard to look as if [I]0-i had not been crying , and not to walk as if [I]0-i was in much pain . [I]0-i do not know whether [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady saw how near [my]0-i tears were to [my]0-i eyes , but [she]336-my lady told [me]0-i [she]336-my lady had sent for [me]0-i , because [she]336-my lady wanted some help in arranging the drawers of [her]336-my lady bureau , and asked [me]0-i — just as if it was a favour [I]0-i was to do [her]336-my lady — if [I]0-i could sit down in the easy - chair near the window—(all quietly arranged before [I]0-i came in , with a footstool , and a table quite near)—and assist [her]336-my lady . [You]919-you will wonder , perhaps , why [I]0-i was not bidden to sit or lie on the sofa ; but ( although [I]0-i found one [there]559-there a morning or two afterwards , when [I]0-i came down ) the fact was , that there was none in [the room]489-the room at this time . [I]0-i have even fancied that the easy - chair was brought in on purpose for [me]0-i ; for it was not the chair in which [I]0-i remembered [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady sitting the first time [I]0-i saw [her]336-my lady . [That chair]923-that chair was very much carved and gilded , with [a countess]499-a countess ’ coronet at the top . [I]0-i tried it one day , some time afterwards , when [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady was out of [the room]489-the room , and [I]0-i had a fancy for seeing how [I]0-i could move about , and very uncomfortable it was . Now [my]0-i chair ( as [I]0-i learnt to call it , and to think it ) was soft and luxurious , and seemed somehow to give [one]927-one ’s body rest just in that part where one most needed it . [I]0-i was not at [my]0-i ease that first day , nor indeed for many days afterwards , notwithstanding [my]0-i chair was so comfortable . Yet [I]0-i forgot [my]0-i sad pain in silently wondering over the meaning of many of the things [we]928-we turned out of those curious old drawers . [I]0-i was puzzled to know why some were kept at all ; a scrap of writing maybe , with only half a dozen common - place words written on it , or a bit of broken riding - whip , and here and there a stone , of which [I]0-i thought [I]0-i could have picked up twenty just as good in the first walk [I]0-i took . But it seems that was just [my]0-i ignorance ; for [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady told [me]0-i they were pieces of valuable marble , used to make the floors of [the great Roman emperors palaces]930-the great roman emperors palaces long ago ; and that when [she]336-my lady had been [a girl , and made the grand tour]931-a girl , and made the grand tour long ago , [[her]336-my lady cousin]932-her cousin [Sir Horace Mann]137-sir horace mann , [the Ambassador]933-the ambassador or Envoy at [Florence]32-florence , had told [her]336-my lady to be sure to go into [the fields inside the walls of ancient [Rome]33-rome]934-the fields inside the walls of ancient rome , when [the farmers]935-the farmers were preparing the ground for the onion - sowing , and had to make the soil fine , and pick up what bits of marble [she]336-my lady could find . [She]336-my lady had done so , and meant to have had them made into a table ; but somehow that plan fell through , and there they were with all the dirt out of the onion - field upon them ; but once when [I]0-i thought of cleaning them with soap and water , at any rate , [she]336-my lady bade [me]0-i not to do so , for it was Roman dirt — earth , [I]0-i think , [she]336-my lady called it — but it was dirt all the same . Then , in this bureau , were many other things , the value of which [I]0-i could understand — locks of hair carefully ticketed , which [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady looked at very sadly ; and lockets and bracelets with miniatures in them,—very small pictures to what [they]937-they make now - a - days , and called miniatures : some of them had even to be looked at through a microscope before [you]938-you could see the individual expression of the faces , or how beautifully they were painted . [I]0-i do n’t think that looking at these made [may lady]939-may lady seem so melancholy , as the seeing and touching of the hair did . But , to be sure , the hair was , as it were , a part of some beloved body which [she]336-my lady might never touch and caress again , but which lay beneath the turf , all faded and disfigured , except perhaps the very hair , from which the lock [she]336-my lady held had been dissevered ; whereas the pictures were but pictures after all — likenesses , but not the very things themselves . This is only [my]0-i own conjecture , mind . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady rarely spoke out [her]336-my lady feelings . For , to begin with , [she]336-my lady was of rank : and [I]0-i have heard [her]336-my lady say that [people of rank]661-people of rank do not talk about [their]661-people of rank feelings except to [[their]661-people of rank equals]942-their equals , and even to [them]661-people of rank [they]661-people of rank conceal [them]661-people of rank , except upon rare occasions . Secondly,—and this is [my]0-i own reflection,—she was [an only child]943-an only child and [an heiress]944-an heiress ; and as such was more apt to think than to talk , as [all well - brought - up heiresses]945-all well - brought - up heiresses must be . [I]0-i think . Thirdly , [she]336-my lady had long been [a widow]340-a widow , without [any companion of [her]336-my lady own age]947-any companion of her own age with whom it would have been natural for [her]336-my lady to refer to old associations , past pleasures , or mutual sorrows . [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott came nearest to [her]336-my lady as [a companion of this sort]948-a companion of this sort ; and [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship talked more to [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott , in a kind of familiar way , than [she]336-my lady did to [all the rest of [the household]951-the household]950-all the rest of the household put together . But [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott was silent by nature , and did not reply at any great length . [Adams]104-adams , indeed , was the only one who spoke much to [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow . After [we]952-we had worked away about an hour at [the bureau]953-the bureau , [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship said [we]952-we had done enough for one day ; and as the time was come for [her]336-my lady afternoon ride , [she]336-my lady left [me]0-i , with a volume of engravings from [Mr. Hogarth]138-mr. hogarth ’s pictures on one side of [me]0-i ( [I]0-i do n’t like to write down the names of them , though [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady thought nothing of it , [I]0-i am sure ) , and upon a stand [her]336-my lady great prayer - book open at the evening psalms for the day , on the other . But as soon as [she]336-my lady was gone , [I]0-i troubled [myself]0-i little with either , but amused [myself]0-i with looking round [the room]489-the room at [my]0-i leisure . The side on which [the fire - place]957-the fire - place stood was all panelled,—part of the old ornaments of [the house]3047-the house , for there was an Indian paper with birds and beasts and insects on it , on all the other sides . There were coats of arms , of [the various families with whom [the Hanburys]139-the hanburys]959-the various families with whom the hanburys had intermarried , all over these panels , and up and down the ceiling as well . There was very little looking - glass in [the room]489-the room , though one of [the great drawing - rooms]961-the great drawing - rooms was called the “ Mirror Room , ”[0-i] because [it]489-the room was lined with glass , which [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s great - grandfather]963-my lady ’s great - grandfather had brought from [Venice]34-venice when [he]963-my lady ’s great - grandfather was ambassador [there]559-there . There were china jars of all shapes and sizes round and about [the room]489-the room , and some china monsters , or idols , of which [I]0-i could never bear the sight , they were so ugly , though [I]0-i think [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady valued them more than all . There was a thick carpet on the middle of the floor , which was made of small pieces of rare wood fitted into a pattern ; the doors were opposite to each other , and were composed of two heavy tall wings , and opened in the middle , moving on brass grooves inserted into the floor — they would not have opened over a carpet . There were two windows reaching up nearly to the ceiling , but very narrow and with deep window - seats in the thickness of the wall . [The room]489-the room was full of scent , partly from the flowers outside , and partly from the great jars of pot - pourri inside . The choice of odours was what [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady piqued [herself]336-my lady upon , saying nothing showed birth like a keen susceptibility of smell . [We]969-we never named musk in [her]336-my lady presence , [her]336-my lady antipathy to it was so well understood through [the household]951-the household : [her]336-my lady opinion on the subject was believed to be , that no scent derived from an animal could ever be of a sufficiently pure nature to give pleasure to [any person of good family , where , of course , the delicate perception of the senses had been cultivated for generations]971-any person of good family , where , of course , the delicate perception of the senses had been cultivated for generations . [She]336-my lady would instance the way in which [sportsmen]972-sportsmen preserve the breed of [dogs who have shown keen scent]973-dogs who have shown keen scent ; and how such gifts descend for generations amongst animals , who can not be supposed to have anything of ancestral pride , or hereditary fancies about [them]974-them . Musk , then , was never mentioned at [Hanbury Court]7-hanbury court . No more were bergamot or southern - wood , although vegetable in their nature . [She]336-my lady considered these two latter as betraying a vulgar taste in [the person who chose to gather or wear them]975-the person who chose to gather or wear them . [She]336-my lady was sorry to notice sprigs of them in the button - hole of [any young man in whom [she]336-my lady took an interest , either because [he]976-any young man in whom she took an interest , either because he was engaged to a servant of hers or otherwise , as he came out of church on a sunday afternoon was engaged to [a servant of [hers]336-my lady]977-a servant of hers or otherwise , as [he]976-any young man in whom she took an interest , either because he was engaged to a servant of hers or otherwise , as he came out of church on a sunday afternoon came out of [church]668-church on a Sunday afternoon]976-any young man in whom she took an interest , either because he was engaged to a servant of hers or otherwise , as he came out of church on a sunday afternoon . [She]336-my lady was afraid that [he]976-any young man in whom she took an interest , either because he was engaged to a servant of hers or otherwise , as he came out of church on a sunday afternoon liked coarse pleasures ; and [I]0-i am not sure if [she]336-my lady did not think that [his]976-any young man in whom she took an interest , either because he was engaged to a servant of hers or otherwise , as he came out of church on a sunday afternoon preference for these coarse sweetnesses did not imply a probability that [he]976-any young man in whom she took an interest , either because he was engaged to a servant of hers or otherwise , as he came out of church on a sunday afternoon would take to drinking . But [she]336-my lady distinguished between vulgar and common . Violets , pinks , and sweetbriar were common enough ; roses and mignionette , for those who had [gardens]979-gardens , honeysuckle for [those who walked along [the bowery lanes]981-the bowery lanes]980-those who walked along the bowery lanes ; but wearing them betrayed no vulgarity of taste : [the queen upon [her]982-the queen upon her throne throne]982-the queen upon her throne might be glad to smell at a nosegay of the flowers . A beau - pot ( as [we]983-we called it ) of pinks and roses freshly gathered was placed every morning that they were in bloom on [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s own particular table . For lasting vegetable odours [she]336-my lady preferred lavender and sweet woodroof to any extract whatever . Lavender reminded [her]336-my lady of old customs , [she]336-my lady said , and of [homely cottage - gardens]985-homely cottage - gardens , and many [a cottager]986-a cottager made [his]986-a cottager offering to [her]336-my lady of a bundle of lavender . Sweet woodroof , again , grew in wild , woodland places where the soil was fine and the air delicate : [the poor children]987-the poor children used to go and gather it for [her]336-my lady up in [the woods]988-the woods on [the higher lands]989-the higher lands ; and for this service [she]336-my lady always rewarded [them]987-the poor children with bright new pennies , of which [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord , [[her]336-my lady son]991-her son , used to send [her]336-my lady down a bagful fresh from the Mint in [London]2-london every February . Attar of roses , again , [she]336-my lady disliked . [She]336-my lady said it reminded [her]336-my lady of [the city]992-the city and of [[merchants]993-merchants ’ wives]994-merchants ’ wives , over - rich , over - heavy in [its]995-its perfume . And lilies - of - [the - valley]996-the - valley somehow fell under the same condemnation . They were most graceful and elegant to look at ( [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady was quite candid about this ) , flower , leaf , colour — everything was refined about them but the smell . That was too strong . But the great hereditary faculty on which [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady piqued [herself]336-my lady , and with reason , for [I]0-i never met with [any person who possessed it]999-any person who possessed it , was the power [she]336-my lady had of perceiving the delicious odour arising from a bed of strawberries in the late autumn , when the leaves were all fading and dying . “ [Bacon]140-lord bacon ’s Essays ”[336-my lady] was one of the few books that lay about in [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s room]1001-my lady ’s room ; and if [you]1002-you took it up and opened it carelessly , it was sure to fall apart at [his]1003-his “ Essay on Gardens . ”[3041-her ladyship] “ Listen , ”[3041-her ladyship] [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship would say , “ to what [that great philosopher and statesman]3180-that great philosopher and statesman says . ‘ Next to that,’—he is speaking of violets , [my]3041-her ladyship dear,—‘is the musk - rose,’—of which [you]1002-you remember the great bush , at the corner of the south wall just by the Blue Drawing - room windows ; that is the old musk - rose , [Shakespeare]141-shakespeare ’s musk - rose , which is dying out through [the kingdom]3181-the kingdom now . But to return to [[my]3041-her ladyship [Lord Bacon]140-lord bacon]3182-my lord bacon : ‘ Then the strawberry leaves , dying with a most excellent cordial smell . ’ Now [the Hanburys]139-the hanburys can always smell this excellent cordial odour , and very delicious and refreshing it is . [You]1002-you see , in [Lord Bacon]140-lord bacon ’s time , there had not been so many intermarriages between [the court]572-the court and [the city]992-the city as there have been since the needy days of [[his]1003-his Majesty]3185-his majesty [Charles the Second]142-charles the second ; and altogether in the time of [Queen Elizabeth]143-queen elizabeth , [the great , old families of [England]9-england]3186-the great , old families of england were a distinct race , just as a cart - horse is one creature , and very useful in its place , and [Childers]144-childers or [Eclipse]145-eclipse is another creature , though [both are of the same species]3187-both are of the same species . So [the old families]3188-the old families have gifts and powers of a different and higher class to what the other orders have . [[My]3041-her ladyship dear]3052-my dear , remember that [you]3052-my dear try if [you]3052-my dear can smell the scent of dying strawberry - leaves in this next autumn . [You]3052-my dear have some of [Ursula Hanbury]93-ursula hanbury ’s blood in [you]3052-my dear , and that gives [you]3052-my dear a chance . ”[3041-her ladyship] But when [October]146-october came , [I]0-i sniffed and sniffed , and all to no purpose ; and [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady — who had watched [the little experiment]1006-the little experiment rather anxiously — had to give [me]0-i up as [a hybrid]1007-a hybrid . [I]0-i was mortified , [I]0-i confess , and thought that it was in some ostentation of [her]336-my lady own powers that [she]336-my lady ordered [the gardener]1008-the gardener to plant a border of strawberries on that side of [the terrace]908-the terrace that lay under [her]336-my lady windows . [I]0-i have wandered away from time and place . [I]0-i tell [you]1010-you all the remembrances [I]0-i have of those years just as they come up , and [I]0-i hope that , in [my]0-i old age , [I]0-i am not getting too like [a certain [Mrs. Nickleby]147-mrs. nickleby , whose speeches were once read out aloud to [me]0-i]1011-a certain mrs. nickleby , whose speeches were once read out aloud to me . [I]0-i came by degrees to be all day long in [this room which [I]0-i have been describing]1012-this room which i have been describing ; sometimes sitting in the easy - chair , doing some little piece of dainty work for [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , or sometimes arranging flowers , or sorting letters according to [their]1014-their handwriting , so that [she]336-my lady could arrange them afterwards , and destroy or keep , as [she]336-my lady planned , looking ever onward to [her]336-my lady death . Then , after the sofa was brought in , [she]336-my lady would watch [my]0-i face , and if [she]336-my lady saw [my]0-i colour change , [she]336-my lady would bid [me]0-i lie down and rest . And [I]0-i used to try to walk upon [the terrace]908-the terrace every day for a short time : it hurt [me]0-i very much , it is true , but [the doctor]3071-the doctor had ordered it , and [I]0-i knew [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship wished [me]0-i to obey . Before [I]0-i had seen the background of [a great lady]1018-a great lady ’s life , [I]0-i had thought it all play and fine doings . But whatever [other grand people]1019-other grand people are , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady was never idle . For one thing , [she]336-my lady had to superintend [the agent for [the large Hanbury estate]1022-the large hanbury estate]1021-the agent for the large hanbury estate . [I]0-i believe it was mortgaged for a sum of money which had gone to improve [[the late lord]1023-the late lord ’s Scotch lands]1024-the late lord ’s scotch lands ; but [she]336-my lady was anxious to pay off this before [her]336-my lady death , and so to leave [her]336-my lady own inheritance free of incumbrance to [[her]336-my lady son]991-her son , [the present Earl]1026-the present earl ; whom , [I]0-i secretly think , [she]336-my lady considered [a greater person]1027-a greater person , as being [the heir of [the Hanburys]139-the hanburys]1028-the heir of the hanburys ( though through a female line ) , than as being [[my]0-i Lord [Ludlow]92-lady ludlow]99-lord ludlow with half a dozen other minor titles . With this wish of releasing [her]336-my lady property from the mortgage , skilful care was much needed in the management of it ; and as far as [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady could go , [she]336-my lady took every pains . [She]336-my lady had a great book , in which every page was ruled into three divisions ; on the first column was written the date and the name of [the tenant who addressed any letter on business to [her]336-my lady]1030-the tenant who addressed any letter on business to her ; on the second was briefly stated the subject of the letter , which generally contained a request of some kind . This request would be surrounded and enveloped in so many words , and often inserted amidst so many odd reasons and excuses , that [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ( [the steward]1031-the steward ) would sometimes say it was like hunting through a bushel of chaff to find a grain of wheat . Now , in the second column of this book , the grain of meaning was placed , clean and dry , before [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship every morning . [She]336-my lady sometimes would ask to see the original letter ; sometimes [she]336-my lady simply answered the request by a “ Yes , ”[336-my lady] or a “ No ; ”[336-my lady] and often [she]336-my lady would send for lenses and papers , and examine them well , with [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner at [her]336-my lady elbow , to see if such petitions , as to be allowed to plough up [pasture fields]1033-pasture fields , were provided for in the terms of the original agreement . On every Thursday [she]336-my lady made [herself]336-my lady at liberty to see [[her]336-my lady tenants]1034-her tenants , from four to six in the afternoon . Mornings would have suited [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady better , as far as convenience went , and [I]0-i believe the old custom had been to have these levees ( as [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship used to call them ) held before twelve . But , as [she]336-my lady said to [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner , when [he]238-mr. horner urged returning to the former hours , it spoilt a whole day for [a farmer]1037-a farmer , if [he]238-mr. horner had to dress [himself]238-mr. horner in [his]238-mr. horner best and leave [his]238-mr. horner work in the forenoon ( and [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady liked to see [[her]336-my lady tenants]1034-her tenants come in [their]1034-her tenants Sunday clothes ; [she]336-my lady would not say a word , maybe , but [she]336-my lady would take [her]336-my lady spectacles slowly out , and put them on with silent gravity , and look at [a dirty or raggedly - dressed man]1040-a dirty or raggedly - dressed man so solemnly and earnestly , that [his]1040-a dirty or raggedly - dressed man nerves must have been pretty strong if [he]1040-a dirty or raggedly - dressed man did not wince , and resolve that , however poor [he]1040-a dirty or raggedly - dressed man might be , soap and water , and needle and thread , should be used before [he]1040-a dirty or raggedly - dressed man again appeared in [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship ’s anteroom ) . [The outlying tenants]1042-the outlying tenants had always a supper provided for [them]1042-the outlying tenants in [the servants’-hall]1043-the servants’-hall on Thursdays , to which , indeed [all comers]1044-all comers were welcome to sit down . For [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady said , though there were not many hours left of [a working man]1046-a working man ’s day when [their]1042-the outlying tenants business with [her]336-my lady was ended , yet that [they]1042-the outlying tenants needed food and rest , and that [she]336-my lady should be ashamed if [they]1042-the outlying tenants sought either at [the Fighting Lion]36-the fighting lion ( called at this day [the Hanbury Arms]37-the hanbury arms ) . [They]1042-the outlying tenants had as much beer as [they]1042-the outlying tenants could drink while [they]1042-the outlying tenants were eating ; and when the food was cleared away , [they]1042-the outlying tenants had a cup a piece of good ale , in which [the oldest tenant present]1047-the oldest tenant present , standing up , gave [Madam]3119-madam ’s health ; and after that was drunk , [they]1042-the outlying tenants were expected to set off homewards ; at any rate , no more liquor was given [them]1042-the outlying tenants . [The tenants one and all]1049-the tenants one and all called [her]3119-madam “ [Madam]3119-madam ; ”[1049-the tenants one and all] for [they]1049-the tenants one and all recognized in [her]3119-madam [the married heiress of [the Hanburys]139-the hanburys]1050-the married heiress of the hanburys , not [the widow of [a Lord Ludlow]99-lord ludlow , of whom [they]1049-the tenants one and all and [[their]1049-the tenants one and all forefathers]1052-their forefathers knew nothing]1051-the widow of a lord ludlow , of whom they and their forefathers knew nothing ; and against whose memory , indeed , there rankled a dim unspoken grudge , the cause of which was accurately known to [the very few who understood the nature of a mortgage]1053-the very few who understood the nature of a mortgage , and were therefore aware that [Madam]149-madam ’s money had been taken to enrich [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord [’s poor land in [Scotland]1-scotland]1055-’s poor land in scotland . [I]0-i am sure — for [you]1056-you can understand [I]0-i was behind the scenes , as it were , and had many an opportunity of seeing and hearing , as [I]0-i lay or sat motionless in [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s room]1001-my lady ’s room with the double doors open between [it]1001-my lady ’s room and the anteroom beyond , where [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow saw [[her]92-lady ludlow steward]1059-her steward , and gave audience to [her]92-lady ludlow tenants,—I am certain , [I]0-i say , that [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was silently as much annoyed at the money that was swallowed up by this mortgage as [any one]624-any one ; and , some time or other , [he]238-mr. horner had probably spoken [his]238-mr. horner mind out to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ; for there was a sort of offended reference on [her]336-my lady part , and respectful submission to blame on [his]238-mr. horner , while every now and then there was an implied protest — whenever the payments of the interest became due , or whenever [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady stinted [herself]336-my lady of any personal expense , such as [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner thought was only decorous and becoming in [the heiress of [the Hanburys]139-the hanburys]1063-the heiress of the hanburys . [[Her]336-my lady carriages]1064-her carriages were old and cumbrous , wanting all the improvements which had been adopted by those of [her]336-my lady rank throughout [the county]3101-the county . [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner would fain have had the ordering of [a new coach]1066-a new coach . [The carriage]800-the carriage - horses , too , were getting past [their]800-the carriage work ; yet all the promising colts bred on [the estate]582-the estate were sold for ready money ; and so on . [[My]0-i lord]3081-my lord , [[her]336-my lady son]991-her son , was ambassador at [some foreign place]1071-some foreign place ; and very proud [we]1072-we all were of [his]991-her son glory and dignity ; but [I]0-i fancy it cost money , and [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady would have lived on bread and water sooner than have called upon [him]991-her son to help [her]336-my lady in paying off the mortgage , although [he]991-her son was [the one who was to benefit by it in the end]1074-the one who was to benefit by it in the end . [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was [a very faithful steward]1075-a very faithful steward , and very respectful to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ; although sometimes , [I]0-i thought [she]336-my lady was sharper to [him]238-mr. horner than to [any one else]1077-any one else ; perhaps because [she]336-my lady knew that , although [he]238-mr. horner never said anything , [he]238-mr. horner disapproved of [the Hanburys]139-the hanburys being made to pay for [the Earl Ludlow]124-earl ludlow ’s estates and state . [The late lord]1023-the late lord had been [a sailor]1079-a sailor , and had been as extravagant in [his]1023-the late lord habits as [most sailors]1080-most sailors are , [I]0-i am told,—for [I]0-i never saw [the sea]1081-the sea ; and yet [he]1023-the late lord had a long sight to [his]1023-the late lord own interests ; but whatever [he]1023-the late lord was , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady loved [him]1023-the late lord and [his]1023-the late lord memory , with about as fond and proud a love as ever [wife]1083-wife gave [husband]1084-husband , [I]0-i should think . For a part of [his]238-mr. horner life [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner , who was born on [the Hanbury property]1085-the hanbury property , had been [a clerk to [an attorney in [Birmingham]38-birmingham]1087-an attorney in birmingham]1086-a clerk to an attorney in birmingham ; and these few years had given [him]238-mr. horner a kind of worldly wisdom , which , though always exerted for [her]336-my lady benefit , was antipathetic to [her]336-my lady ladyship , who thought that some of [[her]336-my lady steward]1059-her steward ’s maxims savoured of trade and commerce . [I]0-i fancy that if it had been possible , [she]336-my lady would have preferred a return to the primitive system , of living on the produce of [the land]3166-the land , and exchanging the surplus for such articles as were needed , without the intervention of money . But [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was bitten with new - fangled notions , as [she]336-my lady would say , though [his]238-mr. horner new - fangled notions were what [folk at the present day]1090-folk at the present day would think sadly behindhand ; and some of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s ideas fell on [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s mind like sparks on tow , though they started from two different points . [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner wanted to make [every man]1091-every man useful and active in [this world]1092-this world , and to direct as much activity and usefulness as possible to the improvement of [the Hanbury estates]1093-the hanbury estates , and the aggrandisement of [the Hanbury family]654-the hanbury family , and therefore [he]238-mr. horner fell into the new cry for education . [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray did not care much,—Mr . [Horner]238-mr. horner thought not enough,—for [this world]1092-this world , and where [any man]1096-any man or [family]1097-family stood in [their]1096-any man earthly position ; but [he]238-mr. horner would have every one prepared for [the world]866-the world to come , and capable of understanding and receiving certain doctrines , for which latter purpose , it stands to reason , [he]238-mr. horner must have heard of these doctrines ; and therefore [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray wanted education . The answer in the Catechism that [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was most fond of calling upon [a child]773-a child to repeat , was that to , “ What is [thy]238-mr. horner duty towards [[thy]238-mr. horner neighbour]3191-thy neighbour ? ”[238-mr. horner] The answer [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray liked best to hear repeated with unction , was that to the question , “ What is the inward and spiritual grace ? ”[92-lady ludlow] The reply to which [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow bent [her]92-lady ludlow head the lowest , as [we]1100-we said [our]1100-we Catechism to [her]92-lady ludlow on Sundays , was to , “ What is [thy]238-mr. horner duty towards [God]133-god ? ”[92-lady ludlow] But neither [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner nor [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had heard many answers to the Catechism as yet . Up to this time there was [no Sunday - school in [Hanbury]13-hanbury]1101-no sunday - school in hanbury . [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s desires were bounded by that object . [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner looked farther on : [he]238-mr. horner hoped for a day - school at some future time , to train [up [intelligent labourers]1103-intelligent labourers for working on [the estate]582-the estate]1102-up intelligent labourers for working on the estate . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady would hear of neither one nor [the other]1106-the other : indeed , [not the boldest man whom [she]336-my lady ever saw]1107-not the boldest man whom she ever saw would have dared to name the project of [a day - school within [her]336-my lady hearing]1108-a day - school within her hearing . So [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner contented [himself]238-mr. horner with quietly teaching [a sharp , clever lad]1109-a sharp , clever lad to read and write , with a view to making use of [him]1109-a sharp , clever lad as [a kind of foreman in process of time]1110-a kind of foreman in process of time . [He]238-mr. horner had [his]238-mr. horner pick of [the farm - lads]1111-the farm - lads for this purpose ; and , as the brightest and sharpest , although by far the raggedest and dirtiest , singled out [[Job Gregson]132-job gregson ’s son]1112-job gregson ’s son . But all this — as [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady never listened to gossip , or indeed , was spoken to unless [she]336-my lady spoke first — was quite unknown to [her]336-my lady , until the unlucky incident took place which [I]0-i am going to relate . CHAPTER IV . [I]0-i think [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady was not aware of [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s views on education ( as making [men]3110-men into [more useful members of society]1116-more useful members of society ) , or the practice to which [he]238-mr. horner was putting [his]238-mr. horner precepts in taking [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson as [pupil]1117-pupil and [protege]1118-protege ; if , indeed , [she]336-my lady were aware of [Harry]150-harry gregson ’s distinct existence at all , until the following unfortunate occasion . The anteroom , which was a kind of business - place for [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady to receive [[her]336-my lady steward]1059-her steward and [tenants]1121-tenants in , was surrounded by shelves . [I]0-i can not call them book - shelves , though there were many books on them ; but the contents of the volumes were principally manuscript , and relating to details connected with [the Hanbury property]1085-the hanbury property . There were also one or two dictionaries , gazetteers , works of reference on the management of property ; all of a very old date ( the dictionary was [Bailey]151-bailey ’s , [I]0-i remember ; [we]1123-we had a great Johnson in [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s room]1001-my lady ’s room , but where [lexicographers]1126-lexicographers differed , [she]336-my lady generally preferred [Bailey]151-bailey ) . In [this antechamber]1127-this antechamber [a footman]1128-a footman generally sat , awaiting orders from [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ; for [she]336-my lady clung to the grand old customs , and despised any bells , except [her]336-my lady own little hand - bell , as modern inventions ; [she]336-my lady would have [[her]336-my lady people]1130-her people always within summons of this silvery bell , or [her]336-my lady scarce less silvery voice . [This man]1131-this man had not the sinecure [you]1132-you might imagine . [He]1131-this man had to reply to the private entrance ; what [we]1123-we should call the back door in [a smaller house]1133-a smaller house . As [none]1134-none came to the front door but [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , and those of [the county]3101-the county whom [she]336-my lady honoured by visiting , and [[her]336-my lady nearest acquaintance]1137-her nearest acquaintance of this kind lived eight miles ( of [bad road]1138-bad road ) off , [the majority of [comers]1140-comers]1139-the majority of comers knocked at the nail - studded terrace - door ; not to have [it]1141-it opened ( for open [it]1141-it stood , by [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s orders , winter and summer , so that the snow often drifted into [the back hall]1143-the back hall , and lay there in heaps when the weather was severe ) , but to summon [some one]500-some one to receive [their]500-some one message , or carry [their]500-some one request to be allowed to speak to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . [I]0-i remember it was long before [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray could be made to understand that the great door was only open on state occasions , and even to the last [he]113-mr. gray would as soon come in by that as the terrace entrance . [I]0-i had been received [there]559-there on [my]0-i first setting foot over [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s threshold ; [every stranger]1148-every stranger was led in by that way the first time [they]1148-every stranger came ; but after that ( with the exceptions [I]0-i have named ) [they]1148-every stranger went round by [the terrace]908-the terrace , as it were by instinct . It was an assistance to this instinct to be aware that from time immemorial , the magnificent and fierce Hanbury wolf - hounds , which were extinct in [every other part of [the island]1151-the island]1150-every other part of the island , had been and still were kept chained in [the front quadrangle]1152-the front quadrangle , where [they]1148-every stranger bayed through a great part of the day and night and were always ready with [their]1148-every stranger deep , savage growl at the sight of [every person]1153-every person and thing , excepting [the man who fed [them]1148-every stranger]1154-the man who fed them , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s carriage and four , and [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady [herself]336-my lady . It was pretty to see [her]336-my lady small figure go up to the great , crouching brutes thumping the flags with [their]1148-every stranger heavy , wagging tails , and slobbering in an ecstacy of delight , at [her]336-my lady light approach and soft caress . [She]336-my lady had no fear of [them]1148-every stranger ; but [she]336-my lady was [a Hanbury born]1157-a hanbury born , and the tale went , that [they]1148-every stranger and [[their]1148-every stranger kind]1158-their kind knew [all Hanburys]1159-all hanburys instantly , and acknowledged [their]1148-every stranger supremacy , ever since [the ancestors of the breed]1160-the ancestors of the breed had been brought from [the East]39-the east by [the great [Sir Urian Hanbury]152-sir urian , who lay with [his]152-sir urian legs crossed on the altar - tomb in [the church]642-the church]1161-the great sir urian hanbury , who lay with his legs crossed on the altar - tomb in the church . Moreover , it was reported that , not fifty years before , one of these dogs had eaten up [a child]773-a child , which had inadvertently strayed within reach of its chain . So [you]1164-you may imagine how [most people]1165-most people preferred the terrace - door . [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray did not seem to care for the dogs . It might be absence of mind , for [I]0-i have heard of [his]113-mr. gray starting away from [their]1148-every stranger sudden spring when [he]113-mr. gray had unwittingly walked within reach of [their]1148-every stranger chains : but it could hardly have been absence of mind , when one day [he]113-mr. gray went right up to one of [them]1148-every stranger , and patted [him]113-mr. gray in the most friendly manner , the dog meanwhile looking pleased , and affably wagging [his]113-mr. gray tail , just as if [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had been [a Hanbury]152-sir urian . [We]1166-we were all very much puzzled by this , and to this day [I]0-i have not been able to account for it . But now let [us]1166-we go back to [the terrace - door]1167-the terrace - door , and [the footman sitting in the antechamber]1168-the footman sitting in the antechamber . One morning [we]1166-we heard a parleying , which rose to such a vehemence , and lasted for so long , that [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady had to ring [her]336-my lady hand - bell twice before [the footman]1170-the footman heard it . “ What is the matter , [John]134-john footman ? ”[336-my lady] asked [she]336-my lady , when [he]113-mr. gray entered , “ [A little boy]3192-a little boy , [[my]113-mr. gray lady]336-my lady , who says [he]3192-a little boy comes from [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner , and must see [[your]134-john footman ladyship]3058-your ladyship . [Impudent little lad]3195-impudent little lad ! ”[113-mr. gray] ( This last to [himself]113-mr. gray . ) “ What does [he]3192-a little boy want ? ”[113-mr. gray] “ That ’s just what [I]92-lady ludlow have asked [him]3192-a little boy , [[my]92-lady ludlow lady]336-my lady , but [he]3192-a little boy wo n’t tell [me]92-lady ludlow , please [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship . ”[92-lady ludlow] “ It is , probably , some message from [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner , ”[92-lady ludlow] said [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow , with just a shade of annoyance in [her]92-lady ludlow manner ; for it was against all etiquette to send a message to [her]92-lady ludlow , and by [such a messenger]1171-such a messenger too ! “ No ! please [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship , [I]92-lady ludlow asked [him]3192-a little boy if [he]3192-a little boy had any message , and [he]3192-a little boy said no , [he]3192-a little boy had none ; but [he]3192-a little boy must see [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship for all that . ”[92-lady ludlow] “ [You]336-my lady had better show [him]3192-a little boy in then , without more words , ”[3041-her ladyship] said [[her]92-lady ludlow ladyship]3041-her ladyship , quietly , but still , as [I]0-i have said , rather annoyed . As if in mockery of [the humble visitor]1173-the humble visitor , [the footman]1170-the footman threw open both battants of the door , and in the opening there stood [a lithe , wiry lad , with a thick head of hair , standing out in every direction , as if stirred by some electrical current , a short , brown face , red now from affright and excitement]1175-a lithe , wiry lad , with a thick head of hair , standing out in every direction , as if stirred by some electrical current , a short , brown face , red now from affright and excitement , wide , resolute mouth , and bright , deep - set eyes , which glanced keenly and rapidly round [the room]489-the room , as if taking in everything ( and all was new and strange ) , to be thought and puzzled over at some future time . [He]1170-the footman knew enough of manners not to speak first to one above [him]1170-the footman in rank , or else [he]1170-the footman was afraid . “ What do [you]1170-the footman want with [me]336-my lady ? ”[336-my lady] asked [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ; in so gentle a tone that it seemed to surprise and stun [him]1170-the footman . “ An’t please [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship ? ”[1170-the footman] said [he]1170-the footman , as if [he]1170-the footman had been deaf . “ [You]1170-the footman come from [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s : why do [you]1170-the footman want to see [me]336-my lady ? ”[336-my lady] again asked [she]336-my lady , a little more loudly . “ An’t please [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was sent for all on a sudden to [Warwick]40-warwick this morning . ”[336-my lady] [His]1170-the footman face began to work ; but [he]1170-the footman felt it , and closed [his]1170-the footman lips into a resolute form . “ Well ? ”[1170-the footman] “ And [he]1170-the footman went off all on a sudden like . ”[336-my lady] “ Well ? ”[336-my lady] “ And [he]1170-the footman left a note for [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship with [me]1170-the footman , [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship . ”[1170-the footman] “ Is that all ? [You]336-my lady might have given it to [the footman]1170-the footman . ”[336-my lady] “ Please [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship , [I]1170-the footman ’ve clean gone and lost it . ”[1170-the footman] [He]1170-the footman never took [his]1170-the footman eyes off [her]1178-her face . If [he]1170-the footman had not kept [his]1170-the footman look fixed , [he]1170-the footman would have burst out crying . “ That was very careless , ”[336-my lady] said [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady gently . “ But [I]336-my lady am sure [you]1170-the footman are very sorry for it . [You]1170-the footman had better try and find it ; it may have been of consequence . “[336-my lady] Please , [mum]1180-mum — please [[your]1180-mum ladyship]3058-your ladyship — [I]0-i can say it off by heart . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i ! What do [you]0-i mean ? ” [I]0-i was really afraid now . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s blue eyes absolutely gave out light , [she]336-my lady was so much displeased , and , moreover , perplexed . The more reason [he]238-mr. horner had for affright , the more [his]238-mr. horner courage rose . [He]238-mr. horner must have [seen,—so sharp]153-seen,—so sharp [a lad]3207-a lad must have perceived [her]336-my lady displeasure ; but [he]238-mr. horner went on quickly and steadily . “[0-i] [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , has taught [me]0-i to read , write , and cast accounts , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . And [he]238-mr. horner was in a hurry , and [he]238-mr. horner folded [his]238-mr. horner paper up , but [he]238-mr. horner did not seal it ; and [I]0-i read it , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ; and now , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , it seems like as if [I]0-i had got it off by heart ; ” and [he]238-mr. horner went on with a high pitched voice , saying out very loud what , [I]0-i have no doubt , were the identical words of the letter , date , signature and all : it was merely something about a deed , which required [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s signature . When [he]238-mr. horner had done , [he]238-mr. horner stood almost as if [he]238-mr. horner expected commendation for [his]238-mr. horner accurate memory . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s eyes contracted till the pupils were as needle - points ; it was a way [she]336-my lady had when much disturbed . [She]336-my lady looked at [me]0-i and said — “[0-i] [Margaret Dawson]94-margaret dawson , what will [this world]1092-this world come to ? ” And then [she]336-my lady was silent . [The lad]3210-the lad , beginning to perceive [he]3210-the lad had given deep offence , stood stock still — as if [his]3210-the lad brave will had brought [him]3210-the lad into this presence , and impelled [him]3210-the lad to confession , and the best amends [he]3210-the lad could make , but had now deserted [him]3210-the lad , or was extinct , and left [his]3210-the lad body motionless , until [some one else]3211-some one else with word or deed made [him]3210-the lad quit [the room]489-the room . [[My]94-margaret dawson lady]336-my lady looked again at [him]3210-the lad , and saw the frowning , dumb - foundering terror at [his]3210-the lad misdeed , and the manner in which [his]3210-the lad confession had been received . “[94-margaret dawson] [[My]0-i poor lad]1187-my poor lad ! ” said [she]336-my lady , the angry look leaving [her]336-my lady face , “[94-margaret dawson] into whose hands have [you]1187-my poor lad fallen ? ” [The boy]3214-the boy ’s lips began to quiver . “[94-margaret dawson] Do n’t [you]0-i know what tree [we]1188-we read of in [Genesis?—No]41-genesis?—no ! [I]0-i hope [you]1187-my poor lad have not got to read so easily as that . ” A pause . “[0-i] Who has taught [you]1187-my poor lad to read and write ? ” “[0-i] Please , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , [I]0-i meant no harm , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . ” [He]3214-the boy was fairly blubbering , overcome by [her]336-my lady evident feeling of dismay and regret , the soft repression of which was more frightening to [him]3214-the boy than any strong or violent words would have been . “[0-i] Who taught [you]1187-my poor lad , [I]0-i ask ? ” “[0-i] It were [[Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s clerk]1191-mr. horner ’s clerk who learned [me]0-i , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . ” “[1191-mr. horner ’s clerk] And did [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner know of it ? ” “[238-mr. horner] Yes , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . And [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i thought for to please [him]238-mr. horner . ” “[0-i] Well ! perhaps [you]1187-my poor lad were not to blame for that . But [I]0-i wonder at [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner . However , [[my]0-i boy]1194-my boy , as [you]1194-my boy have got possession of edge - tools , [you]1194-my boy must have some rules how to use them . Did [you]1194-my boy never hear that [you]1194-my boy were not to open letters ? ” “[1194-my boy] Please , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , it were open . [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner forgot for to seal it , in [his]238-mr. horner hurry to be off . ” “[238-mr. horner] But [you]1194-my boy must not read letters that are not intended for [you]1194-my boy . [You]1194-my boy must never try to read any letters that are not directed to [you]1194-my boy , even if they be open before [you]1194-my boy . ” “[939-may lady] Please , [may lady]939-may lady , [I]0-i thought it were good for practice , all as one as a book . ” [[My]1194-my boy lady]336-my lady looked bewildered as to what way [she]336-my lady could farther explain to [him]1194-my boy the laws of honour as regarded letters . “[1194-my boy] [You]1194-my boy would not listen , [I]0-i am sure , ” said [she]0-i , “[0-i] to anything [you]1194-my boy were not intended to hear ? ” [He]1194-my boy hesitated for a moment , partly because [he]1194-my boy did not fully comprehend the question . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady repeated it . The light of intelligence came into [his]1194-my boy eager eyes , and [I]0-i could see that [he]1194-my boy was not certain if [he]1194-my boy could tell the truth . “[0-i] Please , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , [I]0-i always hearken when [I]0-i hear [folk]1198-folk talking secrets ; but [I]0-i mean no harm . ” [[My]0-i poor lady]3217-my poor lady sighed : [she]3217-my poor lady was not prepared to begin a long way off in morals .
