[I]0-i made haste to go down to [him]1450-the old man in [[the housekeeper]1223-the housekeeper ’s room]1224-the housekeeper ’s room , sooner than that [he]1450-the old man should be ushered into [mine]0-i , for fear of [madame]1370-madame hearing any sound . “ [The old man]1450-the old man stood — [I]0-i see [him]1450-the old man now — with [his]1450-the old man hat held before [him]1450-the old man in both [his]1450-the old man hands ; [he]1450-the old man slowly bowed till [his]1450-the old man face touched it when [I]0-i came in . Such long excess of courtesy augured ill . [He]1450-the old man waited for [me]0-i to speak . “[0-i] ‘ Have [you]1450-the old man any intelligence ? ’ [I]0-i inquired . [He]1450-the old man had been often to [the house]3047-the house before , to ask if [we]1554-we had received any news ; and once or twice [I]0-i had seen [him]1450-the old man , but this was the first time [he]1450-the old man had begged to see [me]0-i . “ ‘ Yes , [madame]1370-madame , ’ [he]1450-the old man replied , still standing with [his]1450-the old man head bent down , like [a child in disgrace]3403-a child in disgrace . “[0-i] ‘ And it is bad ! ’ [I]0-i exclaimed . “ ‘ It is bad . ’ For a moment [I]0-i was angry at the cold tone in which [my]0-i words were echoed ; but directly afterwards [I]0-i saw the large , slow , heavy tears of age falling down [the old man]1450-the old man ’s cheeks , and on to the sleeves of [his]1450-the old man poor , threadbare coat . “[0-i] [I]0-i asked [him]1450-the old man how [he]1450-the old man had heard it : it seemed as though [I]0-i could not all at once bear to hear what it was . [He]1450-the old man told [me]0-i that the night before , in crossing [Long Acre]53-long acre , [he]1450-the old man had stumbled upon [an old acquaintance of [his]1450-the old man]1555-an old acquaintance of his ; [one who , like [himself]1450-the old man had been [a dependent upon [the De Crequy family]1558-the de crequy family]1557-a dependent upon the de crequy family , but had managed [their]1558-the de crequy family [Paris]22-paris affairs , while [Flechier]177-flechier had taken charge of [[their]1558-the de crequy family estates in [the country]1448-the country]1447-their estates in the country]1556-one who , like himself had been a dependent upon the de crequy family , but had managed their paris affairs , while flechier had taken charge of their estates in the country . [Both]1561-both were now [emigrants]1562-emigrants , and living on the proceeds of such small available talents as [they]1561-both possessed . [Flechier]177-flechier , as [I]0-i knew , earned a very fair livelihood by going about to dress salads for dinner parties . [[His]177-flechier compatriot]1563-his compatriot , [Le Febvre]178-le febvre , had begun to give a few lessons as [a dancing - master]1564-a dancing - master . [One of [them]1561-both]1565-one of them took [the other]1106-the other [home]586-home to [[his]177-flechier lodgings]1568-his lodgings ; and there , when [their]1561-both most immediate personal adventures had been hastily talked over , came the inquiry from [Flechier]177-flechier as to [Monsieur de Crequy]167-monsieur de crequy “ ‘ [Clement]195-pierre was dead — guillotined . [Virginie]168-virginie was dead — guillotined . ’ “[177-flechier] When [Flechier]177-flechier had told [me]0-i thus much , [he]177-flechier could not speak for sobbing ; and [I]0-i , [myself]0-i , could hardly tell how to restrain [my]0-i tears sufficiently , until [I]0-i could go to [[my]0-i own room]1569-my own room and be at liberty to give way . [He]177-flechier asked [my]0-i leave to bring in [[his]177-flechier friend]1306-his friend [Le Febvre]178-le febvre , who was walking in [the square]1571-the square , awaiting a possible summons to tell [his]177-flechier story . [I]0-i heard afterwards a good many details , which filled up the account , and made [me]0-i feel — which brings [me]0-i back to the point [I]0-i started from — how unfit [the lower orders]1572-the lower orders are for being trusted indiscriminately with the dangerous powers of education . [I]0-i have made a long preamble , but now [I]0-i am coming to the moral of [my]0-i story . ” [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady was trying to shake off the emotion which [she]336-my lady evidently felt in recurring to this sad history of [Monsieur de Crequy]167-monsieur de crequy ’s death . [She]336-my lady came behind [me]0-i , and arranged [my]0-i pillows , and then , seeing [I]0-i had been crying — for , indeed , [I]0-i was weak - spirited at the time , and a little served to unloose [my]0-i tears — [she]336-my lady stooped down , and kissed [my]0-i forehead , and said “[0-i] [Poor child]1573-poor child ! ” almost as if [she]336-my lady thanked [me]1573-poor child for feeling that old grief of [hers]336-my lady . “[1573-poor child] Being once in [France]45-france , it was no difficult thing for [Clement]195-pierre to get into [Paris]22-paris . The difficulty in those days was to leave , not to enter . [He]195-pierre came in dressed as [a Norman peasant]1574-a norman peasant , in charge of a load of fruit and vegetables , with which one of [the Seine barges]1575-the seine barges was freighted . [He]195-pierre worked hard with [[his]195-pierre companions]1576-his companions in landing and arranging [their]1576-his companions produce on [the quays]1577-the quays ; and then , when [they]1576-his companions dispersed to get [their]1576-his companions breakfasts at [some of [the estaminets near [the old Marche aux Fleurs]1580-the old marche aux fleurs]1579-the estaminets near the old marche aux fleurs]1578-some of the estaminets near the old marche aux fleurs , [he]195-pierre sauntered up [a street]1581-a street which conducted [him]195-pierre , by many an odd turn , through [the Quartier Latin]1582-the quartier latin to [a horrid back alley]1583-a horrid back alley , leading out of [the Rue l’Ecole de Medecine]1584-the rue l’ecole de medecine ; some atrocious place , as [I]0-i have heard , not far from the shadow of [that terrible Abbaye]1585-that terrible abbaye , where so many of [the best blood of [France]45-france]1586-the best blood of france awaited [their]1587-their deaths . But [here]3173-here [some old man]1589-some old man lived , on whose fidelity [Clement]195-pierre thought that [he]195-pierre might rely . [I]0-i am not sure if [he]195-pierre had not been gardener in [those very gardens behind [the Hotel Crequy]175-the hotel de crequy where [Clement]195-pierre and [Urian]160-urian used to play together years before]1590-those very gardens behind the hotel crequy where clement and urian used to play together years before . But whatever [[the old man]1450-the old man ’s dwelling]1592-the old man ’s dwelling might be , [Clement]195-pierre was only too glad to reach [it]1592-the old man ’s dwelling , [you]1593-you may be sure , [he]195-pierre had been kept in [Normandy]55-normandy , in all sorts of disguises , for many days after landing in [Dieppe]50-dieppe , through the difficulty of entering [Paris]22-paris unsuspected by [the many ruffians who were always on the look - out for [aristocrats]1465-aristocrats]1594-the many ruffians who were always on the look - out for aristocrats . “ [The old gardener]3406-the old gardener was , [I]195-pierre believe , both faithful and tried , and sheltered [Clement]195-pierre in [his]195-pierre garret as well as might be . Before [he]195-pierre could stir out , it was necessary to procure a fresh disguise , and one more in character with [an inhabitant of [Paris]22-paris]3407-an inhabitant of paris than that of [a Norman carter]3408-a norman carter was procured ; and after waiting indoors for one or two days , to see if any suspicion was excited , [Clement]195-pierre set off to discover [Virginie]168-virginie . “[195-pierre] [He]195-pierre found [her]1596-her at [the old concierge ’s dwelling]1597-the old concierge ’s dwelling . [Madame Babette]179-madame babette was the name of [this woman]1598-this woman , who must have been a less faithful — or rather , perhaps , [I]0-i should say , [a more interested — friend to [[her]1598-this woman guest]1600-her guest than [the old gardener [Jaques]180-jaques]1601-the old gardener jaques]1599-a more interested — friend to her guest than the old gardener jaques was to [Clement]195-pierre . “ [I]180-jaques have seen a miniature of [Virginie]168-virginie , which [a French lady of quality]3409-a french lady of quality happened to have in [her]3409-a french lady of quality possession at the time of [her]3409-a french lady of quality flight from [Paris]22-paris , and which [she]3409-a french lady of quality brought with [her]3409-a french lady of quality to [England]9-england unwittingly ; for it belonged to [the Count de Crequy]174-the count de crequy , with whom [she]3409-a french lady of quality was slightly acquainted . [I]180-jaques should fancy from it , that [Virginie]168-virginie was taller and of a more powerful figure for [a woman]3339-a woman than [[her]168-virginie cousin]932-her cousin [Clement]195-pierre was for [a man]725-a man . [Her]168-virginie dark - brown hair was arranged in short curls — the way of dressing the hair announced the politics of [the individual]3413-the individual , in those days , just as patches did in [[my]180-jaques grandmother]3414-my grandmother ’s time ; and [Virginie]168-virginie ’s hair was not to [my]180-jaques taste , or according to [my]180-jaques principles : it was too classical . [Her]168-virginie large , black eyes looked out at [you]3415-you steadily . [One]927-one can not judge of the shape of a nose from a full - face miniature , but the nostrils were clearly cut and largely opened . [I]180-jaques do not fancy [her]168-virginie nose could have been pretty ; but [her]168-virginie mouth had a character all its own , and which would , [I]180-jaques think , have redeemed a plainer face . It was wide , and deep set into the cheeks at the corners ; the upper lip was very much arched , and hardly closed over the teeth ; so that the whole face looked ( from the serious , intent look in the eyes , and the sweet intelligence of the mouth ) as if [she]168-virginie were listening eagerly to something to which [her]168-virginie answer was quite ready , and would come out of those red , opening lips as soon as ever [you]3415-you had done speaking , and [you]3415-you longed to know what [she]168-virginie would say . “[180-jaques] Well : this [Virginie de Crequy]168-virginie was living with [Madame Babette]179-madame babette in [the conciergerie of [an old French inn]1603-an old french inn]1602-the conciergerie of an old french inn , somewhere to [the north of [Paris]22-paris]1604-the north of paris , so , far enough from [[Clement]195-pierre ’s refuge]1605-clement ’s refuge . [The inn]3381-the inn had been frequented by [farmers from [Brittany]56-brittany]1607-farmers from brittany and [such kind of people]1608-such kind of people , in the days when that sort of intercourse went on between [Paris]22-paris and [the provinces]1609-the provinces which had nearly stopped now . [Few Bretons]1610-few bretons came near [it]3381-the inn now , and [the inn]3381-the inn had fallen into the hands of [[Madame Babette]179-madame babette ’s brother]1612-madame babette ’s brother , as payment for a bad wine debt of [the last proprietor]1613-the last proprietor . [He]1612-madame babette ’s brother put [[his]1612-madame babette ’s brother sister]1614-his sister and [[her]1614-his sister child]1615-her child in , to keep it open , as it were , and sent [all the people [he]1612-madame babette ’s brother could to occupy [the half - furnished rooms of [the house]3047-the house]1617-the half - furnished rooms of the house]1616-all the people he could to occupy the half - furnished rooms of the house . [They]1619-they paid [Babette]179-madame babette for [[their]1619-they lodging]1620-their lodging every morning as [they]1619-they went out to breakfast , and returned or not as [they]1619-they chose , at night . Every three days , [the wine merchant]1621-the wine merchant or [[his]1621-the wine merchant son]1622-his son came to [Madame Babette]179-madame babette , and [she]179-madame babette accounted to [them]1619-they for the money [she]179-madame babette had received . [She]179-madame babette and [[her]179-madame babette child]1615-her child occupied [[the porter]1400-the porter ’s office]1625-the porter ’s office ( in which [the lad]3210-the lad slept at nights ) and [a little miserable bed - room which opened out of [it]1627-a little miserable bed - room which opened out of it]1627-a little miserable bed - room which opened out of it , and received all the light and air that was admitted through the door of communication , which was half glass . [Madame Babette]179-madame babette must have had a kind of attachment for [the De Crequys]161-the de crequys — [her]179-madame babette De Crequys , [you]1628-you understand — [[Virginie]168-virginie ’s father]1629-virginie ’s father , [the Count]3273-the count ; for , at some risk to [herself]179-madame babette , [she]179-madame babette had warned both [him]1629-virginie ’s father and [[his]1629-virginie ’s father daughter]702-his daughter of the danger impending over [them]1632-them . But [he]1629-virginie ’s father , infatuated , would not believe that [[his]1629-virginie ’s father dear Human Race]1633-his dear human race could ever do [him]1629-virginie ’s father harm ; and , as long as [he]1629-virginie ’s father did not fear , [Virginie]168-virginie was not afraid . It was by some ruse , the nature of which [I]0-i never heard , that [Madame Babette]179-madame babette induced [Virginie]168-virginie to come to [[her]179-madame babette abode]1634-her abode at the very hour in which [the Count]3273-the count had been recognized in [the streets]1636-the streets , and hurried off to [the Lanterne]1637-the lanterne . It was after [Babette]179-madame babette had got [her]168-virginie [there]559-there , safe shut up in [the little back den]1639-the little back den , that [she]179-madame babette told [her]168-virginie what had befallen [[her]168-virginie father]1460-her father . From that day , [Virginie]168-virginie had never stirred out of the gates , or crossed the threshold of [[the porter]1400-the porter ’s lodge]1642-the porter ’s lodge . [I]0-i do not say that [Madame Babette]179-madame babette was tired of [her]179-madame babette continual presence , or regretted the impulse which made [her]179-madame babette rush to [[the De Crequy]1643-the de crequy ’s well - known house]1644-the de crequy ’s well - known house — after being compelled to form one of the mad crowds that saw [the Count de Crequy]174-the count de crequy seized and hung — and hurry [[his]1460-her father daughter]702-his daughter out , through alleys and [backways]1646-backways , until at length [she]179-madame babette had [the orphan]1647-the orphan safe in [[her]179-madame babette own dark sleeping - room]1648-her own dark sleeping - room , and could tell [her]179-madame babette tale of horror : but [Madame Babette]179-madame babette was poorly paid for [[her]179-madame babette porter]1649-her porter ’s work by [[her]179-madame babette avaricious brother]1650-her avaricious brother ; and it was hard enough to find food for [herself]179-madame babette and [[her]179-madame babette growing boy]1651-her growing boy ; and , though [the poor girl]1652-the poor girl ate little enough , [I]0-i dare say , yet there seemed no end to the burthen that [Madame Babette]179-madame babette had imposed upon [herself]179-madame babette : [the De Crequys]161-the de crequys were plundered , ruined , had become an extinct race , all but [a lonely friendless girl]1653-a lonely friendless girl , in broken health and spirits ; and , though [she]179-madame babette lent no positive encouragement to [his]1650-her avaricious brother suit , yet , at the time , when [Clement]195-pierre reappeared in [Paris]22-paris , [Madame Babette]179-madame babette was beginning to think that [Virginie]168-virginie might do worse than encourage the attentions of [Monsieur Morin Fils]181-morin , [[her]179-madame babette nephew]1654-her nephew , and [[the wine merchant]1621-the wine merchant ’s son]1656-the wine merchant ’s son . Of course , [he]181-morin and [[his]181-morin father]3292-his father had the entree into [the conciergerie of [the hotel that belonged to [them]1660-them , in right of being both [proprietors]1661-proprietors and [relations]1662-relations]1659-the hotel that belonged to them , in right of being both proprietors and relations]1658-the conciergerie of the hotel that belonged to them , in right of being both proprietors and relations . [The son]1663-the son , [Morin]181-morin , had seen [Virginie]168-virginie in this manner . [He]181-morin was fully aware that [she]168-virginie was far above [him]181-morin in rank , and guessed from [her]168-virginie whole aspect that [she]168-virginie had lost [her]168-virginie natural protectors by the terrible guillotine ; but [he]181-morin did not know [her]168-virginie exact name or station , nor could [he]181-morin persuade [[his]181-morin aunt]1664-his aunt to tell [him]181-morin . However , [he]181-morin fell head over ears in love with [her]168-virginie , whether [she]168-virginie were [princess]1665-princess or [peasant]1666-peasant ; and though at first there was something about [her]168-virginie which made [his]181-morin passionate love conceal itself with shy , awkward reserve , and then made it only appear in the guise of deep , respectful devotion ; yet , by - and - by,—by the same process of reasoning , [I]0-i suppose , that [[his]181-morin aunt]1664-his aunt had gone through even before [him]181-morin — [Jean Morin]182-jean morin began to let [Hope]183-hope oust [Despair]184-despair from [his]181-morin heart . Sometimes [he]181-morin thought — perhaps years hence — that [solitary , friendless lady , pent up in squalor]1668-solitary , friendless lady , pent up in squalor , might turn to [him]181-morin as to [a friend and comforter]1669-a friend and comforter — and then — and then—. Meanwhile [Jean Morin]182-jean morin was most attentive to [[his]181-morin aunt]1664-his aunt , whom [he]181-morin had rather slighted before . [He]181-morin would linger over the accounts ; would bring [her]1664-his aunt little presents ; and , above all , [he]181-morin made a pet and favourite of [Pierre]195-pierre , [the little cousin]1671-the little cousin , who could tell [him]181-morin about all the ways of going on of [Mam’selle Cannes]186-mam’selle cannes , as [Virginie]168-virginie was called . [Pierre]195-pierre was thoroughly aware of the drift and cause of [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s inquiries ; and was [[his]195-pierre ardent partisan]1673-his ardent partisan , as [I]0-i have heard , even before [Jean Morin]182-jean morin had exactly acknowledged [his]182-jean morin wishes to [himself]182-jean morin . “ It must have required some patience and much diplomacy , before [Clement de Crequy]195-pierre found out the exact place where [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin was hidden . [The old gardener]3406-the old gardener took the cause very much to heart ; as , judging from [my]182-jean morin recollections , [I]182-jean morin imagine [he]3406-the old gardener would have forwarded any fancy , however wild , of [Monsieur Clement]195-pierre ’s . ( [I]182-jean morin will tell [you]3419-you afterwards how [I]182-jean morin came to know all these particulars so well . ) “[182-jean morin] After [Clement]195-pierre ’s return , on two succeeding days , from [his]195-pierre dangerous search , without meeting with any good result , [Jacques]171-jacques entreated [Monsieur de Crequy]167-monsieur de crequy to let [him]195-pierre take it in hand . [He]195-pierre represented that [he]195-pierre , as [gardener]1674-gardener for the space of twenty years and more at [the Hotel de Crequy]3287-the hotel de crequy , had a right to be acquainted with [all the successive concierges at [[the Count]3273-the count ’s house]1678-the count ’s house]1676-all the successive concierges at the count ’s house ; that [he]195-pierre should not go among [them]1676-all the successive concierges at the count ’s house as [a stranger]505-a stranger , but as [an old friend]1680-an old friend , anxious to renew pleasant intercourse ; and that if [the Intendant]1681-the intendant ’s story , which [he]195-pierre had told [Monsieur de Crequy]167-monsieur de crequy in [England]9-england , was true , that mademoiselle was in hiding at [the house of [a former concierge]1683-a former concierge]1682-the house of a former concierge , why , something relating to [her]1684-her would surely drop out in the course of conversation . So [he]195-pierre persuaded [Clement]195-pierre to remain indoors , while [he]195-pierre set off on [his]195-pierre round , with no apparent object but to gossip . “ At night [he]195-pierre came home,—having seen [mademoiselle]168-virginie . [He]195-pierre told [Clement]195-pierre much of the story relating to [Madame Babette]179-madame babette that [I]195-pierre have told to [you]195-pierre . Of course , [he]195-pierre had heard nothing of the ambitious hopes of [Morin Fils,—hardly]182-jean morin of [his]195-pierre existence , [I]195-pierre should think . [Madame Babette]179-madame babette had received [him]195-pierre kindly ; although , for some time , [she]179-madame babette had kept [him]195-pierre standing in [the carriage gateway outside [her]179-madame babette door]3420-the carriage gateway outside her door . But , on [his]195-pierre complaining of the draught and [his]195-pierre rheumatism , [she]179-madame babette had asked [him]195-pierre in : first looking round with some anxiety , to see who was in [the room behind [her]179-madame babette]3421-the room behind her . [No one]590-no one was there when [he]195-pierre entered and sat down . But , in a minute or two , [a tall , thin young lady , with great , sad eyes , and pale cheeks]3423-a tall , thin young lady , with great , sad eyes , and pale cheeks , came from [the inner room]3424-the inner room , and , seeing [him]195-pierre , retired . ‘ It is [Mademoiselle Cannes]188-mademoiselle cannes , ’ said [Madame Babette]179-madame babette , rather unnecessarily ; for , if [he]195-pierre had not been on the watch for some sign of [Mademoiselle de Crequy]168-virginie , [he]195-pierre would hardly have noticed the entrance and withdrawal . “[195-pierre] [Clement]195-pierre and [the good old gardener]1685-the good old gardener were always rather perplexed by [Madame Babette]179-madame babette ’s evident avoidance of all mention of [the De Crequy family]1558-the de crequy family . If [she]179-madame babette were so much interested in [one member]1687-one member as to be willing to undergo the pains and penalties of a domiciliary visit , it was strange that [she]179-madame babette never inquired after the existence of [[her]179-madame babette charge ’s friends]1688-her charge ’s friends and relations from [one who might very probably have heard something of [them]1690-them]1689-one who might very probably have heard something of them . [They]1691-they settled that [Madame Babette]179-madame babette must believe that [the Marquise]1692-the marquise and [Clement]195-pierre were dead ; and admired [her]179-madame babette for [her]179-madame babette reticence in never speaking of [Virginie]168-virginie . The truth was , [I]0-i suspect , that [she]179-madame babette was so desirous of [[her]179-madame babette nephews]1693-her nephews success by this time , that [she]179-madame babette did not like letting [any one]624-any one into the secret of [Virginie]168-virginie ’s whereabouts who might interfere with [their]1691-they plan . However , it was arranged between [Clement]195-pierre and [[his]195-pierre humble friend]1695-his humble friend , that [the former]1696-the former , dressed in [the peasant]1697-the peasant ’s clothes in which [he]1696-the former had entered [Paris]22-paris , but smartened up in one or two particulars , as if , although [a countryman]1698-a countryman , [he]1696-the former had money to spare , should go and engage [a sleeping - room]1699-a sleeping - room in [the old Breton Inn]1700-the old breton inn ; where , as [I]0-i told [you]1701-you , accommodation for the night was to be had . This was accordingly done , without exciting [Madame Babette]179-madame babette ’s suspicions , for [she]179-madame babette was unacquainted with the Normandy accent , and consequently did not perceive the exaggeration of it which [Monsieur de Crequy]167-monsieur de crequy adopted in order to disguise [his]167-monsieur de crequy pure Parisian . But after [he]1696-the former had for two nights slept in a queer dark closet , at the end of [one of [the numerous short galleries in [the Hotel Duguesclin]1704-the hotel duguesclin]1703-the numerous short galleries in the hotel duguesclin]1702-one of the numerous short galleries in the hotel duguesclin , and paid [his]1696-the former money for such accommodation each morning at [the little bureau under the window of [the conciergerie]1706-the conciergerie]1705-the little bureau under the window of the conciergerie , [he]1696-the former found [himself]1696-the former no nearer to [[his]1696-the former object]1707-his object . [He]1696-the former stood outside in [the gateway]1708-the gateway : [Madame Babette]179-madame babette opened a pane in [her]179-madame babette window , counted out the change , gave polite thanks , and shut to the pane with a clack , before [he]1696-the former could ever find out what to say that might be the means of opening a conversation . Once in [the streets]1636-the streets , [he]1696-the former was in danger from [the bloodthirsty mob , who were ready in those days to hunt to death]1710-the bloodthirsty mob , who were ready in those days to hunt to death [every one who looked like [a gentleman]1283-a gentleman , as [an aristocrat]1713-an aristocrat]1711-every one who looked like a gentleman , as an aristocrat : and [Clement]195-pierre , depend upon it , looked [a gentleman]1283-a gentleman , whatever dress [he]195-pierre wore . Yet it was unwise to traverse [Paris]22-paris to [[his]1696-the former old friend]1715-his old friend [the gardener ’s grenier]1716-the gardener ’s grenier , so [he]1696-the former had to loiter about , where [I]0-i hardly know . Only [he]1696-the former did leave [the Hotel Duguesclin]1704-the hotel duguesclin , and [he]1696-the former did not go to [old Jacques]171-jacques , and there was not [another house in [Paris]22-paris open to [him]1696-the former]1718-another house in paris open to him . At the end of two days , [he]1696-the former had made out [Pierre]195-pierre ’s existence ; and [he]1696-the former began to try to make [friends]3176-friends with [the lad]3210-the lad . [Pierre]195-pierre was too sharp and shrewd not to suspect something from the confused attempts at friendliness . It was not for nothing that [the Norman farmer]1721-the norman farmer lounged in [the court]572-the court and doorway , and brought home presents of [galette]1723-galette . [Pierre]195-pierre accepted [the galette]1724-the galette , reciprocated the civil speeches , but kept [his]195-pierre eyes open . Once , returning [home]586-home pretty late at night , [he]195-pierre surprised [the Norman]1726-the norman studying the shadows on the blind , which was drawn down when [Madame Babette]179-madame babette ’s lamp was lighted . On going in , [he]195-pierre found [Mademoiselle Cannes]188-mademoiselle cannes with [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother , sitting by the table , and helping in the family mending . “ [Pierre]195-pierre was afraid that [the Norman]1726-the norman had some view upon the money which [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother , as [concierge]3427-concierge , collected for [[her]1358-his mother brother]3428-her brother . But the money was all safe next evening , when [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin , [Monsieur Morin Fils]181-morin , came to collect it . [Madame Babette]179-madame babette asked [[her]179-madame babette nephew]1654-her nephew to sit down , and skilfully barred the passage to the inner door , so that [Virginie]168-virginie , had [she]168-virginie been ever so much disposed , could not have retreated . [She]168-virginie sat silently sewing . All at once [the little party]3431-the little party were startled by a very sweet tenor voice , just close to the street window , singing one of the airs out of Beaumarchais ’ operas , which , a few years before , had been popular all over [Paris]22-paris . But after a few moments of silence , and one or two remarks , the talking went on again . [Pierre]195-pierre , however , noticed an increased air of abstraction in [Virginie]168-virginie , who , [I]188-mademoiselle cannes suppose , was recurring to the last time that [she]168-virginie had heard the song , and did not consider , as [[her]168-virginie cousin]932-her cousin had hoped [she]168-virginie would have done , what were the words set to the air , which [he]195-pierre imagined [she]168-virginie would remember , and which would have told [her]168-virginie so much . For , only a few years before , [Adam]189-adam ’s opera of [Richard le Roi]190-richard le roi had made the story of [the minstrel Blondel]3433-the minstrel blondel and [[our]3434-our English Coeur de [Lion]191-our english coeur de lion]191-our english coeur de lion familiar to [all the opera - going part of [the Parisian public]3436-the parisian public]3435-all the opera - going part of the parisian public , and [Clement]195-pierre had bethought [him]195-pierre of establishing a communication with [Virginie]168-virginie by some such means . “[188-mademoiselle cannes] The next night , about the same hour , the same voice was singing outside the window again . [Pierre]195-pierre , who had been irritated by [the proceeding the evening before]1728-the proceeding the evening before , as it had diverted [Virginie]168-virginie ’s attention from [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin , who had been doing [his]3260-his cousin utmost to make [himself]3260-his cousin agreeable , rushed out to the door , just as [the Norman]1726-the norman was ringing the bell to be admitted for the night . [Pierre]195-pierre looked up and down [the street]1731-the street ; [no one else]1732-no one else was to be seen . The next day , [the Norman]1726-the norman mollified [him]195-pierre somewhat by knocking at the door of [the conciergerie]1706-the conciergerie , and begging [Monsieur Pierre]195-pierre ’s acceptance of some knee - buckles , which had taken [the country farmer]1735-the country farmer ’s fancy the day before , as [he]195-pierre had been gazing into [the shops]1736-the shops , but which , being too small for [his]195-pierre purpose , [he]195-pierre took the liberty of offering to [Monsieur Pierre]195-pierre . [Pierre]195-pierre , [a French boy]1737-a french boy , inclined to foppery , was charmed , ravished by the beauty of the present and with [monsieur]1738-monsieur ’s goodness , and [he]195-pierre began to adjust them to [his]195-pierre breeches immediately , as well as [he]195-pierre could , at least , in [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother ’s absence . [The Norman]1726-the norman , whom [Pierre]195-pierre kept carefully on the outside of the threshold , stood by , as if amused at [the boy]3214-the boy ’s eagerness . “ ‘ Take care , ’ said [he]1726-the norman , clearly and distinctly ; ‘ take care , [[my]1726-the norman little friend]3437-my little friend , lest [you]3214-the boy become [a fop]3438-a fop ; and , in that case , some day , years hence , when [your]3214-the boy heart is devoted to [some young lady]3439-some young lady , [she]3439-some young lady may be inclined to say to [you’—here]3440-you’—here [he]1726-the norman raised [his]1726-the norman voice—‘No , thank [you]3214-the boy ; when [I]1726-the norman marry , [I]1726-the norman marry [a man]725-a man , not [a petit - maitre]1488-a petit - maitre ; [I]1726-the norman marry [a man , who , whatever [his]3443-a man , who , whatever his position may be , will add dignity to the human race by his virtues position may be , will add dignity to [the human race]1490-the human race by [his]3443-a man , who , whatever his position may be , will add dignity to the human race by his virtues virtues]3443-a man , who , whatever his position may be , will add dignity to the human race by his virtues . ’ Farther than that in [his]195-pierre quotation [Clement]195-pierre dared not go . [His]195-pierre sentiments ( so much above the apparent occasion ) met with applause from [Pierre]195-pierre , who liked to contemplate [himself]195-pierre in the light of [a lover , even though it should be a rejected one , and who hailed the mention of the words ‘ virtues ’ and ‘ dignity of the human race ’]3445-a lover , even though it should be a rejected one , and who hailed the mention of the words ‘ virtues ’ and ‘ dignity of the human race ’ as belonging to the ca nt of [a good citizen]3446-a good citizen . “[1726-the norman] But [Clement]195-pierre was more anxious to know how [the invisible Lady]1742-the invisible lady took [his]195-pierre speech . There was no sign at the time . But when [he]195-pierre returned at night , [he]195-pierre heard a voice , low singing , behind [Madame Babette]179-madame babette , as [she]179-madame babette handed [him]195-pierre [his]195-pierre candle , the very air [he]195-pierre had sung without effect for two nights past . As if [he]195-pierre had caught it up from [her]179-madame babette murmuring voice , [he]195-pierre sang it loudly and clearly as [he]195-pierre crossed [the court]572-the court . “ ‘ Here is [[our]3447-our opera - singer]3448-our opera - singer ! ’ exclaimed [Madame Babette]179-madame babette . ‘ Why , [the Norman grazier]3449-the norman grazier sings like [Boupre]192-boupre , ’ naming [a favourite singer at [the neighbouring theatre]3451-the neighbouring theatre]3450-a favourite singer at the neighbouring theatre . “[195-pierre] [Pierre]195-pierre was struck by the remark , and quietly resolved to look after [the Norman]193-the norman ; but again , [I]0-i believe , it was more because of [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother ’s deposit of money than with any thought of [Virginie]168-virginie . “ However , the next morning , to the wonder of both [mother]393-mother and [son]3353-son , [Mademoiselle Cannes]188-mademoiselle cannes proposed , with much hesitation , to go out and make some little purchase for [herself]188-mademoiselle cannes . A month or two ago , this was what [Madame Babette]179-madame babette had been never weary of urging . But now [she]179-madame babette was as much surprised as if [she]179-madame babette had expected [Virginie]168-virginie to remain a prisoner in [[her]179-madame babette rooms]3454-her rooms all the rest of [her]179-madame babette life . [I]179-madame babette suppose [she]179-madame babette had hoped that [her]179-madame babette first time of quitting it would be when [she]179-madame babette left it for [[Monsieur Morin]181-morin ’s house]3455-monsieur morin ’s house as [[his]181-morin wife]3072-his wife . “[179-madame babette] A quick look from [Madame Babette]179-madame babette towards [Pierre]195-pierre was all that was needed to encourage [the boy]3214-the boy to follow [her]179-madame babette . [He]195-pierre went out cautiously . [She]179-madame babette was at the end of [the street]1731-the street . [She]179-madame babette looked up and down , as if waiting for [some one]500-some one . [No one]590-no one was there . Back [she]179-madame babette came , so swiftly that [she]179-madame babette nearly caught [Pierre]195-pierre before [he]195-pierre could retreat through [the porte - cochere]1749-the porte - cochere . There [he]195-pierre looked out again . [The neighbourhood]1750-the neighbourhood was low and wild , and strange ; and [some one]500-some one spoke to [Virginie,—nay]194-virginie,—nay , laid [his]500-some one hand upon [her]194-virginie,—nay arm,—whose dress and aspect ( [he]500-some one had emerged out of [a side - street]1752-a side - street ) [Pierre]195-pierre did not know ; but , after a start , and ( [Pierre]195-pierre could fancy ) a little scream , [Virginie]168-virginie recognised [the stranger]1753-the stranger , and [the two]1484-the two turned up [the side street]1755-the side street whence [the man]413-the man had come . [Pierre]195-pierre stole swiftly to the corner of [this street]1757-this street ; [no one]590-no one was there : [they]1484-the two had disappeared up [some of [the alleys]1760-the alleys]1759-some of the alleys . [Pierre]195-pierre returned [home]586-home to excite [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother ’s infinite surprise . But [they]1484-the two had hardly done talking , when [Virginie]168-virginie returned , with a colour and a radiance in [her]168-virginie face , which [they]1484-the two had never seen there since [[her]168-virginie father]1460-her father ’s death . ” CHAPTER VII . “[168-virginie] [I]0-i have told [you]1764-you that [I]0-i heard much of this story from [a friend of [the Intendant of the De Crequys]1766-the intendant of the de crequys , whom [he]1766-the intendant of the de crequys met with in [London]2-london]1765-a friend of the intendant of the de crequys , whom he met with in london . Some years afterwards — the summer before [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord ’s death — [I]0-i was travelling with [him]1766-the intendant of the de crequys in [Devonshire]57-devonshire , and [we]1484-the two went to see [the French prisoners of war]1768-the french prisoners of war on [Dartmoor]58-dartmoor . [We]1484-the two fell into conversation with one of [them]1768-the french prisoners of war , whom [I]0-i found out to be [the very Pierre of whom [I]0-i had heard before , as having been involved in the fatal story of [Clement]195-pierre and [Virginie]195-pierre]195-pierre , and by [him]1766-the intendant of the de crequys [I]0-i was told much of [their]1768-the french prisoners of war last days , and thus [I]0-i learnt how to have some sympathy with [all those who were concerned in those terrible events]1769-all those who were concerned in those terrible events ; yes , even with [the younger Morin [himself]196-morin , on whose behalf [Pierre]196-morin spoke warmly , even after so long a time had elapsed]196-morin . “ For when [the younger Morin]3457-the younger morin called at [the porter ’s lodge]1642-the porter ’s lodge , on the evening of the day when [Virginie]195-pierre had gone out for the first time after so many months ’ confinement to [the conciergerie]1706-the conciergerie , [he]196-morin was struck with the improvement in [her]3460-her appearance . It seems to have hardly been that [he]196-morin thought [her]3460-her beauty greater : for , in addition to the fact that [she]3460-her was not beautiful , [Morin]196-morin had arrived at that point of being enamoured when it does not signify whether [the beloved one]3461-the beloved one is plain or handsome — [she]3460-her has enchanted one pair of eyes , which henceforward see [her]3460-her through [their]1768-the french prisoners of war own medium . But [Morin]196-morin noticed the faint increase of colour and light in [her]3460-her countenance . It was as though [she]3460-her had broken through [her]3460-her thick cloud of hopeless sorrow , and was dawning forth into a happier life . And so , whereas during [her]3460-her grief , [he]196-morin had revered and respected it even to a point of silent sympathy , now that [she]3460-her was gladdened , [his]196-morin heart rose on the wings of strengthened hopes . Even in the dreary monotony of this existence in [his]196-morin Aunt [Babette]179-madame babette ’s conciergerie , [Time]197-time had not failed in [his]196-morin work , and now , perhaps , soon [he]196-morin might humbly strive to help [Time]197-time . The very next day [he]196-morin returned — on some pretence of business — to [the Hotel Duguesclin]1704-the hotel duguesclin , and made [[[his]196-morin aunt]1664-his aunt ’s room]3464-his aunt ’s room , rather than [[his]196-morin aunt]1664-his aunt [herself]1664-his aunt , a present of roses and geraniums tied up in a bouquet with a tricolor ribbon . [Virginie]195-pierre was in [the room]489-the room , sitting at the coarse sewing [she]1664-his aunt liked to do for [Madame Babette]179-madame babette . [He]196-morin saw [her]1664-his aunt eyes brighten at the sight of the flowers : [she]1664-his aunt asked [[his]196-morin aunt]1664-his aunt to let [her]1664-his aunt arrange them ; [he]196-morin saw [her]1664-his aunt untie the ribbon , and with a gesture of dislike , throw it on the ground , and give it a kick with [her]1664-his aunt little foot , and even in this girlish manner of insulting [his]196-morin dearest prejudices , [he]196-morin found something to admire . “[1770-he] As [he]1770-he was coming out , [Pierre]195-pierre stopped [him]1770-he . [The lad]3210-the lad had been trying to arrest [[his]3210-the lad cousin]3260-his cousin ’s attention by futile grimaces and signs played off behind [Virginie]195-pierre ’s back : but [Monsieur Morin]181-morin saw nothing but [Mademoiselle Cannes]188-mademoiselle cannes . However , [Pierre]195-pierre was not to be baffled , and [Monsieur Morin]181-morin found [him]195-pierre in waiting just outside the threshold . With [his]195-pierre finger on [his]195-pierre lips , [Pierre]195-pierre walked on tiptoe by [[his]195-pierre companion]1773-his companion ’s side till [they]1774-they would have been long past sight or hearing of [the conciergerie]1706-the conciergerie , even had [the inhabitants]1776-the inhabitants devoted [themselves]1776-the inhabitants to the purposes of spying or listening . “ ‘ Chut ! ’ said [Pierre]195-pierre , at last . ‘ [She]1773-his companion goes out walking . ’ “[181-morin] ‘ Well ? ’ said [Monsieur Morin]181-morin , half curious , half annoyed at being disturbed in the delicious reverie of the future into which [he]181-morin longed to fall . “ ‘ Well ! It is not well . It is bad . ’ “[181-morin] ‘ Why ? [I]0-i do not ask who [she]1773-his companion is , but [I]0-i have [my]0-i ideas . [She]1773-his companion is [an aristocrat]1713-an aristocrat . Do [the people about here]1778-the people about here begin to suspect [her]1773-his companion ? ’ “ ‘ No , no ! ’ said [Pierre]195-pierre . ‘ But [she]1773-his companion goes out walking . [She]1773-his companion has gone these two mornings . [I]0-i have watched [her]1773-his companion . [She]1773-his companion meets [a man]725-a man — [she]1773-his companion is friends with [him]1780-him , for [she]1773-his companion talks to [him]1780-him as eagerly as [he]1780-him does to [her]1773-his companion — [mamma]3469-mamma can not tell who [he]1780-him is . ’ “[0-i] ‘ Has [[my]0-i aunt]1779-my aunt seen [him]1780-him ? ’ “ ‘ No , not so much as a fly ’s wing of [him]1780-him . [I]0-i [myself]0-i have only seen [his]1780-him back . It strikes [me]0-i like a familiar back , and yet [I]0-i can not think who it is . But [they]3470-they separate with sudden darts , like two birds who have been together to feed [their]3470-they young ones . One moment [they]3470-they are in close talk , [their]3470-they heads together chuchotting ; the next [he]1780-him has turned up [some bye - street]3471-some bye - street , and [Mademoiselle Cannes]188-mademoiselle cannes is close upon [me]0-i — has almost caught [me]0-i . ’ “[0-i] ‘ But [she]1779-my aunt did not see [you]0-i ? ’ inquired [Monsieur Morin]181-morin , in so altered a voice that [Pierre]195-pierre gave [him]181-morin one of [his]195-pierre quick penetrating looks . [He]195-pierre was struck by the way in which [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s features — always coarse and common - place — had become contracted and pinched ; struck , too , by the livid look on [his]181-morin sallow complexion . But as if [Morin]181-morin was conscious of the manner in which [his]181-morin face belied [his]181-morin feelings , [he]181-morin made an effort , and smiled , and patted [Pierre]195-pierre ’s head , and thanked [him]195-pierre for [his]195-pierre intelligence , and gave [him]195-pierre a five - franc piece , and bade [him]195-pierre go on with [his]195-pierre observations of [Mademoiselle Cannes]188-mademoiselle cannes ’ movements , and report all to [him]195-pierre . “ [Pierre]195-pierre returned [home]586-home with a light heart , tossing up [his]195-pierre five - franc piece as [he]195-pierre ran . Just as [he]195-pierre was at the conciergerie door , [a great tall man]3473-a great tall man bustled past [him]195-pierre , and snatched [his]195-pierre money away from [him]195-pierre , looking back with a laugh , which added insult to injury . [Pierre]195-pierre had no redress ; [no one]590-no one had witnessed the impudent theft , and if [they]590-no one had , [no one]590-no one to be seen in [the street]1731-the street was strong enough to give [him]195-pierre redress . Besides , [Pierre]195-pierre had seen enough of the state of [the streets of [Paris]22-paris]3477-the streets of paris at that time to know that [friends]3176-friends , not [enemies]3479-enemies , were required , and [the man]413-the man had a bad air about [him]413-the man . But all these considerations did not keep [Pierre]195-pierre from bursting out into a fit of crying when [he]195-pierre was once more under [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother ’s roof ; and [Virginie]195-pierre , who was alone [there]559-there ( [Madame Babette]179-madame babette having gone out to make [her]179-madame babette daily purchases ) , might have imagined [him]195-pierre pommeled to death by the loudness of [his]195-pierre sobs . “[1782-me] ‘ What is the matter ? ’ asked [she]1782-me . ‘ Speak , [[my]0-i child]3051-my child . What hast [thou]1784-thou done ? ’ “ ‘ [He]195-pierre has robbed [me]1782-me ! [he]195-pierre has robbed [me]1782-me ! ’ was all [Pierre]195-pierre could gulp out . “[1782-me] ‘ Robbed [thee]3051-my child ! and of what , [[my]0-i poor boy]1785-my poor boy ? ’ said [Virginie]195-pierre , stroking [his]1785-my poor boy hair gently . “ ‘ Of [my]195-pierre five - franc piece — of a five - franc piece , ’ said [Pierre]195-pierre , correcting [himself]195-pierre , and leaving out the word [my]195-pierre , half fearful lest [Virginie]195-pierre should inquire how [he]1785-my poor boy became possessed of such a sum , and for what services it had been given [him]1785-my poor boy . But , of course , no such idea came into [her]0-i head , for it would have been impertinent , and [she]0-i was gentle - born . “[195-pierre] ‘ Wait a moment , [[my]0-i lad]1786-my lad , ’ and going to the one small drawer in [the inner apartment]1787-the inner apartment , which held all [her]0-i few possessions , [she]0-i brought back a little ring — a ring just with one ruby in it — which [she]0-i had worn in the days when [she]0-i cared to wear jewels . ‘ Take this , ’ said [she]0-i , ‘ and run with it to [a jeweller]1788-a jeweller ’s . It is but a poor , valueless thing , but it will bring [you]1785-my poor boy in [your]1785-my poor boy five francs , at any rate . Go ! [I]0-i desire [you]1785-my poor boy . ’ “ ‘ But [I]0-i can not , ’ said [the boy]3214-the boy , hesitating ; some dim sense of honour flitting through [his]3214-the boy misty morals . “[0-i] ‘ Yes , [you]1785-my poor boy must ! ’ [she]0-i continued , urging [him]1785-my poor boy with [her]0-i hand to the door . ‘ Run ! if it brings in more than five francs , [you]1785-my poor boy shall return the surplus to [me]0-i . ’ “ Thus tempted by [her]0-i urgency , and , [I]0-i suppose , reasoning with [himself]1785-my poor boy to the effect that [he]1785-my poor boy might as well have the money , and then see whether [he]1785-my poor boy thought it right to act as [a spy]3484-a spy upon [her]0-i or not — the one action did not pledge [him]1785-my poor boy to [the other]1106-the other , nor yet did [she]0-i make any conditions with [her]0-i gift — [Pierre]195-pierre went off with [her]0-i ring ; and , after repaying [himself]195-pierre [his]195-pierre five francs , [he]195-pierre was enabled to bring [Virginie]195-pierre back two more , so well had [he]195-pierre managed [his]195-pierre affairs . But , although the whole transaction did not leave [him]195-pierre bound , in any way , to discover or forward [Virginie]195-pierre ’s wishes , it did leave [him]195-pierre pledged , according to [his]195-pierre code , to act according to [her]0-i advantage , and [he]195-pierre considered [himself]195-pierre the judge of the best course to be pursued to this end . And , moreover , this little kindness attached [him]195-pierre to [her]0-i personally . [He]195-pierre began to think how pleasant it would be to have so kind and generous [a person]3486-a person for [a relation]3487-a relation ; how easily [his]195-pierre troubles might be borne if [he]195-pierre had always such [a ready helper at hand]3488-a ready helper at hand ; how much [he]195-pierre should like to make [her]0-i like [him]195-pierre , and come to [him]195-pierre for the protection of [his]195-pierre masculine power ! First of all [his]195-pierre duties , as [[her]0-i self - appointed squire]3489-her self - appointed squire , came the necessity of finding out who [her]0-i strange new acquaintance was . Thus , [you]3490-you see , [he]195-pierre arrived at the same end , via supposed duty , that [he]195-pierre was previously pledged to via interest . [I]0-i fancy a good number of [us]3491-us , when any line of action will promote [our]3491-us own interest , can make [ourselves]3491-us believe that reasons exist which compel [us]3491-us to it as a duty . “[0-i] In the course of a very few days , [Pierre]195-pierre had so circumvented [Virginie]195-pierre as to have discovered that [[her]1789-her new friend]1790-her new friend was no other than [the Norman farmer in a different dress]1791-the norman farmer in a different dress . This was a great piece of knowledge to impart to [Morin]181-morin . But [Pierre]195-pierre was not prepared for the immediate physical effect it had on [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin . [Morin]181-morin sat suddenly down on one of the seats in [the Boulevards]1793-the boulevards — it was there [Pierre]195-pierre had met with [him]181-morin accidentally — when [he]181-morin heard who it was that [Virginie]195-pierre met . [I]0-i do not suppose [the man]413-the man had the faintest idea of any relationship or even previous acquaintanceship between [Clement]195-pierre and [Virginie]195-pierre . If [he]413-the man thought of anything beyond the mere fact presented to [him]413-the man , that [[his]413-the man idol]1795-his idol was in communication with [another , younger , handsomer man than [himself]413-the man]1796-another , younger , handsomer man than himself , it must have been that [the Norman farmer]1721-the norman farmer had seen [her]1795-his idol at [the conciergerie]1706-the conciergerie , and had been attracted by [her]1795-his idol , and , as was but natural , had tried to make [her]1795-his idol acquaintance , and had succeeded . But , from what [Pierre]195-pierre told [me]0-i , [I]0-i should not think that even this much thought passed through [Morin]181-morin ’s mind . [He]181-morin seems to have been [a man of rare and concentrated attachments ; violent , though restrained and undemonstrative passions]1799-a man of rare and concentrated attachments ; violent , though restrained and undemonstrative passions ; and , above all , a capability of jealousy , of which [his]181-morin dark oriental complexion must have been a type . [I]0-i could fancy that if [he]181-morin had married [Virginie]195-pierre , [he]181-morin would have coined [his]181-morin life - blood for luxuries to make [her]1795-his idol happy ; would have watched over and petted [her]1795-his idol , at every sacrifice to [himself]181-morin , as long as [she]1795-his idol would have been content to live with [him]181-morin alone . But , as [Pierre]195-pierre expressed it to [me]0-i : ‘ When [I]0-i saw what [[my]0-i cousin]1457-my cousin was , when [I]0-i learned [his]181-morin nature too late , [I]0-i perceived that [he]181-morin would have strangled a bird if [she]1795-his idol whom [he]181-morin loved was attracted by it from [him]181-morin . ’ “ When [Pierre]195-pierre had told [Morin]181-morin of [his]195-pierre discovery , [Morin]181-morin sat down , as [I]1801-his said , quite suddenly , as if [he]181-morin had been shot . [He]195-pierre found out that the first meeting between [the Norman]193-the norman and [Virginie]195-pierre was no accidental , isolated circumstance . [Pierre]195-pierre was torturing [him]181-morin with [his]195-pierre accounts of daily rendezvous : if but for a moment , [they]3492-they were seeing [each other]780-each other every day , sometimes twice a day . And [Virginie]195-pierre could speak to [this man]1131-this man , though to [himself]181-morin [she]1795-his idol was coy and reserved as hardly to utter a sentence . [Pierre]195-pierre caught these broken words while [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s complexion grew more and more livid , and then purple , as if some great effect were produced on [his]195-pierre circulation by the news [he]195-pierre had just heard . [Pierre]195-pierre was so startled by [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s wandering , senseless eyes , and otherwise disordered looks , that [he]195-pierre rushed into [a neighbouring cabaret]3497-a neighbouring cabaret for a glass of absinthe , which [he]195-pierre paid for , as [he]195-pierre recollected afterwards , with a portion of [Virginie]195-pierre ’s five francs . By - and - by [Morin]181-morin recovered [his]181-morin natural appearance ; but [he]181-morin was gloomy and silent ; and all that [Pierre]195-pierre could get out of [him]181-morin was , that [the Norman farmer]1721-the norman farmer should not sleep another night at [the Hotel Duguesclin]1704-the hotel duguesclin , giving [him]1801-his such opportunities of passing and repassing by the conciergerie door . [He]1801-his was too much absorbed in [his]1801-his own thoughts to repay [Pierre]195-pierre the half franc [he]1801-his had spent on the absinthe , which [Pierre]195-pierre perceived , and seems to have noted down in the ledger of [his]195-pierre mind as on [Virginie]195-pierre ’s balance of favour . “[1801-his] Altogether , [he]1801-his was much disappointed at [[his]1801-his cousin]3260-his cousin ’s mode of receiving intelligence , which [the lad]3210-the lad thought worth another five - franc piece at least ; or , if not paid for in money , to be paid for in open - mouthed confidence and expression of feeling , that [he]1801-his was , for a time , so far [a partisan of [Virginie’s]198-virginie’s]1804-a partisan of virginie’s — unconscious [Virginie]195-pierre — against [[his]1801-his cousin]3260-his cousin , as to feel regret when [the Norman]1726-the norman returned no more to [his]1726-the norman night ’s lodging , and when [Virginie]195-pierre ’s eager watch at the crevice of the closely - drawn blind ended only with a sigh of disappointment . If it had not been for [[his]1801-his mother]1358-his mother ’s presence at the time , [Pierre]195-pierre thought [he]195-pierre should have told [her]1358-his mother all . But how far was [[his]1801-his mother]1358-his mother in [[his]1801-his cousin]3260-his cousin ’s confidence as regarded the dismissal of [the Norman]193-the norman ? “ In a few days , however , [Pierre]195-pierre felt almost sure that [they]3500-they had established some new means of communication . [Virginie]195-pierre went out for a short time every day ; but though [Pierre]195-pierre followed [her]1358-his mother as closely as [he]195-pierre could without exciting [her]1358-his mother observation , [he]195-pierre was unable to discover what kind of intercourse [she]1358-his mother held with [the Norman]193-the norman . [She]1358-his mother went , in general , the same short round among [the little shops in [the neighbourhood]1750-the neighbourhood]3501-the little shops in the neighbourhood ; not entering any , but stopping at two or three . [Pierre]195-pierre afterwards remembered that [she]1358-his mother had invariably paused at the nosegays displayed in a certain window , and studied them long : but , then , [she]1358-his mother stopped and looked at caps , hats , fashions , confectionery ( all of the humble kind common in [that quarter]3503-that quarter ) , so how should [he]195-pierre have known that any particular attraction existed among the flowers ? [Morin]181-morin came more regularly than ever to [[his]181-morin aunt]1664-his aunt ’s ; but [Virginie]195-pierre was apparently unconscious that [she]1358-his mother was the attraction . [She]1358-his mother looked healthier and more hopeful than [she]1358-his mother had done for months , and [her]1358-his mother manners to [all]3505-all were gentler and not so reserved . Almost as if [she]1358-his mother wished to manifest [her]1358-his mother gratitude to [Madame Babette]179-madame babette for [her]1358-his mother long continuance of kindness , the necessity for which was nearly ended , [Virginie]195-pierre showed an unusual alacrity in rendering [the old woman]1466-the old woman any little service in [her]1358-his mother power , and evidently tried to respond to [Monsieur Morin]181-morin ’s civilities , [he]181-morin being [[Madame Babette]179-madame babette ’s nephew]3507-madame babette ’s nephew , with a soft graciousness which must have made one of [her]1358-his mother principal charms ; for all who knew [her]1358-his mother speak of the fascination of [her]1358-his mother manners , so winning and attentive to [others]3078-others , while yet [her]1358-his mother opinions , and often [her]1358-his mother actions , were of so decided a character . For , as [I]1810-he have said , [her]1358-his mother beauty was by no means great ; yet [every man who came near [her]1358-his mother]3509-every man who came near her seems to have fallen into the sphere of [her]1358-his mother influence . [Monsieur Morin]181-morin was deeper than ever in love with [her]1358-his mother during these last few days : [he]181-morin was worked up into a state capable of any sacrifice , either of [himself]181-morin or [others]3078-others , so that [he]181-morin might obtain [her]1358-his mother at last . [He]181-morin sat ‘ devouring [her]1358-his mother with [his]181-morin eyes ’ ( to use [Pierre]195-pierre ’s expression ) whenever [she]1358-his mother could not see [him]181-morin ; but , if [she]1358-his mother looked towards [him]181-morin , [he]181-morin looked to the ground — anywhere — away from [her]1358-his mother and almost stammered in [his]181-morin replies if [she]1358-his mother addressed any question to [him]181-morin . “[1810-he] [He]1810-he had been , [I]0-i should think , ashamed of [his]1810-he extreme agitation on [the Boulevards]1793-the boulevards , for [Pierre]195-pierre thought that [he]195-pierre absolutely shunned [him]1810-he for these few succeeding days . [He]195-pierre must have believed that [he]195-pierre had driven [the Norman]1726-the norman ( [[my]0-i poor [Clement]195-pierre]1813-my poor clement ! ) off [the field]821-the field , by banishing [him]1810-he from [[his]1810-he inn]1815-his inn ; and thought that the intercourse between [him]1810-he and [Virginie]195-pierre , which [he]1810-he had thus interrupted , was of so slight and transient a character as to be quenched by a little difficulty . “ But [he]1810-he appears to have felt that [he]1810-he had made but little way , and [he]1810-he awkwardly turned to [Pierre]195-pierre for help — not yet confessing [his]1810-he love , though ; [he]1810-he only tried to make [friends]3176-friends again with [the lad]3210-the lad after [their]3513-their silent estrangement . And [Pierre]195-pierre for some time did not choose to perceive [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s advances . [He]195-pierre would reply to all the roundabout questions [Morin]181-morin put to [him]195-pierre respecting household conversations when [he]195-pierre was not present , or household occupations and tone of thought , without mentioning [Virginie]195-pierre ’s name any more than [[his]195-pierre questioner]3515-his questioner did . [The lad]3210-the lad would seem to suppose , that [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s strong interest in [their]3513-their domestic ways of going on was all on account of [Madame Babette]179-madame babette . At last [he]3210-the lad worked [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin up to the point of making [him]3260-his cousin [a confidant]3519-a confidant : and then [the boy]3214-the boy was half frightened at the torrent of vehement words [he]3210-the lad had unloosed . The lava came down with a greater rush for having been pent up so long . [Morin]181-morin cried out [his]181-morin words in a hoarse , passionate voice , clenched [his]181-morin teeth , [his]181-morin fingers , and seemed almost convulsed , as [he]181-morin spoke out [his]181-morin terrible love for [Virginie]195-pierre , which would lead [him]181-morin to kill [her]3260-his cousin sooner than see [her]3260-his cousin another ’s ; and if [another]3521-another stepped in between [him]181-morin and [her!—and]3522-her!—and then [he]181-morin smiled a fierce , triumphant smile , but did not say any more . “[195-pierre] [Pierre]195-pierre was , as [I]0-i said , half frightened ; but also half - admiring . This was really love — a ‘ grande passion,’—a really fine dramatic thing,—like the plays [they]1816-they acted at [the little theatre yonder]1817-the little theatre yonder . [He]195-pierre had a dozen times the sympathy with [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin now that [he]195-pierre had had before , and readily swore by [the infernal gods]1819-the infernal gods , for [they]1816-they were far too enlightened to believe in [one God]1820-one god , or Christianity , or anything of the kind,—that [he]195-pierre would devote [himself]195-pierre , body and soul , to forwarding [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s views . Then [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin took [him]195-pierre to [a shop]1823-a shop , and bought [him]195-pierre a smart second - hand watch , on which [they]1816-they scratched the word Fidelite , and thus was the compact sealed . [Pierre]195-pierre settled in [his]195-pierre own mind , that if [he]195-pierre were [a woman]3339-a woman , [he]195-pierre should like to be beloved as [Virginie]195-pierre was , by [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin , and that it would be an extremely good thing for [her]3260-his cousin to be [the wife of [so rich a citizen]1827-so rich a citizen as [Morin Fils,—and]199-morin]1826-the wife of so rich a citizen as morin fils,—and for [Pierre]195-pierre [himself]195-pierre , too , for doubtless [their]1816-they gratitude would lead [them]1816-they to give [him]195-pierre rings and watches ad infinitum . “ A day or two afterwards , [Virginie]195-pierre was taken ill . [Madame Babette]179-madame babette said it was because [she]3260-his cousin had persevered in going out in all weathers , after confining [herself]3260-his cousin to [two warm rooms]3523-two warm rooms for so long ; and very probably this was really the cause , for , from [Pierre]195-pierre ’s account , [she]3260-his cousin must have been suffering from a feverish cold , aggravated , no doubt , by [her]3260-his cousin impatience at [Madame Babette]179-madame babette ’s familiar prohibitions of any more walks until [she]3260-his cousin was better . Every day , in spite of [her]3260-his cousin trembling , aching limbs , [she]3260-his cousin would fain have arranged [her]3260-his cousin dress for [her]3260-his cousin walk at the usual time ; but [Madame Babette]179-madame babette was fully prepared to put physical obstacles in [her]3260-his cousin way , if [she]3260-his cousin was not obedient in remaining tranquil on the little sofa by the side of the fire . The third day , [she]3260-his cousin called [Pierre]195-pierre to [her]3260-his cousin , when [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother was not attending ( having , in fact , locked up [Mademoiselle Cannes]188-mademoiselle cannes ’ out - of - door things ) . “[195-pierre] ‘ See , [[my]0-i child]3051-my child , ’ said [Virginie]195-pierre . ‘ [Thou]1829-thou must do [me]0-i a great favour . Go to [[the gardener]1008-the gardener ’s shop in [the Rue des Bons - Enfans]1832-the rue des bons - enfans]1831-the gardener ’s shop in the rue des bons - enfans , and look at the nosegays in the window . [I]0-i long for pinks ; they are [my]0-i favourite flower . Here are two francs . If [thou]1829-thou seest a nosegay of pinks displayed in the window , if it be ever so faded — nay , if [thou]1829-thou seest two or three nosegays of pinks , remember , buy them all , and bring them to [me]0-i , [I]0-i have so great a desire for the smell . ’ [She]0-i fell back weak and exhausted . [Pierre]195-pierre hurried out . Now was the time ; here was the clue to the long inspection of the nosegay in [this very shop]1833-this very shop . “ Sure enough , there was a drooping nosegay of pinks in the window . [Pierre]195-pierre went in , and , with all [his]195-pierre impatience , [he]195-pierre made as good a bargain as [he]195-pierre could , urging that the flowers were faded , and good for nothing . At last [he]195-pierre purchased them at a very moderate price . And now [you]3525-you will learn the bad consequences of teaching [the lower orders]1572-the lower orders anything beyond what is immediately necessary to enable [them]1572-the lower orders to earn [their]1572-the lower orders daily bread ! [The silly Count de Crequy,—he who had been sent to [his]3527-the silly count de crequy,—he who had been sent to his bloody rest bloody rest]3527-the silly count de crequy,—he who had been sent to his bloody rest , by [the very canaille of whom [he]3527-the silly count de crequy,—he who had been sent to his bloody rest thought so much,—he who had made [Virginie]195-pierre ( indirectly , it is true ) reject such a man as [[her]0-i cousin]932-her cousin [Clement]195-pierre]3528-the very canaille of whom he thought so much,—he who had made virginie ( indirectly , it is true ) reject such a man as her cousin clement , by inflating [her]0-i mind with [his]3527-the silly count de crequy,—he who had been sent to his bloody rest bubbles of theories,—this [Count de Crequy]174-the count de crequy had long ago taken a fancy to [Pierre]195-pierre , as [he]174-the count de crequy saw [the bright sharp child]3530-the bright sharp child playing about [[his]174-the count de crequy court]3531-his court — [Monsieur de Crequy]167-monsieur de crequy had even begun to educate [the boy]3214-the boy [himself]174-the count de crequy to try work out certain opinions of [his]174-the count de crequy into practice,—but the drudgery of the affair wearied [him]174-the count de crequy , and , beside , [Babette]179-madame babette had left [his]174-the count de crequy employment . Still [the Count]3273-the count took a kind of interest in [[his]3273-the count former pupil]3534-his former pupil ; and made some sort of arrangement by which [Pierre]195-pierre was to be taught reading and writing , and accounts , and Heaven knows what besides,—Latin , [I]195-pierre dare say . So [Pierre]195-pierre , instead of being [an innocent messenger]3535-an innocent messenger , as [he]195-pierre ought to have been—(as [[Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s little lad [Gregson]150-harry gregson]3536-mr. horner ’s little lad gregson ought to have been this morning)—could read writing as well as either [you]3537-you or [I.]195-pierre So what does [he]195-pierre do , on obtaining the nosegay , but examine it well . The stalks of the flowers were tied up with slips of matting in wet moss . [Pierre]195-pierre undid the strings , unwrapped the moss , and out fell a piece of wet paper , with the writing all blurred with moisture . It was but a torn piece of writing - paper , apparently , but [Pierre]195-pierre ’s wicked mischievous eyes read what was written on it,—written so as to look like a fragment,—‘Ready , every and any night at nine . All is prepared . Have no fright . [Trust one who , whatever hopes [he]195-pierre might once have had , is content now to serve [you]3537-you as [a faithful cousin]3539-a faithful cousin]3538-trust one who , whatever hopes he might once have had , is content now to serve you as a faithful cousin ; ’ and [a place]3540-a place was named , which [I]195-pierre forget , but which [Pierre]195-pierre did not , as it was evidently [the rendezvous]3541-the rendezvous . After [the lad]3210-the lad had studied every word , till [he]3210-the lad could say it off by heart , [he]3210-the lad placed the paper where [he]3210-the lad had found it , enveloped it in moss , and tied the whole up again carefully . [Virginie]195-pierre ’s face coloured scarlet as [she]3543-she received it . [She]3543-she kept smelling at it , and trembling : but [she]3543-she did not untie it , although [Pierre]195-pierre suggested how much fresher it would be if the stalks were immediately put into water . But once , after [his]3210-the lad back had been turned for a minute , [he]3210-the lad saw it untied when [he]3210-the lad looked round again , and [Virginie]195-pierre was blushing , and hiding something in [her]3543-she bosom . “[195-pierre] [Pierre]195-pierre was now all impatience to set off and find [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin , But [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother seemed to want [him]195-pierre for small domestic purposes even more than usual ; and [he]195-pierre had chafed over a multitude of errands connected with [the Hotel]1295-the hotel before [he]195-pierre could set off and search for [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin at [[his]195-pierre usual haunts]1838-his usual haunts . At last [the two]1484-the two met and [Pierre]195-pierre related all the events of the morning to [Morin]199-morin . [He]195-pierre said the note off word by word . ( [That lad]1284-that lad this morning had something of the magpie look of [Pierre]195-pierre — it made [me]0-i shudder to see [him]1284-that lad , and hear [him]1284-that lad repeat the note by heart . ) Then [Morin]199-morin asked [him]195-pierre to tell [him]195-pierre all over again . [Pierre]195-pierre was struck by [Morin]199-morin ’s heavy sighs as [he]195-pierre repeated the story . When [he]195-pierre came the second time to the note , [Morin]199-morin tried to write the words down ; but either [he]199-morin was not [a good , ready scholar]1841-a good , ready scholar , or [his]199-morin fingers trembled too much . [Pierre]195-pierre hardly remembered , but , at any rate , [the lad]3210-the lad had to do it , with [his]3210-the lad wicked reading and writing . When this was done , [Morin]199-morin sat heavily silent . [Pierre]195-pierre would have preferred the expected outburst , for this impenetrable gloom perplexed and baffled [him]195-pierre . [He]195-pierre had even to speak to [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin to rouse [him]195-pierre ; and when [he]195-pierre replied , what [he]195-pierre said had so little apparent connection with the subject which [Pierre]195-pierre had expected to find uppermost in [his]195-pierre mind , that [he]195-pierre was half afraid that [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin had lost [his]195-pierre wits . “ ‘ [My]195-pierre Aunt [Babette]179-madame babette is out of coffee . ’ “[195-pierre] ‘ [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do not know , ’ said [Pierre]195-pierre . “ ‘ Yes , [she]179-madame babette is . [I]195-pierre heard [her]179-madame babette say so . Tell [her]179-madame babette that [a friend of mine]1249-a friend of mine has just opened [a shop in [the Rue Saint Antoine]60-the rue saint antoine]3545-a shop in the rue saint antoine , and that if [she]179-madame babette will join [me]195-pierre [there]559-there in an hour , [I]195-pierre will supply [her]179-madame babette with a good stock of coffee , just to give [[my]195-pierre friend]3547-my friend encouragement . [His]3547-my friend name is [Antoine Meyer]200-antoine meyer , Number One hundred and Fifty at the sign of [the Cap of Liberty]3548-the cap of liberty . ’ “[195-pierre] ‘ [I]0-i could go with [you]195-pierre now . [I]0-i can carry a few pounds of coffee better than [[my]0-i mother]312-my mother , ’ said [Pierre]195-pierre , all in good faith . [He]195-pierre told [me]0-i [he]195-pierre should never forget the look on [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s face , as [he]195-pierre turned round , and bade [him]195-pierre begone , and give [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother the message without another word . It had evidently sent [him]195-pierre [home]586-home promptly to obey [[his]195-pierre cousins]1849-his cousins command . [Morin]199-morin ’s message perplexed [Madame Babette]179-madame babette . “ ‘ How could [he]195-pierre know [I]199-morin was out of coffee ? ’ said [she]179-madame babette . ‘ [I]199-morin am ; but [I]199-morin only used the last up this morning . How could [Victor]201-victor know about it ? ’ “[199-morin] ‘ [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i ca n’t tell , ’ said [Pierre]195-pierre , who by this time had recovered [his]195-pierre usual self - possession . ‘ All [I]0-i know is , that [monsieur]1738-monsieur is in a pretty temper , and that if [you]195-pierre are not sharp to [your]195-pierre time at this [Antoine Meyer]200-antoine meyer ’s [you]195-pierre are likely to come in for some of [his]200-antoine meyer black looks . ’ “ ‘ Well , it is very kind of [him]200-antoine meyer to offer to give [me]195-pierre some coffee , to be sure ! But how could [he]200-antoine meyer know [I]195-pierre was out ? ’ “[195-pierre] [Pierre]195-pierre hurried [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother off impatiently , for [he]195-pierre was certain that the offer of the coffee was only a blind to some hidden purpose on [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s part ; and [he]195-pierre made no doubt that when [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother had been informed of what [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s real intention was , [he]195-pierre , [Pierre]195-pierre , could extract it from [her]1358-his mother by coaxing or bullying . But [he]195-pierre was mistaken . [Madame Babette]179-madame babette returned [home]586-home , grave , depressed , silent , and loaded with the best coffee . Some time afterwards [he]195-pierre learnt why [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin had sought for this interview . It was to extract from [her]3260-his cousin , by promises and threats , the real name of [Mam’selle Cannes]186-mam’selle cannes , which would give [him]195-pierre a clue to the true appellation of [The Faithful Cousin]202-the faithful cousin . [He]195-pierre concealed the second purpose from [[his]195-pierre aunt]1664-his aunt , who had been quite unaware of [his]195-pierre jealousy of [the Norman farmer]1721-the norman farmer , or of [his]195-pierre identification of [him]195-pierre with any relation of [Virginie]195-pierre ’s . But [Madame Babette]179-madame babette instinctively shrank from giving [him]195-pierre any information : [she]179-madame babette must have felt that , in the lowering mood in which [she]179-madame babette found [him]195-pierre , [his]195-pierre desire for greater knowledge of [Virginie]195-pierre ’s antecedents boded [her]179-madame babette no good . And yet [he]195-pierre made [[his]195-pierre aunt]1664-his aunt [[his]195-pierre confidante]1860-his confidante — told [her]1664-his aunt what [she]1664-his aunt had only suspected before — that [he]195-pierre was deeply enamoured of [Mam’selle Cannes]186-mam’selle cannes , and would gladly marry [her]1664-his aunt . [He]195-pierre spoke to [Madame Babette]179-madame babette of [[his]195-pierre father]3292-his father ’s hoarded riches ; and of the share which [he]195-pierre , as [partner]1862-partner , had in [them]1863-them at the present time ; and of the prospect of the succession to the whole , which [he]195-pierre had , as [only child]1864-only child . [He]195-pierre told [[his]195-pierre aunt]1664-his aunt of the provision for [her]179-madame babette ( [Madame Babette]179-madame babette ’s ) life , which [he]195-pierre would make on the day when [he]195-pierre married [Mam’selle Cannes]186-mam’selle cannes . And yet — and yet — [Babette]179-madame babette saw that in [his]195-pierre eye and look which made [her]1664-his aunt more and more reluctant to confide in [him]195-pierre . By - and - by [he]195-pierre tried threats . [She]1664-his aunt should leave [the conciergerie]1706-the conciergerie , and find employment where [she]1664-his aunt liked . Still silence . Then [he]195-pierre grew angry , and swore that [he]195-pierre would inform against [her]1664-his aunt at [the bureau of [the Directory]1868-the directory]1867-the bureau of the directory , for harbouring [an aristocrat]1713-an aristocrat ; [an aristocrat [he]195-pierre knew [Mademoiselle]188-mademoiselle cannes]1870-an aristocrat he knew mademoiselle was , whatever [her]188-mademoiselle cannes real name might be . [[His]195-pierre aunt]1664-his aunt should have a domiciliary visit , and see how [she]1664-his aunt liked that . [The officers of [the Government]1873-the government]1872-the officers of the government were [the people for finding out secrets]1874-the people for finding out secrets . In vain [she]1664-his aunt reminded [him]195-pierre that , by so doing , [he]195-pierre would expose to imminent danger [the lady whom [he]195-pierre had professed to love]1875-the lady whom he had professed to love . [He]195-pierre told [her]1664-his aunt , with a sullen relapse into silence after [his]195-pierre vehement outpouring of passion , never to trouble [herself]1664-his aunt about that . At last [he]195-pierre wearied out [the old woman]1466-the old woman , and , frightened alike of [herself]1664-his aunt and of [him]195-pierre , [she]1664-his aunt told [him]195-pierre all,—that Mam’selle Cannes was [Mademoiselle Virginie de Crequy]168-virginie , [daughter of [the Count of that name]1878-the count of that name]1877-daughter of the count of that name . Who was [the Count]3273-the count ? [Younger brother of [the Marquis]3280-the marquis]1880-younger brother of the marquis . Where was [the Marquis]3280-the marquis ? Dead long ago , leaving [a widow]340-a widow and [child]3053-child . [A son]1517-a son ? ( eagerly ) . Yes , [a son]1517-a son . Where was [he]1517-a son ? [Parbleu]203-parbleu ! how should [she]1664-his aunt know?—for [her]1664-his aunt courage returned a little as the talk went away from [the only person of [the De Crequy family]1558-the de crequy family]1887-the only person of the de crequy family that [she]1664-his aunt cared about . But , by dint of some small glasses out of a bottle of [Antoine Meyer]200-antoine meyer ’s , [she]1664-his aunt told [him]1517-a son more about [the De Crequys]161-the de crequys than [she]1664-his aunt liked afterwards to remember . For the exhilaration of the brandy lasted but a very short time , and [she]1664-his aunt came [home]586-home , as [I]0-i have said , depressed , with a presentiment of coming evil . [She]1664-his aunt would not answer [Pierre]195-pierre , but cuffed [him]1517-a son about in a manner to which [the spoilt boy]1890-the spoilt boy was quite unaccustomed .
