[[His]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s short , angry words , and sudden withdrawal of confidence,—his mother ’s unwonted crossness and fault - finding , all made [Virginie]195-pierre ’s kind , gentle treatment , more than ever charming to [the lad]3210-the lad . [He]1517-a son half resolved to tell [her]1664-his aunt how [he]1517-a son had been acting as a spy upon [her]1664-his aunt actions , and at whose desire [he]1517-a son had done it . But [he]1517-a son was afraid of [Morin]199-morin , and of the vengeance which [he]1517-a son was sure would fall upon [him]1517-a son for any breach of confidence . Towards half - past eight that evening — [Pierre]195-pierre , watching , saw [Virginie]195-pierre arrange several little things — [she]1664-his aunt was in [the inner room]3424-the inner room , but [he]1517-a son sat where [he]1517-a son could see [her]1664-his aunt through the glazed partition . [[His]1517-a son mother]1358-his mother sat — apparently sleeping — in the great easy - chair ; [Virginie]195-pierre moved about softly , for fear of disturbing [her]1358-his mother . [She]1664-his aunt made up one or two little parcels of the few things [she]1664-his aunt could call [her]1664-his aunt own : one packet [she]1664-his aunt concealed about [herself]1664-his aunt — the others [she]1664-his aunt directed , and left on the shelf . ‘ [She]1664-his aunt is going , ’ thought [Pierre]195-pierre , and ( as [he]195-pierre said in giving [me]0-i the account ) [his]195-pierre heart gave a spring , to think that [he]195-pierre should never see [her]1664-his aunt again . If either [[his]1517-a son mother]1358-his mother or [[his]1517-a son cousin]3260-his cousin had been more kind to [him]195-pierre , [he]195-pierre might have endeavoured to intercept [her]1664-his aunt ; but as it was , [he]195-pierre held [his]195-pierre breath , and when [she]1664-his aunt came out [he]195-pierre pretended to read , scarcely knowing whether [he]195-pierre wished [her]1664-his aunt to succeed in the purpose which [he]195-pierre was almost sure [she]1664-his aunt entertained , or not . [She]1664-his aunt stopped by [him]195-pierre , and passed [her]1664-his aunt hand over [his]195-pierre hair . [He]195-pierre told [me]0-i that [his]195-pierre eyes filled with tears at this caress . Then [she]1664-his aunt stood for a moment looking at [the sleeping Madame Babette]179-madame babette , and stooped down and softly kissed [her]179-madame babette on the forehead . [Pierre]195-pierre dreaded lest [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother should awake ( for by this time [the wayward , vacillating boy]1898-the wayward , vacillating boy must have been quite on [Virginie]195-pierre ’s side ) , but the brandy [she]1358-his mother had drunk made [her]1358-his mother slumber heavily . [Virginie]195-pierre went . [Pierre]195-pierre ’s heart beat fast . [He]195-pierre was sure [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin would try to intercept [her]1358-his mother ; but how , [he]195-pierre could not imagine . [He]195-pierre longed to run out and see the catastrophe,—but [he]195-pierre had let the moment slip ; [he]195-pierre was also afraid of reawakening [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother to [her]1358-his mother unusual state of anger and violence . ” CHAPTER VIII . “[195-pierre] [Pierre]195-pierre went on pretending to read , but in reality listening with acute tension of ear to every little sound . [His]195-pierre perceptions became so sensitive in this respect that [he]195-pierre was incapable of measuring time , every moment had seemed so full of noises , from the beating of [his]195-pierre heart up to the roll of the heavy carts in the distance . [He]195-pierre wondered whether [Virginie]195-pierre would have reached [the place of rendezvous]1901-the place of rendezvous , and yet [he]195-pierre was unable to compute the passage of minutes . [[His]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother slept soundly : that was well . By this time [Virginie]195-pierre must have met [the ‘ faithful cousin]1903-the ‘ faithful cousin : ’ if , indeed , [Morin]199-morin had not made [his]199-morin appearance . “ At length , [he]195-pierre felt as if [he]195-pierre could no longer sit still , awaiting the issue , but must run out and see what course events had taken . In vain [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother , half - rousing [herself]1358-his mother , called after [him]195-pierre to ask whither [he]195-pierre was going : [he]195-pierre was already out of hearing before [she]1358-his mother had ended [her]1358-his mother sentence , and [he]195-pierre ran on until , stopped by the sight of [Mademoiselle Cannes]188-mademoiselle cannes walking along at so swift a pace that it was almost a run ; while at [her]1358-his mother side , resolutely keeping by [her]1358-his mother , [Morin]199-morin was striding abreast . [Pierre]195-pierre had just turned the corner of [the street]1731-the street , when [he]195-pierre came upon [them]3551-them . [Virginie]195-pierre would have passed [him]195-pierre without recognizing [him]195-pierre , [she]1358-his mother was in such passionate agitation , but for [Morin]199-morin ’s gesture , by which [he]199-morin would fain have kept [Pierre]195-pierre from interrupting [them]3551-them . Then , when [Virginie]195-pierre saw [the lad]3210-the lad , [she]1358-his mother caught at [his]195-pierre arm , and thanked [God]133-god , as if in [that boy of twelve or fourteen]3553-that boy of twelve or fourteen [she]1358-his mother held [a protector]3554-a protector . [Pierre]195-pierre felt [her]1358-his mother tremble from head to foot , and was afraid lest [she]1358-his mother would fall , there where [she]1358-his mother stood , in [the hard rough street]3555-the hard rough street . “[199-morin] ‘ Begone , [Pierre]195-pierre ! ’ said [Morin]199-morin . “ ‘ [I]199-morin can not , ’ replied [Pierre]195-pierre , who indeed was held firmly by [Virginie]195-pierre . ‘ Besides , [I]199-morin wo n’t , ’ [he]199-morin added . ‘ Who has been frightening mademoiselle in this way ? ’ asked [he]199-morin , very much inclined to brave [[his]199-morin cousin]3260-his cousin at all hazards . “[199-morin] ‘ [Mademoiselle]188-mademoiselle cannes is not accustomed to walk in [the streets]1636-the streets alone , ’ said [Morin]199-morin , sulkily . ‘ [She]188-mademoiselle cannes came upon [a crowd attracted by the arrest of [an aristocrat]1713-an aristocrat]1905-a crowd attracted by the arrest of an aristocrat , and [their]1905-a crowd attracted by the arrest of an aristocrat cries alarmed [her]188-mademoiselle cannes . [I]0-i offered to take charge of [[her]188-mademoiselle cannes home]1907-her home . [Mademoiselle]188-mademoiselle cannes should not walk in [these streets]1908-these streets alone . [We]1909-we are not like [the cold - blooded people of the [Faubourg Saint Germain]61-faubourg saint germain]1910-the cold - blooded people of the faubourg saint germain . ’ “ [Virginie]195-pierre did not speak . [Pierre]195-pierre doubted if [she]188-mademoiselle cannes heard a word of what [they]1909-we were saying . [She]188-mademoiselle cannes leant upon [him]199-morin more and more heavily . “[199-morin] ‘ Will [mademoiselle]188-mademoiselle cannes condescend to take [my]0-i arm ? ’ said [Morin]199-morin , with sulky , and yet humble , uncouthness . [I]0-i dare say [he]199-morin would have given worlds if [he]199-morin might have had that little hand within [his]199-morin arm ; but , though [she]188-mademoiselle cannes still kept silence , [she]188-mademoiselle cannes shuddered up away from [him]199-morin , as [you]1911-you shrink from touching a toad . [He]199-morin had said something to [her]188-mademoiselle cannes during that walk , [you]1911-you may be sure , which had made [her]188-mademoiselle cannes loathe [him]199-morin . [He]199-morin marked and understood the gesture . [He]199-morin held [himself]199-morin aloof while [Pierre]195-pierre gave [her]188-mademoiselle cannes all the assistance [he]195-pierre could in [their]1912-their slow progress homewards . But [Morin]199-morin accompanied [her]188-mademoiselle cannes all the same . [He]199-morin had played too desperate a game to be baulked now . [He]199-morin had given information against [the ci - devant [Marquis de Crequy]204-marquis de crequy]1913-the ci - devant marquis de crequy , as [a returned emigre]1914-a returned emigre , to be met with at such a time , in such a place . [Morin]199-morin had hoped that all sign of the arrest would have been cleared away before [Virginie]195-pierre reached the spot — so swiftly were terrible deeds done in those days . But [Clement]195-pierre defended [himself]195-pierre desperately : [Virginie]195-pierre was punctual to a second ; and , though [the wounded man]1915-the wounded man was borne off to [the Abbaye]1916-the abbaye , amid [a crowd of the unsympathising jeerers who mingled with [the armed officials of [the Directory]1868-the directory]1918-the armed officials of the directory]1917-a crowd of the unsympathising jeerers who mingled with the armed officials of the directory , [Morin]199-morin feared lest [Virginie]195-pierre had recognized [him]1915-the wounded man ; and [he]199-morin would have preferred that [she]188-mademoiselle cannes should have thought that [the ‘ faithful cousin ’]1920-the ‘ faithful cousin ’ was faithless , than that [she]188-mademoiselle cannes should have seen [him]1915-the wounded man in bloody danger on [her]188-mademoiselle cannes account . [I]0-i suppose [he]199-morin fancied that , if [Virginie]195-pierre never saw or heard more of [him]1915-the wounded man , [her]188-mademoiselle cannes imagination would not dwell on [his]1915-the wounded man simple disappearance , as it would do if [she]188-mademoiselle cannes knew what [he]1915-the wounded man was suffering for [her]188-mademoiselle cannes sake . “ At any rate , [Pierre]195-pierre saw that [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin was deeply mortified by the whole tenor of [his]1915-the wounded man behaviour during [their]3558-they walk [home]586-home . When [they]3558-they arrived at [[Madame Babette]179-madame babette ’s]3560-madame babette ’s , [Virginie]195-pierre fell fainting on the floor ; [her]188-mademoiselle cannes strength had but just sufficed for this exertion of reaching the shelter of [the house]3047-the house . [Her]188-mademoiselle cannes first sign of restoring consciousness consisted in avoidance of [Morin]199-morin . [He]1915-the wounded man had been most assiduous in [his]1915-the wounded man efforts to bring [her]188-mademoiselle cannes round ; quite tender in [his]1915-the wounded man way , [Pierre]195-pierre said ; and this marked , instinctive repugnance to [him]1915-the wounded man evidently gave [him]1915-the wounded man extreme pain . [I]188-mademoiselle cannes suppose [Frenchmen]3562-frenchmen are more demonstrative than [we]3558-they are ; for [Pierre]195-pierre declared that [he]195-pierre saw [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin ’s eyes fill with tears , as [she]188-mademoiselle cannes shrank away from [his]195-pierre touch , if [he]195-pierre tried to arrange the shawl [they]3558-they had laid under [her]188-mademoiselle cannes head like a pillow , or as [she]188-mademoiselle cannes shut [her]188-mademoiselle cannes eyes when [he]195-pierre passed before [her]188-mademoiselle cannes . [Madame Babette]179-madame babette was urgent with [her]188-mademoiselle cannes to go and lie down on the bed in [the inner room]3424-the inner room ; but it was some time before [she]188-mademoiselle cannes was strong enough to rise and do this . “[188-mademoiselle cannes] When [Madame Babette]179-madame babette returned from arranging [the girl]545-the girl comfortably , [the three relations]1922-the three relations sat down in silence ; a silence which [Pierre]195-pierre thought would never be broken . [He]195-pierre wanted [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother to ask [[his]195-pierre cousin]3260-his cousin what had happened . But [Madame Babette]179-madame babette was afraid of [[her]179-madame babette nephew]1654-her nephew , and thought it more discreet to wait for such crumbs of intelligence as [he]1654-her nephew might think fit to throw to [her]545-the girl . But , after [she]179-madame babette had twice reported [Virginie]195-pierre to be asleep , without a word being uttered in reply to [her]545-the girl whispers by [either of [[her]545-the girl companions]1927-her companions]1926-either of her companions , [Morin]199-morin ’s powers of self - containment gave way . “ ‘ It is hard ! ’ [he]199-morin said . “[179-madame babette] ‘ What is hard ? ’ asked [Madame Babette]179-madame babette , after [she]179-madame babette had paused for a time , to enable [him]199-morin to add to , or to finish , [his]199-morin sentence , if [he]199-morin pleased . “ ‘ It is hard for [a man]725-a man to love [a woman]3339-a woman as [I]179-madame babette do , ’ [he]199-morin went on—‘I did not seek to love [her]3339-a woman , it came upon [me]179-madame babette before [I]179-madame babette was aware — before [I]179-madame babette had ever thought about it at all , [I]179-madame babette loved [her]3339-a woman better than all [the world]866-the world beside . All [my]179-madame babette life , before [I]179-madame babette knew [her]3339-a woman , seems a dull blank . [I]179-madame babette neither know nor care for what [I]179-madame babette did before then . And now there are just two lives before [me]179-madame babette . Either [I]179-madame babette have [her]3339-a woman , or [I]179-madame babette have not . That is all : but that is everything . And what can [I]179-madame babette do to make [her]3339-a woman have [me]179-madame babette ? Tell [me]179-madame babette , [aunt]3568-aunt , ’ and [he]201-victor caught at [Madame Babette]179-madame babette ’s arm , and gave it so sharp a shake , that [she]1928-her half screamed out , [Pierre]195-pierre said , and evidently grew alarmed at [[her]1928-her nephew]1654-her nephew ’s excitement . “[179-madame babette] ‘ Hush , [Victor]201-victor ! ’ said [she]1928-her . ‘ There are [other women in [the world]866-the world]1929-other women in the world , if [this one]1931-this one will not have [you]201-victor . ’ “ ‘ None other for [me]0-i , ’ [he]201-victor said , sinking back as if hopeless . ‘ [I]0-i am plain and coarse , not one of [the scented darlings of [the aristocrats]3571-the aristocrats]3570-the scented darlings of the aristocrats . Say that [I]0-i am ugly , brutish ; [I]0-i did not make [myself]0-i so , any more than [I]0-i made [myself]0-i love [her]1928-her . It is [my]0-i fate . But am [I]0-i to submit to the consequences of [my]0-i fate without a struggle ? Not [I.]0-i As strong as [my]0-i love is , so strong is [my]0-i will . It can be no stronger , ’ continued [he]201-victor , gloomily . ‘ [Aunt Babette]205-aunt babette , [you]205-aunt babette must help [me]0-i — [you]205-aunt babette must make [her]1928-her love [me]0-i . ’ [He]201-victor was so fierce here , that [Pierre]195-pierre said [he]195-pierre did not wonder that [[his]195-pierre mother]1358-his mother was frightened . “[0-i] ‘ [I]0-i , [Victor]201-victor ! ’ [she]0-i exclaimed . ‘ [I]0-i make [her]0-i love [you]201-victor ? How can [I]0-i ? Ask [me]0-i to speak for [you]201-victor to [Mademoiselle Didot]206-mademoiselle didot , or to [Mademoiselle Cauchois]207-mademoiselle cauchois even , or to such as [they]1932-they , and [I]0-i ’ll do it , and welcome . But to [Mademoiselle de Crequy]168-virginie , why [you]201-victor do n’t know the difference ! [Those people]1933-those people — [the old nobility]1934-the old nobility [I]0-i mean — why [they]1933-those people do n’t know [a man]725-a man from a dog , out of [their]1933-those people own rank ! And no wonder , for [the young gentlemen of quality]1936-the young gentlemen of quality are treated differently to [us]1937-us from [their]1936-the young gentlemen of quality very birth . If [she]0-i had [you]201-victor to - morrow , [you]201-victor would be miserable . Let [me]0-i alone for knowing [the aristocracy]1938-the aristocracy . [I]0-i have not been [a concierge]1939-a concierge to [a duke]1940-a duke and [three counts for nothing]1941-three counts for nothing . [I]0-i tell [you]201-victor , all [your]201-victor ways are different to [her]0-i ways . ’ “ ‘ [I]201-victor would change [my]201-victor “[201-victor] ways , ” as [you]0-i call [them]3573-them . ’ “[201-victor] ‘ Be reasonable , [Victor]201-victor . ’ “ ‘ No , [I]201-victor will not be reasonable , if by that [you]0-i mean giving [her]0-i up . [I]201-victor tell [you]0-i two lives are before [me]201-victor ; one with [her]0-i , one without [her]0-i . But the latter will be but a short career for [both of [us]783-both of us]783-both of us . [You]0-i said , [aunt]3568-aunt , that the talk went in the conciergerie of [[[her]0-i father]1460-her father ’s hotel]3577-her father ’s hotel , that [she]0-i would have nothing to do with [this cousin whom [I]201-victor put out of the way to - day]3578-this cousin whom i put out of the way to - day ? ’ “[201-victor] ‘ So [the servants]509-the servants said . How could [I]0-i know ? All [I]0-i know is , that [he]1943-he left off coming to [[our]1944-our hotel]1276-our hotel , and that at one time before then [he]1943-he had never been two days absent . ’ “ ‘ So much the better for [him]1943-he . [He]1943-he suffers now for having come between [me]195-pierre and [[my]195-pierre object]3579-my object — in trying to snatch [her]3579-my object away out of [my]195-pierre sight . Take [you]1946-you warning , [Pierre]195-pierre ! [I]195-pierre did not like [your]1946-you meddling to - night . ’ And so [he]195-pierre went off , leaving [Madam Babette]149-madam rocking [herself]149-madam backwards and forwards , in all the depression of spirits consequent upon the reaction after the brandy , and upon [her]149-madam knowledge of [[her]149-madam nephew]1654-her nephew ’s threatened purpose combined . “[195-pierre] In telling [you]1946-you most of this , [I]0-i have simply repeated [Pierre]195-pierre ’s account , which [I]0-i wrote down at the time . But here what [he]195-pierre had to say came to a sudden break ; for , the next morning , when [Madame Babette]179-madame babette rose , [Virginie]195-pierre was missing , and it was some time before either [she]179-madame babette , or [Pierre]195-pierre , or [Morin]199-morin , could get the slightest clue to [the missing girl]1947-the missing girl . “ And now [I]179-madame babette must take up the story as it was told to [the Intendant Flechier]177-flechier by [the old gardener [Jacques]208-jacques , with whom [Clement]208-jacques had been lodging on [his]208-jacques first arrival in [Paris]22-paris]208-jacques . [The old man]1450-the old man could not , [I]179-madame babette dare say , remember half as much of what had happened as [Pierre]195-pierre did ; [the former]1696-the former had the dulled memory of age , while [Pierre]195-pierre had evidently thought over the whole series of events as a story — as a play , if one may call it so — during the solitary hours in [his]195-pierre after - life , wherever [they]3583-they were passed , whether in [lonely camp watches]3584-lonely camp watches , or in [the foreign prison]3585-the foreign prison , where [he]195-pierre had to drag out many years . [Clement]195-pierre had , as [I]179-madame babette said , returned to [[the gardener]1008-the gardener ’s garret]3587-the gardener ’s garret after [he]195-pierre had been dismissed from [the Hotel Duguesclin]1704-the hotel duguesclin . There were several reasons for [his]195-pierre thus doubling back . One was , that [he]195-pierre put nearly the whole breadth of [Paris]22-paris between [him]195-pierre and [an enemy]3589-an enemy ; though why [Morin]199-morin was [an enemy]3589-an enemy , and to what extent [he]199-morin carried [his]199-morin dislike or hatred , [Clement]195-pierre could not tell , of course . The next reason for returning to [Jacques]171-jacques was , no doubt , the conviction that , in multiplying [his]195-pierre residences , [he]195-pierre multiplied the chances against [his]195-pierre being suspected and recognized . And then , again , [the old man]1450-the old man was in [his]1450-the old man secret , and [[his]1450-the old man ally]3592-his ally , although perhaps but [a feeble kind of one]3593-a feeble kind of one . It was through [Jacques]208-jacques that the plan of communication , by means of a nosegay of pinks , had been devised ; and it was [Jacques]208-jacques who procured [him]195-pierre the last disguise that [Clement]208-jacques was to use in [Paris]22-paris — as [he]208-jacques hoped and trusted . It was that of [a respectable shopkeeper of no particular class]3594-a respectable shopkeeper of no particular class ; a dress that would have seemed perfectly suitable to [the young man who would naturally have worn it]3595-the young man who would naturally have worn it ; and yet , as [Clement]208-jacques put it on , and adjusted it — giving it a sort of finish and elegance which [I]179-madame babette always noticed about [his]208-jacques appearance and which [I]179-madame babette believed was innate in [the wearer]3596-the wearer — [I]179-madame babette have no doubt it seemed like the usual apparel of [a gentleman]1283-a gentleman . No coarseness of texture , nor clumsiness of cut could disguise [the nobleman of thirty descents]3598-the nobleman of thirty descents , it appeared ; for immediately on arriving at [the place of rendezvous]1901-the place of rendezvous , [he]208-jacques was recognized by [the men placed there on [Morin]199-morin ’s information to seize [him]208-jacques]3600-the men placed there on morin ’s information to seize him . [Jacques]208-jacques , following at a little distance , with a bundle under [his]208-jacques arm containing articles of feminine disguise for [Virginie]195-pierre , saw [four men]3601-four men attempt [Clement]195-pierre ’s arrest — saw [him]208-jacques , quick as lightning , draw a sword hitherto concealed in a clumsy stick — saw [his]208-jacques agile figure spring to [his]208-jacques guard,—and saw [him]208-jacques defend [himself]208-jacques with the rapidity and art of [a man skilled in arms]3602-a man skilled in arms . But what good did it do ? as [Jacques]208-jacques piteously used to ask , [Monsieur Flechier]209-monsieur flechier told [me]179-madame babette . A great blow from a heavy club on the sword - arm of [Monsieur de Crequy]167-monsieur de crequy laid it helpless and immovable by [his]208-jacques side . [Jacques]208-jacques always thought that that blow came from one of [the spectators]3603-the spectators , who by this time had collected round [the scene of the affray]3604-the scene of the affray . The next instant , [[his]208-jacques master]830-his master — [[his]208-jacques little marquis]3606-his little marquis — was down among the feet of [the crowd]3607-the crowd , and though [he]208-jacques was up again before [he]208-jacques had received much damage — so active and light was [[my]179-madame babette poor [Clement]208-jacques]1813-my poor clement — it was not before [the old gardener]3406-the old gardener had hobbled forwards , and , with many an old - fashioned oath and curse , proclaimed [himself]3406-the old gardener [a partisan of the losing side]3610-a partisan of the losing side — [a follower of [a ci - devant aristocrat]3612-a ci - devant aristocrat]3611-a follower of a ci - devant aristocrat . It was quite enough . [He]208-jacques received one or two good blows , which were , in fact , aimed at [[his]208-jacques master]830-his master ; and then , almost before [he]208-jacques was aware , [he]208-jacques found [his]208-jacques arms pinioned behind [him]208-jacques with [a woman]3339-a woman ’s garter , which one of [the viragos in the crowd]3615-the viragos in the crowd had made no scruple of pulling off in public , as soon as [she]3339-a woman heard for what purpose it was wanted . [Poor Jacques]210-jacques was stunned and [unhappy,—his master]3616-unhappy,—his master was out of sight , on before ; and [the old gardener]3406-the old gardener scarce knew whither [they]3615-the viragos in the crowd were taking [him]208-jacques . [His]208-jacques head ached from the blows which had fallen upon it ; it was growing dark — June day though it was,—and when first [he]208-jacques seems to have become exactly aware of what had happened to [him]208-jacques , it was when [he]208-jacques was turned into [one of [the larger rooms of [the Abbaye]1916-the abbaye]3619-the larger rooms of the abbaye]3618-one of the larger rooms of the abbaye , in which all were put who had no other allotted place wherein to sleep . One or two iron lamps hung from the ceiling by chains , giving a dim light for a little circle . [Jacques]210-jacques stumbled forwards over a sleeping body lying on the ground . [The sleeper]3621-the sleeper wakened up enough to complain ; and the apology of [the old man]1450-the old man in reply caught the ear of [[[his]208-jacques master]830-his master , who , until this time , could hardly have been aware of the straits and difficulties of [[his]830-his master faithful [Jacques]210-jacques]3625-his faithful jacques]3624-his master , who , until this time , could hardly have been aware of the straits and difficulties of his faithful jacques . And there [they]3615-the viragos in the crowd sat,—against a pillar , the live - long night , holding [one another]3626-one another ’s hands , and each restraining expressions of pain , for fear of adding to the other ’s distress . That night made [them]3615-the viragos in the crowd [intimate friends]3627-intimate friends , in spite of the difference of age and rank . The disappointed hopes , the acute suffering of the present , the apprehensions of the future , made [them]3615-the viragos in the crowd seek solace in talking of the past . [Monsieur de Crequy]167-monsieur de crequy and [the gardener]1008-the gardener found [themselves]3615-the viragos in the crowd disputing with interest in which chimney of the stack the starling used to build,—the starling whose nest [Clement]208-jacques sent to [Urian]152-sir urian , [you]3629-you remember , and discussing the merits of different espalier - pears which grew , and may grow still , in [the old garden of [the Hotel de Crequy]3287-the hotel de crequy]3630-the old garden of the hotel de crequy . Towards morning both fell asleep . [The old man]1450-the old man wakened first . [His]1450-the old man frame was deadened to suffering , [I]179-madame babette suppose , for [he]1450-the old man felt relieved of [his]1450-the old man pain ; but [Clement]208-jacques moaned and cried in feverish slumber . [His]1450-the old man broken arm was beginning to inflame [his]1450-the old man blood . [He]1450-the old man was , besides , much injured by some kicks from [the crowd]3607-the crowd as [he]1450-the old man fell . As [the old man]1450-the old man looked sadly on the white , baked lips , and the flushed cheeks , contorted with suffering even in [his]1450-the old man sleep , [Clement]208-jacques gave a sharp cry which disturbed [[his]208-jacques miserable neighbours]3635-his miserable neighbours , all slumbering around in uneasy attitudes . [They]3635-his miserable neighbours bade [him]208-jacques with curses be silent ; and then turning round , tried again to forget [their]3635-his miserable neighbours own misery in sleep . For [you]3636-you see , [the bloodthirsty canaille]3637-the bloodthirsty canaille had not been sated with guillotining and hanging all the nobility [they]3635-his miserable neighbours could find , but were now informing , right and left , even against each other ; and when [Clement]208-jacques and [Jacques]208-jacques were in [the prison]3638-the prison , there were few of gentle blood in [the place]437-the place , and fewer still of gentle manners . At the sound of the angry words and threats , [Jacques]208-jacques thought it best to awaken [[his]208-jacques master]830-his master from [his]830-his master feverish uncomfortable sleep , lest [he]830-his master should provoke more enmity ; and , tenderly lifting [him]830-his master up , [he]208-jacques tried to adjust [his]208-jacques own body , so that it should serve as a rest and a pillow for [the younger man]3641-the younger man . The motion aroused [Clement]208-jacques , and [he]208-jacques began to talk in a strange , feverish way , of [Virginie]195-pierre , too,—whose name [he]208-jacques would not have breathed in such a place had [he]208-jacques been quite [himself]208-jacques . But [Jacques]208-jacques had as much delicacy of feeling as [any lady in [the land]3166-the land]3642-any lady in the land , although , mind [you]3644-you , [he]208-jacques knew neither how to read nor write,—and bent [his]208-jacques head low down , so that [[his]208-jacques master]830-his master might tell [him]208-jacques in a whisper what messages [he]208-jacques was to take to [Mademoiselle de Crequy]168-virginie , in case — [Poor Clement]211-poor clement , [he]208-jacques knew it must come to that ! No escape for [him]208-jacques now , in [Norman]193-the norman disguise or otherwise ! Either by gathering fever or guillotine , death was sure of [his]208-jacques prey . Well ! when that happened , [Jacques]208-jacques was to go and find [Mademoiselle de Crequy]168-virginie , and tell [her]168-virginie that [[her]168-virginie cousin]932-her cousin loved [her]168-virginie at the last as [he]932-her cousin had loved [her]168-virginie at the first ; but that [she]168-virginie should never have heard another word of [his]932-her cousin attachment from [his]932-her cousin living lips ; that [he]932-her cousin knew [he]932-her cousin was not good enough for [her]168-virginie , [[his]932-her cousin queen]3647-his queen ; and that no thought of earning [her]168-virginie love by [his]932-her cousin devotion had prompted [his]932-her cousin return to [France]45-france , only that , if possible , [he]932-her cousin might have the great privilege of serving [her]168-virginie whom [he]932-her cousin loved . And then [he]932-her cousin went off into rambling talk about [petit - maitres]3648-petit - maitres , and such kind of expressions , said [Jacques]208-jacques to [Flechier]209-monsieur flechier , [the intendant]1681-the intendant , little knowing what a clue that one word gave to much of [the poor lad]3650-the poor lad ’s suffering . “[179-madame babette] The summer morning came slowly on in [that dark prison]1948-that dark prison , and when [Jacques]208-jacques could look round — [[his]208-jacques master]830-his master was now sleeping on [his]208-jacques shoulder , still the uneasy , starting sleep of fever — [he]208-jacques saw that there were [many women]1950-many women among [the prisoners]1951-the prisoners . ( [I]0-i have heard [some of those who have escaped from [the prisons]1953-the prisons]1952-some of those who have escaped from the prisons say , that the look of despair and agony that came into the faces of [the prisoners on first wakening]1954-the prisoners on first wakening , as the sense of [their]1951-the prisoners situation grew upon [them]1951-the prisoners , was what lasted the longest in the memory of [the survivors]1955-the survivors . This look , [they]1952-some of those who have escaped from the prisons said , passed away from [the women]1956-the women ’s faces sooner than it did from [those of [the men]1958-the men]1957-those of the men . ) “ [Poor old Jacques]208-jacques kept falling asleep , and plucking [himself]208-jacques up again for fear lest , if [he]208-jacques did not attend to [[his]208-jacques master]830-his master , some harm might come to the swollen , helpless arm . Yet [his]208-jacques weariness grew upon [him]208-jacques in spite of all [his]208-jacques efforts , and at last [he]208-jacques felt as if [he]208-jacques must give way to the irresistible desire , if only for five minutes . But just then there was a bustle at the door . [Jacques]208-jacques opened [his]208-jacques eyes wide to look . “[500-some one] ‘ [The gaoler]1959-the gaoler is early with breakfast , ’ said [some one]500-some one , lazily . “ ‘ It is the darkness of [this accursed place]3652-this accursed place that makes [us]3653-us think it early , ’ said another . “[500-some one] All this time a parley was going on at the door . [Some one]500-some one came in ; not [the gaoler]1959-the gaoler — [a woman]3339-a woman . The door was shut to and locked behind [her]3339-a woman . [She]3339-a woman only advanced a step or two , for it was too sudden a change , out of the light into that dark shadow , for [any one]624-any one to see clearly for the first few minutes . [Jacques]208-jacques had [his]208-jacques eyes fairly open now , and was wide awake . It was [Mademoiselle de Crequy]168-virginie , looking bright , clear , and resolute . The faithful heart of [the old man]1450-the old man read that look like an open page . [[Her]168-virginie cousin]932-her cousin should not die there on [her]168-virginie behalf , without at least the comfort of [her]168-virginie sweet presence . “ ‘ Here [he]932-her cousin is , ’ [he]208-jacques whispered as [her]168-virginie gown would have touched [him]208-jacques in passing , without [her]168-virginie perceiving [him]208-jacques , in the heavy obscurity of [the place]437-the place . “[0-i] ‘ [The good God]1967-the good god bless [you]208-jacques , [[my]0-i friend]3547-my friend ! ’ [she]0-i murmured , as [she]0-i saw the attitude of [the old man]1450-the old man , propped against a pillar , and holding [Clement]208-jacques in [his]1450-the old man arms , as if [the young man]1343-the young man had been [a helpless baby]1971-a helpless baby , while one of [the poor gardener]1972-the poor gardener ’s hands supported the broken limb in the easiest position . [Virginie]168-virginie sat down by [the old man]1450-the old man , and held out [her]168-virginie arms . Softly [she]168-virginie moved [Clement]208-jacques ’s head to [her]168-virginie own shoulder ; softly [she]168-virginie transferred the task of holding the arm to [herself]168-virginie . [Clement]208-jacques lay on the floor , but [she]168-virginie supported [him]208-jacques , and [Jacques]208-jacques was at liberty to arise and stretch and shake [his]208-jacques stiff , weary old body . [He]208-jacques then sat down at a little distance , and watched [the pair]1974-the pair until [he]208-jacques fell asleep . [Clement]208-jacques had muttered ‘ [Virginie]168-virginie , ’ as [they]1974-the pair half - roused [him]208-jacques by [their]1974-the pair movements out of [his]208-jacques stupor ; but [Jacques]208-jacques thought [he]208-jacques was only dreaming ; nor did [he]208-jacques seem fully awake when once [his]208-jacques eyes opened , and [he]208-jacques looked full at [Virginie]168-virginie ’s face bending over [him]208-jacques , and growing crimson under [his]208-jacques gaze , though [she]168-virginie never stirred , for fear of hurting [him]208-jacques if [she]168-virginie moved . [Clement]208-jacques looked in silence , until [his]208-jacques heavy eyelids came slowly down , and [he]208-jacques fell into [his]208-jacques oppressive slumber again . Either [he]208-jacques did not recognize [her]168-virginie , or [she]168-virginie came in too completely as a part of [his]208-jacques sleeping visions for [him]208-jacques to be disturbed by [her]168-virginie appearance there . “ When [Jacques]208-jacques awoke it was full daylight — at least as full as it would ever be in [that place]3655-that place . [His]208-jacques breakfast — the gaol - allowance of bread and vin ordinaire — was by [his]208-jacques side . [He]208-jacques must have slept soundly . [He]208-jacques looked for [[his]208-jacques master]830-his master . [He]208-jacques and [Virginie]168-virginie had recognized [each other]780-each other now,—hearts , as well as appearance . [They]780-each other were smiling into [each other]780-each other ’s faces , as if [that dull , vaulted room in [the grim Abbaye]3660-the grim abbaye]3659-that dull , vaulted room in the grim abbaye were [the sunny gardens of [Versailles]23-versailles]3661-the sunny gardens of versailles , with music and festivity all abroad . Apparently [they]780-each other had much to say to [each other]780-each other ; for whispered questions and answers never ceased . “[168-virginie] [Virginie]168-virginie had made a sling for the poor broken arm ; nay , [she]168-virginie had obtained two splinters of wood in some way , and [one of [[their]1976-they fellow - prisoners]1977-their fellow - prisoners]1975-one of their fellow - prisoners — having , it appeared , some knowledge of surgery — had set it . [Jacques]208-jacques felt more desponding by far than [they]1976-they did , for [he]208-jacques was suffering from the night [he]208-jacques had passed , which told upon [his]208-jacques aged frame ; while [they]1976-they must have heard some good news , as it seemed to [him]208-jacques , so bright and happy did [they]1976-they look . Yet [Clement]208-jacques was still in bodily pain and suffering , and [Virginie]168-virginie , by [her]168-virginie own act and deed , was [a prisoner]1978-a prisoner in [that dreadful Abbaye]1979-that dreadful abbaye , whence the only issue was the guillotine . But [they]1976-they were together : [they]1976-they loved : [they]1976-they understood [each other]780-each other at length . “ When [Virginie]168-virginie saw that [Jacques]208-jacques was awake , and languidly munching [his]208-jacques breakfast , [she]168-virginie rose from the wooden stool on which [she]168-virginie was sitting , and went to [him]208-jacques , holding out both hands , and refusing to allow [him]208-jacques to rise , while [she]168-virginie thanked [him]208-jacques with pretty eagerness for all [his]208-jacques kindness to [Monsieur]3663-monsieur . [Monsieur]3664-monsieur [himself]3664-monsieur came towards [him]3664-monsieur , following [Virginie]168-virginie , but with tottering steps , as if [his]3664-monsieur head was weak and dizzy , to thank [the poor old man]3665-the poor old man , who now on [his]3665-the poor old man feet , stood between [them]1976-they , ready to cry while [they]1976-they gave [him]3665-the poor old man credit for faithful actions which [he]3665-the poor old man felt to have been almost involuntary on [his]3665-the poor old man part,—for loyalty was like an instinct in the good old days , before [your]3666-your educational ca nt had come up . And so two days went on . The only event was the morning call for [the victims]3667-the victims , [a certain number of whom were summoned to trial every day]3668-a certain number of whom were summoned to trial every day . And to be tried was to be condemned . [Every one of [the prisoners]1951-the prisoners]3669-every one of the prisoners became grave , as the hour for [their]3669-every one of the prisoners summons approached . [Most of [the victims]3667-the victims]3671-most of the victims went to [their]3671-most of the victims doom with uncomplaining resignation , and for a while after [their]3671-most of the victims departure there was comparative silence in [the prison]3638-the prison . But , by - and - by — so said [Jacques]208-jacques — the conversation or amusements began again . Human nature can not stand the perpetual pressure of such keen anxiety , without an effort to relieve itself by thinking of something else . [Jacques]208-jacques said that [Monsieur]3674-monsieur and [Mademoiselle]168-virginie were for ever talking together of the past days,—it was ‘ Do [you]3674-monsieur remember this ? ’ or , ‘ Do [you]3674-monsieur remember that ? ’ perpetually . [He]208-jacques sometimes thought [they]1981-they forgot where [they]1981-they were , and what was before [them]1981-they . But [Jacques]208-jacques did not , and every day [he]208-jacques trembled more and more as the list was called over . “[1976-they] The third morning of [their]1981-they incarceration , [the gaoler]1959-the gaoler brought in [a man whom [Jacques]208-jacques did not recognize]1983-a man whom jacques did not recognize , and therefore did not at once observe ; for [he]1959-the gaoler was waiting , as in duty bound , upon [[his]1959-the gaoler master]830-his master and [[his]1959-the gaoler sweet young lady]1985-his sweet young lady ( as [he]1959-the gaoler always called [her]1985-his sweet young lady in repeating the story ) . [He]1959-the gaoler thought that [the new introduction]1986-the new introduction was [some friend of [the gaoler]1959-the gaoler]1987-some friend of the gaoler , as [the two]1484-the two seemed well acquainted , and [the latter]841-the latter stayed a few minutes talking with [[his]1959-the gaoler visitor]1991-his visitor before leaving [him]1959-the gaoler in [prison]3153-prison . So [Jacques]208-jacques was surprised when , after a short time had elapsed , [he]208-jacques looked round , and saw the fierce stare with which [the stranger]1753-the stranger was regarding [Monsieur]1994-monsieur and [Mademoiselle de Crequy]168-virginie , as [the pair]1974-the pair sat at breakfast,—the said breakfast being laid as well as [Jacques]208-jacques knew how , on a bench fastened into [the prison]3638-the prison wall,—Virginie sitting on [her]1985-his sweet young lady low stool , and [Clement]208-jacques half lying on the ground by [her]1985-his sweet young lady side , and submitting gladly to be fed by [her]1985-his sweet young lady pretty white fingers ; for it was one of [her]1985-his sweet young lady fancies , [Jacques]208-jacques said , to do all [she]1985-his sweet young lady could for [him]208-jacques , in consideration of [his]208-jacques broken arm . And , indeed , [Clement]208-jacques was wasting away daily ; for [he]208-jacques had received other injuries , internal and more serious than that to [his]208-jacques arm , during the melee which had ended in [his]208-jacques capture . [The stranger]1753-the stranger made [Jacques]208-jacques conscious of [his]208-jacques presence by a sigh , which was almost a groan . [All three prisoners]1998-all three prisoners looked round at the sound . [Clement]208-jacques ’s face expressed little but scornful indifference ; but [Virginie]168-virginie ’s face froze into stony hate . [Jacques]208-jacques said [he]208-jacques never saw such a look , and hoped that [he]208-jacques never should again . Yet after that first revelation of feeling , [her]1985-his sweet young lady look was steady and fixed in another direction to that in which [the stranger]1753-the stranger stood,—still motionless — still watching . [He]208-jacques came a step nearer at last . “ ‘ [Mademoiselle]168-virginie , ’ [he]208-jacques said . Not the quivering of an eyelash showed that [she]1985-his sweet young lady heard [him]208-jacques . ‘ [Mademoiselle]168-virginie ! ’ [he]208-jacques said again , with an intensity of beseeching that made [Jacques]208-jacques — not knowing who [he]208-jacques was — almost pity [him]208-jacques , when [he]208-jacques saw [[his]208-jacques young lady]3675-his young lady ’s obdurate face . “[208-jacques] There was perfect silence for a space of time which [Jacques]208-jacques could not measure . Then again the voice , hesitatingly , saying , ‘ [Monsieur]1738-monsieur ! ’ [Clement]208-jacques could not hold the same icy countenance as [Virginie]168-virginie ; [he]208-jacques turned [his]208-jacques head with an impatient gesture of disgust ; but even that emboldened [the man]413-the man . “ ‘ [Monsieur]3676-monsieur , do ask [mademoiselle]168-virginie to listen to [me,—just]3677-me,—just two words . ’ “[208-jacques] ‘ [Mademoiselle de Crequy]168-virginie only listens to whom [she]168-virginie chooses . ’ Very haughtily [[my]0-i [Clement]208-jacques]2002-my clement would say that , [I]0-i am sure . “ ‘ But , mademoiselle,’—lowering [his]413-the man voice , and coming a step or two nearer . [Virginie]168-virginie must have felt [his]413-the man approach , though [she]168-virginie did not see it ; for [she]168-virginie drew [herself]168-virginie a little on one side , so as to put as much space as possible between [him]413-the man and her.—‘Mademoiselle , it is not too late . [I]208-jacques can save [you]168-virginie : but to - morrow [your]168-virginie name is down on the list . [I]208-jacques can save [you]168-virginie , if [you]168-virginie will listen . ’ “[208-jacques] Still no word or sign . [Jacques]208-jacques did not understand the affair . Why was [she]168-virginie so obdurate to one who might be ready to include [Clement]208-jacques in the proposal , as far as [Jacques]208-jacques knew ? “ [The man]413-the man withdrew a little , but did not offer to leave [the prison]3638-the prison . [He]413-the man never took [his]413-the man eyes off [Virginie]168-virginie ; [he]413-the man seemed to be suffering from some acute and terrible pain as [he]413-the man watched [her]168-virginie . “[208-jacques] [Jacques]208-jacques cleared away the breakfast - things as well as [he]208-jacques could . [Purposely]212-purposely , as [I]0-i suspect , [he]208-jacques passed near [the man]413-the man . “ ‘ [Hist]208-jacques ! ’ said [the stranger]1753-the stranger . ‘ [You]208-jacques are [Jacques]208-jacques , [the gardener]1008-the gardener , arrested for assisting [an aristocrat]1713-an aristocrat . [I]212-purposely know [the gaoler]1959-the gaoler . [You]208-jacques shall escape , if [you]208-jacques will . Only take this message from [me]212-purposely to [mademoiselle]168-virginie . [You]208-jacques heard . [She]168-virginie will not listen to [me]212-purposely : [I]212-purposely did not want [her]168-virginie to come here . [I]212-purposely never knew [she]168-virginie was [here]3173-here , and [she]168-virginie will die to - morrow . [They]3685-they will put [her]168-virginie beautiful round throat under the guillotine . Tell [her]168-virginie , [good old man]3686-good old man , tell [her]168-virginie how sweet life is ; and how [I]212-purposely can save [her]168-virginie ; and how [I]212-purposely will not ask for more than just to see [her]168-virginie from time to time . [She]168-virginie is so young ; and death is annihilation , [you]208-jacques know . Why does [she]168-virginie hate [me]212-purposely so ? [I]212-purposely want to save [her]168-virginie ; [I]212-purposely have done [her]168-virginie no harm . [Good old man]3686-good old man , tell [her]168-virginie how terrible death is ; and that [she]168-virginie will die to - morrow , unless [she]168-virginie listens to [me]212-purposely . ’ “[212-purposely] [Jacques]208-jacques saw no harm in repeating this message . [Clement]208-jacques listened in silence , watching [Virginie]168-virginie with an air of infinite tenderness . “ ‘ Will [you]168-virginie not try [him]208-jacques , [[my]208-jacques cherished one]3688-my cherished one ? ’ [he]208-jacques said . ‘ Towards [you]168-virginie [he]208-jacques may mean well ’ ( which makes [me]208-jacques think that [Virginie]168-virginie had never repeated to [Clement]208-jacques the conversation which [she]168-virginie had overheard that last night at [Madame Babette]179-madame babette ’s ) ; ‘ [you]208-jacques would be in no worse a situation than [you]208-jacques were before ! ’ “[208-jacques] ‘ No worse , [Clement]208-jacques ! and [I]0-i should have known what [you]208-jacques were , and have lost [you]208-jacques . [[My]0-i [Clement]208-jacques]2002-my clement ! ’ said [she]0-i , reproachfully . “ ‘ Ask [him]208-jacques , ’ said [she]0-i , turning to [Jacques]208-jacques , suddenly , ‘ if [he]208-jacques can save [Monsieur de Crequy]167-monsieur de crequy as well,—if [he]208-jacques can?—O [Clement]208-jacques , [we]3689-we might escape to [England]9-england ; [we]3689-we are but young . ’ And [she]0-i hid [her]0-i face on [his]208-jacques shoulder . “[0-i] [Jacques]208-jacques returned to [the stranger]1753-the stranger , and asked [him]1753-the stranger [Virginie]168-virginie ’s question . [His]208-jacques eyes were fixed on [the cousins]3281-the cousins ; [he]208-jacques was very pale , and the twitchings or contortions , which must have been involuntary whenever [he]208-jacques was agitated , convulsed [his]208-jacques whole body . “ [He]208-jacques made a long pause . ‘ [I]208-jacques will save [mademoiselle]168-virginie and [monsieur]1738-monsieur , if [she]2007-your wife will go straight from [prison]3153-prison to [the mairie]3692-the mairie , and be [[my]208-jacques wife]3693-my wife . ’ “[208-jacques] ‘ [[Your]208-jacques wife]2007-your wife ! ’ [Jacques]208-jacques could not help exclaiming , ‘ That [she]2007-your wife will never be — never ! ’ “ ‘ Ask [her]2007-your wife ! ’ said [Morin]199-morin , hoarsely . “[208-jacques] But almost before [Jacques]208-jacques thought [he]208-jacques could have fairly uttered the words , [Clement]208-jacques caught their meaning . “ ‘ Begone ! ’ said [he]208-jacques ; ‘ not one word more . ’ [Virginie]168-virginie touched [the old man]1450-the old man as [he]1450-the old man was moving away . ‘ Tell [him]1450-the old man [he]1450-the old man does not know how [he]1450-the old man makes [me]208-jacques welcome death . ’ And smiling , as if triumphant , [she]168-virginie turned again to [Clement]208-jacques . “[208-jacques] [The stranger]1753-the stranger did not speak as [Jacques]208-jacques gave [him]1753-the stranger the meaning , not the words , of [their]2009-their replies . [He]1753-the stranger was going away , but stopped . A minute or two afterwards , [he]1753-the stranger beckoned to [Jacques]208-jacques . [The old gardener]3406-the old gardener seems to have thought it undesirable to throw away even the chance of assistance from [such a man as this]2011-such a man as this , for [he]1753-the stranger went forward to speak to [him]1753-the stranger . “ ‘ Listen ! [I]1753-the stranger have influence with [the gaoler]1959-the gaoler . [He]1959-the gaoler shall let [thee]1753-the stranger pass out with [the victims]3667-the victims to - morrow . [No one]590-no one will notice it , or miss thee—. [They]2009-their will be led to trial,—even at the last moment , [I]1753-the stranger will save [her]1753-the stranger , if [she]1753-the stranger sends [me]1753-the stranger word [she]1753-the stranger relents . Speak to [her]1753-the stranger , as the time draws on . Life is very sweet,—tell [her]1753-the stranger how sweet . Speak to [him]1959-the gaoler ; [he]1959-the gaoler will do more with [her]1753-the stranger than [thou]1753-the stranger canst . Let [him]1959-the gaoler urge [her]1753-the stranger to live . Even at the last , [I]1753-the stranger will be at [the Palais de Justice,—at]3698-the palais de justice,—at [the Greve]213-the greve . [I]1753-the stranger have [followers,—I]3699-followers,—i have interest . Come among [the crowd that follow the victims,—I]3700-the crowd that follow the victims,—i shall see [thee]1753-the stranger . It will be no worse for [him]1959-the gaoler , if [she]1753-the stranger escapes ’ — “[1753-the stranger] ‘ Save [[my]0-i master]2012-my master , and [I]0-i will do all , ’ said [Jacques]208-jacques . “ ‘ Only on [my]208-jacques one condition , ’ said [Morin]199-morin , doggedly ; and [Jacques]208-jacques was hopeless of that condition ever being fulfilled . But [he]208-jacques did not see why [his]208-jacques own life might not be saved . By remaining in [prison]3153-prison until the next day , [he]208-jacques should have rendered every service in [his]208-jacques power to [[his]208-jacques master]830-his master and [the young lady]3296-the young lady . [He]208-jacques , poor fellow , shrank from death ; and [he]208-jacques agreed with [Morin]199-morin to escape , if [he]208-jacques could , by the means [Morin]199-morin had suggested , and to bring [him]208-jacques word if [Mademoiselle de Crequy]168-virginie relented . ( [Jacques]208-jacques had no expectation that [she]168-virginie would ; but [I]208-jacques fancy [he]208-jacques did not think it necessary to tell [Morin]199-morin of this conviction of [his]208-jacques . ) This bargaining with so base [a man]725-a man for so slight a thing as life , was the only flaw that [I]208-jacques heard of in [the old gardener]3406-the old gardener ’s behaviour . Of course , the mere reopening of the subject was enough to stir [Virginie]168-virginie to displeasure . [Clement]208-jacques urged [her]168-virginie , it is true ; but the light [he]208-jacques had gained upon [Morin]199-morin ’s motions , made [him]208-jacques rather try to set the case before [her]168-virginie in as fair a manner as possible than use any persuasive arguments . And , even as it was , what [he]208-jacques said on the subject made [Virginie]168-virginie shed tears — the first that had fallen from [her]168-virginie since [she]168-virginie entered [the prison]3638-the prison . So , [they]3707-they were summoned and went together , at the fatal call of the muster - roll of [victims]3708-victims the next morning . [He]208-jacques , feeble from [his]208-jacques wounds and [his]208-jacques injured health ; [she]168-virginie , calm and serene , only petitioning to be allowed to walk next to [him]208-jacques , in order that [she]168-virginie might hold [him]208-jacques up when [he]208-jacques turned faint and giddy from [his]208-jacques extreme suffering . “[208-jacques] Together [they]2013-they stood at the bar ; together [they]2013-they were condemned . As the words of judgment were pronounced , [Virginie]168-virginie tuned to [Clement]208-jacques , and embraced [him]208-jacques with passionate fondness . Then , making [him]208-jacques lean on [her]168-virginie , [they]2013-they marched out towards [the Place de la Greve]65-the place de la greve . “ [Jacques]208-jacques was free now . [He]208-jacques had told [Morin]199-morin how fruitless [his]208-jacques efforts at persuasion had been ; and scarcely caring to note the effect of [his]208-jacques information upon [the man]413-the man , [he]208-jacques had devoted [himself]208-jacques to watching [Monsieur]3710-monsieur and [Mademoiselle de Crequy]168-virginie . And now [he]208-jacques followed [them]2013-they to [the Place de la Greve]3711-the place de la greve . [He]208-jacques saw [them]2013-they mount [the platform]3712-the platform ; saw [them]2013-they kneel down together till plucked up by [the impatient officials]3713-the impatient officials ; could see that [she]2014-she was urging some request to [the executioner]3714-the executioner ; the end of which seemed to be , that [Clement]208-jacques advanced first to the guillotine , was executed ( and just at this moment there was a stir among [the crowd]3607-the crowd , as of [a man pressing forward towards the scaffold]3716-a man pressing forward towards the scaffold ) . Then [she]2014-she , standing with [her]2014-she face to the guillotine , slowly made the sign of the cross , and knelt down . “[2013-they] [Jacques]208-jacques covered [his]208-jacques eyes , blinded with tears . The report of a pistol made [him]208-jacques look up . [She]2014-she was gone — [another victim]2015-another victim in [her]2014-she place — and where there had been a little stir in [the crowd]3607-the crowd not five minutes before , [some men]2017-some men were carrying off a dead body . [A man]725-a man had shot [himself]725-a man , [they]2017-some men said . [Pierre]195-pierre told [me]0-i who [that man]2019-that man was . ” CHAPTER IX . After a pause , [I]195-pierre ventured to ask what became of [Madame de Crequy]169-madame de crequy , [[Clement]195-pierre ’s mother]3717-clement ’s mother . “[195-pierre] [She]2014-she never made any inquiry about [him]725-a man , ” said [[my]2014-she lady]336-my lady . “[2014-she] [She]2014-she must have known that [he]725-a man was dead ; though how , [we]2020-we never could tell . [Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott remembered afterwards that it was about , if not on — [Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott to this day declares that it was on the very Monday , June the nineteenth , when [[her]2014-she son]991-her son was executed , that [Madame de Crequy]169-madame de crequy left off [her]169-madame de crequy rouge and took to [her]169-madame de crequy bed , as [one bereaved and hopeless]2022-one bereaved and hopeless . It certainly was about that time ; and [Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott — who was deeply impressed by that dream of [Madame de Crequy]169-madame de crequy ’s ( the relation of which [I]0-i told [you]2023-you had had such an effect on [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord ) , in which [she]103-mrs. medlicott had seen the figure of [Virginie]195-pierre — as [the only light object amid much surrounding darkness as of night , smiling and beckoning Clement on —]2025-the only light object amid much surrounding darkness as of night , smiling and beckoning clement on — on — till at length the bright phantom stopped , motionless , and [Madame de Crequy]169-madame de crequy ’s eyes began to penetrate the murky darkness , and to see closing around [her]103-mrs. medlicott the gloomy dripping walls which [she]103-mrs. medlicott had once seen and never forgotten — the walls of [the vault of [the chapel of the De Crequys in [Saint Germain l’Auxerrois]66-saint germain l’auxerrois]2027-the chapel of the de crequys in saint germain l’auxerrois]2026-the vault of the chapel of the de crequys in saint germain l’auxerrois ; and there [the two last of [the Crequys]161-the de crequys]2028-the two last of the crequys laid [them]2029-them down among [[their]2028-the two last of the crequys forefathers]1052-their forefathers , and [Madame de Crequy]169-madame de crequy had wakened to the sound of the great door , which led to the open air , being locked upon [her]103-mrs. medlicott — [I]0-i say [Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott , who was predisposed by this dream to look out for the supernatural , always declared that [Madame de Crequy]169-madame de crequy was made conscious in some mysterious way , of [[her]169-madame de crequy son]991-her son ’s death , on the very day and hour when it occurred , and that after that [she]169-madame de crequy had no more anxiety , but was only conscious of a kind of stupefying despair . ” “[169-madame de crequy] And what became of [her]169-madame de crequy , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ? ” [I]169-madame de crequy again asked . “[169-madame de crequy] What could become of [her]169-madame de crequy ? ” replied [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow . “[169-madame de crequy] [She]169-madame de crequy never could be induced to rise again , though [she]169-madame de crequy lived more than a year after [[her]169-madame de crequy son]991-her son ’s departure . [She]169-madame de crequy kept [her]169-madame de crequy bed ; [[her]169-madame de crequy room]2034-her room darkened , [her]169-madame de crequy face turned towards the wall , whenever [any one besides [Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott]2035-any one besides medlicott was in [the room]489-the room . [She]169-madame de crequy hardly ever spoke , and would have died of starvation but for [Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott ’s tender care , in putting a morsel to [her]169-madame de crequy lips every now and then , feeding [her]169-madame de crequy , in fact , just as an old bird feeds [her]169-madame de crequy young ones . In the height of summer [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord and [I]0-i left [London]2-london . [We]2038-we would fain have taken [her]169-madame de crequy with [us]2038-we into [Scotland]1-scotland , but [the doctor]3071-the doctor ( [we]2038-we had [the old doctor]2040-the old doctor from [Leicester Square]44-leicester square ) forbade [her]169-madame de crequy removal ; and this time [he]3071-the doctor gave such good reasons against it that [I]0-i acquiesced . [Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott and [a maid]2041-a maid were left with [her]169-madame de crequy . Every care was taken of [her]169-madame de crequy . [She]169-madame de crequy survived till [our]2038-we return . Indeed , [I]0-i thought [she]169-madame de crequy was in much the same state as [I]0-i had left [her]169-madame de crequy in , when [I]0-i came back to [London]2-london . But [Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott spoke of [her]169-madame de crequy as much weaker ; and one morning on awakening , [they]2042-they told [me]0-i [she]169-madame de crequy was dead . [I]0-i sent for [Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott , who was in sad distress , [she]103-mrs. medlicott had become so fond of [her]103-mrs. medlicott charge . [She]103-mrs. medlicott said that , about two o’clock , [she]103-mrs. medlicott had been awakened by unusual restlessness on [Madame de Crequy]169-madame de crequy ’s part ; that [she]103-mrs. medlicott had gone to [her]103-mrs. medlicott bedside , and found [the poor lady]2043-the poor lady feebly but perpetually moving [her]103-mrs. medlicott wasted arm up and down — and saying to [herself]103-mrs. medlicott in a wailing voice : ‘ [I]0-i did not bless [him]2043-the poor lady when [he]2043-the poor lady left [me]0-i — [I]0-i did not bless [him]2043-the poor lady when [he]2043-the poor lady left [me]0-i ! ’ [Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott gave [her]103-mrs. medlicott a spoonful or two of jelly , and sat by [her]103-mrs. medlicott , stroking [her]103-mrs. medlicott hand , and soothing [her]103-mrs. medlicott till [she]103-mrs. medlicott seemed to fall asleep . But in the morning [she]103-mrs. medlicott was dead . ” “[103-mrs. medlicott] It is a sad story , [[your]2043-the poor lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship , ” said [I]3058-your ladyship , after a while . “[3058-your ladyship] Yes it is . [People]302-people seldom arrive at [my]0-i age without having watched the beginning , middle , and end of many lives and many fortunes . [We]2046-we do not talk about [them]302-people , perhaps ; for [they]302-people are often so sacred to [us]2046-we , from having touched into the very quick of [our]2046-we own hearts , as it were , or into those of [others who are dead and gone , and veiled over from human sight]2047-others who are dead and gone , and veiled over from human sight , that [we]2046-we can not tell the tale as if it was a mere story . But [young people]2048-young people should remember that [we]2046-we have had this solemn experience of life , on which to base [our]2046-we opinions and form [our]2046-we judgments , so that they are not mere untried theories . [I]0-i am not alluding to [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner just now , for [he]238-mr. horner is nearly as old as [I]0-i am — within ten years , [I]0-i dare say — but [I]0-i am thinking of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , with [his]113-mr. gray endless plans for some new thing — [schools]588-schools , education , Sabbaths , and what not . Now [he]113-mr. gray has not seen what all this leads to . ” “[113-mr. gray] It is a pity [he]113-mr. gray has not heard [[your]0-i ladyship]3058-your ladyship tell the story of poor [Monsieur de Crequy]167-monsieur de crequy . ” “[3058-your ladyship] Not at all a pity , [[my]0-i dear]3052-my dear . [A young man like [him]113-mr. gray]2052-a young man like him , who , both by position and age , must have had [his]113-mr. gray experience confined to a very narrow circle , ought not to set up [his]113-mr. gray opinion against [mine]0-i ; [he]113-mr. gray ought not to require reasons from [me]0-i , nor to need such explanation of [my]0-i arguments ( if [I]0-i condescend to argue ) , as going into relation of the circumstances on which [my]0-i arguments are based in [my]0-i own mind , would be . ” “[336-my lady] But , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , it might convince [him]113-mr. gray , ” [I]336-my lady said , with perhaps injudicious perseverance . “[336-my lady] And why should [he]113-mr. gray be convinced ? ” [she]336-my lady asked , with gentle inquiry in [her]336-my lady tone . “[113-mr. gray] [He]113-mr. gray has only to acquiesce . Though [he]113-mr. gray is appointed by [Mr. Croxton]214-mr. croxton , [I]0-i am [the lady of the manor]2054-the lady of the manor , as [he]113-mr. gray must know . But it is with [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner that [I]0-i must have to do about [this unfortunate lad Gregson]2055-this unfortunate lad gregson . [I]0-i am afraid there will be no method of making [him]113-mr. gray forget [his]113-mr. gray unlucky knowledge . [His]113-mr. gray poor brains will be intoxicated with the sense of [his]113-mr. gray powers , without any counterbalancing principles to guide [him]113-mr. gray . [Poor fellow]1307-poor fellow ! [I]0-i am quite afraid it will end in [his]113-mr. gray being hanged ! ” The next day [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner came to apologize and explain . [He]238-mr. horner was evidently — as [I]0-i could tell from [his]238-mr. horner voice , as [he]238-mr. horner spoke to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady in [the next room]3720-the next room — extremely annoyed at [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship ’s discovery of the education [he]238-mr. horner had been giving to [this boy]3722-this boy . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady spoke with great authority , and with reasonable grounds of complaint . [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was well acquainted with [her]336-my lady thoughts on the subject , and had acted in defiance of [her]336-my lady wishes . [He]238-mr. horner acknowledged as much , and should on no account have done it , in any other instance , without [her]336-my lady leave . “[0-i] Which [I]0-i could never have granted [you]2057-you , ” said [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . But [this boy]3722-this boy had extraordinary capabilities ; would , in fact , have taught [himself]3722-this boy much that was bad , if [he]3722-this boy had not been rescued , and another direction given to [his]3722-this boy powers . And in all [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner had done , [he]238-mr. horner had had [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship ’s service in view . The business was getting almost beyond [his]238-mr. horner power , so many letters and so much account - keeping was required by the complicated state in which things were . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow felt what was coming — a reference to the mortgage for the benefit of [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord [’s Scottish estates]67-’s scottish estates , which , [she]92-lady ludlow was perfectly aware , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner considered as having been a most unwise proceeding — and [she]92-lady ludlow hastened to observe—“All[0-i] this may be very true , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner , and [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i should be [the last person to wish [you]238-mr. horner to overwork or distress [yourself]238-mr. horner]2058-the last person to wish you to overwork or distress yourself ; but of that [we]2059-we will talk another time . What [I]0-i am now anxious to remedy is , if possible , the state of this poor little [Gregson]150-harry gregson ’s mind . Would not hard work in [the fields]3171-the fields be a wholesome and excellent way of enabling [him]150-harry gregson to forget ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i was in hopes , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , that [you]336-my lady would have permitted [me]0-i to bring [him]150-harry gregson up to act as [a kind of clerk]2062-a kind of clerk , ” said [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner , jerking out [his]238-mr. horner project abruptly . “[2062-a kind of clerk] A what ? ” asked [[my]2063-a kind of — of assistant lady]336-my lady , in infinite surprise . “[2063-a kind of — of assistant] [A kind of — of assistant]2063-a kind of — of assistant , in the way of copying letters and doing up accounts . [He]150-harry gregson is already [an excellent penman and very quick at figures]2064-an excellent penman and very quick at figures . ” “[150-harry gregson] [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner , ” said [[my]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady , with dignity , “[238-mr. horner] [the son of [a poacher and vagabond]2066-a poacher and vagabond]2065-the son of a poacher and vagabond ought never to have been able to copy letters relating to [the [Hanbury]13-hanbury estates]1093-the hanbury estates ; and , at any rate , [he]150-harry gregson shall not . [I]0-i wonder how it is that , knowing the use [he]150-harry gregson has made of [his]150-harry gregson power of reading a letter , [you]2068-you should venture to propose such an employment for [him]150-harry gregson as would require [his]150-harry gregson being in [your]2068-you confidence , and [you]2068-you [the trusted agent of [this family]2070-this family]2069-the trusted agent of this family . Why , every secret ( and [every ancient and honourable family]2071-every ancient and honourable family has its secrets , as [you]2068-you know , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ) would be learnt off by heart , and repeated to [the first comer]2072-the first comer ! ” “[2072-the first comer] [I]0-i should have hoped to have trained [him]150-harry gregson , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , to understand the rules of discretion . ” “[0-i] Trained ! [Train a barn - door fowl]2074-train a barn - door fowl to be a pheasant , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ! That would be the easier task . But [you]2068-you did right to speak of discretion rather than honour . Discretion looks to the consequences of actions — honour looks to the action itself , and is an instinct rather than a virtue . After all , it is possible [you]2068-you might have trained [him]150-harry gregson to be discreet . ” [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was silent . [[My]2068-you lady]336-my lady was softened by [his]238-mr. horner not replying , and began as [she]336-my lady always did in such cases , to fear lest [she]336-my lady had been too harsh . [I]2068-you could tell that by [her]336-my lady voice and by [her]336-my lady next speech , as well as if [I]2068-you had seen [her]336-my lady face . “[2068-you] But [I]0-i am sorry [you]2068-you are feeling the pressure of the affairs : [I]0-i am quite aware that [I]0-i have entailed much additional trouble upon [you]2068-you by some of [my]0-i measures : [I]0-i must try and provide [you]2068-you with some suitable assistance . Copying letters and doing up accounts , [I]0-i think [you]2068-you said ? ” [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner had certainly had a distant idea of turning [the little boy]3731-the little boy , in process of time , into [a clerk]3732-a clerk ; but [he]238-mr. horner had rather urged this possibility of future usefulness beyond what [he]238-mr. horner had at first intended , in speaking of it to [[my]2068-you lady]336-my lady as a palliation of [his]238-mr. horner offence , and [he]238-mr. horner certainly was very much inclined to retract [his]238-mr. horner statement that the letter - writing , or any other business , had increased , or that [he]238-mr. horner was in the slightest want of help of any kind , when [[my]2068-you lady]336-my lady after a pause of consideration , suddenly said — “[2068-you] [I]0-i have it . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo will , [I]0-i am sure , be glad to assist [you]2068-you . [I]0-i will speak to [her]215-miss galindo [myself]0-i . The payment [we]2075-we should make to [a clerk]3732-a clerk would be of real service to [her]215-miss galindo ! ” [I]215-miss galindo could hardly help echoing [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s tone of surprise as [he]238-mr. horner said — “[215-miss galindo] [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ! ” For , [you]3735-you must be told who [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was ; at least , told as much as [I]215-miss galindo know . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had lived in [the village]578-the village for many years , keeping [house]3737-house on the smallest possible means , yet always managing to maintain [a servant]3060-a servant . And [this servant]3739-this servant was invariably chosen because [she]215-miss galindo had some infirmity that made [her]215-miss galindo undesirable to [every one else]3309-every one else . [I]215-miss galindo believe [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had had [lame and blind and hump - backed maids]3741-lame and blind and hump - backed maids . [She]215-miss galindo had even at one time taken in [a girl hopelessly gone in consumption]3742-a girl hopelessly gone in consumption , because if not [she]215-miss galindo would have had to go to [the workhouse]3743-the workhouse , and not have had enough to eat . Of course [the poor creature]3744-the poor creature could not perform a single duty usually required of [a servant]3060-a servant , and [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo [herself]215-miss galindo was both [servant]3746-servant and [nurse]3747-nurse . [[Her]215-miss galindo present maid]3748-her present maid was scarcely four feet high , and bore a terrible character for ill - temper . Nobody but [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo would have kept [her]3748-her present maid ; but , as it was , [mistress]3749-mistress and [servant]3746-servant squabbled perpetually , and were , at heart , [the best of friends]3751-the best of friends . For it was one of [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s peculiarities to do all manner of kind and self - denying actions , and to say all manner of provoking things . [Lame , blind , deformed , and dwarf]3752-lame , blind , deformed , and dwarf , all came in for scoldings without number : it was only [the consumptive girl that never had heard a sharp word]3753-the consumptive girl that never had heard a sharp word . [I]215-miss galindo do n’t think [any of [[her]215-miss galindo servants]3755-her servants]3754-any of her servants liked [her]215-miss galindo the worse for [her]215-miss galindo peppery temper , and passionate odd ways , for [they]3754-any of her servants knew [her]215-miss galindo real and beautiful kindness of heart : and , besides , [she]215-miss galindo had so great a turn for humour that very often [her]215-miss galindo speeches amused as much or more than [they]3754-any of her servants irritated ; and on the other side , a piece of witty impudence from [[her]215-miss galindo servant]3756-her servant would occasionally tickle [her]215-miss galindo so much and so suddenly , that [she]215-miss galindo would burst out laughing in the middle of [her]215-miss galindo passion . But the talk about [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s choice and management of [[her]215-miss galindo servants]3755-her servants was confined to village gossip , and had never reached [[my]215-miss galindo Lady [Ludlow]92-lady ludlow]92-lady ludlow ’s ears , though doubtless [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was well acquainted with it . What [[my]215-miss galindo lady]336-my lady knew of [her]215-miss galindo amounted to this . It was the custom in those days for [the wealthy ladies of [the county]3101-the county]3759-the wealthy ladies of the county to set on foot [a repository]3761-a repository , as it was called , in [the assize - town]3762-the assize - town . [The ostensible manager of this repository]3763-the ostensible manager of this repository was generally [a decayed gentlewoman]3764-a decayed gentlewoman , [[a clergyman]3107-a clergyman ’s widow]3766-a clergyman ’s widow , or so forth . [She]215-miss galindo was , however , controlled by [a committee of [ladies]824-ladies]3767-a committee of ladies ; and paid by [them]3767-a committee of ladies in proportion to the amount of goods [she]215-miss galindo sold ; and these goods were the small manufactures of [ladies of little or no fortune , whose names , if they chose it , were only signified by initials]3769-ladies of little or no fortune , whose names , if they chose it , were only signified by initials . Poor water - colour drawings , indigo and Indian ink ; screens , ornamented with moss and dried leaves ; paintings on velvet , and such faintly ornamental works were displayed on one side of [the shop]3770-the shop . It was always reckoned a mark of characteristic gentility in [the repository]3771-the repository , to have only common heavy - framed sash - windows , which admitted very little light , so [I]215-miss galindo never was quite certain of the merit of these Works of Art as they were entitled . But , on the other side , where the Useful Work placard was put up , there was a great variety of articles , of whose unusual excellence every one might judge . Such fine sewing , and stitching , and button - holing ! Such bundles of soft delicate knitted stockings and socks ; and , above all , in [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow ’s eyes , such hanks of the finest spun flaxen thread ! And the most delicate dainty work of all was done by [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , as [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow very well knew . Yet , for all [their]3767-a committee of ladies fine sewing , it sometimes happened that [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s patterns were of an old - fashioned kind ; and the dozen nightcaps , maybe , on the materials for which [she]215-miss galindo had expended bona - fide money , and on the making - up , no little time and eyesight , would lie for months in a yellow neglected heap ; and at such times , it was said , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was more amusing than usual , more full of dry drollery and humour ; just as at the times when an order came in to [X.]216-x. ( the initial [she]215-miss galindo had chosen ) for a stock of well - paying things , [she]215-miss galindo sat and stormed at [[her]215-miss galindo servant]3756-her servant as [she]215-miss galindo stitched away . [She]215-miss galindo [herself]215-miss galindo explained [her]215-miss galindo practice in this way : — “[215-miss galindo] When everything goes wrong , [one]927-one would give up breathing if [one]927-one could not lighten [ones]927-one heart by a joke . But when [I]0-i ’ve to sit still from morning till night , [I]0-i must have something to stir [my]0-i blood , or [I]0-i should go off into an apoplexy ; so [I]0-i set to , and quarrel with [Sally]217-sally . ” Such were [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s means and manner of living in [[her]215-miss galindo own house]1216-her own house . Out of doors , and in [the village]578-the village , [she]215-miss galindo was not popular , although [she]215-miss galindo would have been sorely missed had [she]215-miss galindo left [the place]437-the place . But [she]215-miss galindo asked too many [home]586-home questions ( not to say impertinent ) respecting the domestic economies ( for even [the very poor]3777-the very poor liked to spend [their]3777-the very poor bit of money [their]3777-the very poor own way ) , and would open cupboards to find out hidden extravagances , and question closely respecting the weekly amount of butter , till one day [she]215-miss galindo met with what would have been a rebuff to [any other person]3778-any other person , but which [she]215-miss galindo rather enjoyed than otherwise . [She]215-miss galindo was going into [a cottage]3779-a cottage , and in the doorway met [the good woman]1351-the good woman chasing out a duck , and apparently unconscious of [[her]215-miss galindo visitor]3781-her visitor . “[217-sally] Get out , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ! ” [she]0-i cried , addressing the duck . “[215-miss galindo] Get out ! O , [I]0-i ask [your]215-miss galindo pardon , ” [she]0-i continued , as if seeing [the lady]1342-the lady for the first time . “[0-i] It ’s only that weary duck will come in . Get out [Miss Gal]218-miss gal — — ” ( to the duck ) . “[218-miss gal] And so [you]215-miss galindo call it after [me]0-i , do [you]215-miss galindo ? ” inquired [[her]215-miss galindo visitor]3781-her visitor . “[215-miss galindo] O , yes , [ma’am]2079-ma’am ; [[my]0-i master]2012-my master would have it so , for [he]2012-my master said , sure enough the unlucky bird was always poking [herself]0-i where [she]0-i was not wanted . ” “[2012-my master] Ha , ha ! very good ! And so [[your]215-miss galindo master]2081-your master is [a wit]2082-a wit , is [he]2081-your master ?
