Well ! tell [him]2081-your master to come up and speak to [me]0-i to - night about [[my]0-i parlour chimney]2083-my parlour chimney , for there is no one like [him]2081-your master for chimney doctoring . ” And [the master]3784-the master went up , and was so won over by [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s merry ways , and sharp insight into the mysteries of [his]3784-the master various kinds of business ( [he]3784-the master was [a mason]3785-a mason , [chimney - sweeper , and ratcatcher]3786-chimney - sweeper , and ratcatcher ) , that [he]3784-the master came [home]586-home and abused [[his]3784-the master wife]3072-his wife the next time [she]3072-his wife called [the duck]3789-the duck the name by which [he]3784-the master [himself]3784-the master had christened [her]3789-the duck . But odd as [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was in general , [she]215-miss galindo could be as well - bred [a lady]3790-a lady as [any one]624-any one when [she]215-miss galindo chose . And choose [she]215-miss galindo always did when [[my]2081-your master Lady [Ludlow]92-lady ludlow]333-my lady ludlow was by . Indeed , [I]2081-your master do n’t know [the man]413-the man , [woman]3794-woman , or [child]3053-child , that did not instinctively turn out its best side to [[her]215-miss galindo ladyship]3041-her ladyship . So [she]215-miss galindo had no notion of the qualities which , [I]2081-your master am sure , made [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner think that [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo would be most unmanageable as [a clerk]3732-a clerk , and heartily wish that the idea had never come into [[my]2081-your master lady]336-my lady ’s head . But there it was ; and [he]238-mr. horner had annoyed [[her]215-miss galindo ladyship]3041-her ladyship already more than [he]238-mr. horner liked to - day , so [he]238-mr. horner could not directly contradict [her]215-miss galindo , but only urge difficulties which [he]238-mr. horner hoped might prove insuperable . But every one of [them]3800-them [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow knocked down . Letters to copy ? Doubtless . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo could come up to [the Hall]501-the hall ; [she]215-miss galindo should have [a room to [herself]215-miss galindo]3802-a room to herself ; [she]215-miss galindo wrote a beautiful hand ; and writing would save [her]215-miss galindo eyesight . “[2081-your master] Capability with regard to accounts ? ” [[My]2081-your master lady]336-my lady would answer for that too ; and for more than [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner seemed to think it necessary to inquire about . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was by birth and breeding [a lady of the strictest honour]3804-a lady of the strictest honour , and would , if possible , forget the substance of any letters that passed through [her]215-miss galindo hands ; at any rate , [no one]590-no one would ever hear of them again from [her]215-miss galindo . “[2081-your master] Remuneration ? ” Oh ! as for that , [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow would [herself]92-lady ludlow take care that it was managed in the most delicate manner possible . [She]92-lady ludlow would send to invite [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo to tea at [the Hall]501-the hall that very afternoon , if [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner would only give [[her]215-miss galindo ladyship]3041-her ladyship the slightest idea of the average length of time that [[my]2081-your master lady]336-my lady was to request [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo to sacrifice to [her]215-miss galindo daily . “[2081-your master] Three hours ! Very well . ” [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner looked very grave as [he]238-mr. horner passed the windows of [the room where [I]0-i lay]3809-the room where i lay . [I]0-i do n’t think [he]238-mr. horner liked the idea of [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo as [a clerk]3732-a clerk . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow ’s invitations were like royal commands . Indeed , [the village]578-the village was too quiet to allow [the inhabitants]1776-the inhabitants to have many evening engagements of any kind . Now and then , [Mr.]3813-mr. and [Mrs. Horner]219-mrs. horner gave a tea and supper to [the principal tenants]3814-the principal tenants and [[their]3814-the principal tenants wives]3815-their wives , to which [the clergyman]376-the clergyman was invited , and [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott , and [one or two other spinsters]3817-one or two other spinsters and [widows]3818-widows . The glory of the supper - table on these occasions was invariably furnished by [[her]215-miss galindo ladyship]3041-her ladyship : it was a cold roasted peacock , with [his]376-the clergyman tail stuck out as if in life . [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott would take up the whole morning arranging the feathers in the proper semicircle , and was always pleased with the wonder and admiration it excited . It was considered a due reward and fitting compliment to [her]215-miss galindo exertions that [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner always took [her]215-miss galindo in to supper , and placed [her]215-miss galindo opposite to the magnificent dish , at which [she]215-miss galindo sweetly smiled all the time [they]3820-they were at table . But since [Mrs. Horner]219-mrs. horner had had the paralytic stroke these parties had been given up ; and [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo wrote a note to [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow in reply to [her]219-mrs. horner invitation , saying that [she]215-miss galindo was entirely disengaged , and would have great pleasure in doing [herself]215-miss galindo the honour of waiting upon [[her]215-miss galindo ladyship]3041-her ladyship . [Whoever visited [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady]3822-whoever visited my lady took [their]3822-whoever visited my lady meals with [her]215-miss galindo , sitting on the dais , in the presence of all [[my]0-i former companions]3824-my former companions . So [I]0-i did not see [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo until some time after tea ; as [the young gentlewomen]3825-the young gentlewomen had had to bring [her]215-miss galindo [their]3825-the young gentlewomen sewing and spinning , to hear the remarks of [so competent a judge]3826-so competent a judge . At length [[her]215-miss galindo ladyship]3041-her ladyship brought [[her]215-miss galindo visitor]3781-her visitor into [the room where [I]0-i lay,—it]3829-the room where i lay,—it was one of [my]0-i bad days , [I]0-i remember,—in order to have [her]215-miss galindo little bit of private conversation . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was dressed in [her]215-miss galindo best gown , [I]0-i am sure , but [I]0-i had never seen anything like it except in a picture , it was so old - fashioned . [She]215-miss galindo wore a white muslin apron , delicately embroidered , and put on a little crookedly , in order , as [she]215-miss galindo told [us]3830-us , even [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow , before the evening was over , to conceal a spot whence the colour had been discharged by a lemon - stain . This crookedness had an odd effect , especially when [I]0-i saw that it was intentional ; indeed , [she]215-miss galindo was so anxious about [her]215-miss galindo apron ’s right adjustment in the wrong place , that [she]215-miss galindo told [us]3830-us straight out why [she]215-miss galindo wore it so , and asked [[her]215-miss galindo ladyship]3041-her ladyship if the spot was properly hidden , at the same time lifting up [her]215-miss galindo apron and showing [her]3041-her ladyship how large it was . “[0-i] When [[my]0-i father]309-my father was alive , [I]0-i always took [his]309-my father right arm , so , and used to remove any spotted or discoloured breadths to the left side , if it was a walking - dress . That ’s the convenience of [a gentleman]1283-a gentleman . But [widows]3818-widows and [spinsters]2087-spinsters must do what [they]2088-they can . Ah , [[my]0-i dear]3052-my dear ( to [me]0-i ) ! when [you]2090-you are reckoning up the blessings in [your]2090-you lot,—though [you]2090-you may think it a hard one in some respects,—don’t forget how little [your]2090-you stockings want darning , as [you]2090-you are obliged to lie down so much ! [I]0-i would rather knit two pairs of stockings than darn one , any day . ” “[0-i] Have [you]0-i been doing any of [your]0-i beautiful knitting lately ? ” asked [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , who had now arranged [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo in the pleasantest chair , and taken [her]336-my lady own little wicker - work one , and , having [her]336-my lady work in [her]336-my lady hands , was ready to try and open the subject . “[0-i] No , and alas ! [[your]0-i ladyship]3058-your ladyship . It is partly the hot weather ’s fault , for [people]302-people seem to forget that winter must come ; and partly , [I]0-i suppose , that [every one]1255-every one is stocked who has the money to pay four - and - sixpence a pair for stockings . ” “[0-i] Then may [I]0-i ask if [you]0-i have any time in [your]0-i active days at liberty ? ” said [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , drawing a little nearer to [her]336-my lady proposal , which [I]0-i fancy [she]336-my lady found it a little awkward to make . “[0-i] Why , [the village]578-the village keeps [me]0-i busy , [[your]0-i ladyship]3058-your ladyship , when [I]0-i have neither knitting or sewing to do . [You]3058-your ladyship know [I]0-i took [X.]216-x. for [my]0-i letter at [the repository]3771-the repository , because it stands for [Xantippe , who was a great scold in old times]2097-xantippe , who was a great scold in old times , as [I]0-i have learnt . But [I]0-i ’m sure [I]0-i do n’t know how [the world]866-the world would get on without scolding , [[your]0-i ladyship]3058-your ladyship . It would go to sleep , and the sun would stand still . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t think [I]0-i could bear to scold , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , ” said [[her]0-i ladyship]3041-her ladyship , smiling . “[215-miss galindo] No ! because [[your]0-i ladyship]3058-your ladyship has [people]302-people to do it for [you]0-i . Begging [your]0-i pardon , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , it seems to [me]0-i the generality of [people]302-people may be divided into [saints]2104-saints , scolds , and [sinners]2105-sinners . Now , [[your]0-i ladyship]3058-your ladyship is [a saint]2107-a saint , because [you]0-i have a sweet and holy nature , in the first place ; and have [people]302-people to do [your]0-i anger and vexation for [you]0-i , in the second place . And [Jonathan Walker]220-jonathan walker is [a sinner]2109-a sinner , because [he]220-jonathan walker is sent to [prison]3153-prison . But here am [I]0-i , half way , having but a poor kind of disposition at best , and yet hating sin , and all that leads to it , such as wasting , and extravagance , and gossiping,—and yet all this lies right under [my]0-i nose in [the village]578-the village , and [I]0-i am not saint enough to be vexed at it ; and so [I]0-i scold . And though [I]0-i had rather be [a saint]2107-a saint , yet [I]0-i think [I]0-i do good in [my]0-i way . ” “[0-i] No doubt [you]0-i do , dear [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , ” said [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow . “[0-i] But [I]0-i am sorry to hear that there is so much that is bad going on in [the village,—very]2113-the village,—very sorry . ” “[0-i] O , [[your]0-i ladyship]3058-your ladyship ! then [I]0-i am sorry [I]0-i brought it out . It was only by way of saying , that when [I]0-i have no particular work to do at [home]586-home , [I]0-i take a turn abroad , and set [[my]0-i neighbours]2116-my neighbours to rights , just by way of steering clear of [Satan]221-satan . For [Satan]221-satan finds some mischief still For idle hands to do , [you]0-i know , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . ” There was no leading into the subject by delicate degrees , for [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was evidently so fond of talking , that , if asked a question , [she]215-miss galindo made [her]215-miss galindo answer so long , that before [she]215-miss galindo came to an end of it , [she]215-miss galindo had wandered far away from the original starting point . So [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow plunged at once into what [she]92-lady ludlow had to say . “[336-my lady] [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , [I]0-i have a great favour to ask of [you]215-miss galindo . ” “[336-my lady] [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady , [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could tell [you]336-my lady what a pleasure it is to hear [you]336-my lady say so , ” replied [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , almost with tears in [her]215-miss galindo eyes ; so glad were [we]3835-we all to do anything for [[her]215-miss galindo ladyship]3041-her ladyship , which could be called a free service and not merely a duty . “[336-my lady] It is this . [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner tells [me]0-i that the business - letters , relating to [the estate]582-the estate , are multiplying so much that [he]238-mr. horner finds it impossible to copy them all [himself]238-mr. horner , and [I]0-i therefore require the services of [some confidential and discreet person]2120-some confidential and discreet person to copy these letters , and occasionally to go through certain accounts . Now , there is [a very pleasant little sitting - room very near to [[Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s office]2122-mr. horner ’s office]2121-a very pleasant little sitting - room very near to mr. horner ’s office ( [you]2123-you know [[Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s office]2122-mr. horner ’s office — on the other side of [the stone hall]2125-the stone hall ? ) , and if [I]0-i could prevail upon [you]2123-you to come here to breakfast and afterwards sit [there]559-there for three hours every morning , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner should bring or send [you]2123-you the papers — ” [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow stopped . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s countenance had fallen . There was some great obstacle in [her]92-lady ludlow mind to [her]92-lady ludlow wish for obliging [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow . “[238-mr. horner] What would [Sally]217-sally do ? ” [she]92-lady ludlow asked at length . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow had not a notion who [Sally]217-sally was . Nor if [she]92-lady ludlow had had a notion , would [she]92-lady ludlow have had a conception of the perplexities that poured into [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s mind , at the idea of leaving [[her]92-lady ludlow rough forgetful dwarf]3837-her rough forgetful dwarf without the perpetual monitorship of [[her]92-lady ludlow mistress]3838-her mistress . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow , accustomed to [a household where everything went on noiselessly , perfectly , and by clockwork , conducted by a number of highly - paid , well - chosen , and accomplished servants]3839-a household where everything went on noiselessly , perfectly , and by clockwork , conducted by a number of highly - paid , well - chosen , and accomplished servants , had not a conception of the nature of the rough material from which [[her]92-lady ludlow servants]3755-her servants came . Besides , in [[her]92-lady ludlow establishment]3841-her establishment , so that the result was good , [no one]590-no one inquired if the small economies had been observed in the production . Whereas every penny — every halfpenny , was of consequence to [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ; and visions of squandered drops of milk and wasted crusts of bread filled [her]92-lady ludlow mind with dismay . But [she]92-lady ludlow swallowed all [her]92-lady ludlow apprehensions down , out of [her]92-lady ludlow regard for [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow , and desire to be of service to [her]92-lady ludlow . [No one]590-no one knows how great a trial it was to [her]92-lady ludlow when [she]92-lady ludlow thought of [Sally]217-sally , unchecked and unscolded for three hours every morning . But all [she]92-lady ludlow said was — “[238-mr. horner] ‘ [Sally]217-sally , go to [the Deuce]2127-the deuce . ’ [I]0-i beg [your]2128-you pardon , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , if [I]0-i was talking to [myself]0-i ; it ’s a habit [I]0-i have got into of keeping [my]0-i tongue in practice , and [I]0-i am not quite aware when [I]0-i do it . Three hours every morning ! [I]0-i shall be only too proud to do what [I]0-i can for [[your]2128-you ladyship]3058-your ladyship ; and [I]0-i hope [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner will not be too impatient with [me]0-i at first . [You]2128-you know , perhaps , that [I]0-i was nearly being [an authoress]2131-an authoress once , and that seems as if [I]0-i was destined to ‘ employ [my]0-i time in writing . ’ ” “[2131-an authoress] No , indeed ; [we]2132-we must return to the subject of the clerkship afterwards , if [you]2128-you please . [An authoress]2131-an authoress , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ! [You]2128-you surprise [me]0-i ! ” “[2128-you] But , indeed , [I]0-i was . [All]3505-all was quite ready . [Doctor Burney]222-doctor burney used to teach [me]0-i music : not that [I]0-i ever could learn , but it was a fancy of [[my]0-i poor father]337-my poor father ’s . And [[his]337-my poor father daughter]702-his daughter wrote a book , and [they]2137-they said [she]702-his daughter was but [a very young lady]2138-a very young lady , and nothing but [[a music - master]2139-a music - master ’s daughter]2140-a music - master ’s daughter ; so why should not [I]0-i try ? ” “[2137-they] Well ? ” “[2137-they] Well ! [I]0-i got paper and half - a - hundred good pens , a bottle of ink , all ready — ” “[0-i] And then — ” “[0-i] O , it ended in [my]0-i having nothing to say , when [I]0-i sat down to write . But sometimes , when [I]0-i get hold of a book , [I]0-i wonder why [I]0-i let such a poor reason stop [me]0-i . It does not others . ” “[0-i] But [I]0-i think it was very well it did , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , ” said [[her]215-miss galindo ladyship]3041-her ladyship . “[215-miss galindo] [I]0-i am extremely against women usurping [men]3110-men ’s employments , as [they]3110-men are very apt to do . But perhaps , after all , the notion of writing a book improved [your]2142-your hand . It is one of the most legible [I]0-i ever saw . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i despise z ’s without tails , ” said [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , with a good deal of gratified pride at [[my]2144-my lady]336-my lady ’s praise . Presently , [[my]2144-my lady]336-my lady took [her]336-my lady to look at a curious old cabinet , which [Lord Ludlow]99-lord ludlow had picked up at [the Hague]3847-the hague ; and while [they]3848-they were out of [the room]489-the room on this errand , [I]2144-my suppose the question of remuneration was settled , for [I]2144-my heard no more of it . When [they]3848-they came back , [they]3848-they were talking of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was unsparing in [her]215-miss galindo expressions of opinion about [him]2144-my : going much farther than [[my]2144-my lady]336-my lady — in [her]215-miss galindo language , at least . “[2144-my] [A little blushing man like [him]2144-my , who ca n’t say bo to a goose without hesitating and colouring , to come to [this village]2145-this village — which is as good [a village]1214-a village as ever lived — and cry [us]2147-us down for a set of [sinners]2105-sinners , as if [we]2147-us had all committed murder and [that other thing!—I]2149-that other thing!—i have no patience with [him]2144-my , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady]2143-a little blushing man like him , who ca n’t say bo to a goose without hesitating and colouring , to come to this village — which is as good a village as ever lived — and cry us down for a set of sinners , as if we had all committed murder and that other thing!—i have no patience with him , my lady . And then , how is [he]2144-my to help [us]2147-us to [heaven]2151-heaven , by teaching [us]2147-us [our]2147-us , a b , ab — b a , ba ? And yet , by all accounts , that ’s to save [poor children]2152-poor children ’s souls . O , [I]0-i knew [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship would agree with [me]0-i . [I]0-i am sure [[my]0-i mother]312-my mother was as good a creature as ever breathed the blessed air ; and if [she]312-my mother ’s not gone to [heaven]2151-heaven [I]0-i do n’t want to go [there]559-there ; and [she]312-my mother could not spell a letter decently . And does [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray think [God]133-god took note of that ? ” “[113-mr. gray] [I]0-i was sure [you]336-my lady would agree with [me]0-i , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , ” said [[my]336-my lady lady]336-my lady . “[336-my lady] [You]336-my lady and [I]0-i can remember how this talk about education — [Rousseau]171-jacques , and [his]2157-his writings — stirred up [the French people]2158-the french people to [their]2158-the french people Reign of Terror , and all those bloody scenes . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m afraid that [Rousseau]171-jacques and [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray are birds of a feather , ” replied [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , shaking [her]215-miss galindo head . “[0-i] And yet there is some good in [the young man]1343-the young man too . [He]1343-the young man sat up all night with [Billy Davis]223-billy davis , when [[his]1343-the young man wife]3072-his wife was fairly worn out with nursing [him]1343-the young man . ” “[1343-the young man] Did [he]1343-the young man , indeed ! ” said [[my]1343-the young man lady]336-my lady , [her]336-my lady face lighting up , as it always did when [she]336-my lady heard of any kind or generous action , no matter who performed it . “[1343-the young man] What a pity [he]1343-the young man is bitten with these new revolutionary ideas , and is so much for disturbing the established order of society ! ” When [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo went , [she]215-miss galindo left so favourable an impression of [her]215-miss galindo visit on [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , that [she]215-miss galindo said to [me]0-i with a pleased smile — “[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i have provided [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner with [a far better clerk than [he]238-mr. horner would have made of [that lad]1284-that lad [Gregson]150-harry gregson in twenty years]2161-a far better clerk than he would have made of that lad gregson in twenty years . CHAPTER X. The next morning , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo made [her]215-miss galindo appearance , and , by some mistake , unusual to [[my]0-i lady ’s well - trained servants]3855-my lady ’s well - trained servants , was shown into [the room where [I]0-i was trying to walk]3856-the room where i was trying to walk ; for a certain amount of exercise was prescribed for [me]0-i , painful although the exertion had become . [She]215-miss galindo brought a little basket along with [her]215-miss galindo and while [the footman]1170-the footman was gone to inquire [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s wishes ( for [I]0-i do n’t think that [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow expected [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo so soon to assume [her]215-miss galindo clerkship ; nor , indeed , had [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner any work of any kind ready for [[his]238-mr. horner new assistant]3859-his new assistant to do ) , [she]215-miss galindo launched out into conversation with [me]0-i . “[0-i] It was a sudden summons , [[my]0-i dear]3052-my dear ! However , as [I]0-i have often said to [myself]0-i , ever since an occasion long ago , if [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow ever honours [me]0-i by asking for [my]0-i right hand , [I]0-i ’ll cut it off , and wrap the stump up so tidily [she]92-lady ludlow shall never find out it bleeds . But , if [I]0-i had had a little more time , [I]0-i could have mended [my]0-i pens better . [You]2167-you see , [I]0-i have had to sit up pretty late to get these sleeves made”—and [she]92-lady ludlow took out of [her]92-lady ludlow basket a pail of brown - holland over - sleeves , very much such as [[a grocer]3860-a grocer ’s apprentice]3861-a grocer ’s apprentice wears—“and[0-i] [I]0-i had only time to make seven or eight pens , out of some quills [Farmer Thomson]224-farmer thomson gave [me]0-i last autumn . As for ink , [I]0-i ’m thankful to say , that ’s always ready ; an ounce of steel filings , an ounce of nut - gall , and a pint of water ( tea , if [you]2167-you ’re extravagant , which , thank [Heaven]165-heaven ! [I]0-i ’m not ) , put all in a bottle , and hang it up behind [the house]3047-the house door , so that the whole gets a good shaking every time [you]2167-you slam it to — and even if [you]2167-you are in a passion and bang it , as [Sally]217-sally and [I]0-i often do , it is all the better for it — and there ’s [my]0-i ink ready for use ; ready to write [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s will with , if need be . ” “[215-miss galindo] O , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ! ” said [I]215-miss galindo , “[215-miss galindo] do n’t talk so [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s will ! and [she]336-my lady not dead yet . ” “[336-my lady] And if [she]336-my lady were , what would be the use of talking of making [her]336-my lady will ? Now , if [you]217-sally were [Sally]217-sally , [I]0-i should say , ‘ Answer [me]0-i that , [you]217-sally goose ! ’ But , as [you]217-sally ’re [a relation of [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s]2171-a relation of my lady ’s , [I]0-i must be civil , and only say , ‘ [I]0-i ca n’t think how [you]217-sally can talk so like [a fool]2173-a fool ! ’ To be sure , poor thing , [you]217-sally ’re lame ! ” [I]238-mr. horner do not know how long [she]336-my lady would have gone on ; but [[my]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady came in , and [I]238-mr. horner , released from [my]238-mr. horner duty of entertaining [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , made [my]238-mr. horner limping way into [the next room]3720-the next room . To tell the truth , [I]238-mr. horner was rather afraid of [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s tongue , for [I]238-mr. horner never knew what [she]336-my lady would say next . After a while [[my]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady came , and began to look in the bureau for something : and as [she]215-miss galindo looked [she]215-miss galindo said—“I[238-mr. horner] think [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner must have made some mistake , when [he]238-mr. horner said [he]238-mr. horner had so much work that [he]238-mr. horner almost required [a clerk]3732-a clerk , for this morning [he]238-mr. horner can not find anything for [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo to do ; and there [she]215-miss galindo is , sitting with [her]215-miss galindo pen behind [her]215-miss galindo ear , waiting for something to write . [I]0-i am come to find [her]215-miss galindo [[my]0-i mother]312-my mother ’s letters , for [I]0-i should like to have a fair copy made of them . O , here they are : do n’t trouble [yourself]2176-yourself , [[my]0-i dear child]2177-my dear child . ” When [[my]215-miss galindo lady]336-my lady returned again , [she]336-my lady sat down and began to talk of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray . “[215-miss galindo] [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo says [she]215-miss galindo saw [him]238-mr. horner going to hold a prayer - meeting in [a cottage]3779-a cottage . Now that really makes [me]0-i unhappy , it is so like what [Mr. Wesley]225-mr. wesley used to do in [my]0-i younger days ; and since then [we]2179-we have had rebellion in [the American colonies]2180-the american colonies and the French Revolution . [You]2181-you may depend upon it , [[my]0-i dear]3052-my dear , making religion and education common — vulgarising them , as it were — is a bad thing for [a nation]2183-a nation . [A man who hears prayers]2184-a man who hears prayers read in [the cottage]584-the cottage where [he]2184-a man who hears prayers has just supped on bread and bacon , forgets the respect due to [a church]445-a church : [he]2184-a man who hears prayers begins to think that [one place]2187-one place is as good as another , and , by - and - by , that [one person]2188-one person is as good as another ; and after that , [I]0-i always find that [people]302-people begin to talk of [their]302-people rights , instead of thinking of [their]302-people duties . [I]0-i wish [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had been more tractable , and had left well alone . What do [you]2181-you think [I]0-i heard this morning ? Why that [the Home Hill estate]2190-the home hill estate , which niches into [the Hanbury property]1085-the hanbury property , was bought by [a Baptist baker]2192-a baptist baker from [Birmingham]38-birmingham ! ” “[2192-a baptist baker] [A Baptist baker]2192-a baptist baker ! ” [I]2192-a baptist baker exclaimed . [I]2192-a baptist baker had never seen [a Dissenter]3866-a dissenter , to [my]2192-a baptist baker knowledge ; but , having always heard [them]3866-a dissenter spoken of with horror , [I]2192-a baptist baker looked upon [them]3866-a dissenter almost as if [they]3866-a dissenter were rhinoceroses . [I]2192-a baptist baker wanted to see [a live Dissenter]3867-a live dissenter , [I]2192-a baptist baker believe , and yet [I]2192-a baptist baker wished it were over . [I]2192-a baptist baker was almost surprised when [I]2192-a baptist baker heard that any of [them]3866-a dissenter were engaged in such peaceful occupations as baking . “[2192-a baptist baker] Yes ! so [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner tells [me]0-i . [A Mr. Lambe]226-a mr. lambe , [I]0-i believe . But , at any rate , [he]226-a mr. lambe is [a Baptist]2194-a baptist , and has been in trade . What with [his]226-a mr. lambe schismatism and [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s methodism , [I]0-i am afraid all the primitive character of [this place]2195-this place will vanish . ” From what [I]2196-i could hear , [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray seemed to be taking [his]113-mr. gray own way ; at any rate , more than [he]113-mr. gray had done when [he]113-mr. gray first came to [the village]578-the village , when [his]113-mr. gray natural timidity had made [him]113-mr. gray defer to [[my]2196-i lady]336-my lady , and seek [her]336-my lady consent and sanction before embarking in any new plan . But newness was a quality [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow especially disliked . Even in the fashions of dress and furniture , [she]92-lady ludlow clung to the old , to the modes which had prevailed when [she]92-lady ludlow was young ; and though [she]92-lady ludlow had a deep personal regard for [Queen Charlotte]106-queen charlotte ( to whom , as [I]2196-i have already said , [she]92-lady ludlow had been [maid - of - honour]794-maid - of - honour ) , yet there was a tinge of Jacobitism about [her]92-lady ludlow , such as made [her]92-lady ludlow extremely dislike to hear [Prince Charles Edward]131-edward called [the young Pretender]3871-the young pretender , as [many loyal people]3872-many loyal people did in those days , and made [her]92-lady ludlow fond of telling of the thorn - tree in [[[my]2196-i lord]3081-my lord ’s park in [Scotland]1-scotland , which had been planted by [bonny Queen Mary]227-mary [herself]227-mary , and before which [every guest in [the Castle of Monkshaven]3876-the castle of monkshaven]3875-every guest in the castle of monkshaven]3874-my lord ’s park in scotland , which had been planted by bonny queen mary herself , and before which every guest in the castle of monkshaven was expected to stand bare - headed , out of respect to the memory and misfortunes of [the royal planter]3877-the royal planter . [We]3878-we might play at cards , if [we]3878-we so chose , on a Sunday ; at least , [I]2196-i suppose [we]3878-we might , for [[my]2196-i lady]336-my lady and [Mr. Mountford]112-mr. mountford used to do so often when [I]2196-i first went . But [we]3878-we must neither play cards , nor read , nor sew on the fifth of November and on the thirtieth of January , but must go to [church]668-church , and meditate all the rest of the day — and very hard work meditating was . [I]2196-i would far rather have scoured [a room]3231-a room . That was the reason , [I]2196-i suppose , why a passive life was seen to be better discipline for [me]2196-i than an active one . But [I]2196-i am wandering away from [[my]2196-i lady]336-my lady , and [her]336-my lady dislike to all innovation . Now , it seemed to [me]2196-i , as far as [I]2196-i heard , that [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray was full of nothing but new things , and that what [he]2196-i first did was to attack [all [our]3878-we established institutions]3883-all our established institutions , both in [the village]578-the village and [the parish]571-the parish , and also in [the nation]3886-the nation . To be sure , [I]2196-i heard of [his]2196-i ways of going on principally from [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , who was apt to speak more strongly than accurately . “[2196-i] There [he]2196-i goes , ” [she]0-i said , “[2196-i] clucking up [the children]394-the children just like an old hen , and trying to teach [them]394-the children about [their]394-the children salvation and [their]394-the children souls , and [I]0-i do n’t know what — things that it is just blasphemy to speak about out of [church]668-church . And [he]2196-i potters [old people]2199-old people about reading [their]2199-old people Bibles . [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do n’t want to speak disrespectfully about the Holy Scriptures , but [I]0-i found [old Job Horton]228-old job horton busy reading [his]228-old job horton Bible yesterday . Says [I]0-i , ‘ What are [you]228-old job horton reading , and where did [you]228-old job horton get it , and who gave it [you]228-old job horton ? ’ So [he]228-old job horton made answer , ‘ That [he]228-old job horton was reading [Susannah]229-susannah and [the Elders]2200-the elders , for that [he]228-old job horton had read [Bel]230-bel and [the Dragon]2201-the dragon till [he]228-old job horton could pretty near say it off by heart , and they were two as pretty stories as ever [he]228-old job horton had read , and that it was a caution to [him]228-old job horton what [bad old chaps there]2202-bad old chaps there were in [the world]866-the world . ’ Now , as [Job]228-old job horton is bedridden , [I]0-i do n’t think [he]228-old job horton is likely to meet with [the Elders]2200-the elders , and [I]0-i say that [I]0-i think repeating [his]228-old job horton Creed , the Commandments , and the Lord ’s Prayer , and , maybe , throwing in a verse of the Psalms , if [he]228-old job horton wanted a bit of a change , would have done [him]228-old job horton far more good than [his]228-old job horton pretty stories , as [he]228-old job horton called them . And what ’s the next thing [[our]2205-our young parson]2206-our young parson does ? Why [he]228-old job horton tries to make [us]2205-our all feel pitiful for [the black slaves]2207-the black slaves , and leaves little pictures of [negroes]2208-negroes about , with the question printed below , ‘ Am [I]0-i not [a man]725-a man and [a brother]2210-a brother ? ’ just as if [I]0-i was to be [hail - fellow - well - met with [every negro footman]2212-every negro footman]2211-hail - fellow - well - met with every negro footman . [They]2212-every negro footman do say [he]228-old job horton takes no sugar in [his]228-old job horton tea , because [he]228-old job horton thinks [he]228-old job horton sees spots of blood in it . Now [I]0-i call that superstition . ” The next day it was a still worse story . “[0-i] Well , [[my]0-i dear]3052-my dear ! and how are [you]3052-my dear ? [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady sent [me]0-i in to sit a bit with [you]3052-my dear , while [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner looks out some papers for [me]0-i to copy . Between [ourselves]2215-ourselves , [Mr. Steward Horner]238-mr. horner does not like having [me]0-i for [a clerk]3732-a clerk . It is all very well [he]238-mr. horner does not ; for , if [he]238-mr. horner were decently civil to [me]0-i , [I]0-i might want [a chaperone]2217-a chaperone , [you]3052-my dear know , now poor [Mrs. Horner]219-mrs. horner is dead . ” This was one of [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s grim jokes . “[219-mrs. horner] As it is , [I]0-i try to make [him]238-mr. horner forget [I]0-i ’m [a woman]3339-a woman , [I]0-i do everything as ship - shape as [a masculine man - clerk]2219-a masculine man - clerk . [I]0-i see [he]238-mr. horner ca n’t find a fault — writing good , spelling correct , sums all right . And then [he]238-mr. horner squints up at [me]0-i with the tail of [his]238-mr. horner eye , and looks glummer than ever , just because [I]0-i ’m [a woman]3339-a woman — as if [I]0-i could help that . [I]0-i have gone good lengths to set [his]238-mr. horner mind at ease . [I]0-i have stuck [my]0-i pen behind [my]0-i ear , [I]0-i have made [him]238-mr. horner a bow instead of a curtsey , [I]0-i have whistled — not a tune [I]0-i ca n’t pipe up that — nay , if [you]2221-you wo n’t tell [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , [I]0-i do n’t mind telling [you]2221-you that [I]0-i have said ‘ Confound it ! ’ and ‘ Zounds ! ’ [I]0-i ca n’t get any farther . For all that , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner wo n’t forget [I]0-i am [a lady]3790-a lady , and so [I]0-i am not half the use [I]0-i might be , and if it were not to please [[my]0-i Lady [Ludlow]92-lady ludlow]333-my lady ludlow , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner and [his]238-mr. horner books might go hang ( see how natural that came out ! ) . And there is an order for a dozen nightcaps for [a bride]2225-a bride , and [I]0-i am so afraid [I]0-i sha n’t have time to do them . Worst of all , there ’s [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray taking advantage of [my]0-i absence to seduce [Sally]217-sally ! ” “[113-mr. gray] To seduce [Sally]217-sally ! [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ! ” “[113-mr. gray] Pooh , pooh , [child]3053-child ! There ’s many a kind of seduction . [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray is seducing [Sally]217-sally to want to go to [church]668-church . There has [he]113-mr. gray been twice at [[my]0-i house]1399-my house , while [I]0-i have been away in the mornings , talking to [Sally]217-sally about the state of [her]217-sally soul and that sort of thing . But when [I]0-i found the meat all roasted to a cinder , [I]0-i said , ‘ Come , [Sally]217-sally , let ’s have no more praying when beef is down at the fire . Pray at six o’clock in the morning and nine at night , and [I]0-i wo n’t hinder [you]217-sally . ’ So [she]217-sally sauced [me]0-i , and said something about [Martha]231-martha and [Mary]227-mary , implying that , because [she]217-sally had let the beef get so overdone that [I]0-i declare [I]0-i could hardly find a bit for [[Nancy Pole]232-nancy pole ’s sick grandchild]2229-nancy pole ’s sick grandchild , [she]217-sally had chosen the better part . [I]0-i was very much put about , [I]0-i own , and perhaps [you]2230-you ’ll be shocked at what [I]0-i said — indeed , [I]0-i do n’t know if it was right [myself]0-i — but [I]0-i told [her]217-sally [I]0-i had a soul as well as [she]217-sally , and if it was to be saved by [my]0-i sitting still and thinking about salvation and never doing [my]0-i duty , [I]0-i thought [I]0-i had as good a right as [she]217-sally had to be [Mary]227-mary , and save [my]0-i soul . So , that afternoon [I]0-i sat quite still , and it was really a comfort , for [I]0-i am often too busy , [I]0-i know , to pray as [I]0-i ought . There is first [one person]2188-one person wanting [me]0-i , and then another , and [the house]3047-the house and the food and [the neighbours]2233-the neighbours to see after . So , when tea - time comes , there enters [[my]0-i maid]1538-my maid with [her]1538-my maid hump on [her]1538-my maid back , and [her]1538-my maid soul to be saved . ‘ Please , [ma’am]2079-ma’am , did [you]2079-ma’am order the pound of butter?’—‘No , [Sally]217-sally , ’ [I]0-i said , shaking [my]0-i head , ‘ this morning [I]0-i did not go round by [[Hale]233-farmer hale ’s farm]2236-hale ’s farm , and this afternoon [I]0-i have been employed in spiritual things . ’ “ Now , [[our]3887-our [Sally]217-sally]3888-our sally likes tea and bread and butter above everything , and dry bread was not to [her]217-sally taste . “[0-i] ‘ [I]0-i ’m thankful , ’ said [the impudent hussy]2237-the impudent hussy , ‘ that [you]0-i have taken a turn towards godliness . It will be [my]0-i prayers , [I]0-i trust , that ’s given it [you]0-i . ’ “ [I]2237-the impudent hussy was determined not to give [her]217-sally an opening towards the carnal subject of butter , so [she]217-sally lingered still , longing to ask leave to run for it . But [I]2237-the impudent hussy gave [her]217-sally none , and munched [my]2237-the impudent hussy dry bread [myself]2237-the impudent hussy , thinking what a famous cake [I]2237-the impudent hussy could make for [little Ben Pole]234-little ben pole with the bit of butter [we]2238-we were saving ; and when [Sally]217-sally had had [her]217-sally butterless tea , and was in none of the best of tempers because [Martha]231-martha had not bethought [herself]231-martha of the butter , [I]2237-the impudent hussy just quietly said — “[2237-the impudent hussy] ‘ Now , [Sally]217-sally , to - morrow [we]2238-we ’ll try to hash that beef well , and to remember the butter , and to work out [our]2238-we salvation all at the same time , for [I]0-i do n’t see why it ca n’t all be done , as [God]133-god has set [us]2238-we to do it all . ’ But [I]0-i heard [her]217-sally at it again about [Mary]227-mary and [Martha]231-martha , and [I]0-i have no doubt that [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray will teach [her]217-sally to consider [me]0-i a lost sheep . ” [I]113-mr. gray had heard so many little speeches about [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray from [one person]2188-one person or another , all speaking against [him]113-mr. gray , as [a mischief - maker]3890-a mischief - maker , [a setter - up of new doctrines]3891-a setter - up of new doctrines , and of a fanciful standard of life ( and [you]3892-you may be sure that , where [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow led , [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott and [Adams]104-adams were certain to follow , each in [their]3893-their different ways showing the influence [[my]113-mr. gray lady]336-my lady had over [them]3893-their ) , that [I]113-mr. gray believe [I]113-mr. gray had grown to consider [him]113-mr. gray as a very instrument of evil , and to expect to perceive in [his]113-mr. gray face marks of [his]113-mr. gray presumption , and arrogance , and impertinent interference . It was now many weeks since [I]113-mr. gray had seen [him]113-mr. gray , and when [he]113-mr. gray was one morning shown into [the blue drawing - room]3895-the blue drawing - room ( into which [I]113-mr. gray had been removed for a change ) , [I]113-mr. gray was quite surprised to see how innocent and awkward [a young man]3896-a young man [he]113-mr. gray appeared , confused even more than [I]113-mr. gray was at [our]3897-our unexpected tete - a - tete . [He]113-mr. gray looked thinner , [his]113-mr. gray eyes more eager , [his]113-mr. gray expression more anxious , and [his]113-mr. gray colour came and went more than it had done when [I]113-mr. gray had seen [him]113-mr. gray last . [I]113-mr. gray tried to make a little conversation , as [I]113-mr. gray was , to [my]113-mr. gray own surprise , more at [my]113-mr. gray ease than [he]113-mr. gray was ; but [his]113-mr. gray thoughts were evidently too much preoccupied for [him]113-mr. gray to do more than answer [me]113-mr. gray with monosyllables . Presently [[my]113-mr. gray lady]336-my lady came in . [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray twitched and coloured more than ever ; but plunged into the middle of [his]113-mr. gray subject at once . “[113-mr. gray] [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady , [I]0-i can not answer it to [my]0-i conscience , if [I]0-i allow [the children of [this village]2145-this village]2240-the children of this village to go on any longer [the little heathens that [they]2240-the children of this village are]2242-the little heathens that they are . [I]0-i must do something to alter [their]2240-the children of this village condition . [I]0-i am quite aware that [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship disapproves of many of the plans which have suggested themselves to [me]0-i ; but nevertheless [I]0-i must do something , and [I]0-i am come now to [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship to ask respectfully , but firmly , what [you]3058-your ladyship would advise [me]0-i to do . ” [His]3899-his eyes were dilated , and [I]336-my lady could almost have said they were full of tears with [his]3899-his eagerness . But [I]336-my lady am sure it is a bad plan to remind [people]302-people of decided opinions which [they]302-people have once expressed , if [you]336-my lady wish [them]302-people to modify those opinions . Now , [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had done this with [[my]336-my lady lady]336-my lady ; and though [I]336-my lady do not mean to say [she]336-my lady was obstinate , yet [she]336-my lady was not one to retract . [She]336-my lady was silent for a moment or two before [she]336-my lady replied . “[336-my lady] [You]336-my lady ask [me]0-i to suggest a remedy for an evil of the existence of which [I]0-i am not conscious , ” was [her]336-my lady answer — very coldly , very gently given . “[336-my lady] In [Mr. Mountford]112-mr. mountford ’s time [I]0-i heard no such complaints : whenever [I]0-i see [the village children]2245-the village children ( and [they]2245-the village children are not unfrequent visitors at [this house]2246-this house , on one pretext or another ) , [they]2245-the village children are well and decently behaved . ” “[2245-the village children] Oh , [madam]3119-madam , [you]3119-madam can not judge , ” [he]113-mr. gray broke in . “[2245-the village children] [They]2245-the village children are trained to respect [you]3119-madam in word and deed ; [you]3119-madam are the highest [they]2245-the village children ever look up to ; [they]2245-the village children have no notion of a higher . ” “[2245-the village children] Nay , [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , ” said [[my]113-mr. gray lady]336-my lady , smiling , “[113-mr. gray] [they]2245-the village children are as loyally disposed as [any children]2248-any children can be . [They]2245-the village children come up here every fourth of June , and drink [[his]2249-his Majesty]3185-his majesty ’s health , and have buns , and ( as [Margaret Dawson]94-margaret dawson can testify ) [they]2245-the village children take a great and respectful interest in all the pictures [I]0-i can show [them]2245-the village children of [the royal family]2251-the royal family . ” “[2245-the village children] But , [madam]3119-madam , [I]0-i think of something higher than any earthly dignities . ” [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady coloured at the mistake [she]336-my lady had made ; for [she]336-my lady [herself]336-my lady was truly pious . Yet when [she]336-my lady resumed the subject , it seemed to [me]0-i as if [her]336-my lady tone was a little sharper than before . “[0-i] Such want of reverence is , [I]0-i should say , [the clergyman]376-the clergyman ’s fault . [You]0-i must excuse [me]0-i , [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , if [I]0-i speak plainly . ” “[336-my lady] [[My]0-i Lady]336-my lady , [I]0-i want plain - speaking . [I]0-i [myself]0-i am not accustomed to those ceremonies and forms which are , [I]0-i suppose , the etiquette in [[your]0-i ladyship]3058-your ladyship ’s rank of life , and which seem to hedge [you]0-i in from any power of [mine]0-i to touch [you]0-i . Among those with whom [I]0-i have passed [my]0-i life hitherto , it has been the custom to speak plainly out what [we]2256-we have felt earnestly . So , instead of needing any apology from [[your]0-i ladyship]3058-your ladyship for straightforward speaking , [I]0-i will meet what [you]0-i say at once , and admit that it is [the clergyman]376-the clergyman ’s fault , in a great measure , when [the children of [[his]376-the clergyman parish]2260-his parish]2259-the children of his parish swear , and curse , and are brutal , and ignorant of all saving grace ; nay , [some of [them]2259-the children of his parish of the very name of [God]133-god]2261-some of them of the very name of god . And because this guilt of [mine]0-i , as [the clergyman of this parish]3120-the clergyman of this parish , lies heavy on [my]0-i soul , and every day leads but from bad to worse , till [I]0-i am utterly bewildered how to do good to [children who escape from [me]0-i as if [I]0-i were [a monster]2264-a monster , and who are growing up to be [men fit for and capable of any crime]2265-men fit for and capable of any crime , but [those requiring wit or sense]2266-those requiring wit or sense , [I]0-i come to [you]0-i , who seem to [me]0-i all - powerful , as far as material power goes — for [[your]0-i ladyship]3058-your ladyship only knows the surface of things , and barely that , that pass in [[your]0-i village]2268-your village]2263-children who escape from me as if i were a monster , and who are growing up to be men fit for and capable of any crime , but those requiring wit or sense , i come to you , who seem to me all - powerful , as far as material power goes — for your ladyship only knows the surface of things , and barely that , that pass in your village — to help [me]0-i with advice , and such outward help as [you]0-i can give . ” [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had stood up and sat down once or twice while [he]113-mr. gray had been speaking , in an agitated , nervous kind of way , and now [he]113-mr. gray was interrupted by a violent fit of coughing , after which [he]113-mr. gray trembled all over . [[My]113-mr. gray lady]336-my lady rang for a glass of water , and looked much distressed . “[113-mr. gray] [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , ” said [she]0-i , “[113-mr. gray] [I]0-i am sure [you]113-mr. gray are not well ; and that makes [you]113-mr. gray exaggerate childish faults into positive evils . It is always the case with [us]2269-us when [we]2269-us are not strong in health . [I]0-i hear of [your]113-mr. gray exerting [yourself]113-mr. gray in every direction : [you]113-mr. gray overwork [yourself]113-mr. gray , and the consequence is , that [you]113-mr. gray imagine [[us]2269-us all worse people than [we]2269-us are]2270-us all worse people than we are . ” And [[my]113-mr. gray lady]336-my lady smiled very kindly and pleasantly at [him]113-mr. gray , as [he]113-mr. gray sat , a little panting , a little flushed , trying to recover [his]113-mr. gray breath . [I]113-mr. gray am sure that now [they]3906-they were brought face to face , [she]336-my lady had quite forgotten all the offence [she]336-my lady had taken at [his]113-mr. gray doings when [she]336-my lady heard of them from [others]3078-others ; and , indeed , it was enough to soften [any one]624-any one ’s heart to see [that young , almost boyish face , looking in such anxiety and distress]3909-that young , almost boyish face , looking in such anxiety and distress . “[113-mr. gray] Oh , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , what shall [I]0-i do ? ” [he]113-mr. gray asked , as soon as [he]113-mr. gray could recover breath , and with such an air of humility , that [I]113-mr. gray am sure [no one who had seen it]3910-no one who had seen it could have ever thought [him]113-mr. gray conceited again . “[113-mr. gray] The evil of [this world]1092-this world is too strong for [me]0-i . [I]0-i can do so little . It is all in vain . It was only to - day — ” and again the cough and agitation returned . “[3052-my dear] [[My]0-i dear]3052-my dear [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , ” said [[my]3052-my dear lady]336-my lady ( the day before [I]3052-my dear could never have believed [she]336-my lady could have called [him]113-mr. gray [[My]3052-my dear dear]3052-my dear ) , “[3052-my dear] [you]113-mr. gray must take the advice of [an old woman]299-an old woman about [yourself]113-mr. gray . [You]113-mr. gray are not fit to do anything just now but attend to [your]113-mr. gray own health : rest , and see [a doctor]2275-a doctor ( but , indeed , [I]0-i will take care of that ) , and when [you]113-mr. gray are pretty strong again , [you]113-mr. gray will find that [you]113-mr. gray have been magnifying evils to [yourself]113-mr. gray . ” “[113-mr. gray] But , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , [I]0-i can not rest . The evils do exist , and the burden of [their]2277-their continuance lies on [my]0-i shoulders . [I]0-i have no place to gather [the children]394-the children together in , that [I]0-i may teach [them]394-the children the things necessary to salvation . [The rooms in [[my]0-i own house]1387-my own house]2279-the rooms in my own house are too small ; but [I]0-i have tried them . [I]0-i have money of [my]0-i own ; and , as [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship knows , [I]0-i tried to get a piece of leasehold property , on which to build [a school - house]2282-a school - house at [my]0-i own expense . [[Your]336-my lady ladyship ’s lawyer]2283-your ladyship ’s lawyer comes forward , at [your]336-my lady instructions , to enforce some old feudal right , by which no building is allowed on [leasehold property]2284-leasehold property without the sanction of [the lady of the manor]2054-the lady of the manor . It may be all very true ; but it was a cruel thing to do,—that is , if [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship had known ( which [I]0-i am sure [you]336-my lady do not ) the real moral and spiritual state of [[my]0-i poor parishioners]2287-my poor parishioners . And now [I]0-i come to [you]336-my lady to know what [I]0-i am to do . Rest ! [I]0-i can not rest , while [children whom [I]0-i could possibly save]2288-children whom i could possibly save are being left in [their]2288-children whom i could possibly save ignorance , [their]2288-children whom i could possibly save blasphemy , [their]2288-children whom i could possibly save uncleanness , [their]2288-children whom i could possibly save cruelty . It is known through [the village]578-the village that [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship disapproves of [my]0-i efforts , and opposes all [my]0-i plans . If [you]336-my lady think them wrong , foolish , ill - digested ( [I]0-i have been [a student]2291-a student , living in [a college]2292-a college , and eschewing all society but that of [pious men]2293-pious men , until now : [I]0-i may not judge for the best , in [my]0-i ignorance of this sinful human nature ) , tell [me]0-i of better plans and wiser projects for accomplishing [my]0-i end ; but do not bid [me]0-i rest , with [Satan]221-satan compassing [me]0-i round , and stealing souls away . ” “[113-mr. gray] [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , ” said [[my]113-mr. gray lady]336-my lady , “[113-mr. gray] there may be some truth in what [you]113-mr. gray have said . [I]0-i do not deny it , though [I]0-i think , in [your]113-mr. gray present state of indisposition and excitement , [you]113-mr. gray exaggerate it much . [I]0-i believe — nay , the experience of a pretty long life has convinced [me]0-i — that education is a bad thing , if given indiscriminately . It unfits the lower orders for [their]2294-their duties , the duties to which [they]2294-their are called by [God]133-god ; of submission to those placed in authority over [them]2294-their ; of contentment with that state of life to which it has pleased [God]133-god to call [them]2294-their , and of ordering [themselves]2294-their lowly and reverently to all [their]2294-their betters . [I]0-i have made this conviction of mine tolerably evident to [you]113-mr. gray ; and [I]0-i have expressed distinctly [my]0-i disapprobation of some of [your]113-mr. gray ideas . [You]113-mr. gray may imagine , then , that [I]0-i was not well pleased when [I]0-i found that [you]113-mr. gray had taken a rood or more of [[Farmer Hale]233-farmer hale ’s land]2295-farmer hale ’s land , and were laying the foundations of [a school - house]2282-a school - house . [You]113-mr. gray had done this without asking for [my]0-i permission , which , as [[Farmer Hale]233-farmer hale ’s liege lady]2297-farmer hale ’s liege lady , ought to have been obtained legally , as well as asked for out of courtesy . [I]0-i put a stop to what [I]0-i believed to be calculated to do harm to [a village]1214-a village , to a population in which , to say the least of it , [I]0-i may be disposed to take as much interest as [you]113-mr. gray can do . How can reading , and writing , and the multiplication - table ( if [you]113-mr. gray choose to go so far ) prevent blasphemy , and uncleanness , and cruelty ? Really , [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , [I]0-i hardly like to express [myself]0-i so strongly on the subject in [your]113-mr. gray present state of health , as [I]0-i should do at any other time . It seems to [me]0-i that books do little ; character much ; and character is not formed from books . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not think of character : [I]0-i think of souls . [I]0-i must get some hold upon [these children]2299-these children , or what will become of [them]2299-these children in [the next world]2300-the next world ? [I]0-i must be found to have some power beyond what [they]2299-these children have , and which [they]2299-these children are rendered capable of appreciating , before [they]2299-these children will listen to [me]0-i . At present physical force is all [they]2299-these children look up to ; and [I]0-i have none . ” “[2299-these children] Nay , [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , by [your]113-mr. gray own admission , [they]2299-these children look up to [me]0-i . ” “[2299-these children] [They]2299-these children would not do anything [[your]113-mr. gray ladyship]3058-your ladyship disliked if it was likely to come to [your]113-mr. gray knowledge ; but if [they]2299-these children could conceal it from [you]113-mr. gray , the knowledge of [your]113-mr. gray dislike to a particular line of conduct would never make [them]2299-these children cease from pursuing it . ” “[235-mr. gray”—surprise] [Mr. Gray”—surprise]235-mr. gray”—surprise in [her]3058-your ladyship air , and some little indignation—“they[235-mr. gray”—surprise] and [[their]2299-these children fathers]2302-their fathers have lived on [the Hanbury lands]2303-the hanbury lands for generations ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not help it , [madam]3119-madam . [I]0-i am telling [you]3119-madam the truth , whether [you]3119-madam believe [me]0-i or not . ” There was a pause ; [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady looked perplexed , and somewhat ruffled ; [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray as though hopeless and wearied out . “[0-i] Then , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , ” said [he]113-mr. gray , at last , rising as [he]113-mr. gray spoke , “[3119-madam] [you]3119-madam can suggest nothing to ameliorate the state of things which , [I]0-i do assure [you]3119-madam , does exist on [[your]3119-madam lands]2306-your lands , and among [[your]3119-madam tenants]2307-your tenants . It shall not be the worse for [you]3119-madam , if [you]3119-madam leave it in [my]0-i hands for a time . ” [[My]3119-madam lady]336-my lady spoke very kindly ; but [he]233-farmer hale was in too excited a state to recognize the kindness , while the idea of delay was evidently a sore irritation . [I]3119-madam heard [him]233-farmer hale say : “[3119-madam] And [I]0-i have so little time in which to do [my]0-i work . [Lord]2310-lord ! lay not this sin to [my]0-i charge . ” But [[my]113-mr. gray lady]336-my lady was speaking to the old butler , for whom , at [her]336-my lady sign , [I]113-mr. gray had rung the bell some little time before . Now [she]336-my lady turned round . “[113-mr. gray] [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , [I]0-i find [I]0-i have some bottles of Malmsey , of the vintage of seventeen hundred and seventy - eight , yet left . [Malmsey]236-malmsey , as perhaps [you]113-mr. gray know , used to be considered a specific for coughs arising from weakness . [You]113-mr. gray must permit [me]0-i to send [you]113-mr. gray half a dozen bottles , and , depend upon it , [you]113-mr. gray will take a more cheerful view of life and its duties before [you]113-mr. gray have finished them , especially if [you]113-mr. gray will be so kind as to see [Dr. Trevor]237-dr. trevor , who is coming to see [me]0-i in the course of the week . By the time [you]113-mr. gray are strong enough to work , [I]0-i will try and find some means of preventing [the children]394-the children from using such bad language , and otherwise annoying [you]113-mr. gray . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady , it is the sin , and not the annoyance . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could make [you]336-my lady understand . ” [He]113-mr. gray spoke with some impatience ; [Poor fellow]1307-poor fellow ! [he]113-mr. gray was too weak , exhausted , and nervous . “[0-i] [I]0-i am perfectly well ; [I]0-i can set to work to - morrow ; [I]0-i will do anything not to be oppressed with the thought of how little [I]0-i am doing . [I]0-i do not want [your]113-mr. gray wine . Liberty to act in the manner [I]0-i think right , will do [me]0-i far more good . But it is of no use . It is preordained that [I]0-i am to be nothing but [a cumberer of the ground]2313-a cumberer of the ground . [I]0-i beg [[your]113-mr. gray ladyship]3058-your ladyship ’s pardon for this call . ” [He]113-mr. gray stood up , and then turned dizzy . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady looked on , deeply hurt , and not a little offended , [he]113-mr. gray held out [his]113-mr. gray hand to [her]336-my lady , and [I]0-i could see that [she]336-my lady had a little hesitation before [she]336-my lady took it . [He]113-mr. gray then saw [me]0-i , [I]0-i almost think , for the first time ; and put out [his]113-mr. gray hand once more , drew it back , as if undecided , put it out again , and finally took hold of mine for an instant in [his]113-mr. gray damp , listless hand , and was gone . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow was dissatisfied with both [him]113-mr. gray and [herself]92-lady ludlow , [I]0-i was sure . Indeed , [I]0-i was dissatisfied with the result of the interview [myself]0-i . But [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady was not one to speak out [her]336-my lady feelings on the subject ; nor was [I]0-i one to forget [myself]0-i , and begin on a topic which [she]336-my lady did not begin . [She]336-my lady came to [me]0-i , and was very tender with [me]0-i ; so tender , that that , and the thoughts of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s sick , hopeless , disappointed look , nearly made [me]0-i cry . “[0-i] [You]2315-you are tired , [little one]2316-little one , ” said [[my]2315-you lady]336-my lady . “[2315-you] Go and lie down in [[my]0-i room]483-my room , and hear what [Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott and [I]0-i can decide upon in the way of strengthening dainties for [that poor young man]2318-that poor young man , who is killing [himself]2318-that poor young man with [his]2318-that poor young man over - sensitive conscientiousness . ” “[0-i] Oh , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ! ” said [I]0-i , and then [I]0-i stopped . “[0-i] Well . What ? ” asked [she]336-my lady . “[0-i] If [you]2315-you would but let [him]2318-that poor young man have [[Farmer Hale]233-farmer hale ’s barn]2320-farmer hale ’s barn at once , it would do [him]2318-that poor young man more good than all . ” “[2315-you] Pooh , pooh , [child]3053-child ! ” though [I]3053-child do n’t think [she]336-my lady was displeased , “[3053-child] [he]2318-that poor young man is not fit for more work just now . [I]0-i shall go and write for [Dr. Trevor]237-dr. trevor . ” And for the next half - hour , [we]3921-we did nothing but arrange physical comforts and cures for [poor Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray . At the end of the time , [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott said — “[237-dr. trevor] Has [[your]2315-you ladyship]3058-your ladyship heard that [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson has fallen from a tree , and broken [his]150-harry gregson thigh - bone , and is like to be a cripple for life ? ” “[150-harry gregson] [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson ! [That black - eyed lad who read [my]0-i letter]2323-that black - eyed lad who read my letter ? It all comes from over - education ! ” CHAPTER XI . But [I]2324-i do n’t see how [[my]2324-i lady]336-my lady could think it was over - education that made [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson break [his]150-harry gregson thigh , for the manner in which [he]150-harry gregson met with the accident was this : — [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner , who had fallen sadly out of health since [[his]238-mr. horner wife]3072-his wife ’s death , had attached [himself]238-mr. horner greatly to [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson . Now , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner had a cold manner to [every one]1255-every one , and never spoke more than was necessary , at the best of times . And , latterly , it had not been the best of times with [him]238-mr. horner . [I]2324-i dare say , [he]238-mr. horner had had some causes for anxiety ( of which [I]2324-i knew nothing ) about [[my]2324-i lady]336-my lady ’s affairs ; and [he]238-mr. horner was evidently annoyed by [[my]2324-i lady]336-my lady ’s whim ( as [he]238-mr. horner once inadvertently called it ) of placing [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo under [him]238-mr. horner in the position of [a clerk]3732-a clerk . Yet [he]238-mr. horner had always been friends , in [his]238-mr. horner quiet way , with [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , and [she]215-miss galindo devoted [herself]215-miss galindo to [her]215-miss galindo new occupation with diligence and punctuality , although more than once [she]215-miss galindo had moaned to [me]2324-i over the orders for needlework which had been sent to [her]215-miss galindo , and which , owing to [her]215-miss galindo occupation in the service of [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow , [she]215-miss galindo had been unable to fulfil . [The only living creature to whom [the staid Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner]3928-the only living creature to whom the staid mr. horner could be said to be attached , was [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson . To [[my]2324-i lady]336-my lady [he]238-mr. horner was [a faithful and devoted servant , looking keenly after [her]336-my lady interests]3930-a faithful and devoted servant , looking keenly after her interests , and anxious to forward them at any cost of trouble to [himself]238-mr. horner . But the more shrewd [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was , the more probability was there of [his]238-mr. horner being annoyed at certain peculiarities of opinion which [[my]2324-i lady]336-my lady held with a quiet , gentle pertinacity ; against which no arguments , based on mere worldly and business calculations , made any way . This frequent opposition to views which [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner entertained , although it did not interfere with the sincere respect which [the lady]1342-the lady and [the steward]1031-the steward felt for each other , yet prevented any warmer feeling of affection from coming in . It seems strange to say it , but [I]2324-i must repeat it — [the only person for whom , since [[his]238-mr. horner wife]3072-his wife ’s death]3934-the only person for whom , since his wife ’s death , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner seemed to feel any love , was the little imp [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson , with [his]150-harry gregson bright , watchful eyes , [his]150-harry gregson tangled hair hanging right down to [his]150-harry gregson eyebrows , for all [the world]866-the world like [a Skye terrier]3937-a skye terrier . [This lad]3938-this lad , [half gipsy and whole poacher]3939-half gipsy and whole poacher , as [many people]3255-many people esteemed [him]3938-this lad , hung about [the silent , respectable , staid Mr. Horner]3941-the silent , respectable , staid mr. horner , and followed [his]150-harry gregson steps with something of the affectionate fidelity of the dog which [he]150-harry gregson resembled . [I]2324-i suspect , this demonstration of attachment to [[his]238-mr. horner person]3942-his person on [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson ’s part was what won [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s regard . In the first instance , [the steward]1031-the steward had only chosen [the lad]3210-the lad out as the cleverest instrument [he]1031-the steward could find for [his]1031-the steward purpose ; and [I]2324-i do n’t mean to say that , if [Harry]150-harry gregson had not been almost as shrewd as [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner [himself]238-mr. horner was , both by original disposition and subsequent experience , [the steward]1031-the steward would have taken to [him]150-harry gregson as [he]1031-the steward did , let [the lad]3210-the lad have shown ever so much affection for [him]150-harry gregson . But even to [Harry Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was silent . Still , it was pleasant to find [himself]238-mr. horner in many ways so readily understood ; to perceive that the crumbs of knowledge [he]238-mr. horner let fall were picked up by [[his]238-mr. horner little follower]3947-his little follower , and hoarded like gold that here was one to hate [the persons and things whom [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner coldly disliked , and to reverence and admire all those for whom [he]238-mr. horner had any regard]3948-the persons and things whom mr. horner coldly disliked , and to reverence and admire all those for whom he had any regard . [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner had never had [a child]773-a child , and unconsciously , [I]2324-i suppose , something of the paternal feeling had begun to develop itself in [him]238-mr. horner towards [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson . [I]2324-i heard one or two things from [different people]3950-different people , which have always made [me]2324-i fancy that [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner secretly and almost unconsciously hoped that [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson might be trained so as to be first [[his]238-mr. horner clerk]3951-his clerk , and next [[his]238-mr. horner assistant]3952-his assistant , and finally [[his]238-mr. horner successor in [his]238-mr. horner stewardship to [the Hanbury estates]1093-the hanbury estates]3953-his successor in his stewardship to the hanbury estates . [Harry]150-harry gregson ’s disgrace with [[my]2324-i lady]336-my lady , in consequence of [his]150-harry gregson reading the letter , was a deeper blow to [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner than [his]150-harry gregson quiet manner would ever have led [any one]624-any one to suppose , or than [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow ever dreamed of inflicting , [I]2324-i am sure . [Probably Harry]238-mr. horner had a short , stern rebuke from [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner at the time , for [his]150-harry gregson manner was always hard even to those [he]150-harry gregson cared for the most . But [Harry]238-mr. horner ’s love was not to be daunted or quelled by a few sharp words . [I]2324-i dare say , from what [I]2324-i heard of [them]3957-them afterwards , that [Harry]238-mr. horner accompanied [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner in [his]150-harry gregson walk over [the farm]3958-the farm the very day of the rebuke ; [his]238-mr. horner presence apparently unnoticed by [the agent]3959-the agent , by whom [his]238-mr. horner absence would have been painfully felt nevertheless . That was the way of it , as [I]2324-i have been told . [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner never bade [Harry]238-mr. horner go with [him]238-mr. horner ; never thanked [him]238-mr. horner for going , or being at [his]238-mr. horner heels ready to run on any errands , straight as the crow flies to [his]238-mr. horner point , and back to heel in as short a time as possible . Yet , if [Harry]238-mr. horner were away , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner never inquired the reason from [any of the men who might be supposed to know whether [he]238-mr. horner was detained by [[his]238-mr. horner father]3292-his father , or otherwise engaged]3960-any of the men who might be supposed to know whether he was detained by his father , or otherwise engaged ; [he]238-mr. horner never asked [Harry]238-mr. horner [himself]238-mr. horner where [he]238-mr. horner had been . But [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo said that [those labourers who knew [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner]3962-those labourers who knew mr. horner well , told [her]215-miss galindo that [he]238-mr. horner was always more quick - eyed to shortcomings , more savage - like in fault - finding , on those days when [the lad]3210-the lad was absent . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , indeed , was [my]2324-i great authority for most of the village news which [I]2324-i heard . [She]215-miss galindo it was who gave [me]2324-i the particulars of poor [Harry]238-mr. horner ’s accident . “[2324-i] [You]2324-i see , [[my]0-i dear]3052-my dear , ” [she]0-i said , “[2324-i] [the little poacher]2326-the little poacher has taken some unaccountable fancy to [[my]0-i master]2012-my master . ” ( This was the name by which [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo always spoke of [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner to [me]2326-the little poacher , ever since [she]0-i had been , as [she]0-i called it , appointed [[his]238-mr. horner clerk]3951-his clerk . ) “[2326-the little poacher] Now if [I]0-i had twenty hearts to lose , [I]0-i never could spare a bit of one of [them]2328-them for [that good , gray , square , severe man]2329-that good , gray , square , severe man . But [different people]3950-different people have different tastes , and here is [that little imp of a gipsy - tinker ready to turn slave for [[my]0-i master]2012-my master]2331-that little imp of a gipsy - tinker ready to turn slave for my master ; and , odd enough , [[my]0-i master,—who]2333-my master,—who , [I]0-i should have said beforehand , would have made short work of imp , and [imp ’s family]2334-imp ’s family , and have sent [Hall]239-hall , [the Bang - beggar]2335-the bang - beggar , after [them]2336-them in no time — [[my]0-i master]2012-my master , as [they]2338-they tell [me]0-i , is in [his]2012-my master way quite fond of [the lad]3210-the lad , and if [he]2012-my master could , without vexing [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady too much , [he]2012-my master would have made [him]3210-the lad what [the folks here]2341-the folks here call [a Latiner]2342-a latiner . However , last night , it seems that there was a letter of some importance forgotten ( [I]0-i ca n’t tell [you]2343-you what it was about , [[my]0-i dear]3052-my dear , though [I]0-i know perfectly well , but ‘ _ service oblige _ , ’ as well as ‘ noblesse , ’ and [you]2343-you must take [my]0-i word for it that it was important , and one that [I]0-i am surprised [[my]0-i master]2012-my master could forget ) , till too late for the post . ( [The poor , good , orderly man]2346-the poor , good , orderly man is not what [he]2346-the poor , good , orderly man was before [[his]2346-the poor , good , orderly man wife]3072-his wife ’s death . ) Well , it seems that [he]2346-the poor , good , orderly man was sore annoyed by [his]2346-the poor , good , orderly man forgetfulness , and well [he]2346-the poor , good , orderly man might be . And it was all the more vexatious , as [he]2346-the poor , good , orderly man had [no one]590-no one to blame but [himself]2346-the poor , good , orderly man . As for that matter , [I]0-i always scold [somebody else]2349-somebody else when [I]0-i ’m in fault ; but [I]0-i suppose [[my]0-i master]2012-my master would never think of doing that , else it ’s a mighty relief . However , [he]2346-the poor , good , orderly man could eat no tea , and was altogether put out and gloomy . And [the little faithful imp - lad]2351-the little faithful imp - lad , perceiving all this , [I]0-i suppose , got up like [a page in an old ballad]2352-a page in an old ballad , and said [he]2351-the little faithful imp - lad would run for [his]2351-the little faithful imp - lad life across [country]2353-country to [Comberford]68-comberford , and see if [he]2351-the little faithful imp - lad could not get [there]559-there before the bags were made up . So [[my]0-i master]2012-my master gave [him]2346-the poor , good , orderly man the letter , and nothing more was heard of [the poor fellow]2356-the poor fellow till this morning , for [the father]2357-the father thought [[his]2357-the father son]1622-his son was sleeping in [[Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s barn]2359-mr. horner ’s barn , as [he]1622-his son does occasionally , it seems , and [[my]0-i master]2012-my master , as was very natural , that [he]1622-his son had gone to [[his]1622-his son father]3292-his father ’s . ” “[1622-his son] And [he]2356-the poor fellow had fallen down [the old stone quarry]2362-the old stone quarry , had [he]2356-the poor fellow not ? ” “[2356-the poor fellow] Yes , sure enough . [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had been up here fretting [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady with some of [his]113-mr. gray new - fangled schemes , and because [the young man]1343-the young man could not have it all [his]1343-the young man own way , from what [I]0-i understand , [he]1343-the young man was put out , and thought [he]1343-the young man would go [home]586-home by [the back lane]2366-the back lane , instead of through [the village]578-the village , where [the folks]2368-the folks would notice if [the parson]1218-the parson looked glum . But , however , it was a mercy , and [I]0-i do n’t mind saying so , ay , and meaning it too , though it may be like methodism ; for , as [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray walked by [the quarry]2370-the quarry , [he]113-mr. gray heard a groan , and at first [he]113-mr. gray thought it was a lamb fallen down ; and [he]113-mr. gray stood still , and then [he]113-mr. gray heard it again ; and then [I]0-i suppose , [he]113-mr. gray looked down and saw [Harry]238-mr. horner . So [he]113-mr. gray let [himself]113-mr. gray down by the boughs of the trees to the ledge where [Harry]238-mr. horner lay half - dead , and with [his]238-mr. horner poor thigh broken . There [he]113-mr. gray had lain ever since the night before : [he]113-mr. gray had been returning to tell [the master]3784-the master that [he]113-mr. gray had safely posted the letter , and the first words [he]113-mr. gray said , when [they]2372-they recovered [him]113-mr. gray from the exhausted state [he]113-mr. gray was in , were ” ( [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo tried hard not to whimper , as [she]215-miss galindo said it ) , “[113-mr. gray] ‘ It was in time , [sir]3124-sir .
