Why [the old gentleman]2374-the old gentleman ( [I]0-i dare n’t say Devil in [[Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow ’s house]2375-lady ludlow ’s house ) is not so black as [he]113-mr. gray is painted ; and [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray must have a deal of good in [him]113-mr. gray , as [I]0-i say at times ; and then at others , when [he]113-mr. gray has gone against [me]0-i , [I]0-i ca n’t bear [him]113-mr. gray , and think hanging too good for [him]113-mr. gray . But [he]113-mr. gray lifted [the poor lad]3650-the poor lad , as if [he]3650-the poor lad had been [a baby]2377-a baby , [I]0-i suppose , and carried [him]3650-the poor lad up the great ledges that were formerly used for steps ; and laid [him]3650-the poor lad soft and easy on the wayside grass , and ran [home]586-home and got help and a door , and had [him]3650-the poor lad carried to [[his]113-mr. gray house]2379-his house , and laid on [his]113-mr. gray bed ; and then somehow , for the first time either [he]113-mr. gray or [any one else]1077-any one else perceived it , [he]113-mr. gray [himself]113-mr. gray was all over blood — [his]113-mr. gray own blood — [he]113-mr. gray had broken a blood - vessel ; and there [he]113-mr. gray lies in [the little dressing - room]2381-the little dressing - room , as white and as still as if [he]113-mr. gray were dead ; and [the little imp in [[Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s own bed]2383-mr. gray ’s own bed]2382-the little imp in mr. gray ’s own bed , sound asleep , now [his]2382-the little imp in mr. gray ’s own bed leg is set , just as if linen sheets and a feather bed were [his]2382-the little imp in mr. gray ’s own bed native element , as one may say . Really , now [he]2382-the little imp in mr. gray ’s own bed is doing so well , [I]0-i ’ve no patience with [him]2382-the little imp in mr. gray ’s own bed , lying there where [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ought to be . It is just what [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady always prophesied would come to pass , if there was any confusion of ranks . ” “[336-my lady] [Poor Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ! ” said [I]113-mr. gray , thinking of [his]113-mr. gray flushed face , and [his]113-mr. gray feverish , restless ways , when [he]113-mr. gray had been calling on [[my]113-mr. gray lady]336-my lady not an hour before [his]113-mr. gray exertions on [Harry]238-mr. horner ’s behalf . And [I]113-mr. gray told [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo how ill [I]113-mr. gray had thought [him]113-mr. gray . “[113-mr. gray] Yes , ” said [she]215-miss galindo . “[113-mr. gray] And that was the reason [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady had sent for [Doctor Trevor]240-doctor trevor . Well , it has fallen out admirably , for [he]240-doctor trevor looked well after [that old donkey of [a Prince]2387-a prince]2386-that old donkey of a prince , and saw that [he]240-doctor trevor made no blunders . ” Now “[240-doctor trevor] [that old donkey of a Prince]2386-that old donkey of a prince ” meant [the village surgeon]3966-the village surgeon , [Mr. Prince]241-mr. prince , between whom and [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo there was war to the knife , as [they]3967-they often met in [the cottages]813-the cottages , when there was illness , and [she]215-miss galindo had [her]215-miss galindo queer , odd recipes , which [he]240-doctor trevor , with [his]240-doctor trevor grand pharmacopoeia , held in infinite contempt , and the consequence of [their]3967-they squabbling had been , not long before this very time , that [he]240-doctor trevor had established a kind of rule , that into whatever sick - room [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was admitted , there [he]240-doctor trevor refused to visit . But [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s prescriptions and visits cost nothing and were often backed by kitchen - physic ; so , though it was true that [she]215-miss galindo never came but [she]215-miss galindo scolded about something or other , [she]215-miss galindo was generally preferred as [medical attendant]3969-medical attendant to [Mr. Prince]241-mr. prince . “[2389-the old donkey] Yes , [the old donkey]2389-the old donkey is obliged to tolerate [me]0-i , and be civil to [me]0-i ; for , [you]2390-you see , [I]0-i got [there]559-there first , and had possession , as it were , and yet [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord the donkey likes the credit of attending [the parson]1218-the parson , and being in consultation with [so grand [a county - town doctor]2395-a county - town doctor as [Doctor Trevor]240-doctor trevor]2394-so grand a county - town doctor as doctor trevor . And [Doctor Trevor]240-doctor trevor is [an old friend of [mine]0-i]2396-an old friend of mine ” ( [she]0-i sighed a little , some time [I]240-doctor trevor may tell [you]3970-you why ) , “[240-doctor trevor] and treats [me]0-i with infinite bowing and respect ; so [the donkey]2397-the donkey , not to be out of medical fashion , bows too , though it is sadly against the grain ; and [he]2397-the donkey pulled a face as if [he]2397-the donkey had heard a slate - pencil gritting against a slate , when [I]0-i told [Doctor Trevor]240-doctor trevor [I]0-i meant to sit up with [the two lads]1293-the two lads , for [I]0-i call [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray little more than [a lad]3207-a lad , and [a pretty conceited one]2400-a pretty conceited one , too , at times . ” “[2400-a pretty conceited one] But why should [you]0-i sit up , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ? It will tire [you]0-i sadly . ” “[2400-a pretty conceited one] Not it . [You]2401-you see , there is [[Gregson]150-harry gregson ’s mother]2402-gregson ’s mother to keep quiet for [she]2402-gregson ’s mother sits by [[her]2402-gregson ’s mother lad]2403-her lad , fretting and sobbing , so that [I]0-i ’m afraid of [her]2402-gregson ’s mother disturbing [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ; and there ’s [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray to keep quiet , for [Doctor Trevor]240-doctor trevor says [his]240-doctor trevor life depends on it ; and there is medicine to be given to [the one]2404-the one , and bandages to be attended to for the other ; and the wild horde of [gipsy brothers]2405-gipsy brothers and [sisters to be turned out]2406-sisters to be turned out , and [the father]2357-the father to be held in from showing too much gratitude to [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , who ca n’t hear it,—and who is to do it all but [me]0-i ? [The only servant]2408-the only servant is old lame [Betty]143-queen elizabeth , who once lived with [me]0-i , and _ would _ leave [me]0-i because [she]143-queen elizabeth said [I]0-i was always bothering—(there was a good deal of truth in what [she]143-queen elizabeth said , [I]0-i grant , but [she]143-queen elizabeth need not have said it ; a good deal of truth is best let alone at the bottom of the well ) , and what can [she]143-queen elizabeth do,—deaf as ever [she]143-queen elizabeth can be , too ? ” So [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo went [her]215-miss galindo ways ; but not the less was [she]215-miss galindo at [her]215-miss galindo post in the morning ; a little crosser and more silent than usual ; but the first was not to be wondered at , and the last was rather a blessing . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow had been extremely anxious both about [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray and [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson . Kind and thoughtful in any case of illness and accident , [she]92-lady ludlow always was ; but somehow , in this , the feeling that [she]92-lady ludlow was not quite — what shall [I]143-queen elizabeth call it?—“friends[143-queen elizabeth] ” seems hardly the right word to use , as to the possible feeling between [the Countess Ludlow]172-the countess ludlow and [the little vagabond messenger]3971-the little vagabond messenger , who had only once been in [her]92-lady ludlow presence,—that [she]92-lady ludlow had hardly parted from either as [she]92-lady ludlow could have wished to do , had death been near , made [her]92-lady ludlow more than usually anxious . [Doctor Trevor]240-doctor trevor was not to spare obtaining the best medical advice [the county]3101-the county could afford : whatever [he]240-doctor trevor ordered in the way of diet , was to be prepared under [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott ’s own eye , and sent down from [the Hall]501-the hall to [the Parsonage]3974-the parsonage . As [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner had given somewhat similar directions , in the case of [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson at least , there was rather a multiplicity of [counsellors and dainties]3975-counsellors and dainties , than any lack of [them]3975-counsellors and dainties . And , the second night , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner insisted on taking the superintendence of the nursing [himself]238-mr. horner , and sat and snored by [Harry]238-mr. horner ’s bedside , while [the poor , exhausted mother]3976-the poor , exhausted mother lay by [her]3976-the poor , exhausted mother child,—thinking that [she]3976-the poor , exhausted mother watched [him]238-mr. horner , but in reality fast asleep , as [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo told [us]3977-us ; for , distrusting [any one]624-any one ’s powers of watching and nursing but [her]215-miss galindo own , [she]215-miss galindo had stolen across [the quiet village street]3979-the quiet village street in cloak and dressing - gown , and found [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray in vain trying to reach the cup of barley - water which [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner had placed just beyond [his]238-mr. horner reach . In consequence of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s illness , [we]3977-us had to have [a strange curate to do duty]3980-a strange curate to do duty ; a man who dropped [his]3980-a strange curate to do duty h ’s , and hurried through the service , and yet had time enough to stand in [[my]2409-i Lady]336-my lady ’s way , bowing to [her]336-my lady as [she]336-my lady came out of [church]668-church , and so subservient in manner , that [I]2409-i believe that sooner than remain unnoticed by [a countess]499-a countess , [he]3980-a strange curate to do duty would have preferred being scolded , or even cuffed . Now [I]2409-i found out , that great as was [[my]2409-i lady]336-my lady ’s liking and approval of respect , nay , even reverence , being paid to [her]336-my lady as a person of quality,—a sort of tribute to [her]336-my lady Order , which [she]336-my lady had no individual right to remit , or , indeed , not to exact,—yet [she]336-my lady , being personally simple , sincere , and holding [herself]336-my lady in low esteem , could not endure anything like the servility of [Mr. Crosse]242-mr. crosse , [the temporary curate]3985-the temporary curate . [She]336-my lady grew absolutely to loathe [his]242-mr. crosse perpetual smiling and bowing ; [his]242-mr. crosse instant agreement with the slightest opinion [she]336-my lady uttered ; [his]242-mr. crosse veering round as [she]336-my lady blew the wind . [I]2409-i have often said that [[my]2409-i lady]336-my lady did not talk much , as [she]336-my lady might have done had [she]336-my lady lived among [[her]336-my lady equals]3987-her equals . But [we]3988-we all loved [her]336-my lady so much , that [we]3988-we had learnt to interpret all [her]336-my lady little ways pretty truly ; and [I]2409-i knew what particular turns of [her]336-my lady head , and contractions of [her]336-my lady delicate fingers meant , as well as if [she]336-my lady had expressed [herself]336-my lady in words . [I]2409-i began to suspect that [[my]2409-i lady]336-my lady would be very thankful to have [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray about again , and doing [his]113-mr. gray duty even with a conscientiousness that might amount to worrying [himself]113-mr. gray , and fidgeting [others]3078-others ; and although [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray might hold [her]336-my lady opinions in as little esteem as those of [any simple gentlewoman]3991-any simple gentlewoman , [she]336-my lady was too sensible not to feel how much flavour there was in [his]113-mr. gray conversation , compared to that of [Mr. Crosse]242-mr. crosse , who was only [her]336-my lady tasteless echo . As for [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , [she]215-miss galindo was utterly and entirely a partisan of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s , almost ever since [she]215-miss galindo had begun to nurse [him]113-mr. gray during [his]113-mr. gray illness . “[2409-i] [You]2409-i know , [I]0-i never set up for reasonableness , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . So [I]0-i do n’t pretend to say , as [I]0-i might do if [I]0-i were [a sensible woman]2411-a sensible woman and all that,—that [I]0-i am convinced by [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s arguments of this thing or t’other . For one thing , [you]2409-i see , [poor fellow]1307-poor fellow ! [he]113-mr. gray has never been able to argue , or hardly indeed to speak , for [Doctor Trevor]240-doctor trevor has been very peremptory . So there ’s been no scope for arguing ! But what [I]0-i mean is this:—When [I]0-i see [a sick man]2413-a sick man thinking always of [others]3078-others , and never of [himself]2413-a sick man ; [patient]2415-patient , humble — a trifle too much at times , for [I]0-i ’ve caught [him]2413-a sick man praying to be forgiven for having neglected [his]2413-a sick man work as [a parish priest]2416-a parish priest , ” ( [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was making horrible faces , to keep back tears , squeezing up [her]215-miss galindo eyes in a way which would have amused [me]2413-a sick man at any other time , but when [she]215-miss galindo was speaking of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ) ; “[2413-a sick man] when [I]0-i see [a downright good , religious man]2417-a downright good , religious man , [I]0-i ’m apt to think [he]2417-a downright good , religious man ’s got hold of the right clue , and that [I]0-i can do no better than hold on by the tails of [his]2417-a downright good , religious man coat and shut [my]0-i eyes , if [we]2418-we ’ve got to go over doubtful places on [[our]2418-we road to [Heaven]165-heaven]2419-our road to heaven . And [I]0-i tell [[your]336-my lady ladyship]3058-your ladyship this now , because [I]0-i think from [your]336-my lady rank — and still more , if [I]0-i may say so , for all [your]336-my lady kindness to [me]0-i long ago , down to this very day — [you’ve]336-my lady a right to be first told of anything about [me]0-i . [[Your]2428-you ancestors]2434-your ancestors have lived here time out of mind , and have owned the land on which [[their]2434-your ancestors forefathers]1052-their forefathers have lived ever since there were [forefathers]2436-forefathers . Let [me]0-i tell [you]2461-you , [I]0-i have known [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady these thirty years ; and if [she]336-my lady were to take [me]0-i by the shoulders , and turn [me]0-i out of [the house]3047-the house , [I]0-i should only love [her]336-my lady the more . [I]336-my lady could not exactly tell what [I]336-my lady had done wrong ; but [I]336-my lady took care never again to come in between [[my]336-my lady lady]336-my lady and [her]336-my lady by any remark about [the one to the other]4003-the one to the other ; for [I]336-my lady saw that some most powerful bond of grateful affection made [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo almost worship [[my]336-my lady lady]336-my lady . Meanwhile , [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson was limping a little about in [the village]578-the village , still finding [[his]150-harry gregson home]587-his home in [[Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s house]4007-mr. gray ’s house ; for there [he]150-harry gregson could most conveniently be kept under [the doctor]3071-the doctor ’s eye , and receive the requisite care , and enjoy the requisite nourishment . As soon as [he]150-harry gregson was a little better , [he]150-harry gregson was to go to [[Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s house]4009-mr. horner ’s house ; but , as [the steward]1031-the steward lived some distance out of the way , and was much from [home]586-home , [he]1031-the steward had agreed to leave [Harry]238-mr. horner at [the house]3047-the house ; to which [he]150-harry gregson had first been taken , until [he]150-harry gregson was quite strong again ; and the more willingly , [I]336-my lady suspect , from what [I]336-my lady heard afterwards , because [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray gave up all the little strength of speaking which [he]113-mr. gray had , to teaching [Harry]238-mr. horner in the very manner which [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner most desired . As for [Gregson]150-harry gregson [the father]2357-the father — [he]2357-the father — [wild man of [the woods]988-the woods]4014-wild man of the woods , [poacher]4016-poacher , [tinker]4017-tinker , [jack - of - all trades]4018-jack - of - all trades — was getting tamed by this kindness to [[his]2357-the father child]4019-his child . Hitherto [his]150-harry gregson hand had been against [every man]1091-every man , as [every man]1091-every man ’s had been against [him]150-harry gregson . That affair before the justice , which [I]336-my lady told [you]4022-you about , when [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray and even [[my]336-my lady lady]336-my lady had interested [themselves]4024-themselves to get [him]150-harry gregson released from unjust imprisonment , was the first bit of justice [he]150-harry gregson had ever met with ; it attracted [him]150-harry gregson to [the people]313-the people , and attached [him]150-harry gregson to the spot on which [he]150-harry gregson had but squatted for a time . [I]336-my lady am not sure if [any of [the villagers]4027-the villagers]4026-any of the villagers were grateful to [him]150-harry gregson for remaining in [[their]4026-any of the villagers neighbourhood]4028-their neighbourhood , instead of decamping as [he]150-harry gregson had often done before , for good reasons , doubtless , of personal safety . [Harry]150-harry gregson was only one out of [a brood of ten or twelve children]4029-a brood of ten or twelve children , [some of whom had earned for [themselves]4030-some of whom had earned for themselves no good character in service no good character in service]4030-some of whom had earned for themselves no good character in service : one , indeed , had been actually transported , for a robbery committed in [a distant part of [the county]3101-the county]4031-a distant part of the county ; and the tale was yet told in [the village]578-the village of how [Gregson]150-harry gregson [the father]2357-the father came back from the trial in a state of wild rage , striding through [the place]437-the place , and uttering oaths of vengeance to [himself]150-harry gregson , [his]150-harry gregson great black eyes gleaming out of [his]150-harry gregson matted hair , and [his]150-harry gregson arms working by [his]150-harry gregson side , and now and then tossed up in [his]150-harry gregson impotent despair . As [I]336-my lady heard the account , [[his]150-harry gregson wife]3072-his wife followed [him]150-harry gregson , child - laden and weeping . After this , [they]4037-they had vanished from [the country]1448-the country for a time , leaving [their]4037-they mud hovel locked up , and the door - key , as [the neighbours]2233-the neighbours said , buried in [a hedge bank]4040-a hedge bank . [The Gregsons]244-the gregsons had reappeared much about the same time that [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray came to [Hanbury]13-hanbury . [He]113-mr. gray had either never heard of [their]244-the gregsons evil character , or considered that it gave [them]244-the gregsons all the more claims upon [his]113-mr. gray Christian care ; and the end of it was , that [this rough , untamed , strong giant of [a heathen]4042-a heathen]4041-this rough , untamed , strong giant of a heathen was [loyal slave to [the weak , hectic , nervous , self - distrustful parson]4044-the weak , hectic , nervous , self - distrustful parson]4043-loyal slave to the weak , hectic , nervous , self - distrustful parson . [Gregson]150-harry gregson had also a kind of grumbling respect for [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner : [he]150-harry gregson did not quite like [the steward]1031-the steward ’s monopoly of [[his]150-harry gregson Harry]4046-his harry : [the mother]4047-the mother submitted to that with a better grace , swallowing down [her]4047-the mother maternal jealousy in the prospect of [[her]4047-the mother child]1615-her child ’s advancement to a better and more respectable position than that in which [[his]150-harry gregson parents]3337-his parents had struggled through life . But [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner , [the steward]1031-the steward , and [Gregson]150-harry gregson , [the poacher and squatter]4051-the poacher and squatter , had come into disagreeable contact too often in former days for [them]3337-his parents to be perfectly cordial at any future time . Even now , when there was no immediate cause for anything but gratitude for [[his]238-mr. horner child]4019-his child ’s sake on [Gregson]150-harry gregson ’s part , [he]150-harry gregson would skulk out of [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s way , if [he]238-mr. horner saw [him]150-harry gregson coming ; and it took all [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s natural reserve and acquired self - restraint to keep [him]238-mr. horner from occasionally holding up [[his]150-harry gregson father]3292-his father ’s life as a warning to [Harry]238-mr. horner . Now [Gregson]150-harry gregson had nothing of this desire for avoidance with regard to [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray . [The poacher]4054-the poacher had a feeling of physical protection towards [the parson]1218-the parson ; while [the latter]841-the latter had shown the moral courage , without which [Gregson]150-harry gregson would never have respected [him]1218-the parson , in coming right down upon [him]1218-the parson more than once in the exercise of unlawful pursuits , and simply and boldly telling [him]1218-the parson [he]1218-the parson was doing wrong , with such a quiet reliance upon [Gregson]150-harry gregson ’s better feeling , at the same time , that [the strong poacher]4057-the strong poacher could not have lifted a finger against [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , though it had been to save [himself]238-mr. horner from being apprehended and taken to [the lock - ups]4058-the lock - ups the very next hour . [He]150-harry gregson had rather listened to [the parson]1218-the parson ’s bold words with an approving smile , much as [Mr. Gulliver]245-mr. gulliver might have hearkened to a lecture from [a Lilliputian]4060-a lilliputian . But when brave words passed into kind deeds , [Gregson]150-harry gregson ’s heart mutely acknowledged [its master]4061-its master and [keeper]4062-keeper . And the beauty of it all was , that [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray knew nothing of the good work [he]113-mr. gray had done , or recognized [himself]113-mr. gray as the instrument which [God]133-god had employed . [He]113-mr. gray thanked [God]133-god , it is true , fervently and often , that the work was done ; and loved [the wild man]4063-the wild man for [his]4063-the wild man rough gratitude ; but it never occurred to [the poor young clergyman]4064-the poor young clergyman , lying on [his]4064-the poor young clergyman sick - bed , and praying , as [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had told [us]4065-us [he]4064-the poor young clergyman did , to be forgiven for [his]4064-the poor young clergyman unprofitable life , to think of [Gregson]150-harry gregson ’s reclaimed soul as anything with which [he]4064-the poor young clergyman had had to do . It was now more than three months since [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had been at [Hanbury Court]7-hanbury court . During all that time [he]113-mr. gray had been confined to [[his]113-mr. gray house]2379-his house , if not to [his]113-mr. gray sick - bed , and [he]113-mr. gray and [[my]336-my lady lady]336-my lady had never met since [their]4068-their last discussion and difference about [[Farmer Hale]233-farmer hale ’s barn]2320-farmer hale ’s barn . This was not [[my]336-my lady dear lady]692-my dear lady ’s fault ; [no one]590-no one could have been more attentive in every way to the slightest possible want of [either of [the invalids]4073-the invalids]4072-either of the invalids , especially of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray . And [she]692-my dear lady would have gone to see [him]113-mr. gray at [[his]113-mr. gray own house]4074-his own house , as [she]692-my dear lady sent [him]113-mr. gray word , but that [her]692-my dear lady foot had slipped upon the polished oak staircase , and [her]692-my dear lady ankle had been sprained . So [we]4075-we had never seen [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray since [his]113-mr. gray illness , when one November day [he]113-mr. gray was announced as wishing to speak to [[my]336-my lady lady]336-my lady . [She]336-my lady was sitting in [[her]336-my lady room]2034-her room — [the room in which [I]336-my lady lay now pretty constantly]4078-the room in which i lay now pretty constantly — and [I]336-my lady remember [she]336-my lady looked startled , when word was brought to [her]336-my lady of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s being at [the Hall]501-the hall . [She]336-my lady could not go to [him]113-mr. gray , [she]336-my lady was too lame for that , so [she]336-my lady bade [him]113-mr. gray be shown into where [she]336-my lady sat . “[336-my lady] Such a day for [him]2467-him to go out ! ” [she]336-my lady exclaimed , looking at the fog which had crept up to the windows , and was sapping the little remaining life in the brilliant Virginian creeper leaves that draperied [the house]3047-the house on [the terrace side]4081-the terrace side . [He]113-mr. gray came in white , trembling , [his]113-mr. gray large eyes wild and dilated . [He]113-mr. gray hastened up to [[Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow ’s chair]4082-lady ludlow ’s chair , and , to [my]336-my lady surprise , took one of [her]336-my lady hands and kissed it , without speaking , yet shaking all over . “[336-my lady] [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ! ” said [she]336-my lady , quickly , with sharp , tremulous apprehension of some unknown evil . “[113-mr. gray] What is it ? There is something unusual about [you]113-mr. gray . ” “[113-mr. gray] Something unusual has occurred , ” replied [he]113-mr. gray , forcing [his]113-mr. gray words to be calm , as with a great effort . “[1283-a gentleman] [A gentleman]1283-a gentleman came to [[my]0-i house]1399-my house , not half an hour ago — [a Mr. Howard]246-a mr. howard . [He]1283-a gentleman came straight from [Vienna]70-vienna . ” “[1283-a gentleman] [[My]0-i son]3267-my son ! ” said [[my]1283-a gentleman dear lady]692-my dear lady , stretching out [her]336-my lady arms in dumb questioning attitude . “[1283-a gentleman] [The Lord]542-the lord gave and [the Lord]542-the lord taketh away . Blessed be the name of [the Lord]542-the lord . ” But [[my]542-the lord poor lady]3217-my poor lady could not echo the words . [He]113-mr. gray was [the last remaining child]4085-the last remaining child . And once [she]3217-my poor lady had been [the joyful mother of nine]4086-the joyful mother of nine . CHAPTER XII . [I]542-the lord am ashamed to say what feeling became strongest in [my]542-the lord mind about this time ; next to the sympathy [we]4087-we all of [us]4087-we felt for [[my]542-the lord dear lady]692-my dear lady in [her]3217-my poor lady deep sorrow , [I]542-the lord mean ; for that was greater and stronger than anything else , however contradictory [you]4089-you may think it , when [you]4089-you hear all . It might arise from [my]542-the lord being so far from well at the time , which produced a diseased mind in a diseased body ; but [I]542-the lord was absolutely jealous for [[my]542-the lord father]309-my father ’s memory , when [I]542-the lord saw how many signs of grief there were for [[my]542-the lord lord]3081-my lord ’s death , [he]309-my father having done next to nothing for [the village]578-the village and parish , which now changed , as it were , [its]578-the village daily course of life , because [[his]309-my father lordship]601-his lordship died in [a far - off city]4094-a far - off city . [[My]542-the lord father]309-my father had spent the best years of [his]309-my father manhood in labouring hard , body and soul , for [the people amongst whom [he]309-my father lived]4096-the people amongst whom he lived . [[His]309-my father family]4097-his family , of course , claimed the first place in [his]309-my father heart ; [he]309-my father would have been good for little , even in the way of benevolence , if [they]4097-his family had not . But close after [them]4097-his family [he]309-my father cared for [[his]309-my father parishioners]4098-his parishioners , and [neighbours]4099-neighbours . And yet , when [he]309-my father died , though the church bells tolled , and smote upon [our]4100-our hearts with hard , fresh pain at every beat , the sounds of every - day life still went on , close pressing around [us,—carts]4101-us,—carts and [carriages]597-carriages , street - cries , distant barrel - organs ( [the kindly neighbours]4103-the kindly neighbours kept [them]4103-the kindly neighbours out of [[our]4100-our street]4104-our street ): life , active , noisy life , pressed on [our]4100-our acute consciousness of Death , and jarred upon it as on a quick nerve . And when [we]4100-our went to [[[church,—my]4105-church,—my father]4106-church,—my father ’s own church,—though]4107-church,—my father ’s own church,—though the pulpit cushions were black , and [many of [the congregation]4109-the congregation]4108-many of the congregation had put on some humble sign of mourning , yet it did not alter the whole material aspect of [the place]437-the place . And yet what was [Lord Ludlow]99-lord ludlow ’s relation to [Hanbury]13-hanbury , compared to [[my]542-the lord father]309-my father ’s work and place in — ? O ! it was very wicked in [me]542-the lord ! [I]542-the lord think if [I]542-the lord had seen [[my]542-the lord lady,—if]2442-my lady,—if [I]542-the lord had dared to ask to go to [her]2442-my lady,—if , [I]542-the lord should not have felt so miserable , so discontented . But [she]2442-my lady,—if sat in [[her]2442-my lady,—if own room]905-her own room , hung with black , all , even over the shutters . [She]2442-my lady,—if saw no light but that which was artificial — candles , lamps , and the like — for more than a month . Only [Adams]104-adams went near [her]2442-my lady,—if . [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray was not admitted , though [he]113-mr. gray called daily . Even [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott did not see [her]2442-my lady,—if for near a fortnight . The sight of [[my]542-the lord lady]336-my lady ’s griefs , or rather the recollection of it , made [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott talk far more than was [her]103-mrs. medlicott wo nt . [She]103-mrs. medlicott told [us]4115-us , with many tears , and much gesticulation , even speaking German at times , when [her]103-mrs. medlicott English would not flow , that [[my]542-the lord lady]336-my lady sat there , a white figure in the middle of [the darkened room]4117-the darkened room ; a shaded lamp near [her]2442-my lady,—if , the light of which fell on an open Bible,—the great family Bible . It was not open at any chapter or consoling verse ; but at the page whereon were registered the births of [[her]2442-my lady,—if nine children]339-her nine children . Five had died in infancy,—sacrificed to the cruel system which forbade [the mother]4047-the mother to suckle [[her]4047-the mother babies]4120-her babies . [Four]4121-four had lived longer ; [Urian]160-urian had been the first to die , Ughtred - [Mortimar]247-mortimar , [Earl Ludlow]124-earl ludlow , the last . [[My]542-the lord lady]336-my lady did not cry , [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott said . [She]336-my lady was quite composed ; very still , very silent . [She]336-my lady put aside everything that savoured of mere business : sent [people]302-people to [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner for that . But [she]336-my lady was proudly alive to every possible form which might do honour to [the last of [[her]336-my lady race]4125-her race]4124-the last of her race . In those days , expresses were slow things , and forms still slower . Before [[my]542-the lord lady]336-my lady ’s directions could reach [Vienna]70-vienna , [[my]542-the lord lord]3081-my lord was buried . There was some talk ( so [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott said ) about taking the body up , and bringing [him]3081-my lord to [Hanbury]13-hanbury . But [[his]3081-my lord executors,—connections]4128-his executors,—connections on the [Ludlow]92-lady ludlow side,—demurred to this . If [he]3081-my lord were removed to [England]9-england , [he]3081-my lord must be carried on to [Scotland]1-scotland , and interred with [[his]3081-my lord Monkshaven forefathers]4129-his monkshaven forefathers . [[My]542-the lord lady]336-my lady , deeply hurt , withdrew from the discussion , before it degenerated to an unseemly contest . But all the more , for this understood mortification of [[my]542-the lord lady]336-my lady ’s , did [[the whole village]4132-the whole village and estate of [Hanbury]13-hanbury]4133-the whole village and estate of hanbury assume every outward sign of mourning . The church bells tolled morning and evening . [The church itself]4134-the church itself was draped in black inside . Hatchments were placed everywhere , where hatchments could be put . [All the tenantry]4135-all the tenantry spoke in hushed voices for more than a week , scarcely daring to observe that all flesh , even that of [an Earl Ludlow]4136-an earl ludlow , and [the last of [the Hanburys]139-the hanburys]4137-the last of the hanburys , was but grass after all . [The very Fighting Lion]4138-the very fighting lion closed [its]4138-the very fighting lion front door , front shutters it had none , and [those who needed drink]4139-those who needed drink stole in at the back , and were silent and maudlin over [their]4139-those who needed drink cups , instead of riotous and noisy . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s eyes were swollen up with crying , and [she]215-miss galindo told [me]542-the lord , with a fresh burst of tears , that [even hump - backed Sally]4140-even hump - backed sally had been found sobbing over [her]4140-even hump - backed sally Bible , and using a pocket - handkerchief for the first time in [her]4140-even hump - backed sally life ; [her]4140-even hump - backed sally aprons having hitherto stood [her]4140-even hump - backed sally in the necessary stead , but not being sufficiently in accordance with etiquette to be used when mourning over [an earl]4141-an earl ’s premature decease . If it was this way out of [the Hall]501-the hall , “[542-the lord] [you]2474-my might work it by the rule of three , ” as [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo used to say , and judge what it was in [the Hall]501-the hall . [We]4144-we [none of [us]4144-we]4145-none of us spoke but in a whisper : [we]4144-we tried not to eat ; and indeed the shock had been so really great , and [we]4144-we did really care so much for [[my]2474-my lady]336-my lady , that for some days [we]4144-we had but little appetite . But after that , [I]2474-my fear [our]4144-we sympathy grew weaker , while [our]4144-we flesh grew stronger . But [we]4144-we still spoke low , and [our]4144-we hearts ached whenever [we]4144-we thought of [[my]2474-my lady]336-my lady sitting there alone in [the darkened room]4117-the darkened room , with the light ever falling on that one solemn page . [We]4144-we wished , O how [I]2474-my wished that [she]336-my lady would see [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ! But [Adams]104-adams said , [she]336-my lady thought [[my]2474-my lady]336-my lady ought to have [a bishop]4150-a bishop come to see [her]336-my lady . Still [no one]590-no one had authority enough to send for one . [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner all this time was suffering as much as [any one]624-any one . [He]238-mr. horner was too faithful [a servant of [the great Hanbury family]4154-the great hanbury family]4153-a servant of the great hanbury family , though now [the family]331-the family had dwindled down to [a fragile old lady]4156-a fragile old lady , not to mourn acutely over its probable extinction . [He]238-mr. horner had , besides , a deeper sympathy and reverence with , and for , [[my]2474-my lady]336-my lady , in all things , than probably [he]238-mr. horner ever cared to show , for [his]238-mr. horner manners were always measured and cold . [He]238-mr. horner suffered from sorrow . [He]238-mr. horner also suffered from wrong . [[My]2474-my lord ’s executors]4158-my lord ’s executors kept writing to [him]238-mr. horner continually . [[My]2474-my lady]336-my lady refused to listen to mere business , saying [she]336-my lady intrusted all to [him]238-mr. horner . But the “[2474-my] all ” was more complicated than [I]0-i ever thoroughly understood . As far as [I]0-i comprehended the case , it was something of this kind:—There had been a mortgage raised on [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s property of [Hanbury]13-hanbury]4161-my lady ’s property of hanbury , to enable [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord , [[her]336-my lady husband]729-her husband , to spend money in cultivating [[his]238-mr. horner Scotch estates]4164-his scotch estates , after some new fashion that required capital . As long as [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord , [[her]336-my lady son]991-her son , lived , who was to succeed to both [the estates]4167-the estates after [her]336-my lady death , this did not signify ; so [she]336-my lady had said and felt ; and [she]336-my lady had refused to take any steps to secure the repayment of capital , or even the payment of the interest of the mortgage from [the possible representatives and possessors of [the Scotch estates]4169-the scotch estates]4168-the possible representatives and possessors of the scotch estates , to [the possible owner of [the Hanbury property]1085-the hanbury property]4170-the possible owner of the hanbury property ; saying it ill became [her]336-my lady to calculate on the contingency of [[her]336-my lady son]991-her son ’s death . But [he]991-her son had died childless , unmarried . [The heir of [the Monkshaven property]4174-the monkshaven property]4173-the heir of the monkshaven property was [an Edinburgh advocate]4175-an edinburgh advocate , [a far - away kinsman of [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord ’s]4176-a far - away kinsman of my lord ’s : the Hanbury property , at [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s death , would go to [the descendants of [a third son of [the Squire Hanbury]4181-the squire hanbury]4180-a third son of the squire hanbury in the days of [Queen Anne]136-queen anne]4179-the descendants of a third son of the squire hanbury in the days of queen anne . This complication of affairs was most grievous to [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner . [He]238-mr. horner had always been opposed to the mortgage ; had hated the payment of the interest , as obliging [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady to practise certain economies which , though [she]336-my lady took care to make [them]4183-them as personal as possible , [he]238-mr. horner disliked as derogatory to [the family]331-the family . [Poor Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ! [He]238-mr. horner was so cold and hard in [his]238-mr. horner manner , so curt and decisive in [his]238-mr. horner speech , that [I]0-i do n’t think [we]4185-we any of [us]4185-we did [him]238-mr. horner justice . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was almost the first , at this time , to speak a kind word of [him]238-mr. horner , or to take thought of [him]238-mr. horner at all , any farther than to get out of [his]238-mr. horner way when [we]4185-we saw [him]238-mr. horner approaching . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t think [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner is well , ” [she]0-i said one day ; about three weeks after [we]4185-we had heard of [[my]238-mr. horner lord]3081-my lord ’s death . “[238-mr. horner] [He]238-mr. horner sits resting [his]238-mr. horner head on [his]238-mr. horner hand , and hardly hears [me]0-i when [I]0-i speak to [him]238-mr. horner . ” But [I]238-mr. horner thought no more of it , as [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo did not name it again . [[My]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady came amongst [us]4185-we once more . From [elderly]4188-elderly [she]336-my lady had become old ; [a little , frail , old lady , in heavy black drapery , never speaking about nor alluding to [her]336-my lady great sorrow]4189-a little , frail , old lady , in heavy black drapery , never speaking about nor alluding to her great sorrow ; quieter , gentler , paler than ever before ; and [her]336-my lady eyes dim with much weeping , never witnessed by [mortal]4190-mortal . [She]336-my lady had seen [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray at the expiration of the month of deep retirement . But [I]238-mr. horner do not think that even to [him]113-mr. gray [she]336-my lady had said one word of [her]336-my lady own particular individual sorrow . All mention of it seemed buried deep for evermore . One day , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner sent word that [he]238-mr. horner was too much indisposed to attend to [his]238-mr. horner usual business at [the Hall]501-the hall ; but [he]238-mr. horner wrote down some directions and requests to [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , saying that [he]238-mr. horner would be at [[his]238-mr. horner office]4192-his office early the next morning . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo [herself]215-miss galindo cried plentifully , but [[my]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady , although very much distressed , could not cry . It seemed a physical impossibility , as if [she]336-my lady had shed all the tears in [her]336-my lady power . Moreover , [I]238-mr. horner almost think [her]336-my lady wonder was far greater that [she]336-my lady [herself]336-my lady lived than that [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner died . It was almost natural that [so faithful a servant]4195-so faithful a servant should break [his]4195-so faithful a servant heart , when [the family]331-the family [he]4195-so faithful a servant belonged to lost [their]331-the family stay , [[their]331-the family heir]4197-their heir , and [their]331-the family last hope . Yes ! [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was [a faithful servant]4198-a faithful servant . [I]238-mr. horner do not think there are [many so faithful]4199-many so faithful now ; but perhaps that is [an old woman]299-an old woman ’s fancy of [mine]238-mr. horner . When [his]238-mr. horner will came to be examined , it was discovered that , soon after [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson ’s accident , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner had left the few thousands ( three , [I]238-mr. horner think , ) of which [he]238-mr. horner was possessed , in trust for [Harry]238-mr. horner ’s benefit , desiring [[his]238-mr. horner executors]648-his executors to see that [the lad]3210-the lad was well educated in certain things , for which [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner had thought that [he]238-mr. horner had shown especial aptitude ; and there was a kind of implied apology to [[my]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady in one sentence where [he]238-mr. horner stated that [Harry]238-mr. horner ’s lameness would prevent [his]238-mr. horner being ever able to gain [his]238-mr. horner living by the exercise of any mere bodily faculties , “[238-mr. horner] as had been wished by [a lady whose wishes ” [he]238-mr. horner , [the testator]4205-the testator]4204-a lady whose wishes ” he , the testator , “[4204-a lady whose wishes ” he , the testator] was bound to regard . ” But there was a codicil in the will , dated since [Lord Ludlow]99-lord ludlow ’s death — feebly written by [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner [himself]238-mr. horner , as if in preparation only for some more formal manner of bequest : or , perhaps , only as a mere temporary arrangement till [he]238-mr. horner could see [a lawyer]4206-a lawyer , and have a fresh will made . In this [he]238-mr. horner revoked [his]238-mr. horner previous bequest to [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson . [He]238-mr. horner only left two hundred pounds to [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray to be used , as [that gentleman]848-that gentleman thought best , for [Henry Gregson]150-harry gregson ’s benefit . [I]4204-a lady whose wishes ” he , the testator may not repeat all this in [lawyer]4209-lawyer ’s phrase ; [I]4204-a lady whose wishes ” he , the testator heard it through [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , and [she]215-miss galindo might make mistakes . Though , indeed , [she]215-miss galindo was very clear - headed , and soon earned the respect of [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson , [[[my]4204-a lady whose wishes ” he , the testator lady]336-my lady ’s lawyer from [Warwick]40-warwick]4211-my lady ’s lawyer from warwick . [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson knew [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo a little before , both personally and by reputation ; but [I]4204-a lady whose wishes ” he , the testator do n’t think [he]248-mr. smithson was prepared to find [her]215-miss galindo installed as [[steward]2453-steward ’s clerk]2454-steward ’s clerk , and , at first , [he]248-mr. smithson was inclined to treat [her]215-miss galindo , in this capacity , with polite contempt . But [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was both [a lady]3790-a lady and [a spirited , sensible woman]4215-a spirited , sensible woman , and [she]215-miss galindo could put aside [her]215-miss galindo self - indulgence in eccentricity of speech and manner whenever [she]215-miss galindo chose . Nay more ; [she]215-miss galindo was usually so talkative , that if [she]215-miss galindo had not been amusing and warm - hearted , one might have thought [her]215-miss galindo wearisome occasionally . But to meet [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson [she]215-miss galindo came out daily in [her]215-miss galindo Sunday gown ; [she]215-miss galindo said no more than was required in answer to [his]248-mr. smithson questions ; [her]215-miss galindo books and papers were in thorough order , and methodically kept ; [her]215-miss galindo statements of matters - of - fact accurate , and to be relied on . [She]215-miss galindo was amusingly conscious of [her]215-miss galindo victory over [his]248-mr. smithson contempt of [a woman - clerk]4216-a woman - clerk and [his]248-mr. smithson preconceived opinion of [her]215-miss galindo unpractical eccentricity . “[4204-a lady whose wishes ” he , the testator] Let [me]0-i alone , ” said [she]215-miss galindo , one day when [she]215-miss galindo came in to sit awhile with [me]4204-a lady whose wishes ” he , the testator . “[4204-a lady whose wishes ” he , the testator] [That man]2019-that man is [a good man]2476-a good man — [a sensible man]2477-a sensible man — and [I]0-i have no doubt [he]2019-that man is [a good lawyer]2478-a good lawyer ; but [he]2019-that man ca n’t fathom [women]2479-women yet . [I]0-i make no doubt [he]2019-that man ’ll go back to [Warwick]40-warwick , and never give credit again to [those people who made [him]2019-that man think [me]0-i half - cracked to begin with]2480-those people who made him think me half - cracked to begin with . O , [[my]0-i dear]3052-my dear , [he]2019-that man did ! [He]2019-that man showed it twenty times worse than [[my]0-i poor dear master]2482-my poor dear master ever did . It was a form to be gone through to please [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , and , for [her]336-my lady sake , [he]2019-that man would hear [my]0-i statements and see [my]0-i books . It was keeping [a woman]3339-a woman out of harm ’s way , at any rate , to let [her]3339-a woman fancy [herself]3339-a woman useful . [I]0-i read [the man]413-the man . And , [I]0-i am thankful to say , [he]413-the man can not read [me]0-i . At least , only one side of [me]0-i . When [I]0-i see an end to be gained , [I]0-i can behave [myself]0-i accordingly . Here was [a man who thought that [a woman in a black silk gown]2487-a woman in a black silk gown was [a respectable , orderly kind of person]2488-a respectable , orderly kind of person]2486-a man who thought that a woman in a black silk gown was a respectable , orderly kind of person ; and [I]0-i was [a woman in a black silk gown]2487-a woman in a black silk gown . [He]2486-a man who thought that a woman in a black silk gown was a respectable , orderly kind of person believed that [a woman]3339-a woman could not write straight lines , and required [a man]725-a man to tell [her]3339-a woman that two and two made four . [I]0-i was not above ruling [my]0-i books , and had [Cocker]249-cocker a little more at [my]0-i fingers ’ ends than [he]413-the man had . But [my]0-i greatest triumph has been holding [my]0-i tongue . [He]2486-a man who thought that a woman in a black silk gown was a respectable , orderly kind of person would have thought nothing of [my]0-i books , or [my]0-i sums , or [my]0-i black silk gown , if [I]0-i had spoken unasked . So [I]0-i have buried more sense in [my]0-i bosom these ten days than ever [I]0-i have uttered in the whole course of [my]0-i life before . [I]0-i have been so curt , so abrupt , so abominably dull , that [I]0-i ’ll answer for it [he]2486-a man who thought that a woman in a black silk gown was a respectable , orderly kind of person thinks [me]0-i worthy to be [a man]725-a man . But [I]0-i must go back to [him]2486-a man who thought that a woman in a black silk gown was a respectable , orderly kind of person , [[my]0-i dear]3052-my dear , so good - bye to conversation and [you]3052-my dear . ” But though [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson might be satisfied with [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , [I]3052-my dear am afraid [she]215-miss galindo was the only part of the affair with which [he]2486-a man who thought that a woman in a black silk gown was a respectable , orderly kind of person was content . Everything else went wrong . [I]3052-my dear could not say who told [me]3052-my dear so — but the conviction of this seemed to pervade [the house]3047-the house . [I]3052-my dear never knew how much [we]4218-we had all looked up to the silent , gruff [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner for decisions , until [he]238-mr. horner was gone . [[My]3052-my dear lady]336-my lady [herself]336-my lady was [a pretty good woman of business]4220-a pretty good woman of business , as [women of business]4221-women of business go . [[Her]336-my lady father]1460-her father , seeing that [she]336-my lady would be [the heiress of [the Hanbury property]1085-the hanbury property]4223-the heiress of the hanbury property , had given [her]336-my lady a training which was thought unusual in those days , and [she]336-my lady liked to feel [herself]336-my lady queen regnant , and to have to decide in all cases between [herself]336-my lady and [[her]336-my lady tenantry]4225-her tenantry . But , perhaps , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner would have done it more wisely ; not but what [she]336-my lady always attended to [him]238-mr. horner at last . [She]336-my lady would begin by saying , pretty clearly and promptly , what [she]336-my lady would have done , and what [she]336-my lady would not have done . If [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner approved of it , [he]238-mr. horner bowed , and set about obeying [her]336-my lady directly ; if [he]238-mr. horner disapproved of it , [he]238-mr. horner bowed , and lingered so long before [he]238-mr. horner obeyed [her]336-my lady , that [she]336-my lady forced [his]238-mr. horner opinion out of [him]238-mr. horner with [her]336-my lady “[3052-my dear] Well , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ! and what have [you]238-mr. horner to say against it ? ” For [she]336-my lady always understood [his]238-mr. horner silence as well as if [he]238-mr. horner had spoken . But [the estate]582-the estate was pressed for ready money , and [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner had grown gloomy and languid since the death of [[his]238-mr. horner wife]3072-his wife , and even [his]238-mr. horner own personal affairs were not in the order in which [they]4228-they had been a year or two before , for [[his]238-mr. horner old clerk]4229-his old clerk had gradually become superannuated , or , at any rate , unable by the superfluity of [his]4229-his old clerk own energy and wit to supply the spirit that was wanting in [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner . Day after day [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson seemed to grow more fidgety , more annoyed at the state of affairs . Like [every one else employed by [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow]4230-every one else employed by lady ludlow , as far as [I]238-mr. horner could learn , [he]248-mr. smithson had an hereditary tie to [the Hanbury family]654-the hanbury family . As long as [the Smithsons]250-the smithsons had been [lawyers]4232-lawyers , [they]250-the smithsons had been [lawyers to [the Hanburys]139-the hanburys]4233-lawyers to the hanburys ; always coming in on all great family occasions , and better able to understand the characters , and connect the links of what had once been [a large and scattered family]4234-a large and scattered family , than [any individual thereof]4235-any individual thereof had ever been . As long as [a man]725-a man was at the head of [the Hanburys]139-the hanburys , [the lawyers]4237-the lawyers had simply acted as [servants]4238-servants , and had only given [their]4237-the lawyers advice when it was required . But [they]4237-the lawyers had assumed a different position on the memorable occasion of the mortgage : [they]4237-the lawyers had remonstrated against it . [[My]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady had resented this remonstrance , and a slight , unspoken coolness had existed between [her]336-my lady and [the father of [this Mr. Smithson]4241-this mr. smithson]4240-the father of this mr. smithson ever since . [I]238-mr. horner was very sorry for [[my]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady . [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson was inclined to blame [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner for the disorderly state in which [he]248-mr. smithson found [some of [the outlying farms]4244-the outlying farms]4243-some of the outlying farms , and for the deficiencies in the annual payment of rents . [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson had too much good feeling to put this blame into words ; but [[my]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady ’s quick instinct led [her]336-my lady to reply to a thought , the existence of which [she]336-my lady perceived ; and [she]336-my lady quietly told the truth , and explained how [she]336-my lady had interfered repeatedly to prevent [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner from taking certain desirable steps , which were discordant to [her]336-my lady hereditary sense of right and wrong between [landlord]4246-landlord and [tenant]4247-tenant . [She]336-my lady also spoke of the want of ready money as a misfortune that could be remedied , by more economical personal expenditure on [her]336-my lady own part ; by which individual saving , it was possible that a reduction of fifty pounds a year might have been accomplished . But as soon as [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson touched on larger economies , such as either affected the welfare of [others]3078-others , or the honour and standing of [the great House of [Hanbury]13-hanbury]4249-the great house of hanbury , [she]336-my lady was inflexible . [[Her]336-my lady establishment]3841-her establishment consisted of somewhere about [forty servants]4251-forty servants , of whom nearly as many as twenty were unable to perform [their]4251-forty servants work properly , and yet would have been hurt if [they]4251-forty servants had been dismissed ; so [they]4251-forty servants had the credit of fulfilling duties , while [[my]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady paid and kept [their]4251-forty servants substitutes . [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson made a calculation , and would have saved some hundreds a year by pensioning off [these old servants]4253-these old servants . But [[my]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady would not hear of it . Then , again , [I]238-mr. horner know privately that [he]248-mr. smithson urged [her]336-my lady to allow [some of [us]4256-we]4255-some of us to return to [[our]4256-we homes]4257-our homes . Bitterly [we]4256-we should have regretted the separation from [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow ; but [we]4256-we would have gone back gladly , had [we]4256-we known at the time that [her]92-lady ludlow circumstances required it : but [she]336-my lady would not listen to the proposal for a moment . “[238-mr. horner] If [I]0-i can not act justly towards [every one]1255-every one , [I]0-i will give up a plan which has been a source of much satisfaction ; at least , [I]0-i will not carry it out to such an extent in future . [I]0-i can not go back from [my]0-i word , [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson . [We]2496-i had better talk no more of this . ” As [she]336-my lady spoke , [she]336-my lady entered [the room where [I]2496-i lay]3809-the room where i lay . [She]336-my lady and [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson were coming for some papers contained in [the bureau]953-the bureau . [They]3178-these young ladies did not know [I]2496-i was [there]559-there , and [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson started a little when [he]248-mr. smithson saw [me]2496-i , as [he]248-mr. smithson must have been aware that [I]2496-i had overheard something . [She]336-my lady came up to [me]2496-i , and kissed [me]2496-i on the forehead , and then went to search for the required papers . “[2496-i] [I]0-i rode over [the Connington farms]2497-the connington farms yesterday , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . [I]0-i must say [I]0-i was quite grieved to see the condition [they]2497-the connington farms are in ; all the land that is not waste is utterly exhausted with working successive white crops . Not a pinch of manure laid on the ground for years . [I]0-i must say that a greater contrast could never have been presented than that between [[Harding]251-harding ’s farm]2499-harding ’s farm and [the next fields]2500-the next fields — fences in perfect order , rotation crops , sheep eating down the turnips on [the waste lands]2501-the waste lands — everything that could be desired . ” “[0-i] [Whose farm]2502-whose farm is that ? ” asked [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . “[0-i] Why , [I]0-i am sorry to say , it was on none of [[your]2503-your ladyship]3058-your ladyship ’s that [I]0-i saw such good methods adopted . [The lad]3210-the lad looked pale enough , as [he]3210-the lad stood propping [himself]3210-the lad up on [his]3210-the lad crutch , and the instant [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady saw [him]3210-the lad , [she]336-my lady bade [John Footman]134-john footman place a stool for [him]3210-the lad to sit down upon while [she]336-my lady spoke to [him]3210-the lad . It might be [his]3210-the lad paleness that gave [his]3210-the lad whole face a more refined and gentle look ; but [I]0-i suspect it was that [the boy]3214-the boy was apt to take impressions , and that [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s grave , dignified ways , and [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s tender and quiet manners , had altered [him]3210-the lad ; and then the thoughts of illness and death seem to turn many of [us]4285-our into [gentlemen]4286-gentlemen , and [gentlewomen]4287-gentlewomen , as long as such thoughts are in [our]4285-our minds . [We]4285-our can not speak loudly or angrily at such times ; [we]4285-our are not apt to be eager about mere worldly things , for [our]4285-our very awe at [our]4285-our quickened sense of the nearness of the invisible world , makes [us]4285-our calm and serene about the petty trifles of to - day . At least , [I]0-i know that was the explanation [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray once gave [me]0-i of what [we]4285-our all thought the great improvement in [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson ’s way of behaving . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady hesitated so long about what [she]336-my lady had best say , that [Harry]150-harry gregson grew a little frightened at [her]336-my lady silence . At last [she]336-my lady said , and [I]0-i think the tears were in [her]336-my lady eyes : “[0-i] [[My]0-i poor little fellow]2551-my poor little fellow , [you]2551-my poor little fellow have had a narrow escape with [your]2551-my poor little fellow life since [I]0-i saw [you]2551-my poor little fellow last . ” To this there was nothing to be said but “[2551-my poor little fellow] Yes ; ” and again there was silence . “[2551-my poor little fellow] And [you]2551-my poor little fellow have lost [a good , kind friend]2552-a good , kind friend , in [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner . ” [The boy]3214-the boy ’s lips worked , and [I]238-mr. horner think [he]3214-the boy said , “[238-mr. horner] Please , do n’t . ” But [I]238-mr. horner ca n’t be sure ; at any rate , [[my]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady went on : “[238-mr. horner] And so have [[I,—a]2553-i,—a good , kind friend]2554-i,—a good , kind friend , [he]238-mr. horner was to both of [us]2555-us ; and to [you]2551-my poor little fellow [he]238-mr. horner wished to show [his]238-mr. horner kindness in even a more generous way than [he]238-mr. horner has done . [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray has told [you]2551-my poor little fellow about [his]113-mr. gray legacy to [you]2551-my poor little fellow , has [he]113-mr. gray not ? ” There was no sign of eager joy on [the lad]3210-the lad ’s face , as if [he]3210-the lad realised the power and pleasure of having what to [him]3210-the lad must have seemed like a fortune . “[113-mr. gray] [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray said as how [he]113-mr. gray had left [me]0-i a matter of money . ” “[113-mr. gray] Yes , [he]113-mr. gray has left [you]2551-my poor little fellow two hundred pounds . ” “[113-mr. gray] But [I]0-i would rather have had [him]113-mr. gray alive , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , ” [he]3210-the lad burst out , sobbing as if [his]3210-the lad heart would break . “[0-i] [[My]0-i lad]1786-my lad , [I]0-i believe [you]2551-my poor little fellow . [We]2558-we would rather have had [our]2558-we dead alive , would [we]2558-we not ? and there is nothing in money that can comfort [us]2558-we for [their]2559-their loss . But [you]2551-my poor little fellow know — [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray has told [you]2551-my poor little fellow — who has appointed all [our]2558-we times to die . [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was [a good , just man]2560-a good , just man ; and has done well and kindly , both by [me]0-i and [you]2551-my poor little fellow . [You]2551-my poor little fellow perhaps do not know ” ( and now [I]238-mr. horner understood what [[my]238-mr. horner lady]336-my lady had been making up [her]336-my lady mind to say to [Harry]238-mr. horner , all the time [she]336-my lady was hesitating how to begin ) “[238-mr. horner] that [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner , at one time , meant to leave [you]2551-my poor little fellow a great deal more ; probably all [he]238-mr. horner had , with the exception of a legacy to [[his]238-mr. horner old clerk]4229-his old clerk , [Morrison]255-morrison . But [he]238-mr. horner knew that [this estate]2562-this estate — on which [[my]0-i forefathers]2563-my forefathers had lived for six hundred years — was in debt , and that [I]0-i had no immediate chance of paying off this debt ; and yet [he]238-mr. horner felt that it was a very sad thing for [an old property like this]2564-an old property like this to belong in part to [those other men , who had lent the money]2565-those other men , who had lent the money . [You]2551-my poor little fellow understand [me]0-i , [I]0-i think , [[my]0-i little man]2566-my little man ? ” said [she]0-i , questioning [Harry]238-mr. horner ’s face . [He]238-mr. horner had left off crying , and was trying to understand , with all [his]238-mr. horner might and main ; and [I]0-i think [he]238-mr. horner had got a pretty good general idea of the state of affairs ; though probably [he]238-mr. horner was puzzled by the term “[0-i] the estate being in debt . ” But [he]238-mr. horner was sufficiently interested to want [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady to go on ; and [he]238-mr. horner nodded [his]238-mr. horner head at [her]336-my lady , to signify this to [her]336-my lady . “[0-i] So [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner took the money which [he]238-mr. horner once meant to be [yours]2567-you , and has left the greater part of it to [me]0-i , with the intention of helping [me]0-i to pay off this debt [I]0-i have told [you]2567-you about . It will go a long way , and [I]0-i shall try hard to save the rest , and then [I]0-i shall die happy in leaving [the land]3166-the land free from debt . ” [She]0-i paused . “[0-i] But [I]0-i shall not die happy in thinking of [you]2567-you . [I]0-i do not know if having money , or even having [a great estate]2569-a great estate and much honour , is a good thing for [any of [us]2571-us]2570-any of us . But [God]133-god sees fit that [some of [us]2571-us]4255-some of us should be called to this condition , and it is [our]2571-us duty then to stand by [[our]2571-us posts]2573-our posts , like [brave soldiers]2574-brave soldiers . Now , [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner intended [you]2567-you to have this money first . [I]0-i shall only call it borrowing from [you]2567-you , [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson , if [I]0-i take it and use it to pay off the debt . [I]0-i shall pay [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray interest on this money , because [he]113-mr. gray is to stand as [[your]2567-you guardian]2575-your guardian , as it were , till [you]2567-you come of age ; and [he]113-mr. gray must fix what ought to be done with it , so as to fit [you]2567-you for spending the principal rightly when the estate can repay it [you]2567-you . [I]0-i suppose , now , it will be right for [you]2567-you to be educated . That will be another snare that will come with [your]2567-you money . But have courage , [Harry]150-harry gregson . Both education and money may be used rightly , if [we]2576-we only pray against the temptations [they]2577-they bring with [them]2577-they . ” [Harry]150-harry gregson could make no answer , though [I]2579-father am sure [he]150-harry gregson understood it all . [[My]2579-father lady]336-my lady wanted to get [him]150-harry gregson to talk to [her]336-my lady a little , by way of becoming acquainted with what was passing in [his]150-harry gregson mind ; and [she]336-my lady asked [him]150-harry gregson what [he]150-harry gregson would like to have done with [his]150-harry gregson money , if [he]150-harry gregson could have part of it now ? To such a simple question , involving no talk about feelings , [his]150-harry gregson answer came readily enough . “[2579-father] Build [a cottage]3779-a cottage for [father]2579-father , with stairs in [it]3779-a cottage , and give [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray [a school - house]2282-a school - house . [Father]256-father saw all the stones lying quarried and hewn on [[Farmer Hale]233-farmer hale ’s land]2295-farmer hale ’s land ; [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had paid for them all [himself]113-mr. gray . [[My]258-mr. brooks lady]336-my lady kept silence . “[258-mr. brooks] If [I]0-i might have a piece of [my]0-i money , [I]0-i would buy land from [Mr. Brooks]258-mr. brooks ; [he]258-mr. brooks has got a bit to sell just at [the corner of [Hendon Lane]76-hendon lane]2586-the corner of hendon lane , and [I]0-i would give it to [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ; and , perhaps , if [[your]113-mr. gray ladyship]3058-your ladyship thinks [I]0-i may be learned again , [I]0-i might grow up into [the schoolmaster]2588-the schoolmaster . ” “[2588-the schoolmaster] [You]113-mr. gray are [a good boy]2589-a good boy , ” said [[my]2588-the schoolmaster lady]336-my lady . “[2588-the schoolmaster] But there are more things to be thought of , in carrying out such a plan , than [you]113-mr. gray are aware of . [My]113-mr. gray first account of [him]113-mr. gray was from [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo . “[113-mr. gray] [He]113-mr. gray ’s not above thirty ; and [I]0-i must just pack up [my]0-i pens and [my]0-i paper , and be off ; for it would be the height of impropriety for [me]0-i to be staying [here]3173-here as [[his]113-mr. gray clerk]3951-his clerk . [I]0-i did not think it became [me]0-i to look at [him]113-mr. gray . Well , now for the nightcaps . [I]0-i should have grudged [any one else]1077-any one else doing them , for [I]0-i have got such a pretty pattern ! ” But when it came to [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s leaving , there was a great misunderstanding between [her]215-miss galindo and [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had imagined that [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady had asked [her]215-miss galindo as a favour to copy the letters , and enter the accounts , and had agreed to do the work without the notion of being paid for so doing . [She]215-miss galindo had , now and then , grieved over a very profitable order for needlework passing out of [her]215-miss galindo hands on account of [her]215-miss galindo not having time to do it , because of [her]215-miss galindo occupation at [the Hall]501-the hall ; but [she]215-miss galindo had never hinted this to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , but gone on cheerfully at [her]215-miss galindo writing as long as [her]215-miss galindo clerkship was required . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady was annoyed that [she]336-my lady had not made [her]336-my lady intention of paying [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo more clear , in the first conversation [she]336-my lady had had with [her]336-my lady ; but [I]0-i suppose that [she]336-my lady had been too delicate to be very explicit with regard to money matters ; and now [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was quite hurt at [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s wanting to pay [her]336-my lady for what [she]336-my lady had done in such right - down good - will . “[0-i] No , ” [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo said ; “[0-i] [[my]0-i own dear lady]2609-my own dear lady , [you]2609-my own dear lady may be as angry with [me]0-i as [you]2609-my own dear lady like , but do n’t offer [me]0-i money . Think of six - and - twenty years ago , and poor [Arthur]259-arthur , and as [you]2609-my own dear lady were to [me]0-i then ! Besides , [I]0-i wanted money — [I]0-i do n’t disguise it — for a particular purpose ; and when [I]0-i found that ( God bless [you]2609-my own dear lady for asking [me]0-i ! ) [I]0-i could do [you]2609-my own dear lady a service , [I]0-i turned it over in [my]0-i mind , and [I]0-i gave up one plan and took up another , and it ’s all settled now . [Bessy]260-bessy is to leave [school]2610-school and come and live with [me]0-i . Do n’t , please , offer [me]0-i money again . [You]2609-my own dear lady do n’t know how glad [I]0-i have been to do anything for [you]2609-my own dear lady . Have not [I]0-i , [Margaret Dawson]94-margaret dawson ? Did [you]2609-my own dear lady not hear [me]0-i say , one day , [I]0-i would cut off [my]0-i hand for [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ; for am [I]0-i a stick or a stone , that [I]0-i should forget kindness ? O , [I]0-i have been so glad to work for [you]2609-my own dear lady . And now [Bessy]260-bessy is coming [here]3173-here ; and [no one]590-no one knows anything about [her]260-bessy — as if [she]260-bessy had done anything wrong , [poor child]1573-poor child ! ” “[260-bessy] Dear [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , ” replied [[my]260-bessy lady]336-my lady , “[260-bessy] [I]0-i will never ask [you]215-miss galindo to take money again . Only [I]0-i thought it was quite understood between [us]2615-us .
