[Dear Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , [you]215-miss galindo must honour [me]0-i by being confidential with [me]0-i in [your]215-miss galindo turn ! ” CHAPTER XIII . [I]633-the king had always understood that [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had once been in much better circumstances , but [I]633-the king had never liked to ask any questions respecting [her]215-miss galindo . But about this time many things came out respecting [her]215-miss galindo former life , which [I]633-the king will try and arrange : not however , in the order in which [I]633-the king heard them , but rather as they occurred . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was [the daughter of [a clergyman in [Westmoreland]77-westmoreland]4310-a clergyman in westmoreland]4309-the daughter of a clergyman in westmoreland . [[Her]215-miss galindo father]1460-her father was [the younger brother of [a baronet]4313-a baronet]4312-the younger brother of a baronet , [[his]1460-her father ancestor]4314-his ancestor having been [one of those of [James the First]261-james the first ’s creation]4315-one of those of james the first ’s creation . [[This baronet]4316-this baronet - uncle of [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo]4317-this baronet - uncle of miss galindo was [one of [the queer , out - of - the - way people who were bred at that time]4319-the queer , out - of - the - way people who were bred at that time , and in [that northern district of [England]9-england]4320-that northern district of england]4318-one of the queer , out - of - the - way people who were bred at that time , and in that northern district of england . [I]633-the king never heard much of [him]4316-this baronet from [any one , besides this one great fact]4321-any one , besides this one great fact : that [he]4316-this baronet had early disappeared from [[his]4316-this baronet family]4097-his family , which indeed only consisted of [a brother]2210-a brother and sister who died unmarried , and lived [no one]590-no one knew where,—somewhere on [the Continent]78-the continent , it was supposed , for [he]4316-this baronet had never returned from the grand tour which [he]4316-this baronet had been sent to make , according to the general fashion of the day , as soon as [he]4316-this baronet had left [Oxford]16-oxford . [He]4316-this baronet corresponded occasionally with [[his]4316-this baronet brother]3293-his brother [the clergyman]376-the clergyman ; but the letters passed through [a banker]4327-a banker ’s hands ; [the banker]4328-the banker being pledged to secrecy , and , as [he]4316-this baronet told [Mr. Galindo]262-mr. galindo , having the penalty , if [he]4316-this baronet broke [his]4316-this baronet pledge , of losing the whole profitable business , and of having the management of [the baronet]4329-the baronet ’s affairs taken out of [his]4316-this baronet hands , without any advantage accruing to [the inquirer]4330-the inquirer , for [Sir Lawrence]263-sir lawrence had told [Messrs. Graham]264-messrs. graham that , in case [his]263-sir lawrence place of residence was revealed by [them]264-messrs. graham , not only would [he]263-sir lawrence cease to bank with [them]264-messrs. graham , but instantly take measures to baffle any future inquiries as to [his]263-sir lawrence whereabouts , by removing to [some distant country]4331-some distant country . [Sir Lawrence]263-sir lawrence paid a certain sum of money to [[his]263-sir lawrence brother]3293-his brother ’s account every year ; but the time of this payment varied , and it was sometimes eighteen or nineteen months between the deposits ; then , again , it would not be above a quarter of the time , showing that [he]263-sir lawrence intended it to be annual , but , as this intention was never expressed in words , it was impossible to rely upon it , and a great deal of this money was swallowed up by the necessity [Mr. Galindo]262-mr. galindo felt [himself]262-mr. galindo under of living in [the large , old , rambling family mansion]4333-the large , old , rambling family mansion , which had been one of [Sir Lawrence]263-sir lawrence ’s rarely expressed desires . [Mr.]4334-mr. and [Mrs. Galindo]265-mrs. galindo often planned to live upon [their]264-messrs. graham own small fortune and the income derived from the living ( [a vicarage]4335-a vicarage , of which the great tithes went to [Sir Lawrence]263-sir lawrence as lay impropriator ) , so as to put - by the payments made by [the baronet]4329-the baronet , for the benefit of [Laurentia]267-laurentia — [[our]4337-our [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo]4338-our miss galindo . But [I]633-the king suppose [they]264-messrs. graham found it difficult to live economically in [a large house]4339-a large house , even though [they]264-messrs. graham had [it]4339-a large house rent free . [They]264-messrs. graham had to keep up with [hereditary neighbours]4340-hereditary neighbours and [friends]3176-friends , and could hardly help doing it in the hereditary manner . [One of [these neighbours]4343-these neighbours]4342-one of these neighbours , [a Mr. Gibson]266-mark , had [a son]1517-a son a few years older than [Laurentia]267-laurentia . [The families]4345-the families were sufficiently intimate for [the young people]4346-the young people to see a good deal of [each other]780-each other : and [I]633-the king was told that this young [Mr. Mark Gibson]266-mark was [an unusually prepossessing man]4348-an unusually prepossessing man ( [he]266-mark seemed to have impressed every one who spoke of [him]266-mark to [me]633-the king as being [a handsome , manly , kind - hearted fellow]4349-a handsome , manly , kind - hearted fellow ) , just what [a girl]304-a girl would be sure to find most agreeable . [The parents]4351-the parents either forgot that [[their]4351-the parents children]4352-their children were growing up to [[man]1233-man ’s and [woman]3794-woman ’s estate]4354-man ’s and woman ’s estate , or thought that the intimacy and probable attachment would be no bad thing , even if it did lead to a marriage . Still , nothing was ever said by [young Gibson]266-mark till later on , when it was too late , as it turned out . [He]266-mark went to and from [Oxford]16-oxford ; [he]266-mark shot and fished with [Mr. Galindo]262-mr. galindo , or came to [the Mere]4356-the mere to skate in winter - time ; was asked to accompany [Mr. Galindo]262-mr. galindo to [the Hall]501-the hall , as [the latter]841-the latter returned to the quiet dinner with [[his]262-mr. galindo wife]3072-his wife and [daughter]4360-daughter ; and so , and so , it went on , [nobody]4361-nobody much knew how , until one day , when [Mr. Galindo]262-mr. galindo received a formal letter from [[[his]262-mr. galindo brother]3293-his brother ’s bankers]4363-his brother ’s bankers , announcing [Sir Lawrence]263-sir lawrence ’s death , of malaria fever , at [Albano]80-albano , and congratulating [Sir Hubert]268-sir hubert on [his]268-sir hubert accession to [the estates]4167-the estates and [the baronetcy]4365-the baronetcy . [The king]633-the king is dead—“Long[633-the king] live [the king]633-the king ! ” as [I]633-the king have since heard that [the French]111-the french express it . [Sir Hubert]268-sir hubert and [[his]268-sir hubert wife]3072-his wife were greatly surprised . [Sir Lawrence]263-sir lawrence was but two years older than [[his]263-sir lawrence brother]3293-his brother ; and [they]4363-his brother ’s bankers had never heard of any illness till [they]4363-his brother ’s bankers heard of [his]263-sir lawrence death . [They]4363-his brother ’s bankers were sorry ; very much shocked ; but still a little elated at the succession to the baronetcy and estates . [The London bankers]4369-the london bankers had managed everything well . There was a large sum of ready money in [their]4369-the london bankers hands , at [Sir Hubert]268-sir hubert ’s service , until [he]268-sir hubert should touch [his]268-sir hubert rents , the rent - roll being eight thousand a - year . And only [Laurentia]267-laurentia to inherit it all ! [[Her]267-laurentia mother]539-her mother , [[a poor clergyman]310-a poor clergyman ’s daughter]4372-a poor clergyman ’s daughter , began to plan all sorts of fine marriages for [her]267-laurentia ; nor was [[her]267-laurentia father]1460-her father much behind [[his]1460-her father wife]3072-his wife in [his]1460-her father ambition . [They]4369-the london bankers took [her]267-laurentia up to [London]2-london , when [they]4369-the london bankers went to buy [new carriages]4375-new carriages , and dresses , and furniture . And it was then and there [she]267-laurentia made [[my]633-the king lady]336-my lady ’s acquaintance . How it was that [they]4369-the london bankers came to take a fancy to [each other]780-each other , [I]633-the king can not say . [[My]633-the king lady]336-my lady was of [the old nobility,—grand]4379-the old nobility,—grand , compose , gentle , and stately in [her]336-my lady ways . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo must always have been hurried in [her]215-miss galindo manner , and [her]215-miss galindo energy must have shown itself in inquisitiveness and oddness even in [her]215-miss galindo youth . But [I]633-the king do n’t pretend to account for things : [I]633-the king only narrate them . And the fact was this:—that [the elegant , fastidious countess]4380-the elegant , fastidious countess was attracted to [the country girl , who on [her]215-miss galindo part almost worshipped [[my]633-the king lady]336-my lady]4381-the country girl , who on her part almost worshipped my lady . [[My]633-the king lady]336-my lady ’s notice of [[their]4369-the london bankers daughter]4384-their daughter made [[her]4384-their daughter parents]4385-her parents think , [I]633-the king suppose , that there was no match that [she]4384-their daughter might not command ; [she]4384-their daughter , [the heiress of eight thousand a - year]4386-the heiress of eight thousand a - year , and visiting about among [earls]4387-earls and [dukes]4388-dukes . So when [they]4369-the london bankers came back to [[their]4369-the london bankers old [Westmoreland Hall]81-westmoreland hall]4389-their old westmoreland hall , and [Mark Gibson]266-mark rode over to offer [his]266-mark hand and [his]266-mark heart , and prospective estate of nine hundred a - year , to [[his]266-mark old companion]4390-his old companion and playfellow , [Laurentia]267-laurentia , [Sir Hubert]268-sir hubert and [Lady Galindo]269-lady galindo made very short work of it . [They]4369-the london bankers refused [him]266-mark plumply [themselves]4369-the london bankers ; and when [he]266-mark begged to be allowed to speak to [Laurentia]267-laurentia , [they]4369-the london bankers found some excuse for refusing [him]266-mark the opportunity of so doing , until [they]4369-the london bankers had talked to [her]267-laurentia [themselves]4369-the london bankers , and brought up every argument and fact in [their]4369-the london bankers power to convince [her]267-laurentia — [a plain girl]4391-a plain girl , and conscious of [her]267-laurentia plainness — that [Mr. Mark Gibson]266-mark had never thought of [her]267-laurentia in the way of marriage till after [[her]267-laurentia father]1460-her father ’s accession to [his]266-mark fortune ; and that it was the estate — not [the young lady]3296-the young lady — that [he]266-mark was in love with . [I]633-the king suppose it will never be known in [this world]1092-this world how far this supposition of [theirs]4369-the london bankers was true . [[My]633-the king Lady [Ludlow]92-lady ludlow]333-my lady ludlow had always spoken as if it was ; but perhaps events , which came to [her]92-lady ludlow knowledge about this time , altered [her]92-lady ludlow opinion . At any rate , the end of it was , [Laurentia]267-laurentia refused [Mark]266-mark , and almost broke [her]267-laurentia heart in doing so . [He]266-mark discovered the suspicions of [Sir Hubert]268-sir hubert and [Lady Galindo]269-lady galindo , and that [they]4369-the london bankers had persuaded [[their]4369-the london bankers daughter]4384-their daughter to share in [them]4369-the london bankers . So [he]266-mark flung off with high words , saying that [they]4369-the london bankers did not know a true heart when [they]4369-the london bankers met with [one]927-one ; and that although [he]266-mark had never offered till after [Sir Lawrence]263-sir lawrence ’s death , yet that [[his]266-mark father]3292-his father knew all along that [he]266-mark had been attached to [Laurentia]267-laurentia , only that [he]266-mark , being [the eldest of [five children]4400-five children]4399-the eldest of five children , and having as yet no profession , had had to conceal , rather than to express , an attachment , which , in those days , [he]266-mark had believed was reciprocated . [He]266-mark had always meant to study for the bar , and the end of all [he]266-mark had hoped for had been to earn a moderate income , which [he]266-mark might ask [Laurentia]267-laurentia to share . This , or something like it , was what [he]266-mark said . But [his]266-mark reference to [[his]266-mark father]3292-his father cut two ways . [Old Mr. Gibson]266-mark was known to be very keen about money . It was just as likely that [he]266-mark would urge [Mark]266-mark to make love to [the heiress]4402-the heiress , now [she]4402-the heiress was [an heiress]944-an heiress , as that [he]266-mark would have restrained [him]266-mark previously , as [Mark]266-mark said [he]266-mark had done . When this was repeated to [Mark]266-mark , [he]266-mark became proudly reserved , or sullen , and said that [Laurentia]267-laurentia , at any rate , might have known [him]266-mark better . [He]266-mark left [the country]1448-the country , and went up to [London]2-london to study law soon afterwards ; and [Sir Hubert]268-sir hubert and [Lady Galindo]269-lady galindo thought [they]4405-they were well rid of [him]266-mark . But [Laurentia]267-laurentia never ceased reproaching [herself]267-laurentia , and never did to [her]267-laurentia dying day , as [I]633-the king believe . The words , “[633-the king] [She]2618-my might have known [me]0-i better , ” told to [her]267-laurentia by [some kind friend or other]4406-some kind friend or other , rankled in [her]267-laurentia mind , and were never forgotten . [[Her]267-laurentia father]1460-her father and [mother]393-mother took [her]267-laurentia up to [London]2-london the next year ; but [she]267-laurentia did not care to visit — dreaded going out even for a drive , lest [she]267-laurentia should see [Mark Gibson]266-mark ’s reproachful eyes — pined and lost [her]267-laurentia health . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow saw this change with regret , and was told the cause by [Lady Galindo]269-lady galindo , who of course , gave [her]269-lady galindo own version of [Mark]266-mark ’s conduct and motives . [[My]2618-my lady]336-my lady never spoke to [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo about it , but tried constantly to interest and please [her]215-miss galindo . It was at this time that [[my]2618-my lady]336-my lady told [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo so much about [her]215-miss galindo own early life , and about [Hanbury]139-the hanburys , that [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo resolved , if ever [she]215-miss galindo could , [she]215-miss galindo would go and see [the old place which [[her]215-miss galindo friend]4412-her friend loved so well]4411-the old place which her friend loved so well . The end of it all was , that [she]215-miss galindo came to live [there]559-there , as [we]4414-they know . But a great change was to come first . Before [Sir Hubert]268-sir hubert and [Lady Galindo]269-lady galindo had left [London]2-london on this , [their]4414-they second visit , [they]4414-they had a letter from [the lawyer]4415-the lawyer , whom [they]4414-they employed , saying that [Sir Lawrence]263-sir lawrence had left [an heir]4416-an heir , [[his]263-sir lawrence legitimate child]4417-his legitimate child by [an Italian woman of low rank]4418-an italian woman of low rank ; at least , legal claims to the title and property had been sent into [him]263-sir lawrence on [the boy]3214-the boy ’s behalf . [Sir Lawrence]263-sir lawrence had always been [a man of adventurous and artistic , rather than of luxurious tastes]4420-a man of adventurous and artistic , rather than of luxurious tastes ; and it was supposed , when all came to be proved at the trial , that [he]263-sir lawrence was captivated by the free , beautiful life [they]4414-they lead in [Italy]82-italy , and had married [[this Neapolitan fisherman]4421-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter , who had people about [her]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter shrewd enough to see that the ceremony was legally performed . [She]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter and [[her]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter husband]729-her husband had wandered about [the shores of [the Mediterranean]83-the mediterranean]4424-the shores of the mediterranean for years , leading a happy , careless , irresponsible life , unencumbered by any duties except those connected with [a rather numerous family]4425-a rather numerous family . It was enough for [her]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter that [they]4414-they never wanted money , and that [[her]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter husband]729-her husband ’s love was always continued to [her]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter . [She]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter hated the name of [England]9-england — wicked , cold , [heretic England]4427-heretic england — and avoided the mention of [any subjects connected with [[her]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter husband]729-her husband ’s early life]4428-any subjects connected with her husband ’s early life . So that , when [he]729-her husband died at [Albano]80-albano , [she]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter was almost roused out of [her]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter vehement grief to anger with [the Italian doctor]4430-the italian doctor , who declared that [he]4430-the italian doctor must write to a certain address to announce the death of [Lawrence Galindo]270-lawrence galindo . [She]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter hid [herself]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter and [them]394-the children in [the Abruzzi]84-the abruzzi , living upon the sale of what furniture and jewels [Sir Lawrence]263-sir lawrence had died possessed of . When these failed , [she]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter returned to [[Naples]85-naples , which [she]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter had not visited since [her]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter marriage]4433-naples , which she had not visited since her marriage . [[Her]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter father]1460-her father was dead ; but [[her]4422-this neapolitan fisherman ’s daughter brother]3428-her brother inherited some of [his]263-sir lawrence keenness . [He]263-sir lawrence interested [the priests]4436-the priests , who made inquiries and found that [the Galindo]215-miss galindo succession was worth securing to [an heir of the true faith]4437-an heir of the true faith . [They]4436-the priests stirred about it , obtained advice at [the English Embassy]4438-the english embassy ; and hence that letter to [the lawyers]4237-the lawyers , calling upon [Sir Hubert]268-sir hubert to relinquish title and property , and to refund what money [he]263-sir lawrence had expended . [He]263-sir lawrence was vehement in [his]263-sir lawrence opposition to this claim . [He]263-sir lawrence could not bear to think of [[his]263-sir lawrence brother]3293-his brother having married [a foreigner]4441-a foreigner — [a papist]4442-a papist , [a fisherman ’s daughter]4443-a fisherman ’s daughter ; nay , of [his]263-sir lawrence having become [a papist]4442-a papist [himself]263-sir lawrence . [He]263-sir lawrence was in despair at the thought of [his]263-sir lawrence ancestral property going to the issue of such a marriage . [He]263-sir lawrence fought tooth and nail , making enemies of [[his]263-sir lawrence relations]4445-his relations , and losing almost all [his]263-sir lawrence own private property ; for [he]263-sir lawrence would go on against [the lawyer]4415-the lawyer ’s advice , long after [every one]1255-every one was convinced except [himself]263-sir lawrence and [[his]263-sir lawrence wife]3072-his wife . At last [he]263-sir lawrence was conquered . [He]263-sir lawrence gave up [his]263-sir lawrence living in gloomy despair . [He]263-sir lawrence would have changed [his]263-sir lawrence name if [he]263-sir lawrence could , so desirous was [he]263-sir lawrence to obliterate all tie between [himself]263-sir lawrence and [the mongrel papist baronet]4449-the mongrel papist baronet and [[his]263-sir lawrence Italian mother]4450-his italian mother , and [all the succession of [children]324-children and nurses who came to take possession of [the Hall]501-the hall soon after [Mr. Hubert Galindo]262-mr. galindo ’s departure]4451-all the succession of children and nurses who came to take possession of the hall soon after mr. hubert galindo ’s departure , stayed [there]559-there one winter , and then flitted back to [Naples]85-naples with gladness and delight . [Mr.]4455-mr. and [Mrs. Hubert Galindo]265-mrs. galindo lived in [London]2-london . [He]263-sir lawrence had obtained [a curacy somewhere in [the city]992-the city]4456-a curacy somewhere in the city . [They]4458-they would have been thankful now if [Mr. Mark Gibson]266-mark had renewed [his]266-mark offer . [No one]590-no one could accuse [him]263-sir lawrence of mercenary motives if [he]263-sir lawrence had done so . Because [he]263-sir lawrence did not come forward , as [they]4458-they wished , [they]4458-they brought [his]263-sir lawrence silence up as a justification of what [they]4458-they had previously attributed to [him]263-sir lawrence . [I]2618-my do n’t know what [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo thought [herself]215-miss galindo ; but [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow has told [me]2618-my how [she]215-miss galindo shrank from hearing [[her]215-miss galindo parents]4385-her parents abuse [him]263-sir lawrence . [Mr. Mark Gibson]266-mark had risen to some eminence as [a barrister on [the Northern Circuit]4473-the northern circuit]4472-a barrister on the northern circuit , but had died unmarried in the lifetime of [[his]266-mark father]3292-his father , [a victim]4475-a victim ( so [people]302-people said ) to intemperance . [Doctor Trevor]240-doctor trevor , [the physician who had been called in to [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray and [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson]4477-the physician who had been called in to mr. gray and harry gregson , had married a sister of [his]3292-his father . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had been to [Warwick]40-warwick , some years before [I]2618-my arrived at [Hanbury]13-hanbury , on some kind of business or shopping , which can only be transacted in [a county town]4480-a county town . [She]272-mrs. trevor was a little pale , a little silent ; [her]272-mrs. trevor eyes were sometimes swollen , and [her]272-mrs. trevor nose red ; but [she]272-mrs. trevor was at an age when such appearances are generally attributed to a bad cold in the head , rather than to any more sentimental reason . [One or two of [[his]266-mark lawyer friends , whom [I]729-her husband met with at the funeral]4531-his lawyer friends , whom i met with at the funeral]4530-one or two of his lawyer friends , whom i met with at the funeral , told [me]729-her husband [they]4530-one or two of his lawyer friends , whom i met with at the funeral were aware of the existence of [the child]4520-the child . ”[729-her husband] “ What is to be done with [her]4520-the child ? ”[275-mrs. gibson] asked [Mrs. Gibson]275-mrs. gibson . “ Nay , [I]2622-i do n’t know , ”[2622-i] replied [he]2622-i . “ [Mark]266-mark has hardly left assets enough to pay [his]266-mark debts , and [[your]4520-the child father]1495-your father is not inclined to come forward . ”[2622-i] That night , as [Doctor Trevor]240-doctor trevor sat in [[his]240-doctor trevor study]2623-his study , after [[his]240-doctor trevor wife]3072-his wife had gone to bed , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo knocked at [his]240-doctor trevor door . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was not fond of [children]324-children ; and [I]0-i dare say [she]215-miss galindo dreaded taking [this child]2631-this child to live with [her]215-miss galindo for more reasons than one . [[My]0-i Lady [Ludlow]92-lady ludlow]333-my lady ludlow could not endure any mention of [illegitimate children]2633-illegitimate children . And [I]0-i believe [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had always agreed with [her]92-lady ludlow until now , when the thing came home to [her]215-miss galindo womanly heart . Still [she]215-miss galindo shrank from having [this child of [some strange woman under [her]215-miss galindo roof]2636-some strange woman under her roof]2635-this child of some strange woman under her roof . [She]215-miss galindo went over to see it from time to time ; [she]215-miss galindo worked at its clothes long after every one thought [she]215-miss galindo was in bed ; and , when the time came for [Bessy]260-bessy to be sent to [school]2610-school , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo laboured away more diligently than ever , in order to pay the increased expense . For [the Gibson family]4479-the gibson family had , at first , paid [their]4479-the gibson family part of the compact , but with unwillingness and grudging hearts ; then [they]4479-the gibson family had left it off altogether , and it fell hard on [Dr. Trevor]237-dr. trevor with [[his]2639-his twelve children]2640-his twelve children ; and , latterly , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had taken upon [herself]215-miss galindo almost all the burden . [One]927-one can hardly live and labour , and plan and make sacrifices , for [any human creature]2642-any human creature , without learning to love it . And [Bessy]260-bessy loved [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , too , for all [the poor girl]1652-the poor girl ’s scanty pleasures came from [her]215-miss galindo , and [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had always a kind word , and , latterly , many a kind caress , for [[Mark Gibson]266-mark ’s child]2644-mark gibson ’s child ; whereas , if [she]215-miss galindo went to [[Dr. Trevor]237-dr. trevor ’s]4489-dr. trevor ’s for [her]215-miss galindo holiday , [she]215-miss galindo was overlooked and neglected in [that bustling family]2646-that bustling family , who seemed to think that if [she]215-miss galindo had comfortable board and lodging under [their]2646-that bustling family roof , it was enough . [I]0-i am sure , now , that [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had often longed to have [Bessy]260-bessy to live with [her]215-miss galindo ; but , as long as [she]215-miss galindo could pay for [her]215-miss galindo being at [school]2610-school , [she]215-miss galindo did not like to take so bold a step as bringing [her]215-miss galindo [home]586-home , knowing what the effect of the consequent explanation would be on [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . And as [the girl]545-the girl was now more than seventeen , and past the age when [young ladies]3088-young ladies are usually kept at [school]2610-school , and as there was no great demand for [governesses]2653-governesses in those days , and as [Bessy]260-bessy had never been taught any trade by which to earn [her]260-bessy own living , why [I]0-i do n’t exactly see what could have been done but for [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo to bring [her]260-bessy to [[her]260-bessy own home in [Hanbury]13-hanbury]2654-her own home in hanbury . For , although [the child]4520-the child had grown up lately , in a kind of unexpected manner , into [a young woman]534-a young woman , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo might have kept [her]260-bessy at [school]2610-school for a year longer , if [she]260-bessy could have afforded it ; but this was impossible when [she]260-bessy became [[Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s clerk]1191-mr. horner ’s clerk , and relinquished all the payment of [her]260-bessy repository work ; and perhaps , after all , [she]260-bessy was not sorry to be compelled to take the step [she]260-bessy was longing for . At any rate , [Bessy]260-bessy came to live with [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , in a very few weeks from the time when [Captain James]253-captain james set [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo free to superintend [her]215-miss galindo own domestic economy again . For a long time , [I]0-i knew nothing about [this new inhabitant of [Hanbury]13-hanbury]2659-this new inhabitant of hanbury . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady never mentioned [her]2659-this new inhabitant of hanbury in any way . This was in accordance with [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow ’s well - known principles . [She]260-bessy neither saw nor heard , nor was in any way cognisant of the existence of [those who had no legal right to exist at all]2661-those who had no legal right to exist at all . If [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had hoped to have an exception made in [Bessy]260-bessy ’s favour , [she]260-bessy was mistaken . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady sent a note inviting [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo [herself]215-miss galindo to tea one evening , about a month after [Bessy]260-bessy came ; but [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo “ had a cold and could not come . ”[215-miss galindo] The next time [she]215-miss galindo was invited , [she]215-miss galindo “ had an engagement at home”—a[215-miss galindo] step nearer to the absolute truth . And the third time , [she]215-miss galindo “ had [a young friend]4534-a young friend staying with [her]215-miss galindo whom [she]215-miss galindo was unable to leave . ”[215-miss galindo] [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady accepted every excuse as bona fide , and took no further notice . [I]0-i missed [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo very much ; [we]2664-we all did ; for , in the days when [she]215-miss galindo was [clerk]2665-clerk , [she]215-miss galindo was sure to come in and find the opportunity of saying something amusing to some of [us]2664-we before [she]215-miss galindo went away . And [I]0-i , as [an invalid]1441-an invalid , or perhaps from natural tendency , was particularly fond of little bits of village gossip . There was no [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner — [he]238-mr. horner even had come in , now and then , with formal , stately pieces of intelligence — and there was no [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo in these days . [I]0-i missed [her]215-miss galindo much . And so did [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , [I]0-i am sure . Behind all [her]215-miss galindo quiet , sedate manner , [I]0-i am certain [her]215-miss galindo heart ached sometimes for a few words from [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , who seemed to have absented [herself]215-miss galindo altogether from [the Hall]501-the hall now [Bessy]260-bessy was come . [Captain James]253-captain james might be very sensible , and all that ; but not even [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady could call [him]253-captain james a substitute for [the old familiar friends]2670-the old familiar friends . [He]253-captain james was [a thorough sailor]2671-a thorough sailor , as [sailors]2547-sailors were in those days — swore a good deal , drank a good deal ( without its ever affecting [him]253-captain james in the least ) , and was very prompt and kind - hearted in all [his]253-captain james actions ; but [he]253-captain james was not accustomed to [women]2479-women , as [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady once said , and would judge in all things for [himself]253-captain james . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady had expected , [I]0-i think , to find [some one who would take [his]253-captain james notions on the management of [[her]336-my lady estate]2677-her estate from [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship ’s own self]2676-some one who would take his notions on the management of her estate from her ladyship ’s own self ; but [he]253-captain james spoke as if [he]253-captain james were responsible for the good management of the whole , and must , consequently , be allowed full liberty of action . [He]253-captain james had been too long in command over [men]3110-men at [sea]3221-sea to like to be directed by [a woman in anything [he]253-captain james undertook]2681-a woman in anything he undertook , even though [that woman]2682-that woman was [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady . [I]0-i suppose this was the common - sense [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady spoke of ; but when common - sense goes against [us]2685-us , [I]0-i do n’t think [we]2685-us value it quite so much as [we]2685-us ought to do . [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow was proud of [her]92-lady ludlow personal superintendence of [[her]92-lady ludlow own estate]2686-her own estate . [She]92-lady ludlow liked to tell [us]2685-us how [[her]92-lady ludlow father]1460-her father used to take [her]92-lady ludlow with [him]1460-her father in [[his]1460-her father rides]2688-his rides , and bid [her]92-lady ludlow observe this and that , and on no account to allow such and such things to be done . But [I]0-i have heard that the first time [she]92-lady ludlow told all this to [Captain James]253-captain james , [he]253-captain james told [her]92-lady ludlow point - blank that [he]253-captain james had heard from [Mr. Smithson]248-mr. smithson that [the farms]2689-the farms were much neglected and the rents sadly behindhand , and that [he]253-captain james meant to set to in good earnest and study agriculture , and see how [he]253-captain james could remedy the state of things . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady would , [I]0-i am sure , be greatly surprised , but what could [she]92-lady ludlow do ? Here was [the very man [she]92-lady ludlow had chosen [herself]92-lady ludlow]2691-the very man she had chosen herself , setting to with all [his]2691-the very man she had chosen herself energy to conquer the defect of ignorance , which was all that [those who had presumed to offer [her]92-lady ludlow ladyship]2692-those who had presumed to offer her ladyship advice had ever had to say against [him]2691-the very man she had chosen herself . [Captain James]253-captain james read [Arthur Young]259-arthur ’s “ Tours ”[2691-the very man she had chosen herself] in all [his]2691-the very man she had chosen herself spare time , as long as [he]2691-the very man she had chosen herself was [an invalid]1441-an invalid ; and shook [his]253-captain james head at [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s accounts as to how [the land]3166-the land had been cropped or left fallow from time immemorial . Then [he]253-captain james set to , and tried too many new experiments at once . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady looked on in dignified silence ; but [all the farmers]2697-all the farmers and [tenants]1121-tenants were in an uproar , and prophesied a hundred failures . Perhaps fifty did occur ; [they]2699-they were only half as many as [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow had feared ; but they were twice as many , four , eight times as many as [the captain]3378-the captain had anticipated . [His]253-captain james openly - expressed disappointment made [him]253-captain james popular again . [The rough country people]2701-the rough country people could not have understood silent and dignified regret at the failure of [his]253-captain james plans , but [they]2701-the rough country people sympathized with [a man who swore at [his]253-captain james ill success]2702-a man who swore at his ill success — sympathized , even while [they]2701-the rough country people chuckled over [his]253-captain james discomfiture . [Mr. Brooke]252-mr. brooke , [the retired tradesman]2703-the retired tradesman , did not cease blaming [him]253-captain james for not succeeding , and for swearing . “ But what could [you]336-my lady expect from [a sailor]1079-a sailor ? ”[252-mr. brooke] [Mr. Brooke]252-mr. brooke asked , even in [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s hearing ; though [he]252-mr. brooke might have known [Captain James]253-captain james was [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s own personal choice , from the old friendship [Mr. Urian]160-urian had always shown for [him]253-captain james . [I]0-i think it was this speech of [the Birmingham baker]2542-the birmingham baker ’s that made [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady determine to stand by [Captain James]253-captain james , and encourage [him]253-captain james to try again . For [she]336-my lady would not allow that [her]336-my lady choice had been an unwise one , at the bidding ( as it were ) of [a dissenting tradesman]2708-a dissenting tradesman ; [the only person in [the neighbourhood]1750-the neighbourhood]2709-the only person in the neighbourhood , too , who had flaunted about in coloured clothes , when all [the world]866-the world was in mourning for [[my]0-i lady ’s only son]2712-my lady ’s only son . [Captain James]253-captain james would have thrown [the agency]2713-the agency up at once , if [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady had not felt [herself]336-my lady bound to justify the wisdom of [her]336-my lady choice , by urging [him]253-captain james to stay . [He]253-captain james was much touched by [her]336-my lady confidence in [him]253-captain james , and swore a great oath , that the next year [he]253-captain james would make [the land]3166-the land such as it had never been before for produce . It was not [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s way to repeat anything [she]336-my lady had heard , especially to [another person]2717-another person ’s disadvantage . So [I]0-i do n’t think [she]336-my lady ever told [Captain James]253-captain james of [Mr. Brooke]252-mr. brooke ’s speech about [a sailor]1079-a sailor ’s being likely to mismanage [the property]2719-the property ; and [the captain]3378-the captain was too anxious to succeed in this , the second year of [his]3378-the captain trial , to be above going to the flourishing , shrewd [Mr. Brooke]252-mr. brooke , and asking for [his]252-mr. brooke advice as to the best method of working [the estate]582-the estate . [I]0-i dare say , if [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had been as intimate as formerly at [the Hall]501-the hall , [we]2723-we should [all of [us]2723-we]2724-all of us have heard of this new acquaintance of [the agent]3959-the agent ’s long before [we]2723-we did . As it was , [I]0-i am sure [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady never dreamed that [the captain , who held opinions that were even more Church and King]2727-the captain , who held opinions that were even more church and king than [her]336-my lady own , could ever have made [friends]3176-friends with [a Baptist baker from [Birmingham]38-birmingham]2729-a baptist baker from birmingham , even to serve [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship ’s own interests in the most loyal manner . [We]2723-we heard of it first from [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , who came now often to see [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , for neither [he]113-mr. gray nor [she]336-my lady could forget the solemn tie which the fact of [his]113-mr. gray being the person to acquaint [her]336-my lady with [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord ’s death had created between [them]2733-them . For true and holy words spoken at that time , though having no reference to aught below the solemn subjects of life and death , had made [her]336-my lady withdraw [her]336-my lady opposition to [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s wish about establishing [a village school]2734-a village school . [She]336-my lady had sighed a little , it is true , and was even yet more apprehensive than hopeful as to the result ; but almost as if as a memorial to [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord , [she]336-my lady had allowed [a kind of rough [school - house]2737-school - house]2736-a kind of rough school - house to be built on [the green]2738-the green , just by [the church]642-the church ; and had gently used the power [she]336-my lady undoubtedly had , in expressing [her]336-my lady strong wish that [the boys]1304-the boys might only be taught to read and write , and the first four rules of arithmetic ; while [the girls]2741-the girls were only to learn to read , and to add up in [their]2741-the girls heads , and the rest of the time to work at mending [their]2741-the girls own clothes , knitting stockings and spinning . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady presented [the school]2590-the school with more spinning - wheels than there were [girls]2744-girls , and requested that there might be a rule that [they]2741-the girls should have spun so many hanks of flax , and knitted so many pairs of stockings , before [they]2741-the girls ever were taught to read at all . After all , it was but making the best of a bad job with [[my]0-i poor lady]3217-my poor lady — but life was not what it had been to [her]3217-my poor lady . [I]0-i remember well the day that [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray pulled some delicately fine yarn ( and [I]0-i was a good judge of those things ) out of [his]113-mr. gray pocket , and laid it and a capital pair of knitted stockings before [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , as the first - fruits , so to say , of [[his]113-mr. gray school]2450-his school . [I]0-i recollect seeing [her]336-my lady put on [her]336-my lady spectacles , and carefully examine both productions . Then [she]336-my lady passed them to [me]0-i . “ This is well , [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray . [I]336-my lady am much pleased . [You]0-i are fortunate in [[your]0-i schoolmistress]4536-your schoolmistress . [She]336-my lady has had both proper knowledge of womanly things and much patience . Who is [she]336-my lady ? [One out of [[our]4538-our village]4539-our village]4537-one out of our village ? ”[336-my lady] “ [[My]113-mr. gray lady]336-my lady , ”[113-mr. gray] said [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , stammering and colouring in [his]113-mr. gray old fashion , “ [Miss Bessy]260-bessy is so very kind as to teach all those sorts of things — [Miss Bessy]260-bessy , and [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , sometimes . ”[113-mr. gray] [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady looked at [him]113-mr. gray over [her]336-my lady spectacles : but [she]336-my lady only repeated the words “ [Miss Bessy]260-bessy , ”[336-my lady] and paused , as if trying to remember who [such a person]2749-such a person could be ; and [he]113-mr. gray , if [he]113-mr. gray had then intended to say more , was quelled by [her]336-my lady manner , and dropped the subject . [He]113-mr. gray went on to say , that [he]113-mr. gray had thought it [his]113-mr. gray duty to decline the subscription to [[his]113-mr. gray school]2450-his school offered by [Mr. Brooke]252-mr. brooke , because [he]113-mr. gray was [a Dissenter]3866-a dissenter ; that [he]113-mr. gray ( [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ) feared that [Captain James]253-captain james , through whom [Mr. Brooke]252-mr. brooke ’s offer of money had been made , was offended at [his]253-captain james refusing to accept it from [a man who held heterodox opinions]2752-a man who held heterodox opinions ; nay , whom [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray suspected of being infected by [Dodwell]276-dodwell ’s heresy . “ [I]336-my lady think there must be some mistake , ”[336-my lady] said [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , “ or [I]336-my lady have misunderstood [you]113-mr. gray .
