[I]336-my lady beg [your]113-mr. gray pardon [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , but it is impossible . ”[336-my lady] CHAPTER XIV . Like many other things which have been declared to be impossible , this report of [Captain James]253-captain james being attentive to [Miss Brooke]277-miss brooke turned out to be very true . The mere idea of [[her]277-miss brooke agent]2756-her agent being on the slightest possible terms of acquaintance with [the Dissenter]2757-the dissenter , [the tradesman]2758-the tradesman , [the Birmingham democrat]2759-the birmingham democrat , who had come to settle in [[our]2760-our good , orthodox , aristocratic , and agricultural [Hanbury]13-hanbury]2761-our good , orthodox , aristocratic , and agricultural hanbury , made [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady very uneasy . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s misdemeanour in having taken [Miss Bessy]260-bessy to live with [her]215-miss galindo , faded into a mistake , a mere error of judgment , in comparison with [Captain James]253-captain james ’s intimacy at [Yeast House]86-yeast house , as [the Brookes]278-the brookes called [[their]278-the brookes ugly square - built farm]2763-their ugly square - built farm . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady talked [herself]336-my lady quite into complacency with [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , and even [Miss Bessy]260-bessy was named by [her]215-miss galindo , the first time [I]0-i had ever been aware that [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady recognized [her]336-my lady existence ; but — [I]0-i recollect it was a long rainy afternoon , and [I]0-i sat with [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship , and [we]2767-we had time and opportunity for a long uninterrupted talk — whenever [we]2767-we had been silent for a little while [she]336-my lady began again , with something like a wonder how it was that [Captain James]253-captain james could ever have commenced an acquaintance with “ [that man [Brooke]277-miss brooke]4542-that man brooke . ”[336-my lady] [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady recapitulated all the times [she]336-my lady could remember , that anything had occurred , or been said by [Captain James]253-captain james which [she]336-my lady could now understand as throwing light upon the subject . “ [He]253-captain james said once that [he]253-captain james was anxious to bring in the [Norfolk]87-norfolk system of cropping , and spoke a good deal about [Mr. Coke of Holkham]279-mr. coke of holkham ( who , by the way , was no more a Coke than [I]0-i am — collateral in the female line — which counts for little or nothing among [the great old commoners ’ families of pure blood]4550-the great old commoners ’ families of pure blood ) , and [his]253-captain james new ways of cultivation ; of course [new men]4551-new men bring in new ways , but it does not follow that either are better than the old ways . However , [Captain James]253-captain james has been very anxious to try turnips and bone manure , and [he]253-captain james really is [a man of such good sense and energy]4552-a man of such good sense and energy , and was so sorry last year about the failure , that [I]0-i consented ; and now [I]0-i begin to see [my]0-i error . [I]0-i have always heard that [town bakers]4553-town bakers adulterate [their]4553-town bakers flour with bone - dust ; and , of course , [Captain James]253-captain james would be aware of this , and go to [Brooke]277-miss brooke to inquire where the article was to be purchased . ”[0-i] [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady always ignored the fact which had sometimes , [I]0-i suspect , been brought under [her]336-my lady very eyes during [her]336-my lady drives , that [[Mr. Brooke]252-mr. brooke ’s few fields]2770-mr. brooke ’s few fields were in a state of far higher cultivation than [her]336-my lady own ; so [she]336-my lady could not , of course , perceive that there was any wisdom to be gained from asking the advice of [the tradesman turned farmer]2771-the tradesman turned farmer . But by - and - by this fact of [[her]336-my lady agent]2756-her agent ’s intimacy with [the person whom in [the whole world]2774-the whole world [she]336-my lady most disliked]2773-the person whom in the whole world she most disliked ( with that sort of dislike in which a large amount of uncomfortableness is combined — the dislike which [conscientious people]2775-conscientious people sometimes feel to [another]3521-another without knowing why , and yet which [they]2775-conscientious people can not indulge in with comfort to [themselves]2775-conscientious people without having a moral reason why ) , came before [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady in many shapes . For , indeed [I]0-i am sure that [Captain James]253-captain james was not [a man to conceal or be ashamed of one of [his]253-captain james actions]2778-a man to conceal or be ashamed of one of his actions . [I]0-i can not fancy [his]253-captain james ever lowering [his]253-captain james strong loud clear voice , or having a confidental conversation with [any one]624-any one . When [his]253-captain james crops had failed , all [the village]578-the village had known it . [He]253-captain james complained , [he]253-captain james regretted , [he]253-captain james was angry , or owned [himself]253-captain james a — — fool , all down [the village street]2781-the village street ; and the consequence was that , although [he]253-captain james was [a far more passionate man than [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner]2782-a far more passionate man than mr. horner , [all the tenants]2783-all the tenants liked [him]253-captain james far better . [People]302-people , in general , take a kindlier interest in any one , the workings of whose mind and heart [they]302-people can watch and understand , than in [a man who only lets [you]2786-you know what [he]2785-a man who only lets you know what he has been thinking about and feeling , by what he does has been thinking about and feeling , by what [he]2785-a man who only lets you know what he has been thinking about and feeling , by what he does does]2785-a man who only lets you know what he has been thinking about and feeling , by what he does . But [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson was faithful to the memory of [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner . [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo has told [me]0-i that [she]215-miss galindo used to watch [him]253-captain james hobble out of the way of [Captain James]253-captain james , as if to accept [his]253-captain james notice , however good - naturedly given , would have been a kind of treachery to [[his]253-captain james former benefactor]2787-his former benefactor . But [Gregson]150-harry gregson ( [the father]2357-the father ) and [the new agent]2789-the new agent rather took to [each other]780-each other ; and one day , much to [my]0-i surprise , [I]0-i heard that [the “ poaching , tinkering vagabond]4554-the “ poaching , tinkering vagabond , ”[4554-the “ poaching , tinkering vagabond] as [the people]313-the people used to call [Gregson]150-harry gregson when [I]0-i first had come to live at [Hanbury]13-hanbury , had been appointed gamekeeper ; [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray standing godfather , as it were , to [his]113-mr. gray trustworthiness , if [he]113-mr. gray were trusted with anything ; which [I]0-i thought at the time was rather an experiment , only it answered , as many of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s deeds of daring did . It was curious how [he]253-captain james was growing to be [a kind of autocrat in [the village]578-the village]2792-a kind of autocrat in the village ; and how unconscious [he]253-captain james was of it . [He]253-captain james was as shy and awkward and nervous as ever in any affair that was not of some moral consequence to [him]253-captain james . But as soon as [he]253-captain james was convinced that a thing was right , [he]253-captain james “ shut [his]253-captain james eyes and ran and butted at it like a ram , ”[253-captain james] as [Captain James]253-captain james once expressed it , in talking over something [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had done . [People in [the village]578-the village]2794-people in the village said , “ [they]2794-people in the village never knew what [the parson]1218-the parson would be at next ; ”[2794-people in the village] or [they]2794-people in the village might have said , “ where [his]1218-the parson reverence would next turn up . ”[2794-people in the village] For [I]0-i have heard of [his]253-captain james marching right into the middle of a set of [poachers]2796-poachers , gathered together for some desperate midnight enterprise , or walking into a public - house that lay just beyond the bounds of [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s estate]2798-my lady ’s estate , and in [that extra - parochial piece of ground [I]0-i named long ago , and which was considered the rendezvous of all [the ne’er - do - weel characters]2800-the ne’er - do - weel characters for miles round , and where [a parson]2801-a parson and [a constable]2802-a constable]2799-that extra - parochial piece of ground i named long ago , and which was considered the rendezvous of all the ne’er - do - weel characters for miles round , and where a parson and a constable were held in much the same kind of esteem as [unwelcome visitors]2803-unwelcome visitors . And yet [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray had [his]113-mr. gray long fits of depression , in which [he]113-mr. gray felt as if [he]113-mr. gray were doing nothing , making no way in [his]113-mr. gray work , useless and unprofitable , and better out of [the world]866-the world than in it . In comparison with the work [he]113-mr. gray had set [himself]113-mr. gray to do , what [he]113-mr. gray did seemed to be nothing . [I]0-i suppose it was constitutional , those attacks of lowness of spirits which [he]113-mr. gray had about this time ; perhaps a part of the nervousness which made [him]113-mr. gray always so awkward when [he]113-mr. gray came to [the Hall]501-the hall . Even [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott , who almost worshipped the ground [he]113-mr. gray trod on , as the saying is , owned that [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray never entered one of [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s rooms]2807-my lady ’s rooms without knocking down something , and too often breaking it . [He]113-mr. gray would much sooner have faced [a desperate poacher]2808-a desperate poacher than [a young lady]2809-a young lady any day . At least so [we]2810-we thought . [I]0-i do not know how it was that it came to pass that [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady became reconciled to [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo about this time . Whether it was that [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship was weary of the unspoken coolness with [[her]336-my lady old friend]2813-her old friend ; or that the specimens of delicate sewing and fine spinning at [the school]2590-the school had mollified [her]336-my lady towards [Miss Bessy]260-bessy ; but [I]0-i was surprised to learn one day that [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo and [[her]215-miss galindo young friend]2815-her young friend were coming that very evening to tea at [the Hall]501-the hall . This information was given [me]0-i by [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott , as a message from [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , who further went on to desire that certain little preparations should be made in [[her]336-my lady own private sitting - room]2818-her own private sitting - room , in which the greater part of [my]0-i days were spent . From the nature of these preparations , [I]0-i became quite aware that [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady intended to do honour to [[her]336-my lady expected visitors]2820-her expected visitors . Indeed , [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow never forgave by halves , as [I]0-i have known [some people]2821-some people do . Whoever was coming as a visitor to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , [peeress]2823-peeress , or [poor nameless girl]2824-poor nameless girl , there was a certain amount of preparation required in order to do them fitting honour . [I]0-i do not mean to say that the preparation was of the same degree of importance in each case . [I]0-i dare say , if [a peeress]2825-a peeress had come to visit [us]2826-us at [the Hall]501-the hall , the covers would have been taken off the furniture in [the white drawing - room]2828-the white drawing - room ( they never were uncovered all the time [I]0-i stayed at [the Hall]501-the hall ) , because [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady would wish to offer [her]336-my lady the ornaments and luxuries which [this grand visitor]2831-this grand visitor ( who never came — [I]0-i wish [she]2831-this grand visitor had ! [I]0-i did so want to see that furniture uncovered ! ) was accustomed to at [home]586-home , and to present them to [her]336-my lady in the best order in which [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady could . The same rule , mollified , held good with [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo . Certain things , in which [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady knew [she]336-my lady took an interest , were laid out ready for [her]336-my lady to examine on this very day ; and , what was more , great books of prints were laid out , such as [I]0-i remembered [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady had had brought forth to beguile [my]0-i own early days of illness,—Mr . [Hogarth]138-mr. hogarth ’s works , and the like,—which [I]0-i was sure were put out for [Miss Bessy]260-bessy . [No one]590-no one knows how curious [I]0-i was to see [this mysterious Miss Bessy]260-bessy — twenty times more mysterious , of course , for want of [her]260-bessy surname . And then again ( to try and account for [my]0-i great curiosity , of which in recollection [I]0-i am more than half ashamed ) , [I]0-i had been leading the quiet monotonous life of [a crippled invalid]2837-a crippled invalid for many years,—shut up from any sight of new faces ; and this was to be the face of one whom [I]0-i had thought about so much and so long,—Oh ! [I]0-i think [I]0-i might be excused . Of course [they]2838-they drank tea in [the great hall]453-the great hall , with [the four young gentlewomen , who , with [myself]0-i , formed the small bevy now under [[her]260-bessy ladyship]3041-her ladyship ’s charge]2840-the four young gentlewomen , who , with myself , formed the small bevy now under her ladyship ’s charge . Of [those who were at [Hanbury]13-hanbury when first [I]0-i came]2842-those who were at hanbury when first i came , none remained ; [all]3505-all were married , or gone once more to live at [some home which could be called [their]3505-all own]2844-some home which could be called their own , whether the ostensible head were [father]2579-father or [brother]2846-brother . [I]0-i [myself]0-i was not without some hopes of a similar kind . [[My]0-i brother]2847-my brother [Harry]150-harry gregson was now [a curate in [Westmoreland]77-westmoreland]2848-a curate in westmoreland , and wanted [me]0-i to go and live with [him]150-harry gregson , as eventually [I]0-i did for a time . But that is neither here nor there at present . What [I]0-i am talking about is [Miss Bessy]260-bessy . After a reasonable time had elapsed , occupied as [I]0-i well knew by the meal in [the great hall,—the]2849-the great hall,—the measured , yet agreeable conversation afterwards,—and a certain promenade around [the hall]501-the hall , and through [the drawing - rooms]2851-the drawing - rooms , with pauses before different pictures , the history or subject of each of which was invariably told by [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady to [every new visitor,—a]2853-every new visitor,—a sort of giving [them]2853-every new visitor,—a the freedom of [the old family]2854-the old family - seat , by describing the kind and nature of [the great progenitors who had lived there before the narrator,—I]2855-the great progenitors who had lived there before the narrator,—i heard the steps approaching [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s room]1001-my lady ’s room , where [I]0-i lay . [I]0-i think [I]0-i was in such a state of nervous expectation , that if [I]0-i could have moved easily , [I]0-i should have got up and run away . And yet [I]0-i need not have been , for [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo was not in the least altered ( [her]215-miss galindo nose a little redder , to be sure , but then that might only have had a temporary cause in the private crying [I]0-i know [she]215-miss galindo would have had before coming to see [[her]215-miss galindo dear]2858-her dear [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow once again ) . But [I]0-i could almost have pushed [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo away , as [she]215-miss galindo intercepted [me]0-i in [my]0-i view of the mysterious [Miss Bessy]260-bessy . [Miss Bessy]260-bessy was , as [I]0-i knew , only about eighteen , but [she]260-bessy looked older . Dark hair , dark eyes , a tall , firm figure , a good , sensible face , with a serene expression , not in the least disturbed by what [I]0-i had been thinking must be such awful circumstances as a first introduction to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , who had so disapproved of [her]336-my lady very existence : those are the clearest impressions [I]0-i remember of [my]0-i first interview with [Miss Bessy]260-bessy . [She]260-bessy seemed to observe [us]2860-us all , in [her]260-bessy quiet manner , quite as much as [I]0-i did [her]260-bessy ; but [she]260-bessy spoke very little ; occupied [herself]260-bessy , indeed , as [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady had planned , with looking over the great books of engravings . [I]0-i think [I]0-i must have ( foolishly ) intended to make [her]260-bessy feel at [her]260-bessy ease , by [my]0-i patronage ; but [she]260-bessy was seated far away from [my]0-i sofa , in order to command the light , and really seemed so unconcerned at [her]260-bessy unwonted circumstances , that [she]260-bessy did not need [my]0-i countenance or kindness . One thing [I]0-i did like — [her]260-bessy watchful look at [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo from time to time : it showed that [her]260-bessy thoughts and sympathy were ever at [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s service , as indeed they well might be . When [Miss Bessy]260-bessy spoke , [her]260-bessy voice was full and clear , and what [she]260-bessy said , to the purpose , though there was a slight provincial accent in [her]260-bessy way of speaking . After a while , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady set [us]2863-we two to play at chess , a game which [I]0-i had lately learnt at [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s suggestion . Still [we]2863-we did not talk much together , though [we]2863-we were becoming attracted towards [each other]780-each other , [I]0-i fancy . “ [You]0-i will play well , ”[260-bessy] said [she]260-bessy . “ [You]0-i have only learnt about six months , have [you]0-i ? And yet [you]0-i can nearly beat [me]260-bessy , who have been at it as many years . ”[260-bessy] “ [I]260-bessy began to learn last November . [I]260-bessy remember [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s bringing [me]260-bessy ‘ [Philidor]280-philidor on Chess , ’ one very foggy , dismal day . ”[260-bessy] What made [her]260-bessy look up so suddenly , with bright inquiry in [her]260-bessy eyes ? What made [her]260-bessy silent for a moment as if in thought , and then go on with something , [I]0-i know not what , in quite an altered tone ? [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady and [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo went on talking , while [I]0-i sat thinking . [I]0-i heard [Captain James]253-captain james ’s name mentioned pretty frequently ; and at last [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady put down [her]336-my lady work , and said , almost with tears in [her]336-my lady eyes : “ [I]336-my lady could not — [I]336-my lady can not believe it . [He]253-captain james must be aware [she]215-miss galindo is [a schismatic]4541-a schismatic ; [[a baker]4557-a baker ’s daughter]4558-a baker ’s daughter ; and [he]253-captain james is [a gentleman by virtue and feeling]4559-a gentleman by virtue and feeling , as well as by [his]253-captain james profession , though [his]253-captain james manners may be at times a little rough . [[My]336-my lady dear]3052-my dear [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , what will [this world]1092-this world come to ? ”[336-my lady] [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo might possibly be aware of [her]215-miss galindo own share in bringing [the world]866-the world to the pass which now dismayed [my]0-i lady,—for of course , though all was now over and forgiven , yet [Miss]2868-miss , [Bessy]260-bessy ’s being received into [[a respectable maiden lady]2869-a respectable maiden lady ’s house]2870-a respectable maiden lady ’s house , was one of the portents as to [the world]866-the world ’s future which alarmed [[her]215-miss galindo ladyship]3041-her ladyship ; and [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo knew this,—but , at any rate , [she]215-miss galindo had too lately been forgiven [herself]215-miss galindo not to plead for mercy for the next offender against [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s delicate sense of fitness and propriety,—so [she]215-miss galindo replied : “ Indeed , [[my]215-miss galindo lady]336-my lady , [I]215-miss galindo have long left off trying to conjecture what makes [Jack fancy Gill]281-jack fancy gill , or [Gill Jack]282-gill jack . It ’s best to sit down quiet under the belief that marriages are made for [us]4563-us , somewhere out of [this world]1092-this world , and out of the range of [this world]1092-this world ’s reason and laws . [I]215-miss galindo ’m not so sure that [I]215-miss galindo should settle it down that they were made in [heaven]2151-heaven ; [t’other place]4567-t’other place seems to [me]215-miss galindo as likely [a workshop]4568-a workshop ; but at any rate , [I]215-miss galindo ’ve given up troubling [my]215-miss galindo head as to why they take place . [Captain James]253-captain james is [a gentleman]1283-a gentleman ; [I]215-miss galindo make no doubt of that ever since [I]215-miss galindo saw [him]253-captain james stop to pick up [old Goody Blake]283-old goody blake ( when [she]283-old goody blake tumbled down on the slide last winter ) and then swear at [a little lad who was laughing at [her]283-old goody blake]4570-a little lad who was laughing at her , and cuff [him]253-captain james till [he]253-captain james tumbled down crying ; but [we]4571-we must have bread somehow , and though [I]215-miss galindo like it better baked at [home]586-home in a good sweet brick oven , yet , as [some folks]4573-some folks never can get it to rise , [I]215-miss galindo do n’t see why [a man]725-a man may not be [a baker]4557-a baker . [You]4576-you see , [[my]215-miss galindo lady]336-my lady , [I]215-miss galindo look upon baking as a simple trade , and as such lawful . There is [no machine]4578-no machine comes in to take away [a man]725-a man ’s or [woman]3794-woman ’s power of earning [their]4581-their living , like the spinning - jenny ( [the old busybody that]4582-the old busybody that [she]4582-the old busybody that is ) , to knock up all [[our]4571-we good old women]4583-our good old women ’s livelihood , and send [them]4583-our good old women to [their]4583-our good old women graves before [their]4583-our good old women time . There ’s an invention of [the enemy]4584-the enemy , if [you]4576-you will ! ”[215-miss galindo] “ That ’s very true ! ”[336-my lady] said [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , shaking [her]336-my lady head . “ But baking bread is wholesome , straightforward elbow - work . [They]4581-their have not got to inventing any contrivance for that yet , thank [Heaven]165-heaven ! It does not seem to [me]336-my lady natural , nor according to Scripture , that iron and steel ( whose brows ca n’t sweat ) should be made to do [man]1233-man ’s work . And so [I]336-my lady say , all those trades where iron and steel do the work ordained to [man at the Fall]4586-man at the fall , are unlawful , and [I]336-my lady never stand up for [them]4581-their . But say [this baker]4587-this baker [Brooke]252-mr. brooke did knead [his]252-mr. brooke bread , and make it rise , and then that [people , who had , perhaps , no good ovens]4588-people , who had , perhaps , no good ovens , came to [him]252-mr. brooke , and bought [his]252-mr. brooke good light bread , and in this manner [he]252-mr. brooke turned an honest penny and got rich ; why , all [I]336-my lady say , [[my]336-my lady lady]336-my lady , is this,—I dare say [he]252-mr. brooke would have been born [a Hanbury]4590-a hanbury , or [a lord]4591-a lord if [he]252-mr. brooke could ; and if [he]252-mr. brooke was not , it is no fault of [his]252-mr. brooke , that [I]336-my lady can see , that [he]252-mr. brooke made good bread ( being [a baker]4557-a baker by trade ) , and got money , and bought [[his]252-mr. brooke land]4593-his land . It was [his]252-mr. brooke misfortune , not [his]252-mr. brooke fault , that [he]252-mr. brooke was not [a person of quality by birth]4594-a person of quality by birth . ”[336-my lady] “ That ’s very true , ”[336-my lady] said [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , after a moment ’s pause for consideration . “ But , although [he]252-mr. brooke was [a baker]4557-a baker , [he]252-mr. brooke might have been [a Churchman]4596-a churchman . Even [your]215-miss galindo eloquence , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , sha n’t convince [me]336-my lady that that is not [his]252-mr. brooke own fault . ”[336-my lady] “ [I]215-miss galindo do n’t see even that , begging [your]215-miss galindo pardon , [[my]215-miss galindo lady]336-my lady , ”[215-miss galindo] said [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo , emboldened by the first success of [her]215-miss galindo eloquence . “ When [a Baptist]2194-a baptist is [a baby]2377-a baby , if [I]215-miss galindo understand [their]2194-a baptist creed aright , [he]2194-a baptist is not baptized ; and , consequently , [he]2194-a baptist can have [no godfathers]4600-no godfathers and [godmothers]4601-godmothers to do anything for [him]2194-a baptist in [his]2194-a baptist baptism ; [you]336-my lady agree to that , [[my]215-miss galindo lady]336-my lady ? ”[215-miss galindo] [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady would rather have known what [her]336-my lady acquiescence would lead to , before acknowledging that [she]336-my lady could not dissent from this first proposition ; still [she]336-my lady gave [her]336-my lady tacit agreement by bowing [her]336-my lady head . “ And , [you]336-my lady know , [[our]4603-we godfathers]4604-our godfathers and [godmothers]4601-godmothers are expected to promise and vow three things in [our]4603-we name , when [we]4603-we are [little babies]4606-little babies , and can do nothing but squall for [ourselves]4603-we . It is a great privilege , but do n’t let [us]4603-we be hard upon those who have not had the chance of [godfathers and godmothers]4607-godfathers and godmothers . [Some people]2821-some people , [we]4603-we know , are born with silver spoons,—that ’s to say , [a godfather to give one things , and teach one]4609-a godfather to give one things , and teach one ’s catechism , and see that [we]4603-we ’re confirmed into [good church - going Christians,—and [others]3078-others with wooden ladles in [their]3078-others mouths]4610-good church - going christians,—and others with wooden ladles in their mouths . [These poor last folks]4612-these poor last folks must just be content to be [godfatherless orphans]4613-godfatherless orphans , and [Dissenters]606-dissenters , all [their]4612-these poor last folks lives ; and if [they]4612-these poor last folks are [tradespeople]4615-tradespeople into the bargain , so much the worse for [them]4612-these poor last folks ; but let [us]4603-we be [humble Christians]4616-humble christians , [[my]336-my lady dear lady]692-my dear lady , and not hold [our]4603-we heads too high because [we]4603-we were born orthodox quality . ”[336-my lady] “ [You]0-i go on too fast , [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ! [I]336-my lady ca n’t follow [you]0-i . Besides , [I]336-my lady do believe dissent to be an invention of [the Devil]3068-the devil ’s . Why ca n’t [they]4619-they believe as [we]4603-we do ? It ’s very wrong . Besides , its schism and heresy , and , [you]0-i know , the Bible says that ’s as bad as witchcraft . ”[336-my lady] [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady was not convinced , as [I]0-i could see . After [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo had gone , [she]336-my lady sent [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott for certain books out of [the great old library]2878-the great old library up stairs , and had them made up into a parcel under [her]336-my lady own eye . “ If [Captain James]253-captain james comes to - morrow , [I]336-my lady will speak to [him]253-captain james about [these Brookes]4620-these brookes . [I]336-my lady have not hitherto liked to speak to [him]253-captain james , because [I]336-my lady did not wish to hurt [him]253-captain james , by supposing there could be any truth in the reports about [his]253-captain james intimacy with [them]4620-these brookes . But now [I]336-my lady will try and do [my]336-my lady duty by [him]253-captain james and [them]4620-these brookes . Surely this great body of divinity will bring [them]4620-these brookes back to [the true church]4621-the true church . ”[336-my lady] [I]0-i could not tell , for though [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady read [me]0-i over the titles , [I]0-i was not any the wiser as to [their]2880-their contents . Besides , [I]0-i was much more anxious to consult [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady as to [my]0-i own change of place . [I]0-i showed [her]336-my lady the letter [I]0-i had that day received from [Harry]150-harry gregson ; and [we]2882-we once more talked over the expediency of [my]0-i going to live with [him]150-harry gregson , and trying what entire change of air would do to re - establish [my]0-i failing health . [I]0-i could say anything to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , [she]336-my lady was so sure to understand [me]0-i rightly . For one thing , [she]336-my lady never thought of [herself]336-my lady , so [I]0-i had no fear of hurting [her]336-my lady by stating the truth . [I]0-i told [her]336-my lady how happy [my]0-i years had been while passed under [her]336-my lady roof ; but that now [I]0-i had begun to wonder whether [I]0-i had not duties elsewhere , in making a home for [Harry,—and]284-harry,—and whether the fulfilment of these duties , quiet ones they must needs be in the case of [such a cripple as [myself]0-i]2884-such a cripple as myself , would not prevent [my]0-i sinking into the querulous habit of thinking and talking , into which [I]0-i found [myself]0-i occasionally falling . Add to which , there was the prospect of benefit from the more bracing air of [the north]2885-the north . It was then settled that [my]0-i departure from [Hanbury]13-hanbury , [[my]0-i happy home]2886-my happy home for so long , was to take place before many weeks had passed . And as , when one period of life is about to be shut up for ever , [we]2887-we are sure to look back upon it with fond regret , so [I]0-i , happy enough in [my]0-i future prospects , could not avoid recurring to all the days of [my]0-i life in [the Hall]501-the hall , from the time when [I]0-i came to [it]501-the hall , [a shy awkward girl]2889-a shy awkward girl , scarcely past childhood , to now , when [a grown woman,—past childhood]2890-a grown woman,—past childhood — almost , from the very character of [my]0-i illness , past youth,—I was looking forward to leaving [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s house]2892-my lady ’s house ( as [a residence]2893-a residence ) for ever . As it has turned out , [I]0-i never saw either [her]336-my lady or [it]501-the hall again . Like a piece of sea - wreck , [I]0-i have drifted away from those days : quiet , happy , eventless days,—very happy to remember ! [I]0-i thought of [good , jovial Mr. Mountford,—and]285-good , jovial mr. mountford,—and [his]285-good , jovial mr. mountford,—and regrets that [he]285-good , jovial mr. mountford,—and might not keep a pack , “ a very small pack , ”[285-good , jovial mr. mountford,—and] of harriers , and [his]285-good , jovial mr. mountford,—and merry ways , and [his]285-good , jovial mr. mountford,—and love of good eating ; of the first coming of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , and [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s attempt to quench [his]285-good , jovial mr. mountford,—and sermons , when [they]2895-they tended to enforce any duty connected with education . And now [we]2896-we had [an absolute school - house in [the village]578-the village]2897-an absolute school - house in the village ; and since [Miss Bessy]260-bessy ’s drinking tea at [the Hall]501-the hall , [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady had been twice inside [it]501-the hall , to give directions about some fine yarn [she]336-my lady was having spun for table - napery . And [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship had so outgrown [her]336-my lady old custom of dispensing with sermon or discourse , that even during the temporary preaching of [Mr. Crosse]242-mr. crosse , [she]336-my lady had never had recourse to it , though [I]0-i believe [she]336-my lady would have had all [the congregation]4109-the congregation on [her]336-my lady side if [she]336-my lady had . And [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was dead , and [Captain James]253-captain james reigned in [his]253-captain james stead . Good , steady , severe , silent [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ! with [his]238-mr. horner clock - like regularity , and [his]238-mr. horner snuff - coloured clothes , and silver buckles ! [I]0-i have often wondered which one misses most when [they]2903-they are dead and gone,—the bright creatures full of life , who are hither and thither and everywhere , so that [no one]590-no one can reckon upon [their]2903-they coming and going , with whom stillness and the long quiet of the grave , seems utterly irreconcilable , so full are [they]2903-they of vivid motion and passion,—or [the slow , serious people , whose movements — nay , whose very words , seem to go by clockwork]2905-the slow , serious people , whose movements — nay , whose very words , seem to go by clockwork ; who never appear much to affect the course of [our]2906-our life while [they]2903-they are with [us]2906-our , but whose methodical ways show [themselves]2903-they , when [they]2903-they are gone , to have been intertwined with [our]2906-our very roots of daily existence . [I]0-i think [I]0-i miss these last the most , although [I]0-i may have loved [the former]1696-the former best . [Captain James]253-captain james never was to [me]0-i what [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner was , though [the latter]841-the latter had hardly changed a dozen words with [me]0-i at the day of [his]238-mr. horner death . Then [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ! [I]0-i remembered the time as if it had been only yesterday , when [she]215-miss galindo was but a name — and a very odd one — to [me]0-i ; then [she]215-miss galindo was [a queer , abrupt , disagreeable , busy old maid]2909-a queer , abrupt , disagreeable , busy old maid . Now [I]0-i loved [her]215-miss galindo dearly , and [I]0-i found out that [I]0-i was almost jealous of [Miss Bessy]260-bessy . [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray [I]0-i never thought of with love ; the feeling was almost reverence with which [I]0-i looked upon [him]113-mr. gray . [I]0-i have not wished to speak much of [myself]0-i , or else [I]0-i could have told [you]2910-you how much [he]113-mr. gray had been to [me]0-i during these long , weary years of illness . But [he]113-mr. gray was almost as much to every one , rich and poor , from [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady down to [[Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ’s Sally]88-miss galindo ’s sally . [The village]578-the village , too , had a different look about it . [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i could not tell [you]2910-you what caused the change ; but there were [no more lounging young men]2913-no more lounging young men to form [a group]2914-a group at [the cross - road]2915-the cross - road , at a time of day when [young men]2916-young men ought to be at work . [I]0-i do n’t say this was all [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s doing , for there really was so much to do in [the fields]3171-the fields that there was but little time for lounging now - a - days . And [the children]394-the children were hushed up in [school]2610-school , and better behaved out of it , too , than in the days when [I]0-i used to be able to go [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s errands in [the village]578-the village . [I]0-i went so little about now , that [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i ca n’t tell who [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo found to scold ; and yet [she]215-miss galindo looked so well and so happy that [I]0-i think [she]215-miss galindo must have had [her]215-miss galindo accustomed portion of that wholesome exercise . Before [I]0-i left [Hanbury]13-hanbury , the rumour that [Captain James]253-captain james was going to marry [Miss Brooke]277-miss brooke , [[Baker Brooke]286-baker brooke ’s eldest daughter , who had only a sister to share [[his]253-captain james property]644-his property with [her]277-miss brooke]2922-baker brooke ’s eldest daughter , who had only a sister to share his property with her , was confirmed . [He]253-captain james [himself]253-captain james announced it to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ; nay , more , with a courage , gained , [I]0-i suppose , in [his]253-captain james former profession , where , as [I]0-i have heard , [he]253-captain james had led [[his]253-captain james ship]2925-his ship into many a post of danger , [he]253-captain james asked [[her]336-my lady ladyship]3041-her ladyship , [the Countess Ludlow]172-the countess ludlow , if [he]253-captain james might bring [[his]253-captain james bride]2927-his bride elect , ( [[the Baptist baker]2928-the baptist baker ’s daughter]2929-the baptist baker ’s daughter ! ) and present [her]2929-the baptist baker ’s daughter to [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ! [I]0-i am glad [I]0-i was not present when [he]253-captain james made this request ; [I]0-i should have felt so much ashamed for [him]253-captain james , and [I]0-i could not have helped being anxious till [I]0-i heard [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s answer , if [I]0-i had been [there]559-there . Of course [she]336-my lady acceded ; but [I]0-i can fancy the grave surprise of [her]336-my lady look . [I]0-i wonder if [Captain James]253-captain james noticed it . [I]0-i hardly dared ask [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady , after the interview had taken place , what [she]336-my lady thought of [the bride elect]2934-the bride elect ; but [I]0-i hinted [my]0-i curiosity , and [she]336-my lady told [me]0-i , that if [the young person]2935-the young person had applied to [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott , for the situation of cook , and [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott had engaged [her]336-my lady , [she]336-my lady thought that it would have been a very suitable arrangement . [I]0-i understood from this how little [she]336-my lady thought a marriage with [Captain James]253-captain james , [R.N.]287-r.n. , suitable . About a year after [I]0-i left [Hanbury]13-hanbury , [I]0-i received a letter from [Miss Galindo]215-miss galindo ; [I]0-i think [I]0-i can find it.—Yes , this is it . ‘ [Hanbury]13-hanbury , May 4 , 1811 . [DEAR MARGARET]288-dear margaret , ‘ [You]288-dear margaret ask for news of [us]2936-we all . Do n’t [you]288-dear margaret know there is no news in [Hanbury]13-hanbury ? Did [you]288-dear margaret ever hear of an event here ? Now , if [you]288-dear margaret have answered “ Yes , ”[288-dear margaret] in [your]288-dear margaret own mind to these questions , [you]288-dear margaret have fallen into [my]0-i trap , and never were more mistaken in [your]288-dear margaret life . [Hanbury]13-hanbury is full of news ; and [we]2936-we have more events on [our]2936-we hands than [we]2936-we know what to do with . [I]0-i will take them in the order of the newspapers — births , deaths , and marriages . In the matter of births , [Jenny Lucas]289-jenny lucas has had [twins]2937-twins not a week ago . Sadly too much of a good thing , [you]288-dear margaret ’ll say . Very true : but then [they]2937-twins died ; so [their]2937-twins birth did not much signify . [My]0-i cat has kittened , too ; [she]2938-she has had three kittens , which again [you]288-dear margaret may observe is too much of a good thing ; and so it would be , if it were not for the next item of intelligence [I]0-i shall lay before [you]288-dear margaret . [Captain]2939-captain and [Mrs. James]290-mrs. james have taken [the old house next Pearson ’s]2940-the old house next pearson ’s ; and [the house]3047-the house is overrun with mice , which is just as fortunate for [me]0-i as [the King of [[Egypt]89-egypt ’s rat - ridden kingdom]89-egypt]2942-the king of egypt ’s rat - ridden kingdom was to [Dick Whittington]291-dick whittington . For [my]0-i cat ’s kittening decided [me]0-i to go and call on [the bride]2943-the bride , in hopes [she]2943-the bride wanted a cat ; which [she]2943-the bride did like [a sensible woman]2411-a sensible woman , as [I]0-i do believe [she]2943-the bride is , in spite of [Baptism]292-baptism , [Bakers]2945-bakers , Bread , and [Birmingham]38-birmingham , and something worse than all , which [you]2946-you shall hear about , if [you]2946-you ’ll only be patient . As [I]0-i had got [my]0-i best bonnet on , the one [I]0-i bought when [poor Lord Ludlow]99-lord ludlow was last at [Hanbury]13-hanbury in ’ 99 — [I]0-i thought it a great condescension in [myself]0-i ( always remembering the date of the Galindo baronetcy ) to go and call on [the bride]2943-the bride ; though [I]0-i do n’t think so much of [myself]0-i in [my]0-i every - day clothes , as [you]2946-you know . But who should [I]0-i find there but [[my]0-i [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow]333-my lady ludlow ! [She]92-lady ludlow looks as frail and delicate as ever , but is , [I]0-i think , in better heart ever since [that old city merchant of [a Hanbury]4590-a hanbury]2949-that old city merchant of a hanbury took it into [his]2949-that old city merchant of a hanbury head that [he]2949-that old city merchant of a hanbury was [a cadet of [the Hanburys of Hanbury]139-the hanburys]2951-a cadet of the hanburys of hanbury , and left [her]92-lady ludlow that handsome legacy . [I]0-i ’ll warrant [you]2946-you that the mortgage was paid off pretty fast ; and [Mr. Horner]238-mr. horner ’s money — or [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s money , or [Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson ’s money , call it which [you]2946-you will — is invested in [his]150-harry gregson name , all right and tight ; and [they]2953-they do talk of [his]150-harry gregson being [captain of [[his]150-harry gregson school]2450-his school]2954-captain of his school , or [Grecian]2956-grecian , or something , and going to [college]2957-college , after all ! [[Harry Gregson]150-harry gregson [the poacher]4054-the poacher ’s son]2958-harry gregson the poacher ’s son ! Well ! to be sure , [we]2960-we are living in strange times ! ‘ But [I]0-i have not done with the marriages yet . [[Captain James]253-captain james ’s]2961-captain james ’s is all very well , but [no one]590-no one cares for it now , [we]2960-we are so full of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s . Yes , indeed , [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray is going to be married , and to [nobody else]2963-nobody else but [[my]0-i little Bessy]2964-my little bessy ! [I]0-i tell [her]2964-my little bessy [she]2964-my little bessy will have to nurse [him]113-mr. gray half the days of [her]2964-my little bessy life , [he]113-mr. gray is such a frail little body . But [she]2964-my little bessy says [she]2964-my little bessy does not care for that ; so that [his]113-mr. gray body holds [his]113-mr. gray soul , it is enough for [her]2964-my little bessy . [She]2964-my little bessy has a good spirit and a brave heart , has [[my]0-i Bessy]2965-my bessy ! It is a great advantage that [she]2964-my little bessy wo n’t have to mark [her]2964-my little bessy clothes over again : for when [she]2964-my little bessy had knitted [herself]2964-my little bessy [her]2964-my little bessy last set of stockings , [I]0-i told [her]2964-my little bessy to put G for [Galindo]215-miss galindo , if [she]2964-my little bessy did not choose to put it for [Gibson]266-mark , for [she]2966-she should be [[my]0-i child]3051-my child if [she]2966-she was [no one else]1732-no one else ’s . And now [you]2969-you see it stands for [Gray]113-mr. gray . So there are two marriages , and what more would [you]2969-you have ? And [she]2964-my little bessy promises to take another of [my]0-i kittens . ‘ Now , as to deaths , [old Farmer Hale]233-farmer hale is dead — [poor old man]2970-poor old man , [I]0-i should think [[his]233-farmer hale wife]3072-his wife thought it a good riddance , for [he]233-farmer hale beat [her]3072-his wife every day that [he]233-farmer hale was drunk , and [he]233-farmer hale was never sober , in spite of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray . [I]0-i do n’t think ( as [I]0-i tell [him]233-farmer hale ) that [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray would ever have found courage to speak to [Bessy]260-bessy as long as [Farmer Hale]233-farmer hale lived , [he]233-farmer hale took [the old gentleman]2374-the old gentleman ’s sins so much to heart , and seemed to think it was all [his]233-farmer hale fault for not being able to make [a sinner]2109-a sinner into [a saint]2107-a saint . [The parish bull]2975-the parish bull is dead too . [I]0-i never was so glad in [my]0-i life . But [they]2976-they say [we]2977-we are to have a new one in [[his]233-farmer hale place]2978-his place . In the meantime [I]0-i cross [the common]804-the common in peace , which is very convenient just now , when [I]0-i have so often to go to [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ’s to see about furnishing . ‘ Now [you]2980-you think [I]0-i have told [you]2980-you all the [Hanbury]13-hanbury news , do n’t [you]2980-you ? Not so . The very greatest thing of all is to come . [I]0-i wo n’t tantalize [you]2980-you , but just out with it , for [you]2980-you would never guess it . [[My]0-i Lady [Ludlow]92-lady ludlow]333-my lady ludlow has given a party , just like [any plebeian amongst [us]2977-we]2982-any plebeian amongst us . [We]2977-we had tea and toast in [the blue drawing - room]3895-the blue drawing - room , old [John Footman]134-john footman waiting with [Tom Diggles]257-tom diggles , [the lad that used to frighten away crows in [[Farmer Hale]233-farmer hale ’s fields]2985-farmer hale ’s fields]2984-the lad that used to frighten away crows in farmer hale ’s fields , following in [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s livery , hair powdered and everything . [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott made tea in [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s own room]2988-my lady ’s own room . [[My]0-i lady]336-my lady looked like [a splendid fairy queen of mature age]2990-a splendid fairy queen of mature age , in black velvet , and the old lace , which [I]0-i have never seen [her]336-my lady wear before since [[my]0-i lord]3081-my lord ’s death . But the company ? [you]2992-you ’ll say . Why , [we]2993-we had [the parson of Clover]2994-the parson of clover , and [the parson of Headleigh]2995-the parson of headleigh , and [the parson of [Merribank]91-merribank]2996-the parson of merribank , and [the three parsonesses]2997-the three parsonesses ; and [Farmer Donkin]293-farmer donkin , and two [Miss Donkins]294-miss donkins ; and [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ( of course ) , and [myself]0-i and [Bessy]260-bessy ; and [Captain]2939-captain and [Mrs. James]290-mrs. james ; yes , and [Mr.]2999-mr. and [Mrs. Brooke]295-mrs. brooke ; think of that ! [I]0-i am not sure [the parsons]3000-the parsons liked it ; but [he]3000-the parsons was there . For [he]3000-the parsons has been helping [Captain James]253-captain james to get [[[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s land]3002-my lady ’s land into order ; and then [[his]3000-the parsons daughter]702-his daughter married [the agent]3959-the agent ; and [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray ( who ought to know ) says that , after all , [Baptists]296-baptists are [not such bad people]3005-not such bad people ; and [he]113-mr. gray was right against [them]296-baptists at one time , as [you]3006-you may remember . [Mrs. Brooke]295-mrs. brooke is [a rough diamond]3007-a rough diamond , to be sure . [People]302-people have said that of [me]0-i , [I]0-i know . But , being [a Galindo]215-miss galindo , [I]0-i learnt manners in [my]0-i youth and can take them up when [I]0-i choose . But [Mrs. Brooke]295-mrs. brooke never learnt manners , [I]0-i ’ll be bound . When [John Footman]134-john footman handed [her]295-mrs. brooke the tray with the tea - cups , [she]295-mrs. brooke looked up at [him]134-john footman as if [she]295-mrs. brooke were sorely puzzled by that way of going on . [I]0-i was sitting next to [her]295-mrs. brooke , so [I]0-i pretended not to see [her]295-mrs. brooke perplexity , and put [her]295-mrs. brooke cream and sugar in for [her]295-mrs. brooke , and was all ready to pop it into [her]295-mrs. brooke hands,—when who should come up , but [that impudent lad]3009-that impudent lad [Tom Diggles]257-tom diggles ( [I]0-i call [him]257-tom diggles [lad]3010-lad , for all [his]257-tom diggles hair is powdered , for [you]3011-you know that it is not natural gray hair ) , with [his]257-tom diggles tray full of cakes and what not , all as good as [Mrs. Medlicott]103-mrs. medlicott could make them . By this time , [I]0-i should tell [you]3011-you , [all the parsonesses]3012-all the parsonesses were looking at [Mrs. Brooke]295-mrs. brooke , for [she]295-mrs. brooke had shown [her]295-mrs. brooke want of breeding before ; and [the parsonesses]3013-the parsonesses , who were just a step above [her]295-mrs. brooke in manners , were very much inclined to smile at [her]295-mrs. brooke doings and sayings . Well ! what does [she]295-mrs. brooke do , but pull out a clean Bandanna pocket - handkerchief all red and yellow silk , spread it over [her]295-mrs. brooke best silk gown ; it was , like enough , a new one , for [I]0-i had it from [Sally]217-sally , who had it from [[her]217-sally cousin [Molly]254-mary legard , who is [dairy - woman at [the Brookes ’]3016-the brookes ’]3015-dairy - woman at the brookes ’]3014-her cousin molly , who is dairy - woman at the brookes ’ , that [the Brookes]278-the brookes were mighty set - up with an invitation to drink tea at [the Hall]501-the hall . There [we]3018-we were , [Tom Diggles]257-tom diggles even on the grin ( [I]0-i wonder how long it is since [he]257-tom diggles was [own brother]3019-own brother to [a scarecrow]3020-a scarecrow , only not so decently dressed ) and [Mrs. Parsoness of Headleigh,—I]297-mrs. parsoness of headleigh,—i forget [her]297-mrs. parsoness of headleigh,—i name , and it ’s no matter , for [she]297-mrs. parsoness of headleigh,—i ’s [an ill - bred creature]3021-an ill - bred creature , [I]0-i hope [Bessy]260-bessy will behave [herself]260-bessy better — was right - down bursting with laughter , and as near a hee - haw as ever a donkey was , when what does [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady do ? Ay ! there ’s [my]0-i own dear [Lady Ludlow]92-lady ludlow , God bless [her]336-my lady ! [She]336-my lady takes out [her]336-my lady own pocket - handkerchief , all snowy cambric , and lays it softly down on [her]336-my lady velvet lap , for all [the world]866-the world as if [she]336-my lady did it every day of [her]336-my lady life , just like [Mrs. Brooke]295-mrs. brooke , [[the baker]3024-the baker ’s wife]3025-the baker ’s wife ; and when [the one]2404-the one got up to shake the crumbs into the fire - place , [the other]1106-the other did just the same . But with such a grace ! and such a look at [us]3028-us all ! [Tom Diggles]257-tom diggles went red all over ; and [Mrs. Parsoness of Headleigh scarce]298-mrs. parsoness of headleigh scarce spoke for the rest of the evening ; and the tears came into [my]0-i old silly eyes ; and [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , who was before silent and awkward in a way which [I]0-i tell [Bessy]260-bessy [she]260-bessy must cure [him]113-mr. gray of , was made so happy by this pretty action of [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady ’s , that [he]113-mr. gray talked away all the rest of the evening , and was the life of [the company]3030-the company . ‘ Oh , [Margaret Dawson]94-margaret dawson ! [I]0-i sometimes wonder if [you]94-margaret dawson ’re the better off for leaving [us]3028-us . To be sure [you]94-margaret dawson ’re with [[your]94-margaret dawson brother]3165-your brother , and blood is blood . But when [I]0-i look at [[my]0-i lady]336-my lady and [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray , for all [they]3033-they ’re so different , [I]0-i would not change places with any in [England]9-england . ’ Alas ! alas ! [I]0-i never saw [[my]0-i dear lady]692-my dear lady again . [She]692-my dear lady died in eighteen hundred and fourteen , and [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray did not long survive [her]692-my dear lady . As [I]0-i dare say [you]94-margaret dawson know , [the Reverend Henry Gregson]150-harry gregson is now [vicar of [Hanbury]13-hanbury]3035-vicar of hanbury , and [[his]150-harry gregson wife]3072-his wife is [the daughter of [Mr. Gray]113-mr. gray and [Miss Bessy]260-bessy]3037-the daughter of mr. gray and miss bessy . * * *
